Sense.DEF: the eighth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第八个字母

Sense.DEF: a type of bird flu that can kill people
used when you are surprised or have discovered something interesting
Sense.TRAN: 哈〔表示惊奇或发现了有趣的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ha! I thought it might be you hiding there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈！我想可能就是你藏在那里！

Sense.DEF: a law which says that a person can only be kept in prison following a court’s decision
Sense.TRAN: 人身保护法〔指规定只有经法院裁定才可对某人执行监禁的法律〕

Sense.DEF: a shopkeeper who sells haberdashery
Sense.TRAN: 缝纫用品商[店员]﹔男士服饰用品商[店员]

Sense.DEF: a shop or part of a large store where things used for making clothes are sold
a shop or part of a large store where men’s clothes, especially hats, are sold
Sense.TRAN: 男士服饰用品〔尤指帽子〕店[部]

Sense.DEF: the goods sold in these shops
Sense.TRAN: 缝纫用品﹔男士服饰用品

Sense.DEF: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise is a good habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一个习惯﹐一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝﹐也是出于习惯。

GramExa.GLOSS: because this is what you usually do in this situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I did it out of habit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这么做是出于习惯。

Sense.DEF: a strong physical need to keep taking a drug regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of drug addicts get into petty crime to support their habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多吸毒者为满足毒瘾而犯轻罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His cocaine habit ruined him physically and financially.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的可卡因瘾搞垮了他的身体﹐耗光了他的钱财。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not make a habit of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not usually do something bad or wrong, or should not do it again
Sense.TRAN: 不常做某事﹔不要养成做某事的习惯
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re ten minutes late. I hope you’re not going to make a habit of this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你迟到了十分钟﹐我希望你不要养成迟到的习惯。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’m not in the habit of doing sth
Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed, to say that you would not do something
Sense.TRAN: 我没有做某事的习惯〔用于恼怒时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not in the habit of lying to my friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有对朋友撒谎的习惯。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a habit of doing sth
Sense.DEF: if something has a habit of doing something, it usually or often does it - used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 有做某事的习惯〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life has a habit of springing surprises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活中常会冒出让人意想不到的事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is difficult to make people change their attitudes or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew it probably wasn’t necessary any more, but old habits die hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道这也许已经没有必要了﹐但是旧习难改。

Sense.DEF: the way someone usually thinks about something, or their usual attitudes
Sense.TRAN: 已成习惯的思维方式/惯常的态度

Sense.DEF: a long loose piece of clothing worn by people in some religious groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些宗教团体成员穿的〕长袍
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nun’s habit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修女服

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has a habit of being late.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有迟到的习惯。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Once you have been driving for a few weeks, it becomes a habit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要开上几星期的车﹐就会习惯了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start doing something regularly or often
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Try to get into the habit of walking for 30 minutes each day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量养成习惯﹐每天步行30分钟。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop doing something regularly or often
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t get out of the habit of saying ‘sorry’.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她改不掉说“抱歉”的习惯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop doing something that is bad for you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve smoked for years, but I really want to kick the habit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已吸烟多年﹐但很想改掉这个习惯。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eating healthy food as snacks is a good habit to get into.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 零食吃健康食品﹐这是应该养成的好习惯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the kinds of things you eat or drink regularly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You need to change your eating habits.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要改变饮食习惯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the kinds of things you buy regularly
the kinds of television shows you regularly watch
the things you normally do each day, for example keeping yourself clean or whether you smoke

Collocate.COLLOC: be in the habit of doing sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: On Friday evenings Carrie was in the habit of visiting her parents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 周五晚上卡丽习惯去看望父母。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used about a habit that is difficult to change
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I still walk by his house each day – force of habit, I suppose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天依然走路经过他家——我想是走惯了吧。

Collocate.COLLOC: change/break the habits of a lifetime
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop doing the things you have done for many years
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 改变/改掉一辈子的习惯

Exponent.DEF: something you do regularly, often without thinking about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Biting your nails is a bad habit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 咬指甲是个坏习惯。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I always go to the same supermarket, out of habit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于习惯﹐我总是去同一家超市。

Exponent.DEF: something that people in a particular society do because it is traditional or the accepted thing to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In Japan it is the custom to take off your shoes when you enter a house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日本﹐进屋脱鞋是一种风俗习惯。

Exponent.DEF: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tradition of giving Easter eggs goes back hundreds of years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 赠送复活节彩蛋的传统可追溯至几百年前。

Exponent.DEF: something that people often do, especially as part of their work or daily life
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指工作或日常生活中的〕惯常做法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel has ended the practice of leaving chocolates in guests’ rooms.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该酒店已停止在客房摆放巧克力的做法。

Sense.DEF: good enough for people to live in
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: the natural home of a plant or animal
Sense.TRAN: 〔动植物的〕生活环境﹔〔动物的〕栖息地
Sense.EXAMPLE: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

Sense.DEF: a building that is unfit for human habitation is not safe or healthy for people to live in
Sense.TRAN: 不适合人类居住的﹐不适宜住人的

Sense.DEF: the act of living in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no sign of habitation as far as the eye could see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放眼望去﹐了无人烟。

Sense.DEF: a house or place to live in
a drug or activity that is habit-forming makes you want to keep taking it, keep doing it etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔药物〕使人上瘾的﹔〔活动〕让人形成习惯的

Sense.DEF: doing something from habit, and unable to stop doing it
done as a habit that you cannot stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: His drinking had become habitual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝酒已上瘾。

Sense.DEF: usual or typical of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: James took his habitual morning walk around the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯又像往常习惯的那样绕花园作晨间散步去了。

Sense.DEF: to be used to something or gradually become used to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the centuries, these animals have become habituated to living in a dry environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几百年下来﹐这些动物已经习惯于生活在干燥的环境里。

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly goes to a particular place or event
a large farm in Spanish-speaking countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔西班牙语国家的〕大庄园﹐大农场

Sense.DEF: to cut something roughly or violently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hacked away at the ice, trying to make a hole.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在冰上凿﹐想凿出一个洞来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whole forests have been hacked down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整片整片的森林都已经被砍平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hacked his way through the undergrowth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在灌木丛中劈出一条路来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Both men had been hacked to death killed using large knives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人都被砍死了。

Sense.DEF: to secretly find a way of getting information from someone else’s computer or changing information on it
Sense.TRAN: 侵入〔他人的计算机系统〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somebody hacked into the company’s central database.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人侵入了这家公司的中央数据库。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to hack the code.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他设法窃取了密码。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you cannot continue to do something that is difficult or boring
Sense.TRAN: 〔因困难或乏味而〕不愿继续做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been doing this job for years, but I just can’t hack it anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作我已经干了很多年﹐但是我再也不想干了。

Sense.DEF: to ride a horse along roads or through the country
Sense.TRAN: 骑马〔沿路而行或穿越乡村地区〕

Sense.DEF: to cough in a loud unpleasant way
to annoy someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attitude really hacks me off!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度实在让我生气！

Sense.DEF: a writer who does a lot of low-quality work, especially writing newspaper articles
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为报纸写文章的〕蹩脚文人﹐雇佣文人﹐写手
Sense.EXAMPLE: A Sunday newspaper hack uncovered the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某星期日报的一个雇佣文人披露了这一新闻事件。

Sense.DEF: an unimportant politician
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was attended by the usual old party hacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加会议的还是那些无足轻重的老党徒。

Sense.DEF: a way of using a computer to get into someone else’s computer system without their permission
a taxi, or a taxi driver
an act of hitting something roughly with a cutting tool
Sense.EXAMPLE: One more hack and the branch was off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

Sense.DEF: an old tired horse
a horse you can pay money to ride on
a ride on a horse
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long hack across the fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在野外长时间骑马

Sense.DEF: extremely annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting really hacked off about the whole thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对整件事情非常生气。

Sense.DEF: someone who secretly uses or changes the information in other people’s computer systems
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hacker had managed to get into the system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个黑客设法侵入了系统。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the threat of hacking and computer viruses
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑客侵入和计算机病毒的威胁

Sense.DEF: a repeated painful cough with an unpleasant sound
if someone’s hackles rise, they begin to feel very angry, because someone’s behaviour or attitude offends them
Sense.TRAN: 某人被激怒﹐某人勃然大怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura heard his remark, and felt her hackles rising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉听到他的话不由得心头火起。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His tactless remarks were enough to raise anyone’s hackles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缺心眼的话语足以激起任何人的怒火。

Sense.DEF: the long feathers or hairs on the back of the neck of some animals and birds, which stand up straight when they are in danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些鸟兽遇到危险时会竖起的〕颈背毛﹐颈羽

Sense.DEF: a carriage pulled by a horse, used in the past like a taxi
a taxi
a hackneyed phrase is boring and does not have much meaning because it has been used so often
a cutting tool with small teeth on its blade, used especially for cutting metal
a hacker who hacks into other computers for political reasons
the past tense and past participle of have
a common fish that lives in northern seas and is often used as food
the land of the dead in the stories of ancient Greece
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话中的〕冥界﹐地府﹐阴间

Sense.EXAMPLE: If I hadn’t seen it myself, I’d never have believed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是亲眼所见﹐我是怎么也不会相信的。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of blood
a red substance in the blood that contains iron and carries oxygen
a serious disease that prevents a person’s blood from becoming thick, so that they lose a lot of blood easily if they are injured
a person who suffers from haemophilia
a serious medical condition in which a person bleeds a lot, sometimes inside their body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died of a massive brain haemorrhage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于脑部大出血。

Sense.DEF: when a company or country loses a lot of money or people very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a haemorrhage of jobs from the region
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区工作岗位的大量流失

Sense.DEF: to lose a lot of blood in a very short time
to lose a lot of something over a short period of time, such as money or jobs
Sense.TRAN: 大量损失﹐大量流失〔资金﹑工作岗位等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The once prosperous town has hemorrhaged manufacturing jobs over the last 15 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城镇曾经非常繁荣﹐但在过去15年里已经流失了大量制造业的工作岗位。

Sense.DEF: painfully swollen blood vessels near a person’s anus
a long handle on an axe1 or other weapon
an ugly or unpleasant woman, especially one who is old or looks like a witch
someone who looks haggard has lines on their face and dark marks around their eyes, especially because they are ill, worried, or tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam looked tired and haggard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆看起来疲惫而憔悴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a haggard face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 憔悴的面容

Sense.DEF: a food eaten in Scotland, made from the heart and other organs of a sheep, cut up and boiled in a skin made from the sheep’s stomach
Sense.TRAN: 肚包羊杂碎〔把羊杂碎放入羊肚中煮成的一种苏格兰食品〕

Sense.DEF: to argue when you are trying to agree about the price of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tourists haggling over the price of souvenirs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对纪念品讨价还价的游客

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ted was haggling with the street vendors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德正在和街边小贩讨价还价。

Sense.DEF: a book about the lives of saints
a book about someone that praises them too much
another spelling of ha
used in writing to represent a shout of laughter
Sense.TRAN: 哈哈〔用于书面语﹐表示笑声〕

Sense.DEF: used, sometimes angrily, to show that you do not think something is funny
Sense.TRAN: 哈哈〔表示某事并不好笑﹐有时表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, very funny, John, ha ha.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐约翰﹐很好笑﹐哈哈。

Sense.DEF: a type of Japanese poem with three lines consisting of five, seven, and five syllables
frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy showers of rain and hail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

Sense.DEF: a large number of bullets, stones etc that are thrown or fired at someone
Sense.TRAN: 一阵弹雨/像雹子般袭来的石块等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aircraft were met by a hail of gunfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机遭到一阵炮火的袭击。

Sense.DEF: a lot of criticism etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposals met with a hail of criticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建议遭到一阵痛批。

Sense.DEF: to describe someone or something as being very good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lang’s first film was immediately hailed as a masterpiece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朗的第一部电影立即就被誉为杰作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new service has been hailed a success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新推出的服务被认为很成功。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A young man is being hailed a hero tonight after rescuing two children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚﹐一位青年因为救了两个孩子而被称为英雄。

Sense.DEF: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她探出窗户向一个路人大喊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel doorman will hail a cab for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店的门童会替你叫出租车的。

Sense.DEF: if it hails, small balls of ice fall like rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s windy and hailing outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面风很大﹐还下着冰雹。

Sense.DEF: to have been born in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: And where do you hail from?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在哪里出生？

Sense.DEF: a special Roman Catholic prayer to Mary, the mother of Jesus
Sense.TRAN: 万福马利亚〔天主教徒向圣母马利亚祷告的祈祷词〕

Sense.DEF: in American football, a long throw forward that you hope will be caught successfully, although it is unlikely, so that your team will score a point when you do not have much time to do this
Sense.TRAN: 万福马利亚传球〔指美式橄榄球比赛快要结束时﹐虽明知不大可能成功却仍然传出、希望队友接住并得分的长传球〕

Sense.DEF: an action you take that is unlikely to succeed, and which you only take because there is no other way of achieving something
Sense.TRAN: 孤注一掷的行为﹐不大可能成功的无奈之举

Sense.DEF: a small ball of frozen rain
a storm when a lot of hail falls
the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was short and dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发又短又黑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short fat man with no hair on his head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光头的矮胖男人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s a tall fair-haired guy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个浅色头发的高个子。

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In this meaning, hair is an uncountable noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: hair表示这个意思时是不可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He has black hair (NOT 不说 black hairs).

Sense.DEF: one of the long fine things like thread that grows on people’s heads and on other parts of their bodies, or similar things that grow on animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔人的〕头发﹐毛﹐汗毛﹔〔动物的〕茸毛﹐毛(发)
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat has left white hairs all over the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的猫毛掉得满沙发都是。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m starting to get a few grey hairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始有白头发了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: long-haired cats
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长毛猫

Sense.DEF: to be very worried or angry about something, especially because you do not know what to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因不知怎么办而〕极其担忧[愤怒]﹔〔因焦急﹑愤怒而〕撕扯自己的头发
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone else would have been tearing their hair out trying to work it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换了谁来解决这个问题都会急得焦头烂额的。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself and start to relax, especially after working very hard
Sense.TRAN: 玩乐放松〔尤指在辛勤工作之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party gave us all a chance to really let our hair down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次聚会给了我们所有人一个痛快玩乐的机会。

Sense.DEF: a day when your hair does not look tidy or neat even when you try to arrange it carefully – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不如意的一天﹐不顺利的一天〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m having a bit of a bad hair day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天做什么都不大对劲。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to keep calm and not get annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: All right, all right, keep your hair on! I’m sorry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐好啦﹐别发火！对不起。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by always being near them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因不断烦扰而〕惹恼某人

Sense.LEXUNIT: make sb’s hair stand on end
Sense.DEF: to make someone very frightened
if a story, experience etc makes your hair curl, it is very surprising, frightening, or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑经历等〕使人大吃一惊[毛骨悚然]
Sense.EXAMPLE: tales that would make your hair curl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会使人毛骨悚然的故事

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a hair out of place
Sense.DEF: to have a very neat appearance
to remain completely calm when something bad or surprising suddenly happens
Sense.TRAN: 处之泰然﹐面不改色﹐从容不迫

Sense.LEXUNIT: not harm/touch a hair of/on sb’s head
Sense.DEF: to not harm someone in any way

Sense.LEXUNIT: the hair of the dog (that bit you)
Sense.DEF: alcohol that you drink to cure a headache caused by drinking too much alcohol the night before - used humorously

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a good/fine/thick etc head of hair

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He's about six feet tall, with dark hair and blue eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大约六英尺高﹐黑发﹐蓝眼睛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: completely black

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her long fair hair fell untidily over her shoulders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的浅色长发凌乱地披在肩上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: yellowish-white in colour

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her hair was pale brown.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发是浅棕色的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: dark brown
yellowish-brown
an unattractive dull brown

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The whole family had red hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人都是红头发。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: orange-brown in colour
orange-brown in colour

Collocate.EXAMPLE: an old man with white hair
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名白发老汉

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I like your hair when it’s short like that.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢你像这样留短发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A few of the boys had long hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个男孩留着长发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had shoulder-length reddish hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一头略带红色的齐肩发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a girl with long straight hair
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 留着长长直发的女孩

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When he was young, his hair was thick and curly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时头发浓密卷曲。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tightly curled
with loose curls
thin
stiff and standing up on top of your head

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How do you keep your hair in such perfect condition?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么把头发保养得这么好的？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no longer in good condition

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She combed her hair until it was all glossy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头发一直梳到精光发亮。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very shiny and attractive
not shiny
containing too much oil
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This shampoo is ideal for greasy hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种洗发液最适合油性发质。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lacking oil
thin, straight, and unattractive
becoming thinner because you are losing your hair
gradually disappearing, so that it is high on your forehead

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has beautiful blonde hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一头美丽的金发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He cleaned his teeth and brushed his hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刷了牙﹐梳了头发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He showered and washed his hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冲了淋浴﹐洗了头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: arrange it in a style
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s upstairs doing her hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在楼上做头发。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: by a hairdresser
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I need to get my hair cut.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得理发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My Mum always cuts my hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头发一直都是妈妈理的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: change its colour, especially using chemicals
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 把头发染成(金色/红色等)

Collocate.COLLOC: wear your hair long/in a ponytail etc
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have that style of hair
let it grow longer
become bald
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was a small, round man who was losing his hair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胖胖的﹐个子矮小﹐已开始脱发。

Collocate.COLLOC: run your fingers through sb’s hair
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: touch someone’s hair in a loving way
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔怜爱地〕用手指拢某人的头发

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: rub it in a kind friendly way

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The drug can cause hair loss.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药会引起脱发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Genes control characteristics such as hair colour and eye colour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 基因控制头发颜色﹑眼睛颜色等特征。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a thin piece of hair
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She brushed away a strand of hair from her eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拂开挡住眼睛的一缕头发。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a fairly thick piece of hair
a large amount of thick untidy hair

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘I cut my hair’ if another person cut your hair for you. Say I had my hair cut. 要是他人给你理了发﹐不要说 I cut my hair﹐而要说 I had my hair cut。

Sense.DEF: a brush you use on your hair to make it smooth
the act of washing and drying your hair and shaping it into a style
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on make-up and hair care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于化妆和美发的建议

Sense.DEF: a type of rough material made from animal hair
Sense.TRAN: 马尾衬〔用动物毛织成的粗布料〕

Sense.DEF: when you have a haircut, someone cuts your hair for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had a haircut for months!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好几个月没理发了！

Sense.DEF: the style your hair is cut in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you like my new haircut?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢我的新发型吗？

Sense.DEF: the style in which someone’s hair is cut or shaped
a person who cuts, washes, and arranges people’s hair in particular styles
the hairdresser’s shop
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appointment at the hairdresser’s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和美发师的预约

Sense.DEF: a machine that blows out hot air for drying hair
a small thin piece of metal that a woman uses to hold her hair in place
with no hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young rabbits are born blind and hairless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小兔子生下来时看不见东西﹐而且没有毛。

Sense.DEF: the line around your head, especially at the front, where your hair starts growing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had put on weight, and his hairline was beginning to recede.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发福了﹐头发也开始往后秃了。

Sense.DEF: a very thin crack
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hairline fracture in a bone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细微的骨折

Sense.DEF: a very thin net that stretches over your hair to keep it in place
a piece of false hair that you wear on your head to make your own hair look thicker
Sense.TRAN: 〔加在头发上使之显得更浓密的〕小假发﹐假发片

Sense.DEF: a pin made of wire bent into a U-shape to hold long hair in position
a very sharp U-shaped curve in a road
frightening and dangerous in a way that is exciting
Sense.TRAN: 惊险的﹔使人毛发直竖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hair-raising car chase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场惊险的汽车追逐

Sense.DEF: a very small amount or distance
Sense.TRAN: 一发之差﹐极细微的距离
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet missed me by a hair’s breadth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那颗子弹以毫发之差从我身边擦过。

Sense.DEF: a shirt made of rough uncomfortable cloth containing hair, worn in the past by some religious people to punish themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去有些宗教信徒惩罚自己时穿的〕刚毛衬衣

Sense.DEF: a small attractive metal or plastic object that a woman uses to fasten her hair in place
when people pay too much attention to small differences and unimportant details, especially in an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在争论中的〕过分纠缠于细枝末节﹐吹毛求疵

Sense.DEF: a sticky liquid that you spray on your hair to keep it in place
Sense.TRAN: 喷发胶﹐喷发定型剂﹐定型喷雾

Sense.DEF: the style in which someone’s hair has been cut or shaped
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you like my new hairstyle?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢我的新发型吗？

PIC.HEADING: HAIRSTYLES 发型
PIC.PICCONTENT: wavy 波浪形的；bob 齐短发；bon 圆发髻；bald head 光头；crew cut 平头；curly 卷曲的；straight 直的；layered hair 有层次的头发；layers 层次；frizzy 紧紧卷曲的；flattop 平头；ponytail 马尾辫；pigtails 发辫；parting BrE【英】/ part AmE【美】分缝；dreadlocks 拉斯塔法里发绺；bunches BrE【英】(两侧的)发辫；French plait 法式辫子；plait BrE【英】/ braid AmE【美】辫子

Sense.DEF: a trigger1 on a gun that needs very little pressure to fire the gun
easily made angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: his hair-trigger temperament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的火爆脾气

Sense.DEF: a hairy person or animal has a lot of hair on their body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skinny guy with hairy legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个腿上多毛的干瘦男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hairy caterpillar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛茸茸的毛虫

Sense.DEF: dangerous or frightening, often in a way that is exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was pretty hairy climbing down the cliff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爬下悬崖真吓人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few hairy moments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个惊险的片刻

Sense.DEF: a journey to Makkah (Mecca) for religious reasons, that all Muslims try to make at least once in their life
used as a title for a Muslim who has made a haj
Sense.TRAN: 哈吉〔朝觐过麦加的穆斯林的称号〕

Sense.DEF: a sea fish, used as food
Sense.TRAN: 狗鳕﹐无须鳕〔一种食用海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a Muslim doctor
halal meat is meat from an animal that has been killed in a way that is approved by Islamic lan
Sense.TRAN: 〔肉〕按伊斯兰教教规宰杀牲畜而得的

Sense.DEF: a type of sword that was used as a weapon in the past
a time in the past when you were very happy
someone, especially an old person, who is hale and hearty is very healthy and active
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指老人〕精神矍铄的﹐老当益壮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s still hale and hearty at 74.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她74岁仍然精神矍铄。

Sense.DEF: exactly or about 50% (1/2) of an amount, time, distance, number etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over half of the children live in one-parent families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子有一半多生活在单亲家庭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Only half the guests had arrived by seven o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7点钟前只来了一半客人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you look at our members, at least half are women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看我们的会员﹐至少有一半是女性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: half a pound of butter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 半磅黄油
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s about half a mile down the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条路走大约半英里就到了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She drank half a bottle of wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喝了半瓶酒。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: half a million dollars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 50万美元

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t just waltz in a half hour late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可以迟到半小时才大摇大摆地进来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s about a half mile down the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条路走大约半英里就到了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a half day excursion to the island
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去岛上的半日游
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He demanded a half share of the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要求分得一半的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s only half the size of a normal violin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它只有普通小提琴的一半大。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They offered to pay half the cost of repairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提出支付一半的修理费用。

Sense.DEF: the largest part of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We missed half of what he said because someone was talking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为有人讲话﹐他大半的话我们都没听到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems to be asleep half the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎多半时间都在睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting covered in mud is half the fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大一部分乐趣在于浑身沾满泥巴。

Sense.DEF: 30 minutes after the hour mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got home at about half past one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我1点半左右到家的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I rang at about half six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是6点半左右打电话的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be there by seven or half past half past seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会在7点或7点半前到那儿。

Subsense.DEF: six
Subsense.EXAMPLE: half a dozen eggs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六只蛋

Subsense.DEF: a small number of people or things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were half a dozen other people in front of me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我前面还有其他几个人。

Sense.DEF: a small opportunity to do something, especially one which someone would take eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d go to university if I got half the chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我有一丁点机会﹐我就去上大学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many kids would sleep till noon given half a chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要有机会﹐很多孩子会睡到中午。

Sense.DEF: if you have half an eye on something, or if you are listening with half an ear, you are giving only part of your attention to it
Sense.TRAN: 心不在焉[不全神贯注]地看/听
Sense.EXAMPLE: He listened with only half an ear and his thoughts wandered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心不在焉地听着﹐思绪游移不定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher kept half an eye on them all through the lesson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整堂课上老师分出一部分注意力留意着他们。

Sense.DEF: used to say that when you have done the most difficult part of an activity, the rest is easy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting the audience to like you is half the battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让观众喜欢你意味着成功了一大半。

Sense.DEF: a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold on, this will only take half a second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一等﹐一会儿就行了。

Sense.DEF: an explanation that is not complete, used especially to say that someone is trying to keep something secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists are convinced that she was only telling them half the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们确信她只告诉了他们部分真相。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have half a mind to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you would like to do something but you probably will not do it
Sense.TRAN: 有点想做某事〔但很可能不做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had half a mind to ask for his money back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有点想要回他的钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have half a mind to tell your mother about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点想把这事告诉你母亲。

Sense.DEF: actions or methods that are not strong enough, and so are not effective in dealing with a difficult problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔处理难题〕不彻底的办法[行动]
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is no time for half measures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这时候不痛不痒的办法行不通。

Sense.LEXUNIT: half a loaf (is better than none)
Sense.DEF: something that is less than what you wanted or asked for, but that you might accept because it is better than nothing
Sense.TRAN: 有总比没有好﹐聊胜于无

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a plural verb after half (of) if you are referring to a number of people or things.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果指若干人或事物﹐half (of)后要用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Barely half the citizens bother to vote.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有半数公民愿意投票。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb if you are referring to an amount or thing.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果指某一数量或事物﹐要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Half the food was wasted.
Over half of Britain’s ancient woodland has been destroyed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国超过一半的古林地已遭毁坏。
F2NBox.EXPL: You do not usually say ‘the half’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 一般不说the half
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ve only read half of the story (NOT 不说 the half of the story).
F2NBox.EXPL: The only time you say ‘the half’ is when you are referring to a particular half.
F2NBox.TRAN: 只有在指特定的一半时﹐才可以用the half
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the first half of the book
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘half of hour’. Say half an hour or, especially in spoken American English, a half hour.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说 half of hour﹐而要说 half an hour 或者 a half hour (尤在美语口语中使用)。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘one and half’, ‘two and half’ etc. Say one and a half , two and a half etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说 one and half, two and half 等﹐而要说 one and a half, two and a half 等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She is two and a half years old.
F2NBox.EXPL: These phrases are followed by a plural noun, not a singular noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: 这样的短语后要用复数名词﹐而不要用单数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: one and a half days (NOT 不说 one and a half day)

Sense.DEF: one of two equal parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two halves make a whole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个一半构成一个整体。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My son’s three and a half now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿子现在三岁半了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an hour and a half later
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个半小时以后
GramExa.EXAMPLE: two and a half thousand people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两千五百人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in the first half of the 19th century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在19世纪上半叶
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kept the other half of the cake for himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把另一半蛋糕留给了自己。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A veil covered the lower half of her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面纱遮住了她的下半边脸。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the southern half of the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的南半部

GramExa.GLOSS: into two equal parts
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 将某物分成/切成/撕成等两半
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tore the piece of paper in half.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把那张纸撕成了两半。

GramExa.GLOSS: make something 50% smaller
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plan to cut European forces by half
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲裁军一半的计划

Sense.DEF: one of the two parts into which a sports event is divided

GramExa.EXAMPLE: France played very well in the first half.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国队上半场打得非常好。

Sense.DEF: a player who plays in the middle part of the field in sports like football, rugby etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 23-year-old Newcastle centre half
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 23岁的纽卡斯尔队中前卫

Sense.DEF: a half of a pint of beer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I have a half of lager, please?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我来半品脱淡啤酒好吗？

Sense.DEF: a child’s ticket, for example on a bus or train, that is cheaper than an adult’s ticket
Sense.EXAMPLE: One and a half to Waterloo, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到滑铁卢一张全票﹐一张半票﹐谢谢。

Sense.DEF: used when you think that something is very unusual or surprising, or very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a meal and a half!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那顿饭棒极了！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a situation is more difficult, complicated, or unpleasant than people realize
Sense.TRAN: 整个情况的一部分〔用于强调比人们所意识到的更难﹑更复杂或更糟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone knows she’s a difficult girl, but they don’t know the half of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都知道她是个难相处的女孩﹐但却不知道她还有更糟糕的一面。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to mean your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 你的另一半〔幽默用法﹐指丈夫或妻子〕

Sense.DEF: to do something very eagerly and using a lot of care and effort
Sense.TRAN: 一丝不苟地做某事﹐做某事不马虎
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure it will be a fantastic wedding. Eva never does anything by halves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定婚礼一定会办得非常出色。伊娃办事从不马虎。

Sense.DEF: to share something, especially the cost of something, equally between two people
Sense.TRAN: 〔两人〕平均分摊(某物的费用)﹔平分﹐对半分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to go halves on a pizza?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要和我合买一个比萨饼吗？

Sense.DEF: very clever, rich etc in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: That boy’s too arrogant by half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩太傲慢了。

Sense.DEF: how people who are much richer or much poorer than you manage their lives, work, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 富人[穷人]是怎样过日子的

Sense.DEF: partly, but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was half in the water and half out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身体一半在水中﹐一半露在水面上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was standing there half dressed, putting on her make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她衣服穿了一半﹐站在那里化着妆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door was only half closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门仅半开着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jug was still half full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个罐子还半满着呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a half-empty wine bottle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半空的葡萄酒瓶
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was only half awake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是半醒着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked half asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去半睡半醒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was half expecting her to say ‘no’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点希望她会说不。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I half hoped that they wouldn’t come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有些希望他们不会来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said it half jokingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是半开玩笑地说的。

Sense.DEF: if something is half one thing and half something else, it is a combination of those two things
Sense.TRAN: 一半〔表示某事物是两种事物的结合〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s half English, half Swiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一半英格兰血统﹐一半瑞士血统。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something bad, to say that it is almost an extremely bad thing
Sense.TRAN: 极其﹐非常〔强调情况很糟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitten looked half starved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小猫看起来饿坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was half dead with exhaustion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他累得半死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had been driven half out of my mind with worry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心得都快发疯了。

Subsense.DEF: half the size, amount etc of something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The new machine has all the same functions, but is only half as large.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台新机器功能和原来的一样﹐但体积只有原来的一半大。

Subsense.DEF: larger by an amount that is equal to half the original size
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A flat in London costs almost half as much again as a flat in Glasgow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的公寓价格几乎比格拉斯哥高出一半。

Sense.DEF: much less good, less interesting etc than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 远不如(某人/某物)好/有趣等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie wasn’t half as entertaining as the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影远不如原书好看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can’t love you half as much as I do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不可能像我这样爱你。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to emphasize an opinion or statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t half talk once she gets started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只要一打开话匣子就没个完。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning good, used especially when you are rather surprised that something is good
Sense.TRAN: 相当好﹐不错〔尤指出乎意料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Actually, the party wasn’t half bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上﹐这次聚会很不错。

Sense.DEF: partly one thing and partly another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group was about half and half, complete beginners and people with some experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小组里有的完全是新手﹐有的有一些经验﹐差不多各占一半。

Sense.DEF: a mixture that is half milk and half cream, used in coffee or tea
Sense.TRAN: 〔加入咖啡或茶中、牛奶和奶油各半的〕稀奶油

Sense.DEF: doing something without making much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a half-arsed attempt to clean up after the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会结束后﹐他草草地收拾了一下。

Sense.DEF: completely stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a half-assed idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是个愚蠢透顶的主意！

Sense.DEF: a player in a game of football, rugby, hockey etc who plays in the middle part of the field
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑英式橄榄球﹑曲棍球等的〕中前卫﹐中场球员

Sense.DEF: a player in American football who, at the start of play, is behind the front line of players and next to the fullback
a half-baked idea, suggestion, plan etc has not been properly planned
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑建议﹑计划等〕不成熟的﹐考虑不周全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always coming out with these half-baked ideas which will never work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是想出这些半半拉拉﹑永远行不通的点子。

Sense.DEF: the price of a room in a hotel that includes breakfast and dinner
Sense.TRAN: 〔包括早餐及晚餐的〕半食宿房价
Sense.EXAMPLE: half board accommodation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半食宿房价的住宿

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone whose parents are of different races, especially one white parent and one Native American parent. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 杂种〔父母为不同种族﹐尤指一方为白人﹐另一方为美洲印第安人〕

Sense.DEF: a brother who is the son of only one of your parents
Sense.TRAN: 同父异母[同母异父]的兄弟

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone whose parents are of different races. Do not use this word.
to do something without enough thought or preparation, so that it is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 草率﹐马虎从事〔结果不成功〕

Sense.DEF: behaving in a slightly crazy uncontrolled way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was half-crazed with pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她疼得快发疯了。

Sense.DEF: a coin used in Britain before 1971. There were eight half crowns in a pound.
Sense.TRAN: 半克朗〔1971年以前的英国硬币﹐合八分之一英镑〕

Sense.DEF: drunk
a day when you work or go to school either in the morning or the afternoon, but not all day
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friday is my half day off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五我休息半天。

Sense.DEF: a half-day event takes place in either the morning or the afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLE: half-day courses on study skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教授学习技巧的半天课程

Sense.DEF: an American or Canadian coin worth 50 cents
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国或加拿大的〕五十分硬币

Sense.DEF: done without much effort and without much interest in the result
Sense.TRAN: 半心半意的﹐敷衍了事的﹐不热心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress has made half-hearted attempts at finance reform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会尝试了一下金融改革﹐却没有尽力而为。

Sense.DEF: an afternoon in which children do not have to go school
a period of time that is 30 minutes long
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fay had been in her room for a good half-hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费伊已经在房里待了足足半个小时。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一档半小时的电视节目

Sense.DEF: done or happening every half hour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trains depart at half-hourly intervals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列车每半小时发出一班。

Sense.DEF: a half-length painting or picture shows the top half of someone’s body
the length of time it takes a radioactive substance to lose half of its radioactivity
the dull grey light you see when it is almost dark but not completely dark
Sense.TRAN: 半明半暗的光﹐灰暗的光线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cold half-light of the early morning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨阴冷昏暗的光线

Subsense.DEF: if a flag is flying at half-mast, it has been raised to the middle of the pole in order to show respect and sadness for someone who has died
Subsense.TRAN: 〔旗帜〕在半旗位置的〔表示对死者的尊敬和哀悼〕

Subsense.DEF: if a piece of clothing is at half-mast, it is lower down the body than is usual

Sense.DEF: actions or methods that are not effective in dealing with the whole of a difficult problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Half measures will not fix the health care system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随随便便的方法不能解决医疗保健制度的问题。

Sense.DEF: the shape of the moon when only half of it is showing
a way of holding your opponent’s arm behind their back in the sport of wrestling
Sense.TRAN: 半尼尔森式﹐单臂扼颈〔摔跤姿势〕

Sense.DEF: a musical note which continues for half the length of a whole note
a small coin worth half of one penny, used in Britain in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国旧时使用的〕半便士硬币

Sense.DEF: a concrete structure which has a rounded bottom and sides and is used for skateboarding
a structure which has a rounded bottom and sides, is made from snow, and is used for snowboarding
half the usual price

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many shoes are at half price or less.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多鞋以半价或更低价格出售。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Half-price tickets will be sold on the day.

Sense.DEF: a sister who is the daughter of only one of your parents
Sense.TRAN: 同父异母[同母异父]的姐妹

Sense.DEF: the difference in pitch between any two notes that are next to each other on a piano
a short holiday from school in the middle of a term
a half-timbered house is usually old and shows the wooden structure of the building on the outside walls
a short period of rest between two parts of a game, such as football or basketball
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑篮球等比赛的〕中场休息

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The score at half-time was 34-7.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场结束时比分为34比7。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a half-time lead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场领先

Sense.DEF: a method of printing black and white photographs that shows different shades of grey by changing the number of black dots in an area of the photograph
a photograph printed by this method
a statement that is only partly true, especially one that is intended to keep something secret
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以隐瞒真相为目的的〕半真半假的陈述
Sense.EXAMPLE: His replies were full of evasions and half-truths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答充满推诿之词和半真半假的鬼话。

Sense.DEF: at a middle point in space or time between two things
Sense.TRAN: 〔空间或时间的〕中间(的)﹐半途(的)

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He chased Kevin halfway up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他追凯文一直追到楼梯的中间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a terrible film - I left halfway through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影太烂﹐我看到一半就离场了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: traffic queues stretching back halfway to London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中途停滞、一路排到伦敦的汽车长龙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve just reached the halfway stage of the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项目他们刚刚进行到一半。

Sense.DEF: to have done something that will allow you to achieve something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Establish the right relationships at work and you’re halfway there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在工作中建立恰当的人际关系﹐你就成功了一半。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/come/go half way to doing sth
Sense.DEF: to achieve something partly but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still only halfway to finishing the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离完成工作还有一半进程呢。

Sense.DEF: reasonably good, normal, successful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the only halfway decent hotel here
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里唯一一家还算体面的宾馆

Sense.DEF: something which is a combination of the qualities of two different things
Sense.TRAN: 介乎两者之间的东西﹐兼有两者性质的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Belief is a kind of halfway house between non-belief and absolute proof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信仰是介乎非信仰和绝对真理之间的一种东西。

Sense.DEF: a place for former prisoners or people who have had problems such as mental illness, where they can live until they are ready to live on their own
Sense.TRAN: 〔为刑满释放者或已痊愈的精神病人重返社会设立的〕过渡教习所[疗养所]﹐重返社会训练所﹐中途之家

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
done or happening every six months
Sense.EXAMPLE: half-yearly meetings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每半年开一次的会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interest you earn will be paid half-yearly in June and December.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所得利息半年支付一次﹐分别在6月和12月。

Sense.DEF: a large flat sea fish used as food
Sense.TRAN: 大比目鱼〔一种食用海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone’s breath smells very bad
the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔住宅的〕门厅﹐〔正门入口处的〕走廊

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hung our coats in a cupboard in the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把外套挂在门厅的衣柜里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge tiled entrance hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺着地砖的大门厅

Sense.DEF: a passage in a building or house that leads to many of the rooms
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each floor had ten rooms on both sides of the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一层在走廊的两边都各有十个房间。

Sense.DEF: a building or large room for public events such as meetings or dances

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school has a new sports hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校有一座新的体育馆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five hundred people filled the lecture hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 500名听众把演讲厅都挤满了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used by people who live in a place
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A coffee morning is to be held in the village hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 村礼堂要举行一次咖啡早会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a concert at Carnegie Hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡内基音乐厅的一场音乐会

Sense.DEF: a college or university building where students live

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a brief time Tom and Dave had shared a room in hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆和戴夫短暂合住过一间学生宿舍。

Sense.DEF: used to express thanks, joy, or praise to God
Sense.TRAN: 哈利路亚〔用于表示感谢﹑欣喜或对上帝的赞美〕

Sense.DEF: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These hotels still offer the sort of service which was the hallmark of the grand days of travel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些酒店依然提供旅游黄金时期的特色服务。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The explosion had all the hallmarks of a terrorist attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起爆炸事件具有恐怖袭击的所有特征。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their performance did not bear the hallmark of European champions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的表现不像是欧洲冠军队。

Sense.DEF: a mark put on silver, gold, or platinum that shows the quality of the metal, and where and when it was made
to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum
Sense.TRAN: 在〔银﹑金或白金制品〕上打印记

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned British spelling of hello
in the US, a list of famous sports players or a building where their uniforms, equipment, and information about them are shown
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕体育名人录﹔(体育)名人堂

Sense.DEF: a college or university building where students live
holy or made holy by religious practices
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bones will be buried in hallowed ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸骸将被安葬在神圣的土地上。

Sense.DEF: important and respected by a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hallowed halls of government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的神圣殿堂
Sense.EXAMPLE: hallowed traditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神圣的传统

Sense.DEF: the night of October 31st, which is now celebrated by children, who dress in costumes and go from house to house asking for sweets, especially in the US and Canada. In the past, people believed the souls of dead people appeared on Halloween.
to see or hear things that are not really there
something which you imagine you can see or hear, but which is not really there, or the experience of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patients suffered hallucinations caused by the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人受药物影响产生了幻觉。

Sense.DEF: causing hallucinations or resulting from hallucinations
Sense.TRAN: 引起幻觉的﹔幻觉导致的
Sense.EXAMPLE: hallucinatory drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致幻药物

Sense.DEF: using strange images, sounds etc like those experienced in a hallucination
Sense.EXAMPLE: hallucinatory poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如梦如幻的诗歌

Sense.DEF: a substance that causes hallucinations
hallucinogenic drugs make people experience hallucinations
the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔住宅的〕门厅﹐〔正门入口处的〕走廊

Sense.DEF: a passage in a building or house that leads to many of the rooms
a bright circle that is often shown above or around the heads of holy people in religious art
a circle of light or something bright

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a halo of sunlight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一圈日晕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a halo of blonde curls
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一圈金色鬈发

Sense.DEF: a halogen light uses halogen gas to produce light
one of a group of five simple chemical substances that make compounds easily
a compound gas that damages the ozone layer
a stop or pause
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt made it stop moving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt was stopped from continuing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop moving or continuing
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 停下/慢慢停下/发着尖锐的声音停下等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole peace process seems to have ground to a halt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个和平进程似乎已经停滞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car skidded to a halt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车打着滑停了下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

Sense.DEF: to stop an activity from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I urge those responsible to call a halt to the violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敦促肇事者停止暴力行径。

Sense.DEF: a place in the countryside where a train stops to let passengers get off, but where there is no station
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡村地区没有车站建筑物的〕小火车站

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has failed to halt economic decline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府没能阻止经济衰退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Safety concerns have led them to halt work on the dam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于安全方面的顾虑﹐他们已经停止水坝的施工。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Halt is mainly used in journalism. In everyday English, people usually say stop.
F2NBox.TRAN: halt主要为新闻用语。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说stop
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They had to stop the building work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只得停止建筑施工。

Sense.DEF: to stop moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The parade halted by a busy corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行队伍在一个热闹的拐角处停下了。

Sense.DEF: used as a military order to tell someone to stop moving or soldiers to stop marching
Sense.EXAMPLE: Company halt!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体立定！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Halt! Who goes there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 站住！是谁？

Sense.DEF: a rope or leather band that fastens around a horse’s head, usually used to lead the horse
a type of clothing for women that ties behind the neck and across the back, so that the arms and back are not covered
Sense.TRAN: 〔在颈后及背部系带的〕女式露背上装﹐三角背心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jen was wearing black shorts and a halter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍穿着黑色短裤和露背装。

Sense.DEF: if your speech or movements are halting, you stop for a moment between words or movements, especially because you are not confident
Sense.TRAN: 断断续续的﹐结结巴巴的﹔迟疑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We carried on a rather halting conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们断断续续地交谈。

Sense.DEF: to reduce something by a half
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cash cuts have halved the number of places available on training courses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经费削减使培训名额减少了一半。

Sense.DEF: to cut or divide something into two equal pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Halve the potatoes lengthwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把马铃薯竖着切成两半。

Sense.DEF: the plural of half
if you go halves with someone, you divide something equally between you, especially money
a rope used to raise or lower a flag or sail
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以升降旗﹑帆的〕吊索﹐升降索

Sense.DEF: the upper part of a pig’s leg, or the meat from this that has been preserved with salt or smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ham sandwich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火腿三明治
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seven-pound ham
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七磅重的火腿

Sense.DEF: someone who receives and sends radio messages for fun rather than as their job
an actor who performs with too much false emotion
Sense.TRAN: 演技做作的演员﹐表演过火的演员

Sense.DEF: to perform with too much false emotion when acting
a flat round piece of finely cut beefmeat from a cow which is cooked and eaten in a bread bun
beef that has been cut into very small pieces
not at all skilful or careful in the way that you deal with people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made several ham-fisted attempts to spy on her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们几次用拙劣的方式监视她。

Sense.DEF: not at all skilful with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 笨手笨脚的﹐手不灵巧的

Sense.DEF: a very small village

Subsense.DEF: a tool with a heavy metal part on a long handle, used for hitting nails into wood
a tool like this with a wooden head used to make something flat, make a noise etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an auctioneer’s hammer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍卖人的木槌

Sense.DEF: to be offered for sale at an auction
an event that damages something very seriously

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision is a hammer blow for the coal industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定对于煤炭业是一个沉重的打击。

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: if people go at each other hammer and tongs, they fight or argue very loudly
Subsense.TRAN: 〔打斗或争吵〕激烈地﹐闹哄哄地

Subsense.DEF: if someone does something hammer and tongs, they do it with all their energy

Sense.DEF: the part of a gun that hits the explosive charge that fires a bullet
a heavy metal ball on a wire with a handle at the end, which you throw as far as possible as a sport
a wooden part of a piano that hits the strings inside to make a musical sound
to hit something with a hammer in order to force it into a particular position or shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hammer the nails into the back of the frame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把钉子锤入框子的背面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All afternoon, Martin had been hammering away in the conservatory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个下午马丁一直在温室里埋头苦干。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the sound of hammering and sawing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锤打和拉锯的声音

Sense.DEF: to hit something many times, especially making a loud noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Daniella hammered at the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹妮拉不停地捶门。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain was hammering against the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨点不停地敲打着窗户。

Sense.DEF: to hurt someone or something by causing them a lot of problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: British industry was being hammered by the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国工业正受到经济衰退的冲击。

Sense.DEF: to hit or kick something very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robinson hammered the ball into the goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁宾逊猛力将球踢进了球门。

Sense.DEF: to strongly criticize or attack someone for something they have said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president has been hammered for his lack of leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统因领导无方而受到猛烈抨击。

Sense.DEF: to make sure that people understand something by repeating it many times
Sense.TRAN: 〔向人们〕反复说明某事﹔强调某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The message must be hammered home that crime doesn’t pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一点必须反复强调犯罪是划不来的。

Sense.DEF: if your heart hammers, you feel it beating strongly and quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood outside the door, her heart hammering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在门外﹐心怦怦直跳。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely at a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal hammered Manchester United 5-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队以5比0大败曼联队。

Sense.DEF: to keep saying something because you want people to understand or accept it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I keep hammering away at this point because it’s important.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直反复强调这一点﹐因为它很重要。

Sense.DEF: to work hard and continuously at something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep on hammering away at achieving your goals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为达到目标要坚持不懈。

Sense.DEF: to keep saying something until people completely understand it
Sense.TRAN: 不断重复使〔某人〕明白〔某事〕﹐向〔某人〕反复灌输〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coach hammered his message into the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练反复向全队灌输他的意图。

Sense.DEF: to decide on an agreement, contract etc after a lot of discussion and disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔经大量讨论及争议后〕商定〔协议﹑合同等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leading oil producers tried to hammer out a deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几大石油生产国试图商定一个协议。

Sense.DEF: the sign of a hammer crossing a sickle on a red background, used as a sign of communism
Sense.TRAN: 锤子和镰刀(图案)〔共产主义的标志〕

Sense.DEF: the flag of the former Soviet Union
very drunk

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a hammering/be given a hammering
Sense.DEF: to be attacked or defeated very severely
Sense.TRAN: 受到猛烈攻击﹔遭遇惨败
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city took a real hammering during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市在战争期间受到猛烈攻击。

Sense.DEF: the sound of someone hitting something with a hammer or with their hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud hammering at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人使劲敲门。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of cloth that is hung between two trees or posts so that you can sleep in it
if a performance by an actor is hammy, it is done with too much false emotion
to make it difficult for someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想跑﹐但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

Sense.DEF: a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present
Sense.TRAN: 有盖篮子〔用于盛装食品或作为礼篮〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picnic hamper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐篮子
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sent us a lovely Christmas hamper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们送给我们一个精美的圣诞礼篮。

Sense.DEF: a large basket that you put dirty clothes in until they can be washed
a small animal that looks like a mouse with no tail
a tendon behind your knee, which sometimes gets injured when you do sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled a hamstring in training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他训练时拉伤了腘绳肌腱。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 腘绳肌腱受伤/问题/扭伤等

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to take the action they want or need to take, especially by restricting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President feels he is hamstrung by Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统觉得自己受到了国会的束缚。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

Sense.DEF: help with something - used in the following phrases

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you need a hand packing?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我帮你收拾行李吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a hand to lift this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能否帮我把这个拎起来？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you get stuck, Denise is always willing to lend a hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有困难﹐丹尼丝总是乐于帮忙。

GramExa.PROPFORM: I could do with a hand/use a hand
GramExa.GLOSS: it would be useful to have some help
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could certainly do with a hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们肯定是需要帮忙的。

Sense.DEF: control, power, or influence that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President has strengthened the hand of the gun lobby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统给枪支游说团体撑了腰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This matter is too important to be left in the hands of in the control of an inexperienced lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事情事关重大﹐不能交给没有经验的律师来处理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a manager with a firm hand who controls things strictly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位管理严格的经理

Sense.DEF: if a situation or person gets out of hand, they become impossible to control any longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The demonstration was getting out of hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威游行开始失控。

Variant.LEXVAR: on the one hand...on the other hand

Sense.DEF: used to give another opinion or fact that should be considered as well as the one you have just given
Sense.TRAN: 另一方面…﹔从一方面来说…﹐从另一方面来说…
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to eat out, but on the other hand I should be trying to save money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想出去吃饭﹐但另一方面我又该省钱。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘on one hand’. Say 而要说 on the one hand.

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone cannot have, take, or touch something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey! Hands off that CD! It’s mine!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐别碰那张CD！它是我的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell your little brother to keep his hands off my car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉你的小弟弟别碰我的汽车。

Subsense.DEF: if something is in hand, it is being done or dealt with
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Plans are in hand to perform ‘Oz’ next semester.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前正在筹划下学期演出《绿野仙踪》的事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lisa seemed to have things in hand by the time he returned.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回来的时候莉萨好像手头有事在忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our officers have to concentrate 100 per cent on the task in hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的官员必须将全部注意力都集中在要处理的事情上。

GramExa.GLOSS: begin to deal with someone’s problems etc

Subsense.DEF: if you work a week, a month etc in hand, you do not get paid until after you have worked two weeks, two months etc
Subsense.TRAN: 押〔一周﹑一个月等的工资〕先干活〔即工作两周﹑两个月等后领薪〕

Subsense.DEF: if you have time, money etc in hand, you have it available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I usually have a few days’ leave in hand at the end of the year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年底的时候通常我手头会有几天假期。

Subsense.DEF: if a team or player has a game in hand in a competition, they still have another game to play in which they could gain more points

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the hands of sb/in sb’s hands
Sense.DEF: being dealt with or cared for by someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The matter is in the hands of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事现在由警方处理。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can be sure your children are in good hands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以放心﹐你的孩子会被照顾得很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The fear is that nuclear secrets could fall into the wrong hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人担心的是核机密可能落入敌人之手。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘in the hand of someone’. Say 而要说 in the hands of someone.

Subsense.DEF: with your arms straight up in the air – used especially to tell someone to do this as a sign that they will not attack you
Subsense.TRAN: 举起手来〔尤用作要人做出投降姿态的命令〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hands up! You’re under arrest!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举起手来！你被捕了！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The men emerged from the building with their hands up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名男子举着双手从楼里走了出来。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell people to put their arm straight up in the air if they know the answer to a question or want to say something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hands up if you agree with what Eric was saying.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同意埃里克说的就举手。

Subsense.DEF: likely to happen soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Recent economic performance suggests that a major crisis is at hand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的经济状况预示着一场重大的危机可能即将到来。

Subsense.DEF: close to you and available to be used
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, help is at hand!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐随时有人可以帮你！

Subsense.DEF: needing to be dealt with now
Subsense.TRAN: 手头的﹐需要马上处理的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Peter turned his attention to the task at hand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得将注意力转移到手头的工作上。

Sense.DEF: something that is to hand is close to you, so that you can reach it easily
close by and ready when needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our staff are always on hand to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的员工会随时提供帮助。

Subsense.DEF: done or made by a person rather than a machine
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We had to wash our clothes by hand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得手洗自己的衣服。

Subsense.DEF: delivered by someone personally, rather than being sent through the post, emailed etc
Subsense.TRAN: 亲手递交的﹐专人递送的

Sense.DEF: if you know or experience something first hand, you have personal experience of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to view at first hand the workings of the court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲身经历法庭工作程序的机会

Sense.DEF: if you know something second, third etc hand, someone tells you about it, but you have no personal experience of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Until now, information has been second or third hand, but this news comes from someone who was there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此前只有间接的消息﹐但这一消息却来自现场人员。

Sense.DEF: caused or done by a particular person - used about something bad or unpleasant that someone does
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who suffered at the hands of care workers will be entitled to compensation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何吃过护理员苦头的人都有资格获得赔偿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is their third defeat at the hands of the world champions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们第三次败在世界冠军队手下了。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s only marrying him to get her hands on his money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁给他只是图他的钱财。

Sense.DEF: to find or get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would read any book I could lay my hands on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是我能到手的书我都要看。

Sense.DEF: if something comes to hand, it is there for you to use - used especially about something that is there by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ran, picking up whatever weapons came to hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不管什么武器拿起来就跑。

Sense.DEF: to catch someone you are angry with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just wait till I get my hands on you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就等着我收拾你吧！

Sense.DEF: to influence or be involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a hand in both goals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个进球都有他的功劳。

Subsense.DEF: if two things go hand in hand, they are closely connected
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wealth and power go hand in hand in most societies.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大多数社会里﹐财富和权力都是密切相关的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They say that genius often goes hand in hand with madness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说天才往往都是疯子。

Subsense.DEF: if two people walk, stand etc hand in hand, they walk, stand etc while they are holding each other’s hand
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They walked hand in hand in silence up the path.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们手拉手﹐默默地沿着小路走去。

Sense.DEF: to have a difficult job, problem, situation etc to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 手头有某事/某人待处理〔指困难的事情﹑问题等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid we have a murder on our hands, Inspector.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们恐怕有一宗谋杀案要处理﹐督察。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone is off your hands, you are not responsible for them any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once this problem is off our hands we can relax for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题一脱手﹐我们就可以放松一下了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wants someone to take the kids off her hands occasionally.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望偶尔有人能替她一下﹐带一下孩子。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something you have not tried before
Sense.EXAMPLE: John dreamed of being a writer and had tried his hand at poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰梦想成为作家﹐已尝试过写诗。

Sense.DEF: to do something well, even if it is the first time you have tried
Sense.TRAN: 能做好某事〔即使是第一次尝试的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larry’s one of those men who can turn their hand to anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉里是那种什么都拿得起来的人。

Sense.DEF: without even stopping to consider what someone has suggested, asked for etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: reject/dismiss/refuse etc sth out of hand
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Aromatherapy was dismissed out of hand by traditional doctors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的医生断然认为香薰疗法根本不值一提。

Sense.DEF: easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nigel always won hands down in any argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论争辩什么﹐奈杰尔总是毫不费劲地获胜。

Sense.DEF: to be very busy or too busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can’t it wait? I already have my hands full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事不能等一下吗？我已经忙得团团转了。

Sense.DEF: skilful at making things
on both sides or in every direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thick forest stood on either hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两面都是茂密的森林。

Subsense.DEF: to do hard or dirty physical work - usually used in questions or negative statements
Subsense.TRAN: 干体力活﹐干脏活〔通常用于疑问句或否定句中〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s not that the jobs aren’t there, it’s just that she doesn’t want to get her hands dirty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是没有事做﹐只是她不想干脏活累活。

Subsense.DEF: to get involved in the difficult, dishonest, or unpleasant side of something
Subsense.TRAN: 牵连到困难[不诚实﹐讨厌]的事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He never talked to the media or got his hands dirty in any way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不和媒体打交道﹐也绝不去沾惹什么事情。

Sense.DEF: to do something that you used to do a lot, so you do not forget how to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should at least work part-time, just to keep your hand in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你至少应该做一份兼职工作﹐免得生疏了。

Sense.DEF: closely connected with someone, especially in an illegal activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Far from being independent, the government and media work hand in glove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府和媒体互相勾结﹐绝非各不相干。

Sense.DEF: if you gain or lose something hand over fist, you gain or lose it very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Five years ago, the company was losing money hand over fist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年前﹐这家公司一下子亏了很多钱。

Sense.DEF: used to tell the people who are watching a performance to clap or cheer loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s all give the girls a big hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家都给女孩们热烈鼓掌加油吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that everyone is needed to help in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: With only half an hour to get everything ready, it was all hands on deck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有半小时就要把一切都准备好﹐这得人人出力了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the left hand does not know what the right hand is doing
Sense.DEF: used to say that two parts of an organization that should be doing the same thing are each doing different things without the other knowing
Sense.TRAN: 〔同一机构中的两个部门〕各干各的﹐各自为政

Sense.DEF: someone who does physical work on a farm, factory, ship etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔农场﹑工厂或船上等的〕体力劳动者
Sense.EXAMPLE: farm hands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场工人

Subsense.DEF: the playing cards given to one person in a game
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a winning hand
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一手赢牌

Subsense.DEF: a single game of cards

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of metal that points at the numbers on a clock
someone’s handwriting
if someone’s hands are tied, they cannot help in a particular situation because of rules, laws etc
Sense.TRAN: 某人受到约束〔因而无能为力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank claims its hands are tied by federal regulators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行声称受到联邦监管机构的约束。

Subsense.DEF: to tie up someone’s hands and feet
to make it very difficult or impossible for someone to do what they think is best

Sense.LEXUNIT: can do sth with one hand (tied) behind your back
Sense.DEF: used to say that you can do something very easily
to do no work at all
permission for a man to marry a particular woman
Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked for her hand in marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她求婚。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring the height of a horse, equal to about ten centimetres
Sense.TRAN: 一掌﹐掌宽〔用于量度马匹高度的单位﹐约10厘米〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: bite the hand that feeds you
have your hands/fingers in the till
shake sb’s hand/shake hands with sb

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She held the book in her right hand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她右手拿着书。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Marta waved a hand to attract his attention.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛尔塔挥挥手想引起他的注意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were singing and clapping their hands.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们边唱歌边拍手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Go wash your hands before dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭前要去洗手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Joanne and Kevin held hands on the sofa.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔安妮和凯文手拉手坐在沙发上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Nice to meet you,’ he said, as they shook hands.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “很高兴见到你。”他们握手时他说。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hold someone’s hand
hold someone’s hand in order to take them somewhere
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 牵某人的手〔带某人去某地〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take hold of the hands of people on either side of you
hold them together tightly
put your hands together and rest them on something
lift your hand, especially when you want to ask or answer a question
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 举手〔尤指想要提问或回答问题〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had a suitcase in his hand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手中拎着一只手提箱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a crawling position
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They got down on their hands and knees to search.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们趴下来找。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the inside surface of your hand
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The phone could fit into the palm of his hand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电话他握着正合适。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the outside surface of your hand
without using a tool, weapon, machine etc

PIC.HEADING: HAND 手
PIC.PICCONTENT: middle finger 中指；index finger 食指；palm 手掌；wrist 手腕；thumb 拇指；fingernail 手指甲；ring finger 无名指；littlefinger小指

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone else with your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He handed the teacher a slip of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他交给老师一张纸条。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lit a cigarette and handed it to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他点了一支烟递给她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This form must be handed to all employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份表格必须发到所有雇员手中。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you have to hand it to sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that you admire someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to hand it to her. She’s really made a success of that company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不得不佩服她﹐她的确把那家公司经营得很成功。

Sense.DEF: to offer something to each person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Willie helped hand the mugs around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威利帮忙分发啤酒杯。

Sense.DEF: to give something back to the person who gave it to you, with your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kurt examined the document and handed it back to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库尔特检查过文件后就交还给她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She handed him his pen back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把钢笔交还给他。

Sense.DEF: to give something back to the person who used to own it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land was handed back to its original owner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那块土地被归还给了原来的主人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to hand investors back their money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府允诺归还投资者钱款。

Sense.DEF: to give or leave something to people who will live after you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ring was handed down to her from her grandmother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这枚戒指是她祖母传给她的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: stories handed down by word of mouth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口口相传的故事

Sense.DEF: to officially announce a decision, punishment etc
Sense.TRAN: 公布[宣布]一项决定/裁决/判决等

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone in authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom has handed in his resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆已提交辞职信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you hand your homework in on time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准时交家庭作业了吗？

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of handing on government secrets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控泄露政府机密。

Sense.DEF: to give something to each person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you start handing these books out please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把这些书分发下去好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was handing out leaflets to members of the audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在给观众分发宣传小册子。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone with your hand, especially because they have asked for it or should have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were ordered to hand over their guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们被命令交出枪支。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He handed the phone over to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把电话交给我。

Sense.DEF: to give someone power or responsibility over something which you used to be in charge of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On his retirement, he handed the business over to his son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他退休时把生意移交给了他儿子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Political control has been handed over to religious leaders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治控制权已转至宗教领导人手中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now she feels the time has come to hand over to someone else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得现在该是找人接手的时候了。

Sense.DEF: a small bag in which a woman carries money and personal things
used humorously to describe a situation in which two people are fighting, but in a way that is so weak or lacking in force that the fight is funny to watch
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dennis looked like he threw a punch, but it was just handbags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼斯看似挥了一拳﹐其实只是装样子。

Sense.DEF: a game in which two teams try to score points by throwing or hitting a ball with their hands
a game in which players hit a ball against a wall with their hand
a ball that is used to play handball
the act of touching the ball with your hands in a game of football, which is not allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee gave a free kick for handball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为手球犯规﹐裁判员判罚任意球。

Sense.DEF: a small printed notice or advertisement that is given to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students distributed handbills calling for better funding for schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们散发传单﹐要求增加学校经费。

Sense.DEF: a short book that gives information or instructions about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Fiction Writer’s Handbook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《小说写作手册》

Sense.DEF: a brake in a car that you pull up with your hand to stop the car from moving when it is parked
a small railway vehicle that people move along by pushing large handles up and down
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路上的〕手泵式小车﹐手摇车

Sense.DEF: a small vehicle that you push or pull by hand and use for carrying goods
if people give someone a slow handclap, they hit their hands together slowly to show that they disapprove of them
Sense.TRAN: 慢吞吞的鼓掌〔表示不满〕

Sense.DEF: skilfully made by hand, not by machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handcrafted rocking chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手工做成的摇椅

Sense.DEF: to put handcuffs on someone
a pair of metal rings joined by a chain. Handcuffs are used for holding a prisoner’s wrists together.
Sense.EXAMPLE: They put handcuffs on the two men and led them away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给两名男子戴上手铐﹐把他们带走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was brought into the court in handcuffs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他戴着手铐被带入法庭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of handcuffs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副手铐

Sense.DEF: the way in which your hands and eyes work together, especially in sport, so that you can throw, hit, and catch a ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育运动中的〕手眼协调

Sense.DEF: an amount that you can hold in your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩捡起一把石子﹐开始朝我们扔过来。

Sense.DEF: a very small number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were only a handful of people there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里只有几个人。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is a handful is difficult to control
Sense.TRAN: 是难管教[控制]的人〔尤指孩子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a lovely child, but she can be a bit of a handful sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个可爱的孩子﹐不过有时候会比较难管。

Sense.DEF: a small bomb that you throw
a small gun that you hold in one hand when you fire it
a hand-held machine is small enough to hold in your hand when you use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hand-held camera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手提摄像机
Sense.EXAMPLE: hand-held video games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌上游戏机

Sense.DEF: a pda
a part of something that you can hold onto when climbing it
Sense.TRAN: 攀爬时手可抓的东西[地方]

Sense.DEF: if someone has a handicap, a part of their body or their mind has been permanently injured or damaged. Many people think that this word is offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体或智力上的〕残障﹐残疾〔许多人认为此词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

Sense.DEF: an advantage that is given to a weaker player in a game of golf
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球比赛中〕给弱者的让杆数
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s improved a lot, and his handicap has come down from 18 to 12.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的球技大大进步﹐被让杆数已从18降为12。

Sense.DEF: a race for horses in which the best horses carry extra weight so that all the horses have an equal chance of winning
Sense.TRAN: 〔给最好的马额外负重的〕让步赛

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity is handicapped by lack of funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个慈善机构因为缺乏资金难以开展工作。

Sense.DEF: if someone is handicapped, a part of their body or their mind has been permanently injured or damaged. Some people think that this word is offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 残疾的﹔弱智的〔有人认为此词具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a special school for mentally handicapped children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弱智儿童特殊学校

Sense.DEF: people who are handicapped. Some people think that this expression is offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 残障人士〔有人认为此词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: an activity such as sewing or making baskets, in which you use your hands in a skilful way to make things
something that someone has made in a skilful way using their hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop selling handicrafts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家出售手工艺品的商店

Sense.DEF: something that is handily placed is in a position where it can easily be reached or used
Sense.EXAMPLE: She kept the key handily by the back door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把钥匙挂在后门﹐方便拿取。

Sense.DEF: if you win something handily, you win easily

Subsense.DEF: something that someone has made or done using their hands in a skilful way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She stood back and admired her handiwork.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她退后几步欣赏自己的手艺。

Subsense.DEF: something that someone has done or caused
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The explosion looks like the handiwork of terrorists.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次爆炸看来像是恐怖分子所为。
