Sense.DEF: the act of touching or rubbing a man’s sex organs to give him sexual pleasure
a piece of cloth that you use for drying your nose or eyes
to do the things that are necessary to complete a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: I handled most of the paperwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分文书工作是我做的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance department handles all the accounts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务部处理所有账目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机能处理大量数据。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a situation or problem by behaving in a particular way and making particular decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The headmaster handled the situation very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长很好地处理了这一情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew I had handled the matter badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这件事我处理得很糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave it to me. I can handle it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它交给我吧﹐我能应付的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most customers were satisfied with the way their complaints were handled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数客人对自己投诉的受理方式感到满意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition leaders will be watching carefully to see how the Prime Minister handles the crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党领导人将密切注意首相如何处理这一危机。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a person or behave towards them in a particular way, especially in order to keep them happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some customers are quite difficult to handle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些客人很难应付。

Sense.DEF: to not become upset in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can’t handle it when people criticize her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受不得别人对她的批评。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t handle stress very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不太会调节压力。

Sense.DEF: to touch something or pick it up and hold it in your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had never handled a weapon before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前从未碰过武器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We teach the children to handle the animals gently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们教孩子们要温柔地抚摸动物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was roughly handled by the mob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到暴民粗暴的推搡。

Subsense.DEF: to control the movement of a vehicle or an animal
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know if I’d be able to handle such a large vehicle.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道我能不能驾驶这么大一辆车。

Subsense.DEF: the way a vehicle handles is how easy it is to control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car handles well, even on wet roads.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车很好开﹐即使在湿滑的路上也没问题。

Sense.DEF: to move goods from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Post Office handles nearly 2 billion letters and parcels over the Christmas period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节期间邮政局要处理近20亿件信件和包裹。

Sense.DEF: to buy or sell goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bennet was charged with handling stolen goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝内特被控买卖赃物。

Sense.DEF: the part of a door that you use for opening it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then he turned the handle and went in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后他转动把手走了进去。

Sense.DEF: the part of an object that you use for holding it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knife with a carved wooden handle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带雕花木柄的刀
Sense.EXAMPLE: the handle of his cup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他杯子的柄
Sense.EXAMPLE: a broom handle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扫帚柄

Sense.DEF: to start to understand a situation, subject etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to get a handle on how widespread this problem is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难了解这个问题的普遍程度。

PIC.HEADING: HANDLES 把手
PIC.PICCONTENT: handle 柄；door handle 门把手；handle提手；handle 拉手；handle 拉手；label 标签

Sense.DEF: a long thick moustache which curves upwards at both ends
the bar above the front wheel of a bicycle or motorcycle that you turn to control its direction
someone who trains an animal, especially a dog
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police dog handler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警犬训练员

Sense.DEF: someone who touches, carries, or moves things as their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: All food handlers should be properly trained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品操作员都应该接受适当的培训。
Sense.EXAMPLE: baggage handlers at the airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场行李员

Sense.DEF: someone who helps and advises an important person
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is kept well away from the press by her handlers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的顾问使她得以远离媒体。

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone does a job or deals with a situation, problem, or person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President has been much criticized for his handling of the crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统对这场危机的处理大受批评。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Such a situation needs very careful handling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情况处理起来需要格外小心。

Sense.DEF: the act of touching something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The equipment should be able to withstand a certain amount of rough handling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件设备应该能经得住一定的磕碰。

Sense.DEF: the act of buying, selling, or moving goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: cargo handling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物搬运
Sense.EXAMPLE: A special licence is required for the manufacture or handling of any dangerous chemical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产或销售危险化学品必须获得特殊许可证。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a vehicle can be controlled, especially how easy it is for a driver to control it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a lovely little car – the ride is comfortable and the handling excellent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆小汽车真不错——乘坐舒适﹐操控非常灵便。

Sense.DEF: the amount that someone charges for dealing with goods or moving them from one place to another
a small machine for weaving by hand
the small bags that you carry with you when you are travelling on a plane
made by people using their hands, not by a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of expensive handmade shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双昂贵的手工制作的鞋子

Sense.DEF: a female servant
something that supports an idea, system, or way of life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Science must not become the handmaiden of the state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学绝不能成为政府的附庸。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing which has been used by someone and then given to another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to wear hand-me-downs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿意穿别人穿过的旧衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: hand-me-down clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人穿过的旧衣服

Sense.DEF: money or goods that are given to someone, for example because they are poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who have to live on handouts from the state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须依赖国家发放的救济金生活的人们
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cash handout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救济款

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper with information, which is given to people who are attending a lesson, meeting etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔分发给听众的〕材料﹐讲义﹐印刷品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please read the handout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请看一下发下来的材料。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving someone else control of a place or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president will remain in office until the official handover in April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在4月份正式移交职权之前﹐总统将继续留任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a smooth handover of power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 权力的顺利移交
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the handover of the business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移交业务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The handover to civilian government has been delayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向文官政府移交权力推迟了。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving something to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They demanded the immediate handover of all relevant documents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求立即递交所有相关文件。

Sense.DEF: someone who is handpicked has been carefully chosen for a special purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of his handpicked advisers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精挑细选的顾问之一

Sense.DEF: a movement in skateboarding and snowboarding in which you hold the back part of your board with one hand and put your other hand down on the top edge of a ramp as you turn to ride back down the ramp
Sense.TRAN: 〔滑板﹑单板滑雪运动中双腿腾空﹐以单手握住滑板后部﹐另一手支撑在坡道顶端边沿的〕单手倒立

Sense.DEF: a long bar that is fixed to the side of a set of stairs for people to hold while they walk up or down
a small tool for cutting wood, which has a flat metal blade with a lot of sharp V-shaped teeth
the part of a telephone that you hold near your ear and mouth
the part of a mobile phone that you hold in your hand
a handsfree machine is one that you can use without using your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handsfree phone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免提电话

Sense.DEF: the act of taking someone’s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have made an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He greeted me with a handshake and a glass of wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与我握手问候﹐并递给我一杯酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her handshake was warm and firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的握手温暖而有力。

Sense.DEF: a special signal sent between two computers, fax machines etc when they begin to exchange information
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机﹑传真机等之间开始互传信息的〕交换信号

Sense.DEF: a hands-off way of organizing something involves letting people do what they want and make their own decisions, without telling them what to do
Sense.TRAN: 放手的﹔不干涉的﹔不插手的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hands-off style of management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放手式管理
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has a hands-off approach to the industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对这一行业采取不干涉的政策。

Subsense.DEF: a man who is handsome looks attractive
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an extremely handsome young man
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位特别英俊的年轻人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sam was tall, dark, and handsome.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆高大黝黑﹐相貌堂堂。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: his handsome face
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他英俊的脸庞

Subsense.DEF: a woman who is handsome looks attractive in a strong healthy way

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say good-looking rather than handsome.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说good-looking﹐而不说handsome
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her new boyfriend is really good-looking.

Sense.DEF: an animal, object, or building that is handsome looks attractive in an impressive way
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物﹑物体〕漂亮的﹐给人印象深的﹔〔建筑〕宏伟的﹐雄伟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a row of handsome Georgian houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排宏伟的乔治王朝时期的房子

Sense.DEF: a handsome amount of money is large
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to make a handsome profit out of the deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从这笔买卖中赚取了丰厚的利润。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handsome fee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大笔费用

Sense.DEF: a handsome gift or prize is worth a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some handsome prizes to be won.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以赢到丰厚的奖品。

Sense.DEF: a handsome victory is important and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won a handsome victory in the elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在选举中取得了重大的胜利。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was handsomely rewarded by the king.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到国王丰厚的赏赐。

Sense.DEF: doing something yourself rather than just talking about it or telling other people to do it
Sense.TRAN: 实际操作的﹐亲身实践的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to get some hands-on experience of the job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得一些实际工作经验的机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a very hands-on approach to management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他采用事必躬亲的管理方式。

Sense.DEF: a quick movement in which you put your hands on the ground, move your feet over your head, and stand up again
a movement in which you put your hands on the ground and your legs in the air
hand-to-hand fighting is a way of fighting in which people use their hands and knives rather than guns

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was fierce hand-to-hand fighting in the streets of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市街道上发生了激烈的肉搏战。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were defeated in hand-to-hand combat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在肉搏战中他们被打败了。

Sense.DEF: if you have a hand-to-mouth existence, you have just enough money and food to live
Sense.TRAN: 勉强糊口的﹐只够糊口的

Sense.DEF: a tool that does not use electricity
a small piece of cloth that you use for drying your hands
if you handwash a piece of clothing, you wash it by hand, not in a washing machine
the style of someone’s writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I recognised her handwriting on the envelope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认出了信封上她的笔迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My handwriting has never been very neat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的字从来都写得不够工整。

Sense.DEF: written by hand, not printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handwritten letter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手写的信

Sense.DEF: useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quite a handy little tool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件小工具非常有用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy be useful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带上你的游泳裤﹐可能会派上用场的。

Sense.DEF: near and easy to reach
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always keep my gun handy just in case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是随身带着枪以防万一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a piece of paper handy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你手边有纸吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was in Drury Lane, very handy for the theatre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子在德鲁里街﹐离剧院很近。

Sense.DEF: good at using something, especially a tool
Sense.TRAN: 手巧的﹐灵活的﹐善用〔尤指工具〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s very handy with a screwdriver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他善于修修弄弄。

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at doing repairs and practical jobs in the house

Subsense.DEF: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a position where the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An old-fashioned gas lamp hung from the ceiling.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盏老式煤气灯吊挂在天花板上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her long hair hung loose about her shoulders.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的长发披散在肩上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The shirt hung down almost to his ankles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衬衫差不多都垂到他脚踝了。

Subsense.DEF: to fix a picture, photograph etc to a wall
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to hang the picture in the hall.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把这幅画挂在门厅里。

Subsense.DEF: if a picture, photograph etc is hanging somewhere, it is fixed to a wall
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a family photograph hanging on the wall.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上挂着一幅全家福。

Subsense.DEF: if the walls of a room are hung with pictures or decorations, the pictures etc are on the walls
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The entrance hall was hung with rich tapestries.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门厅的墙上挂着华丽的壁毯。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by dropping them with a rope around their neck, or to die in this way, especially as a punishment for a serious crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was hanged for murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因谋杀罪而被绞死。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Corey hanged himself in his prison cell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科里在囚室里上吊自杀。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If he is found guilty, he will almost certainly hang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果被判有罪﹐他几乎肯定会被处以绞刑。

Sense.DEF: to fasten attractive paper to a wall in order to decorate a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the afternoon hanging wallpaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下午在贴墙纸。

Sense.DEF: to fasten a door in position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hanging a door is quite a tricky job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装门是个很费事的活儿。

Sense.DEF: if something such as smoke hangs in the air, it stays in the air for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smoke from the bonfires hung in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 篝火的烟在空中缭绕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A thick mist hung over the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇笼罩在浓浓的雾霭中。

Sense.DEF: if a door, someone’s mouth etc hangs open, it is open
if something hangs in the balance, it is not certain what will happen to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The future of the company hangs in the balance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的前景无法预料。

Sense.DEF: if something is hanging by a thread, it is in a very dangerous situation and may not continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is still in hospital, his life hanging by a thread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍在医院里﹐命悬一线。

Sense.DEF: to remain brave and determined when you are in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. Just hang on in there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐坚持到底就好。

Sense.DEF: to look ashamed and embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hung her head, not sure how to reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她垂下头﹐不知该如何回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daphne had hung her head in shame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达夫妮羞愧地低下了头。

Sense.DEF: to wait for a short while before you do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we should hang fire for a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们应该等一星期再说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: leave sth hanging in the air
Sense.DEF: to leave something in a situation where it has not been explained, completed, or dealt with
Sense.EXAMPLE: His resignation has left some important questions hanging in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他辞职后留下一些重要问题有待解决。

Sense.DEF: to turn right or left when driving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go straight on for two blocks, then hang a left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 继续往前开两个街区﹐然后左转。

Sense.DEF: to spend time somewhere, relaxing and enjoying yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were just hanging with the dudes at Mike’s house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是在迈克家和几个哥们儿泡在一起。

Sense.DEF: used to express annoyance or to say that you will not allow something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be hanged if I’ll give them any money!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休想让我给他们一分钱！

Sense.DEF: to say that you are disappointed or annoyed about something
used to say that you are not going to do something
Sense.TRAN: 让某事见鬼去吧〔表示不想做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh hang the report, let’s go for a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写什么鬼报告﹐我们去喝一杯吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I/you might as well be hanged for a sheep as (for) a lamb
Sense.DEF: used to say that, if a small action may have the same bad results for you as a larger one, there is no reason for not doing the larger thing
to move slowly or take too long doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, we haven’t got time to hang about!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐我们没时间拖拖拉拉了！

Sense.DEF: to spend time somewhere without any real purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were always groups of boys hanging about in the square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广场上总是有一群群男孩在闲荡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He normally hung about the house all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他通常都是整天待在房子里无所事事。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone to wait or stop what they are doing
used when you have just noticed or thought of something that is interesting or wrong
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hang about – that can’t be right.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等﹐那肯定有问题。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time with someone
to wait or spend time somewhere, doing nothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hung around the station for an hour but he never came.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在车站等了一小时﹐但他始终没来。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people I used to hang around with were much older than me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前和我混在一起的人都比我年长许多。

Sense.DEF: to stay a short distance away from someone or something, and not go too near them
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某人或某物〕保持一小段距离
Sense.EXAMPLE: Instinctively he hung back in the shelter of a rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本能地退到一块岩石后面躲起来。

Sense.DEF: to not say or do something because you are shy or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害羞或害怕而〕吞吞吐吐﹔犹豫

Sense.DEF: to hold something tightly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hung on to the side of the cart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧紧抓住手推车的一边。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hang on tight!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓紧了！

Sense.DEF: spoken

Subsense.DEF: used to ask or tell someone to wait
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hang on! I’ll be back in a minute.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等！我一会儿就回来。

Subsense.DEF: used when you have just noticed or thought of something that is interesting or wrong
Subsense.TRAN: 且慢！〔用于表示刚发现或想到什么有趣或不对的事情〕

Sense.DEF: to depend on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything hangs on the outcome of this meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都取决于这次会议的结果。

Sense.DEF: to pay close attention to everything someone is saying
Sense.TRAN: 倾听[注意]某人说的话/每一个字
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was watching his face, hanging on his every word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她注视着他的脸﹐倾听他说的每一个字。

Sense.DEF: to keep something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll hang on to the documents for a bit longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我会把这些文件再保存一段时间。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time in a particular place or with particular people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t really know who she hangs out with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太清楚她平时都和一些什么人混在一起。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do the youngsters hang out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人都到哪儿去消遣？

Sense.DEF: to hang clothes outside in order to dry them
Sense.EXAMPLE: My job was to hang out the washing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作就是晾晒洗好的衣物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hang the wet things out to dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些湿东西拿出去晾干。

Sense.DEF: to relax and do what you like
if something bad is hanging over you, you are worried or anxious about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The threat of redundancy was still hanging over us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业的威胁依然笼罩在我们心头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not very nice to have huge debts hanging over your head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心里牵挂着巨额债务总是很难受的。

Sense.DEF: if a plan, story, set of ideas etc hangs together, it is well organized and its different parts go well together
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑故事﹑系列观点等〕站得住脚﹐前后一致
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her story just doesn’t hang together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的说法前后根本不一致。

Sense.DEF: if people hang together, they help each other
to finish a telephone conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said goodbye and hung up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说完再见就挂了电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t hang up on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别挂我的电话。

Sense.DEF: to hang clothes on a hook etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took her coat off and hung it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脱下外套挂起来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: hang up your hat/football boots/briefcase etc
Sense.DEF: to stop doing a particular kind of work
Sense.TRAN: 离开某一工作/挂靴/退休等

Sense.DEF: to learn how to do something or use something
Sense.TRAN: 学会做某事﹔学会使用某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems difficult at first, but you’ll soon get the hang of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始时看上去挺难﹐不过很快你就会掌握的。

Sense.DEF: a very large building in which aircraft are kept
an expression that shows you feel sorry or ashamed about something
Sense.TRAN: 难过的表情﹐羞愧的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell from his hangdog look that things had gone badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从他难过的表情中看出情况很不好。

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of wood or metal with a hook on top, used for hanging clothes on
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took off her jacket and hung it on a hanger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脱下夹克挂在衣架上。

Sense.DEF: someone who spends a lot of time with a rich or important person, because they hope to get some advantage for themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was surrounded by a crowd of friends and hangers-on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身边围着一群朋友和逢迎拍马的人。

Sense.DEF: a large frame covered with cloth that you hold on to and fly slowly through the air on, without an engine
someone who flies using a hang-glider
the sport of flying using a hang-glider
the act of killing someone by putting a rope around their neck and dropping them, used as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: public hangings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当众执行的绞刑
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who believe that bringing back hanging will reduce the amount of crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相信恢复绞刑会减少犯罪数量的人

Sense.DEF: a large piece of cloth that is hung on a wall as a decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colourful wall hanging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挂在墙上的彩帘

Sense.DEF: a basket with plants growing in it that is hung on the outside of a building as decoration
someone whose job is to kill criminals by hanging them
a piece of skin that has become loose near the bottom of your fingernail
a place someone likes to go to often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar is a favourite hangout for students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒吧是学生们爱去的地方。

Sense.DEF: a pain in your head and a feeling of sickness that you get the day after you have drunk too much alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a terrible hangover the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天我的宿醉反应很厉害。

Sense.DEF: something from the past that still exists or happens but is no longer necessary or useful
Sense.TRAN: 旧时遗留之物〔已不需要或有用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This feeling was a hangover from her schooldays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情感是她学生时代遗留下来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an institution which is a hangover from Victorian times
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代留存下来的机构

Sense.DEF: a feeling of worry or embarrassment about something that you have although there is no real reason to feel this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had cured him of all his hang-ups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她消除了他所有的顾虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s got a real hang-up about her body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为自己的身体非常苦恼。

Sense.DEF: an amount of wool or thread that has been wound into a loose ball
to feel strongly that you want something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hankered for a new life in a different country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她渴望在异国开始新的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: holidaymakers who hanker after the sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴求阳光的度假者

Sense.DEF: a strong wish to have or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his hankering for adventure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对探险的渴望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always had a hankering to be a doctor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直渴望成为一名医生。

Sense.DEF: a handkerchief
sexual activity – used humorously
a small vehicle pulled by a horse which was used in the past as a taxi
an eight-day Jewish holiday in November or December
another spelling of halfpenny
happening or done in a way that is not planned or organized
Sense.TRAN: 无计划的﹐没有条理的﹐随意的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I continued my studies in a rather haphazard way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我毫无计划地继续着学业。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Educational provision in the country is haphazard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国提供的教育毫无计划性。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: bushes growing haphazardly here and there

Sense.DEF: unlucky
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hapless passengers were stranded at the airport for three days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒霉的乘客在机场滞留了三天。

Sense.DEF: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: When did the accident happen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故什么时候发生的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something terrible has happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了可怕的事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她继续干﹐似乎什么都未曾发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事注定早晚会发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of thing happens all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种事一直在发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll still be friends, whatever happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管发生什么﹐我们仍然是朋友。

Sense.DEF: if something happens to someone or something, they are affected by an event
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事发生什么事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should be here by now – something must have happened to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在应该到了﹐一定是发生了什么事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The same thing happened to me last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年﹐同样的事在我身上发生了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s happened to your coat? It’s all ripped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的外套怎么了？都扯破了。

Sense.DEF: if you happen to do something, you do it by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I happened to see James in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我碰巧在镇上遇见詹姆斯。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone something in an angry way
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物碰巧[凑巧]是…〔表示恼怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This happens to be my house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这正巧是我家！

Sense.LEXUNIT: as it happens/it just so happens
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone something that is surprising, interesting, or useful
Sense.TRAN: 碰巧﹐正巧〔用于告诉某人惊讶﹑有趣或有用的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真巧﹐我正好认识一个人﹐这个人也许帮得上忙。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry about a mistake they have made, an accident they have caused etc
Sense.TRAN: 这种事情难免会发生〔用于告诉某人别因自己犯了错﹑出了事等而担忧〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not your fault – these things happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是你的错﹐这是在所难免的。

Sense.DEF: used to ask where a person or thing is now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever happened to Steve? I haven’t seen him for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫哪里去了？我已经好久没见他了。

Exponent.DEF: used especially when talking about events that have not been planned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When did the accident happen?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故什么时候发生的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Something terrible has happened!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了可怕的事！

Exponent.DEF: to happen – used especially when talking about events that have been planned or that have already happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指按照计划或已经〕发生﹐进行
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The conference will take place on the 16th of June.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大会将于6月16日举行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The competition took place on Saturday 30th June.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛于6月30日(星期六)举行。

Exponent.DEF: to happen – used especially when talking about events that have not been planned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The incident occurred outside the police station at around 9 pm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次事件发生在晚上9点左右﹐事发地点在警察局外面。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that a particular event happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was an earthquake about a week ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约一周前发生了一次地震。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are strikes almost every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每年都会发生罢工。

Exponent.DEF: to happen – used about problems, questions, or opportunities
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There aren’t any jobs at the moment, but we’ll let you know if something comes up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前没有职位空缺﹐要是有了我们会通知你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This question often comes up when I’m talking to students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和学生交谈时﹐这个问题常常会出现。

Exponent.DEF: to happen unexpectedly – used about problems, arguments, or difficult situations
Exponent.TRAN: 〔问题﹑争论或困境意外地〕发生﹐出现
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A dispute arose about who should receive the money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于谁该得到这笔钱发生了纠纷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is best to deal with the problem as soon as it arises.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是问题一出现就解决。

Exponent.DEF: to happen – used about problems or difficult situations, especially ones that are less serious, and can quickly be dealt with
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指不太严重的问题或困境〕突然出现﹐发生
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The banks will contact their customers if a problem crops up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有突发问题﹐银行会与客户联系。

Exponent.DEF: to happen suddenly and unexpectedly – used about very bad events
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hurricane struck at around 1 am.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨1点左右飓风突然来袭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Disaster struck, and he lost all movement in his legs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 灾难降临﹐他的双腿完全瘫痪了。

Exponent.DEF: to happen in a particular way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Luckily, everything turned out well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸结果一切都顺利。

Sense.DEF: to find something or meet someone by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I happened on the restaurant by chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偶然发现了这家餐馆。

Sense.DEF: something that happens, especially a strange event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There have been reports of strange happenings in the town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇上不断传出有怪事发生。

Sense.DEF: fashionable and exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brighton is definitely a happening place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖顿绝对是个时尚之地。

Sense.DEF: chance, or something that happens by chance
in a happy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michelle smiled happily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔高兴地笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a happily married man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是个快乐的已婚男人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So she married the prince, and they lived happily ever after used at the end of children’s stories to say that someone was happy for the rest of their life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁给了王子﹐他们从此过着幸福的生活。

Sense.DEF: fortunately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Happily, his injuries were not serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好﹐他的伤势并不严重。

Sense.DEF: very willingly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d happily go for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很乐意为你去一趟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most restaurants will happily accept payment by cheque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数餐馆会乐意接受支票付款。

Sense.DEF: the state of being happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Juliet’s eyes shone with happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱丽叶的双眼闪耀着幸福的光芒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want our children to have the best possible chance of happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望自己的孩子得到追求幸福的最佳机会。

Sense.DEF: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a lovely house and we’ve been very happy here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子很漂亮﹐我们住在这里非常开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never felt happier in my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一生从未感到如此快乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a happy child who rarely cried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个快乐的孩子﹐很少哭鼻子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the happy faces of the children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们快乐的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: I loved her and thought I could make her happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱她﹐我想我能让她幸福快乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John will be so happy to see you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰看见你会很高兴的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m happy that everything worked out well in the end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴到最后一切都很顺利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What a wonderful opportunity! I’m so happy for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多好的机会呀！我真为你高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re very happy to be taking part.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们非常高兴能够参加。

GramExa.GLOSS: a couple that have just got married or will soon get married

Sense.DEF: a happy time, relationship, event etc is a good one that makes you feel happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has been the happiest day of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我一生中最快乐的一天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a very happy marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻很美满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have lots of happy memories of the place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对那地方有着许多美好的回忆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story has a happy ending, however.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过故事的结局还是圆满的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When’s the happy event the birth of your child?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么时候喜迎贵子啊？

Sense.DEF: satisfied or not worried

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the whole, I’m happy with the way I look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总体来说﹐我对自己的外貌比较满意。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People living nearby are not happy with the decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近的居民对这一决定感到不满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mom wasn’t happy about Tess going off travelling on her own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈对特丝单独外出旅行感到不放心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I pretended to agree with her, just to keep her happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我假装同意她﹐纯粹是为了让她高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m quite happy doing what I’m doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对现在自己所做的很满意。

Sense.DEF: to be very willing to do something, especially to help someone
Sense.TRAN: 乐意做某事〔尤指帮助别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team will be happy to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的团队很乐意帮忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d be happy to take you in my car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很乐意开车送你去。

Sense.DEF: used to wish someone happiness on a special occasion
Sense.TRAN: 生日/新年/圣诞节等快乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Happy Birthday, Michael!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生日快乐﹐迈克尔！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Happy Thanksgiving, everyone!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家感恩节快乐！

Sense.DEF: used to wish someone happiness on their birthday
fortunate or lucky
Sense.EXAMPLE: By a happy coincidence, James was also in town that weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧得很﹐詹姆斯那个周末也在城里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m in the happy position of not having to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我运气真好﹐不用工作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a happy medium (between sth and sth)
Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that is not extreme but is somewhere between two possible choices
Sense.TRAN: 〔两件事之间〕皆大欢喜的折中办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always tried to strike a happy medium between having a home that looked like a bomb had hit it and becoming obsessively tidy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想找个满意的折中办法﹐使家里既不会像被炸过那样乱﹐也不会像有洁癖似的过分齐整。

Sense.DEF: suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: His choice of words was not a very happy one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的措辞不十分恰当。

Sense.DEF: if you are in or go to your happy place, you imagine you are in a place that makes you feel calm and happy, because it helps you stop thinking about a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 一个/你的等快乐之乡〔指通过美好的想象来摆脱烦恼等的思想境界〕

Sense.DEF: not pleased with a situation

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you happy in your new job?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的新工作干得开心吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film has a happy ending.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片结局圆满。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a happy childhood
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 快乐的童年

Exponent.DEF: looking happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cheerful face/expression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愉快的面孔/表情
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room looked bright and cheerful it made you feel good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋子看起来明亮宜人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He seems a lot more cheerful today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天他好像高兴多了。

Exponent.DEF: to feel happy and relaxed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was the day before the vacation and everyone was in a good mood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天是假期的前一天﹐大家心情都不错。

Exponent.DEF: feeling happy with your life, job, situation etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对生活﹑工作﹑处境等〕满意的﹐满足的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was contented with his job as a cycle mechanic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己自行车修理工的工作挺满意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sat down with a contented expression on her face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐了下来，一脸心满意足的表情。

Exponent.DEF: happy because something good has happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因有好事发生而〕高兴的﹐满意的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m pleased I passed my exam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴自己通过了考试。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was glad to see someone that he knew.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到认识的人他很高兴。

Exponent.DEF: very happy because something good has happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因有好事发生而〕非常高兴的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctors say they are delighted with her progress.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们表示对她的进展很满意。

Exponent.DEF: very happy and excited about something
Exponent.TRAN: 非常兴奋的﹔极为激动的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s thrilled at the idea of going to Disneyworld.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要去迪士尼世界﹐他非常兴奋。

Exponent.DEF: very happy because you have heard some good news
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was overjoyed when she found out that her son was safe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知儿子平安无事﹐她欣喜若狂。

Exponent.EXP: be on top of the world
Exponent.DEF: to be very happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was over the moon when I won the championship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了冠军﹐乐不可支。

Exponent.DEF: extremely happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowd were ecstatic, and cheered wildly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众欣喜若狂﹐欢声雷动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ecstatic fans
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢腾的球迷

Exponent.DEF: a blissful time is one in which you feel extremely happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We stayed on the islands for two blissful weeks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无忧无虑地在岛上待了两星期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It sounded blissful – sea, sun, and good food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来幸福极了——大海﹑阳光﹐还有美食。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the adjective happy are. 本图表所示为形容词happy构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: relating to a Christian church where people sing, shout, show their emotions, and encourage other people to join their church – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教派〕过分热情的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: happy-clappy Christians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过分热情的基督徒

Sense.DEF: enjoying life and not worrying about things
Sense.TRAN: 无忧无虑的﹔逍遥自在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a happy-go-lucky kind of person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无忧无虑的人

Sense.DEF: a special time in a bar when alcoholic drinks are sold at lower prices
Sense.TRAN: 快乐时光〔指酒吧的优惠时段〕

Sense.DEF: the act of deliberately attacking someone and filming the attack on a mobile phone
Sense.TRAN: 开心掌掴﹐巴巴乐〔指故意掴人耳光并用手机拍下攻击过程〕

Sense.DEF: a way of killing yourself by cutting open your stomach, used in the past in Japan to avoid losing honour
to speak in a loud angry way, often for a long time, in order to criticize someone or to persuade them that you are right
Sense.TRAN: 对…慷慨激昂地演说﹔高声训斥

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood on the street corner, haranguing passers-by about the stupidity of the forthcoming war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在街角向路人慷慨陈词﹐痛诉这场即将爆发的战争是如何荒唐。

Sense.DEF: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them
Sense.EXAMPLE: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

GramExa.GLOSS: harass someone because of their sex or race
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对某人进行性/种族骚扰
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One woman claimed that she had been sexually harassed by a male manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名女子声称曾遭到一名男经理性骚扰。

Sense.DEF: to keep attacking an enemy again and again
Sense.TRAN: 反复攻击﹐屡次侵扰〔敌人〕

Sense.DEF: anxious and tired because you have too many problems or things to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked pale and harassed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去脸色苍白﹐又忧虑又疲惫。

Sense.DEF: when someone behaves in an unpleasant or threatening way towards you
Sense.EXAMPLE: African-Americans have been complaining about police harassment for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国黑人多年来一直抱怨受到警察的骚扰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Political parties are banned, and harassment of dissidents is commonplace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党被取缔﹐而持不同政见者受到骚扰也是司空见惯的事。

GramExa.GLOSS: because of someone’s sex or race
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need effective strategies to combat sexual harassment in the workplace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要采取有效策略对抗职场性骚扰。

Sense.DEF: a sign that something is going to happen soon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These birds are considered to be harbingers of doom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟被认为是凶兆。

Sense.DEF: an area of water next to the land where the water is calm, so that ships are safe when they are inside it
Sense.EXAMPLE: as they sailed into Portsmouth Harbour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当他们驶入朴次茅斯港的时候

Sense.DEF: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 怀有﹐心存〔不好的想法﹑恐惧或希望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s harbouring some sort of grudge against me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他对我有点怀恨在心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She began to harbour doubts over the wisdom of their journey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始对他们的旅行是否明智产生了怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to contain something, especially something hidden and dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sinks and draining boards can harbour germs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗涤槽和沥水板可能藏有病菌。

Sense.DEF: to protect and hide criminals that the police are searching for
the official who is in charge of a harbour
firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard wooden chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把硬木椅
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hardest substance known to man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已知的最硬物质
Sense.EXAMPLE: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数月无雨﹐土地坚硬难犁。

Sense.DEF: difficult to do or understand
Sense.TRAN: 难做的﹔难懂的﹔困难的﹐不易的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to make some hard decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们必须作出困难的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re a hard team to beat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是一支很难打败的球队。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is hard to believe/imagine/see/know etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was hard to see what else we could have done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难想出我们原本还可以做些什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to believe that anyone would say something like that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难相信有人会说出那样的话。

GramExa.PROPFORM: find it hard to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was finding it hard to concentrate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得很难集中精神。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Permanent jobs are hard to come by difficult to find or get.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难找到固定的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must be hard for her, bringing up three kids on her own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一个人养育三个孩子﹐一定很不容易。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Telling my parents is going to be the hardest thing about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最难办的将是如何告诉我的父母。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have a hard time doing sth
GramExa.GLOSS: be difficult for someone to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll have a hard time proving that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要证明那一点很难。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a hard time persuading him to accept the offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我费了很多功夫说服他接受那个提议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Such criticism was hard to take difficult to accept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难接受这样的批评。

Sense.DEF: using or involving a lot of mental or physical effort
Sense.TRAN: 费力的﹐费劲的﹔耗费体力[脑力]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: To be successful in sport requires hard work and a great deal of determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要在体育方面有所成就需要艰辛的努力和百折不挠的决心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a hard day at work, I just want to come home and put my feet up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛苦工作一天之后﹐我只想回家休息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a sauna where you can relax after a hard day’s skiing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个桑拿浴室﹐在累人地滑了一天雪之后﹐你可以在里面放松一下。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Becoming a doctor never interested him. It was too much like hard work it would involve too much work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于当医生他从不感兴趣﹐那要付出太多的艰辛。

Sense.DEF: a situation or time that is hard is one in which you have a lot of problems, especially when you do not have enough money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指缺钱时处境或日子〕艰难的﹐困苦的﹐拮据的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s had a hard life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生艰辛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Times were hard and they were forced to sell their house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时的日子很艰难﹐他们被迫卖掉了房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had clearly fallen on hard times did not have much money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然过得很拮据。

Subsense.DEF: to criticize someone in a way that is unfair, or to be too strict with them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps I’m too hard on her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能我对她太严厉了。

Subsense.DEF: to have a bad effect on someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Divorce can be very hard on children.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚会对孩子产生不良影响。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standing all day is very hard on the feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整天站着脚很受罪。

Sense.DEF: to learn, achieve, or do something after a bad experience or by making mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He learned the hard way about the harsh reality of the boxing world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他碰过壁后才了解拳击界的严酷现实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you put the baby’s diaper on before you start feeding her. I learned this lesson the hard way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给宝宝喂奶之前一定要给她垫上尿布﹐这是我受过教训才懂的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He earned his promotion the hard way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是好不容易才得到升职的。

Sense.DEF: using a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane gave the door a good hard push.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简使劲地推门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a hard slap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狠狠地给了他一记耳光。

Sense.DEF: facts that are definitely true and can be proved
Sense.TRAN: 确切[确凿]的证据/事实/情报等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no hard evidence to support this theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有切实的证据支持这一理论。

Sense.DEF: showing no sympathetic or gentle feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无情的脸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was hard and cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音很冷酷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re a hard man, John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰﹐你是个无情的人。

Subsense.DEF: difficult to do and needing a lot of effort
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A strong wind made the race very hard going.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为刮大风﹐赛跑选手都跑得很吃力。

Subsense.DEF: boring, or difficult to deal with, talk to etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I find some of his friends pretty hard going.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的有些朋友相当乏味。

Sense.DEF: to make something you are doing seem more difficult than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Juventus were making hard work of what should have been an easy game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尤文图斯队在本该轻松取胜的比赛中陷入苦战。

Sense.DEF: to be very busy doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah was hard at it on her computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉在计算机上忙着。

Sense.DEF: hard water contains a lot of minerals, and does not mix easily with soap

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you feel sorry for them because they have not succeeded in what they were trying to do
Subsense.TRAN: 真不幸﹐真倒霉〔对别人表示同情〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I failed my driving test.’ ‘Oh, hard luck!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没通过驾照考试。”“唉﹐你真倒霉！”

Subsense.DEF: when bad things happen to you that are not your fault
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ve had your share of hard luck.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经走过背运了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was hard luck on you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真不幸。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not care if someone is having problems, does not like something etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t like the idea then hard luck!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不喜欢这个主意﹐那抱歉啦！

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: to treat someone badly or cause problems for them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔故意〕让某人难堪[难受]﹐让某人吃苦头
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Giving you a hard time, is she?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让你难堪了﹐是吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They reached the border where officials gave them a hard time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到了边境﹐在那里受到边防官的刁难。

Subsense.DEF: to criticize someone a lot
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hostile critics have given Hartman a hard time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满敌意的评论家严厉地批评了哈特曼。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of problems or bad experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m glad she’s happy at last – she’s had such a hard time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴她终于得到了幸福﹐她曾饱受苦难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vegetarians still often have a hard time of it when it comes to eating out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外出就餐对于素食者来说依然是很头痛的事。

Sense.DEF: to demand a lot or refuse to give too much when you are making an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is believed to have struck a hard bargain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据信该公司在谈判过程中态度强硬。

Subsense.DEF: anger between people because of something that has happened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’d known each other too long for hard feelings.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相识太久﹐彼此之间不会心生嫌隙。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I have no hard feelings towards Steve.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有生史蒂夫的气。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not want to be angry with them or for them to be angry with you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry it didn’t work out, but no hard feelings, eh?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉那不行﹐别生我的气﹐好吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a (long) hard look at sth/sb
Sense.DEF: to think carefully about something, especially with the result that you change your opinions or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should take a long hard look at the issues before committing yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该认真考虑这些问题再作出决定。

Sense.DEF: a strict way of dealing with someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president should abandon his hard line in the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统应该停止在该地区采取的强硬措施。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school takes a very hard line on drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该学校在毒品问题上的态度非常强硬。

Sense.DEF: news stories that are about serious subjects or events
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV news programs seem to be more interested in gossip than in hard news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视新闻节目似乎对小道消息比对重大新闻更感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: strong, ready to fight, and not afraid of anyone or anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks he’s really hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为自己很厉害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones was known as soccer’s hard man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯被称为足球场上的硬汉。

Sense.DEF: someone who is hard as nails seems to have no feelings such as fear or sympathy
Sense.TRAN: 无所畏惧的﹔冷酷无情的

Sense.DEF: someone who makes people work too hard
Sense.TRAN: 要求过分严格的上司﹔逼迫别人拼命工作的人

Sense.DEF: a very cold winter or frost
people who have extreme left-wing or right-wing political aims and ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: concerns about the re-emergence of the hard right in some areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对某些地区极右势力复苏的担心

Sense.DEF: hard light is bright and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hard brilliance of the moonlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺眼的月光

Sense.DEF: very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: hard liquor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烈酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never touch the hard stuff strong alcohol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不喝烈酒。

Sense.DEF: a big turn to the left or right, for example when you are driving
a hard ‘c’ is pronounced /k/ rather than /s/; a hard ‘g’ is pronounced /G/ rather than /dZ/
Sense.TRAN: 发硬音的〔指字母c发/k/音而不发/s/音﹐字母g发/G/音而不发/dZ/音〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a material that would combine the flexibility of rubber with the hardness of glass
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 既有橡胶的弹性又有玻璃的硬度的一种材料

Exponent.DEF: difficult to press down, break, or cut, and not at all soft
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I fell onto the hard stone floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跌倒在坚硬的石地板上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The clay gets harder as it dries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏土干了就会变硬。

Exponent.DEF: not completely hard, but not easy to press or bend – used especially when this seems a good thing
Exponent.TRAN: 结实的﹐坚实的〔尤在这似乎是优点时使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I like to sleep on a firm mattress.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢睡硬床垫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: exercises to make your stomach muscles nice and firm
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 使腹肌健美紧实的运动

Exponent.DEF: difficult to bend and not changing shape
Exponent.TRAN: 不易弯曲的﹐不易变形的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a piece of stiff cardboard
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张硬卡纸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The collar of his shirt felt stiff and uncomfortable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衬衫领子硬硬的﹐不舒服。

Exponent.DEF: made of a thick hard material and not hollow
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a solid oak door
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 实心橡木门
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The floor felt strong and solid beneath her feet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脚下的地板坚固而结实。

Exponent.DEF: having a structure that is made of a material that is difficult or impossible to bend
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tent is supported by a rigid frame.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷由坚硬的支架支撑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Carry sandwiches in a rigid container.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 三明治要放在硬质容器里携带。

Exponent.DEF: used about food that is pleasantly hard, so that it makes a noise when you bite it – often used about things that have been cooked in thin slices until they are brown
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指烘﹑烤﹑煎﹑炸至金黄色的薄片食物〕(酥)脆的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bake the cookies until they are crisp and golden.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把小甜饼烤至酥脆并呈金黄色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: crispy bacon
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 脆熏肉

Exponent.DEF: food that is crunchy makes a noise when you bite on it – often used about things that are fresh, for example fruit, vegetables, and nuts
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指水果﹑蔬菜﹑坚果等新鲜食品〕(爽)脆的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a crunchy breakfast cereal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 香脆的谷类早餐食物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The carrots were still nice and crunchy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡萝卜仍然爽脆可口。

Exponent.DEF: meat that is tough is too hard and is difficult to cut or eat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meat was tough and flavourless.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉很老﹐淡而无味。

Exponent.DEF: too hard and bending like rubber rather than breaking – used especially about meat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The chicken was all rubbery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡肉太老﹐跟橡皮似的。

Sense.DEF: using a lot of effort, energy, or attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has worked hard all her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生辛勤工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had thought long and hard before getting involved with the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参与这个计划之前他曾思之再三。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried her hardest to ignore what he’d said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力不去理会他说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ella was concentrating very hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉全神贯注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t convince him no matter how hard I tried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管我怎么努力﹐都说服不了他。

Sense.DEF: with a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to hit the ball hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要用力击球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slammed the door hard behind him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使劲把身后的门砰地关上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was raining very hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得很大。

Sense.DEF: becoming solid, stiff, or firm
Sense.EXAMPLE: By now the cement had set hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水泥现在变硬了。

Sense.DEF: to be badly affected by something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 受到严重影响﹐受到沉重打击
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales were hard hit by high interest rates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售因高利率而受到严重影响。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be hard put/pressed/pushed to do sth
Sense.DEF: to have difficulty doing something
Sense.TRAN: 难以做到某事﹐做某事有困难
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d be hard pressed to find anyone better for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找一个更好的人来做这一工作很难。

Sense.DEF: to be or feel unfairly treated
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a child I felt hard done by, living so far away from my friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候觉得很不公平﹐住得离朋友们那么远。

Sense.DEF: to be very upset about something, especially bad news
Sense.TRAN: 对某事〔尤指坏消息〕感到悲伤[难过]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan took his mother’s death particularly hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的去世让艾伦特别伤心。

Sense.DEF: soon after something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His second major contract followed hard upon the first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一个大合同之后﹐他紧接着又签下了第二个。

Sense.DEF: to laugh, cry etc a lot
clear, definite, and always able to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is impossible to give hard-and-fast rules, but here are some points to consider.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给出明确的放之四海而皆准的准则是不可能的﹐但是下面几点可以考虑。

Sense.DEF: a book that has a strong stiff cover

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His first novel sold over 40,000 copies in hardback.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一本小说卖出了四万多册精装本。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a hardback edition of ‘The Joy of Cooking’

Sense.DEF: to be very determined to get what you want, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在商界或政界中〕态度果决﹐采取强硬手段

Sense.DEF: not easily shocked or upset, because you have had a lot of experience
Sense.TRAN: 老练而顽强的﹔经过磨炼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-bitten cop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老练的警察

Sense.DEF: a material made from small pieces of wood pressed together
Sense.TRAN: 硬质纤维板﹔加压纤维板

Sense.DEF: a hard-boiled egg has been boiled until it becomes solid
informal

Subsense.DEF: not showing your emotions and not influenced by your feelings
Subsense.TRAN: 不动感情的﹐铁石心肠的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a hard-boiled marketing executive
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位强悍的营销主管

Subsense.DEF: a film etc that deals with people who do not show their emotions

Sense.DEF: very near
Sense.EXAMPLE: in a house hard by the city gate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在城门边上的一座房子里

Sense.DEF: paper money and coins, not cheques or credit cards
information from a computer that is printed out onto paper, or the printed papers themselves
Sense.TRAN: 硬拷贝﹐硬副本〔指计算机打印出来的信息资料〕﹔打印件

Subsense.DEF: the small group of people that are most active within a group or organization
Subsense.TRAN: 〔组织中的〕核心力量﹐中坚分子﹐骨干
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the hard core of the Communist party
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党的中坚力量

Subsense.DEF: a group of people who cannot be persuaded to change their behaviour or beliefs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There is still a small hard core of football supporters who cause trouble whenever they can.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍然有一小撮顽固的足球迷只要一有机会就会制造事端。

Sense.DEF: having an extreme way of life or an extreme belief that is very unlikely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-core drug addict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可救药的吸毒者
Sense.EXAMPLE: hard-core racists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽固不化的种族主义者

Sense.DEF: magazines, films etc that show the details of sexual behaviour, often in an unpleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 硬性色情作品﹐露骨的色情作品〔如杂志﹑电影等〕

Sense.DEF: an area for playing tennis which has a hard surface, not grass
a book that has a strong stiff cover
money that is from a country that has a strong economy and is therefore unlikely to lose its value
a stiff disk inside a computer that is used for storing information
a hard-drinking person drinks a lot of alcohol
the part of a computer where information and programs are stored, consisting of hard disks and the electronic equipment that reads what is stored on them
very strong illegal drugs such as heroin and cocaine
Sense.TRAN: 硬性毒品﹐烈性毒品〔如海洛因﹑可卡因等〕

Sense.DEF: earned or achieved after a lot of effort
Sense.TRAN: 辛苦挣来的﹔来之不易的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too quick to part with your hard-earned cash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要太快花掉你辛苦挣来的钱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hard-earned victory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得之不易的胜利

Sense.DEF: dealing with difficult subjects or criticizing someone severely in a way that may offend some people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-edged collection of songs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组歌词犀利的歌曲

Sense.DEF: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will take about 24 hours for the glue to harden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胶水干透大约需要24小时。

Sense.DEF: if your attitude hardens, or if something hardens it, you become more strict and determined and less sympathetic
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attitudes towards the terrorists have hardened even more since the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从那次袭击后﹐对待恐怖分子的态度更加强硬了。

Sense.DEF: if your face or voice hardens, or if something hardens it, you look or sound less sympathetic or happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face hardened momentarily, then he looked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸色一时阴沉下来﹐随即把头转向一边。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself not feel pity or sympathy for someone
a criminal, police officer etc who has had a lot of experience of things that are shocking and is therefore less affected by them
to become used to something shocking because you have seen it many times
a hard-fought game, competition etc involves two opposing sides who are trying very hard to defeat each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the most hard-fought games this season
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季最激烈的比赛之一
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hard-fought battle for the presidency
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的总统竞选战

Sense.DEF: a protective hat, worn especially by workers in places where buildings are being built
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指建筑工人戴的〕安全帽﹐防护帽

Sense.DEF: practical and able to make difficult decisions without letting your emotions affect your judgment
Sense.TRAN: 头脑清醒的﹐不感情用事的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-headed business tycoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头脑冷静的商业巨头

Sense.DEF: not caring about other people’s feelings
Sense.TRAN: 硬心肠的﹐没有同情心的

Sense.DEF: criticizing someone or something in a strong and effective way
Sense.TRAN: 〔批评〕一针见血的﹐直言不讳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-hitting report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直言不讳的报道

Sense.DEF: punishment in prison which consists of hard physical work
having extreme political beliefs, and refusing to change them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-line Marxist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定的马克思主义者

Sense.DEF: a politician who wants political problems to be dealt with in a strong and extreme way
a story you tell someone about bad things that have happened to you, in order to get their sympathy or help
Sense.TRAN: 〔为博取别人的同情或帮助而倾诉的〕不幸遭遇

Sense.DEF: almost not
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我六岁时父母离婚﹐我对父亲几乎一无所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can hardly believe it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这简直让我难以置信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hardly anyone almost no one writes to me these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad ate hardly anything almost nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was hardly any very little traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上车少人稀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever almost never see her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住在西班牙﹐所以我们几乎见不到她。

GramExa.PROPFORM: hardly a day/week/month etc goes by without/when
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something happens almost every day, week etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 几乎每天/每周/每月等都…
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hardly a month goes by without another factory closing down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每个月都会有一家工厂倒闭。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘not’, when you are suggesting that the person you are speaking to will agree with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hardly surprising that she won’t answer his calls after the way he’s treated her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这样对她﹐她不接他的电话也不奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can hardly blame Tom for not waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能责怪汤姆没有等你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My boss could hardly be described as handsome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的老板一点也算不上英俊。

GramExa.GLOSS: a very unsuitable time, place, person etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 绝不是恰当的时间/地点/人选等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is hardly the place to discuss the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里不是讨论这件事的地方。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has only just happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building work has hardly begun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施工才刚刚开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had hardly sat down when the phone rang.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚坐下电话就响了。

F2NBox.HEADING: grammar 语法：hardly, scarcely
F2NBox.EXPL: Scarcely is more formal and literary than hardly. These adverbs come before the verb, unless the verb is a sim ple tense of ‘be’, or after the first auxiliary.
F2NBox.TRAN: scarcely比hardly更为正式﹐更具有文学色彩。这两个副词要用于动词之前(动词be的一般式除外)﹐或第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was so ill he could hardly speak (NOT 不说 he hardly could speak).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病得很重﹐几乎不能言语 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use hardly or scarcely with a negative word.
F2NBox.TRAN: hardly或scarcely不和表示否定的词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I can hardly believe (NOT 不说 can’t hardly believe) he said that.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很难相信他那么说过。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There’s hardly any milk left (NOT 不说 There’s hardly no milk left).
F2NBox.EXPL: When talking about one event being followed closely by another, we usually use hardly or scarcely after ‘had’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一件事紧跟另一件事﹐一般用had hardly或had scarcely
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I had hardly got in the house when the phone rang.
F2NBox.EXPL: In literary writing, it is possible to put hardly or scarcely first, followed by ‘had’ and the subject.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在文学作品中﹐可以将hardly或scarcely置于句首﹐后接had和主语
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Hardly had I got in the house when the phone rang.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use hardly as the adverb of hard. The adverb of hard is hard.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要把hardly当作hard的副词形式来用。hard的副词形式就是hard
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Students have to study very hard (NOT 不说 very hardly).
I tried hard to remember.

Sense.DEF: not affected by emotions, and determined to get what you want
Sense.TRAN: 顽强的﹐不屈不挠的﹐冷静而坚决的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-nosed businessman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽强不屈的生意人

Sense.DEF: unable to hear very well
people who are unable to hear very well
Sense.TRAN: 有听力障碍的人﹐耳背者

Sense.DEF: an erection1
magazines, films etc that show sexual behaviour in an unacceptable, sometimes violent way
Sense.TRAN: 硬性色情作品﹐露骨的色情作品〔指杂志﹑电影等〕

Sense.DEF: having a lot of problems and not enough money or time
Sense.TRAN: 处于困境的﹔遭受巨大压力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new exams will only add to the workload of already hard-pressed teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新推出的考试只会给原本就承受巨大压力的老师们增加工作负担。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be hard pressed to do sth

Sense.DEF: a type of rock music that is played loudly, has a strong beat, and uses electric instruments
hardscrabble land has poor soil and will not produce good crops of food, and sometimes not any food at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I remembered it being green and humid, nothing like this hardscrabble land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得这片土地原本葱郁而湿润﹐完全不是如此贫瘠。

Sense.DEF: poor, and working on land that does not produce enough food to eat or crops to sell
Sense.TRAN: 〔在贫瘠土地上耕作而〕贫困的﹐勉强维持生活的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town is also home to hardscrabble residents who have to eat at the soup kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小镇还有一些贫困的居民﹐他们只能在施食处分得一点吃的。

Sense.DEF: a way of selling something in which there is a lot of pressure on you to buy
something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life
Sense.EXAMPLE: an economic policy that caused great hardship for many people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成许多人贫困的经济政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many students are suffering severe financial hardship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生经济非常困难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the hardships of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的苦难

Sense.DEF: the area at the side of a big road where you are allowed to stop if you have a problem with your car
a prison, especially one controlled by the army, where the prisoners are kept in uncomfortable conditions and treated extremely severely
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指由军队控制﹑条件恶劣的〕监狱

Sense.DEF: if you are hard up, you do not have much money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a bit hard up at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我目前手头有点紧。

Sense.DEF: not having something that you want or need
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏〔想要或需要的东西〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How about a date with Tom?’ ‘No, thanks, I’m not that hard up.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “和汤姆约会一下怎么样？”“不﹐谢啦﹐我还不至于那么饥不择食。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The media are obviously hard up for stories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然媒体缺乏新闻素材。

Sense.DEF: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work
equipment and tools for your home and garden
Sense.TRAN: 〔家用和园艺用的〕金属器件[用具]﹔五金制品

Sense.DEF: the machinery and equipment that is needed to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: tanks and other military hardware
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦克和其他军事装备

Sense.DEF: products that are hard-wearing will remain in good condition for a long time even when they are used a lot
computer systems that are hard-wired are controlled by hardware rather than software and cannot be easily changed by the user
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机系统〕硬件控制的﹐硬连线的

Sense.DEF: if an attitude, way of behaving etc is hard-wired, it is a natural part of a person’s character that they are born with and cannot change
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑行为方式等〕天生的﹐不可改变的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The desire to communicate seems to be hard-wired into our brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的大脑似乎生来就有与人沟通的欲望。

Sense.DEF: achieved only after a lot of effort and difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 来之不易的﹐辛苦得来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her hard-won independence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得来不易的独立

Sense.DEF: strong heavy wood from trees such as oak, used for making furniture
working with a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hard-working teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 努力工作的老师

Sense.DEF: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions
Sense.TRAN: 能吃苦耐劳的﹔坚强的﹔强壮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: hardy mountain goats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

Sense.DEF: a hardy plant is able to live through the winter
a hardy plant that produces flowers for several years
an idea that is often suggested or discussed
an animal like a rabbit but larger, which can run very quickly
to run or go very fast

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hared off down the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他沿着马路飞快地跑掉了。

Sense.DEF: a hare-brained plan or idea is very silly or unlikely to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑想法〕愚蠢的﹐轻率的﹐不切实际的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his latest hare-brained scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那不切实际的最新方案

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for the condition of having your top lip divided into two parts because it did not develop correctly before birth
the group of wives or women who lived with a rich or powerful man in some Islamic societies in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时某些伊斯兰社会中权贵的〕妻妾﹐女眷

Sense.DEF: part of a Muslim house that is separate from the rest of the house, where only women live
Sense.TRAN: 〔穆斯林家庭中女眷居住的〕内室﹐闺房

Sense.DEF: a small white bean
used when you think someone is saying something stupid or acting as if they are more important than they really are
Sense.TRAN: 听他/她/你吹的！〔认为某人在说蠢话或表现得自以为是〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hark at him! I bet he couldn’t do any better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听他乱吹！我敢打赌他也好不到哪里去。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to listen
to remember and talk about things that happened in the past
Sense.TRAN: 回想﹐谈论往事﹐追忆过去

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s useless to continually hark back to the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老是回想往事没有用。

Sense.DEF: to be similar to something in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: music that harks back to the early age of jazz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 类似早期爵士乐的音乐

Sense.DEF: another spelling of hearken
a character in some traditional plays who wears brightly coloured clothes and plays tricks
Sense.TRAN: 〔传统戏剧中身穿鲜艳服装的〕滑稽角色﹐小丑

Sense.DEF: a harlequin pattern is made up of diamond shapes in many different colours
a street in central London where many well-known and expensive doctors have their offices
Sense.TRAN: 哈利街〔伦敦中心街道﹐许多名医的办公场所设于此〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Harley Street specialist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈利街的专科医生

Sense.DEF: a prostitute
damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our children deserve protection from harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come to no harm/not come to any harm
Sense.DEF: to not be hurt or damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was relieved to see the children had come to no harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到孩子们没有受到伤害﹐舒了一口气。

Sense.LEXUNIT: mean no harm/not mean any harm
Sense.DEF: to have no intention of hurting or upsetting anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a terrible gossip but she means no harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很爱说长道短﹐不过没有恶意。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s no harm in doing sth/it does no harm to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to suggest something to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no harm in trying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试也无妨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It does no harm to ask.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不妨问问。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it wouldn’t do sb any harm to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something that may be helpful or useful to them
Sense.TRAN: 做某事对某人并无害处
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wouldn’t do you any harm to get some experience first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不妨先积累点经验。

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is out of harm’s way, they are in a place where they cannot be hurt or damaged
Subsense.TRAN: 在安全的地方﹐在不受到伤害的地方
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Copies of your documents should be kept in a safe place, well out of harm’s way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的那些文件要保存在安全的地方﹐一个绝对不会遭到损坏的地方。

Subsense.DEF: if something dangerous is out of harm’s way, it is in a place where it cannot hurt anyone or damage anything
Subsense.TRAN: 〔危险物品〕在不会造成伤害的地方
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you have small children, make sure that you store medicines out of harm’s way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有年幼的孩子﹐一定要把药品存放在安全的地方。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Try to choose products that do the least harm to the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量选择对环境损害最小的产品。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Very small amounts of the chemical cause no lasting harm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 极少量的这种化学品不会造成持久损害。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause harm, especially physical harm
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 造成伤害〔尤指身体伤害〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: None of us wants to inflict harm on another human being.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有人想对他人造成伤害。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 极大的/严重的/相当大的伤害
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you drink too much alcohol, you can do yourself serious harm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮酒过度对自己的身体非常有害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were afraid that he would do them some actual physical harm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们担心他真的会对他们实施人身伤害。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that cannot be made better
so much harm that it cannot be described completely
cause more problems rather than improve a situation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you don’t warm up properly, exercise may do more harm than good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不做适当的热身运动﹐锻炼有可能害多益少。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to tell someone not to worry about something they have done
used when you think that something seems reasonable, although other people may not

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘give harm’or 或 ‘make harm’. Say 而要说 do harm or 或 cause harm.

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: chemicals that harm the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 损害环境的化学品

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something is bad for something rather than that it harms something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说something is bad for something﹐而不说it harms something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: chemicals that are bad for the environment

Sense.DEF: to physically hurt a person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kidnappers didn’t harm him, thank God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢天谢地﹐绑匪没有伤害他。

Sense.DEF: to make people have a worse opinion of a person or group

Exponent.DEF: to have a bad effect on someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many women said parenthood harmed their careers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性说抚养孩子阻碍了她们的职业前途。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A little hard work never harmed anyone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作努力一点对任何人都绝无害处。

Exponent.DEF: to harm something badly. Damage is more serious than harm.
Exponent.TRAN: 损害﹐损坏〔damage比harm的程度更严重〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His reputation was damaged and his career was in ruins.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他名声受损﹐事业尽毁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The affair has damaged people’s confidence in the government.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次事件严重损害了民众对政府的信心。

Exponent.DEF: to be likely to harm someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Too much fatty food is bad for you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 过多食用高脂食品对身体不好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All this rain is bad for business.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了这么多雨﹐真影响生意。

Exponent.DEF: formal to be bad for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new housing development will be detrimental to the character of this small town.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建的住宅区会破坏这座小镇的特色。

Exponent.DEF: to harm something, especially someone’s ability to do something or the correct working of a system
Exponent.TRAN: 削弱﹐损害〔做某事的能力或系统的正确运行〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Any amount of alcohol that you drink will impair your ability to drive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒无论多少都会影响驾驶能力。

Exponent.DEF: to have a bad effect on the future success of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t do anything to prejudice our chances of winning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要做任何阻碍我们获胜的事。

Sense.DEF: causing harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: the harmful effects of smoking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟的害处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: chemicals that are harmful to the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对环境有害的化学品

Exponent.DEF: causing physical harm – used especially about things that cause harm to your health, the environment etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smoking is harmful to your health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟有害健康。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: drugs with harmful side-effects
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有不良副作用的药物

Exponent.DEF: to have a harmful effect on someone or something – very commonly used in everyday English when saying that something is harmful.
Exponent.TRAN: 对某人/某物有害〔常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone knows that too much alcohol is bad for you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都知道饮酒过量对身体有害。

Exponent.DEF: used about things that cause permanent physical harm, or that have a bad effect in other ways, for example on people’s opinion of someone
Exponent.TRAN: 造成损害[伤害]的﹔产生不良影响的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Acid rain has a damaging effect on trees and the soil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸雨对树木和土壤有破坏作用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The allegations were very damaging to his career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些指控对他的职业生涯极为不利。

Exponent.DEF: causing harm or having a bad effect on something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Employers are worried that the new laws will have a detrimental effect on their business.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主担心新法令对他们的生意会有不利影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: chemicals that are detrimental to the environment
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对环境有害的化学品

Exponent.DEF: a negative effect is one that is bad and causes problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car tax had a negative effect on car sales.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车税对汽车销量有消极影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the negative impact of the recession in the US
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国经济衰退的负面影响

Exponent.DEF: hazardous substances are likely to be dangerous to people’s health and safety
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hazardous waste needs to be disposed of safely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险废料应妥善处理。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hazardous chemicals
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险化学品

Exponent.DEF: toxic substances, smoke etc are poisonous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: toxic waste
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废料
Exponent.EXAMPLE: toxic fumes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒烟雾
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Toxic chemicals spilled into the river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒化学品泄漏﹐流入了河中。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that has a gradual bad effect which is not easy to notice, especially on people’s morals, or on their health
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指对人们的道德品质或健康〕有害的〔通常不易察觉〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the pernicious effects of violent video games
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力电子游戏的危害性
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the pernicious effect of secondhand smoke
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 二手烟的危害性

Sense.DEF: unable or unlikely to hurt anyone or cause damage
Sense.TRAN: 无害的﹔不会造成损伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her brother’s a bit simple, but he’s quite harmless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的弟弟有点愚钝﹐不过他决不会伤害别人。

Sense.DEF: not likely to upset or offend anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just a bit of harmless fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是个没有恶意的玩笑。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The spear whistled harmlessly over his head.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支标枪从他头上呼啸而过﹐有惊无险。

Sense.DEF: relating to the way notes are played or sung together to give a pleasing sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: harmonic scales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和声音阶

Sense.DEF: a small musical instrument that you play by blowing or sucking and moving it from side to side near your mouth
harmonious relationships are ones in which people are friendly and helpful to one another
sounds that are harmonious are very pleasant
parts, colours etc that are harmonious look good or work well together
Sense.TRAN: 〔各部分﹑颜色等〕协调的﹐和谐的﹐调和的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decor is a harmonious blend of traditional and modern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种装饰风格是传统与现代的和谐统一。

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument with a keyboard and metal pipes like a small organ
if two or more things harmonize, they work well together or look good together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new offices harmonize with the other buildings in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新办公楼和这一地区的其他大楼看上去很协调。

Sense.DEF: to make two or more sets of rules, taxes etc the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proposal to harmonize tax levels throughout the EU
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一欧盟税率水平的提议

Sense.DEF: to sing or play music in harmony
notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a choir singing in perfect harmony
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用完美的和声演唱的唱诗班

Sense.EXAMPLE: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱
Sense.EXAMPLE: three-part harmonies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三部和声

Sense.DEF: when people live or work together without fighting or disagreeing with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔一起生活或工作时的〕融洽相处
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do believe it is possible for different ethnic groups to live together in harmony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信不同民族的人民可以融洽相处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an era of peace and harmony
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平共处的时代

Sense.DEF: to agree with another idea, feeling etc, or look good with other things
Sense.TRAN: 和某事物一致﹔和某事物协调
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your suggestions are not in harmony with the aims of this project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的建议与本项目的目标不符。

Sense.DEF: the pleasant effect made by different things that form an attractive whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: the harmony of sea and sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海天一色

Sense.DEF: a set of leather bands used to control a horse or to attach it to a vehicle it is pulling
a set of bands used to hold someone in a place or to stop them from falling
Sense.TRAN: 〔把人固定在一处或防止其坠落的〕系带
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safety harness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全带

Sense.DEF: doing your usual work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt glad to be back in harness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴又回来正常工作了。

Sense.DEF: working closely with another person or group
to control and use the natural force or power of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以利用风力发电。
