Sense.DEF: to fasten two animals together, or to fasten an animal to something using a harness
Sense.TRAN: 将〔两只动物〕拴在一起﹔将〔动物〕拴到…上

Sense.DEF: to put a harness on a horse
a large musical instrument with strings that are stretched across a vertical frame with three corners, and that you play with your fingers
to talk about something continuously, especially in a way that is annoying or boring
Sense.TRAN: 唠唠叨叨﹐喋喋不休地谈论〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandfather harps on about the war all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父总是喋喋不休地说战争的事。

Sense.DEF: a weapon used for hunting whales
a musical instrument like a piano, used especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 羽管键琴﹐拨弦键琴〔类似钢琴的一种乐器﹐尤用于旧时〕

Sense.DEF: a cruel woman
a cruel creature in ancient Greek stories, with the head and upper body of a woman and the wings and feet of a bird
a bad-tempered unpleasant woman
a farming machine with sharp metal blades, used to break up the earth before planting crops
very frightening or shocking and making you feel very upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harrowing experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harrowing story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖的故事

Sense.DEF: to keep attacking an enemy
to keep asking someone for something in a way that is upsetting or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 〔以问题等〕缠住﹐不断骚扰〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the harsh Canadian winters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大的严冬

Sense.EXAMPLE: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

Sense.DEF: severe, cruel, or unkind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His theory met with harsh criticism from colleagues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论遭到了同事们的严厉批评。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the harsh measures taken against the protesters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对抗议者采取的严厉措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s an idiot!’ ‘Aren’t you being a bit harsh?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她是个白痴！”“你是不是有点太苛刻了？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harsh, authoritarian regime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残酷的独裁政权
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had harsh words severe criticism for the Government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他严词批评政府

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly loud and rough

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His voice was harsh and menacing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音刺耳且令人恐惧。

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood outside, blinking in the harsh sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在外面﹐在耀眼的阳光下眨动着双眼。

Sense.DEF: ugly and unpleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: the harsh outline of the factories against the sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在天空映衬下丑陋的工厂轮廓线

Sense.DEF: too strong and likely to damage the thing you are cleaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: My skin is quite sensitive and I find some soaps too harsh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的皮肤很敏感﹐我觉得有些肥皂刺激性太强。

Sense.DEF: a male deer
the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: every year at harvest time
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年在收获的季节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It rained for the potato harvest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收马铃薯的时节下起了雨。

Sense.DEF: the crops that have been gathered, or the amount and quality of the crops gathered

GramExa.GLOSS: a lot of crops
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

GramExa.GLOSS: few crops

Sense.DEF: to get good or bad results from your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is now reaping the harvest of careful planning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司现在尝到了精心规划带来的甜头。

Sense.DEF: to gather crops from the fields
someone who gathers crops
a church service held in the autumn to thank God for the harvest
the third person singular of the present tense of have
Sense.TRAN: have的第三人称单数现在式

Sense.DEF: someone who was important or popular but who has now been forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 被遗忘的名人﹐风光不再的人

Sense.DEF: to do something very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I made a real hash of my exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我考试考得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: a dish made with cooked meat and potatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咸牛肉烧马铃薯

Sense.DEF: the symbol #
to discuss something very thoroughly and carefully, especially until you reach an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reorganization plan was hashed out September 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重组计划在9月16号进行了充分讨论。

Sense.DEF: potatoes that are cut into very small pieces, pressed together, and cooked in oil
the strongest form of the drug cannabis

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘has not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hasn’t she finished yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还没做完吗？

Sense.DEF: a flat piece of metal used to fasten a door, lid etc
something that is annoying, because it causes problems or is difficult to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel like cooking tonight, it’s too much hassle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上我不想做饭﹐太麻烦了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s such a hassle not having a washing machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有洗衣机真是麻烦。

Sense.DEF: an argument between two people or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: hassles with the management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与管理层的争论

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by asking them many times to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop hassling me! I said I’ll call them tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别烦我了！我说过明天会给他们打电话的。

Sense.DEF: a small cushion for kneeling on in a church
a soft round piece of furniture used as a seat or for resting your feet on
a way of saying ‘you have’
great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon regretted my haste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快就对自己的仓促感到后悔。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in your haste to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his haste to leave, he forgot his briefcase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走得很匆忙﹐忘了带公文包。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say hurry rather than haste.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说hurry﹐而不说haste
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: In my hurry, I left my coat behind.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我匆匆忙忙的﹐忘了拿外套。

Sense.DEF: quickly or in a hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: They left in haste, without even saying goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走得很匆忙﹐连再见都没说。

Sense.DEF: to hurry or do something quickly
used to say that it is better to do something slowly, because if you do it too quickly you will make mistakes
to make something happen faster or sooner
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个冬天异常寒冷﹐所以他们提前走了。

Sense.DEF: to do or say something quickly or without delay

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hastened to assure her that there was no danger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赶紧向她保证不会有什么危险。

Sense.DEF: used when you realize that what you have said may not have been understood correctly
Sense.TRAN: 我得赶紧补充说〔用于生怕别人误解的时候〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exhausting course, which, I hasten to add, was also great fun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一门让人学得筋疲力尽的课程﹐不过我得赶紧补充一句﹐也是非常有趣的

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere quickly
quickly, perhaps too quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hastily arranged news conference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓促安排的记者招待会
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t worry,’ Jenny added hastily. ‘I checked with Lizzie first.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别担心﹐”珍妮赶紧补充﹐“我先和莉齐核实过了。”

Sense.DEF: done in a hurry, especially with bad results
Sense.EXAMPLE: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hasty breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

Sense.DEF: to do something too soon, without careful enough thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s not be hasty – sit down for a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们别急﹐坐一会儿。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that you wear on your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria was wearing a beautiful new hat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚戴着一顶漂亮的新帽子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a man in a fur hat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴毛皮帽子的男人

GramExa.GLOSS: wearing a bowler hat, top hat etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 戴常礼帽的/戴高顶礼帽等的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bowler-hatted gentleman
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位戴常礼帽的绅士

PIC.HEADING: HATS 帽子
PIC.PICCONTENT: top hat 高顶礼帽；baseball cap 棒球帽；bonnet 包头软帽；peaked cap BrE【英】有檐帽；sun hat 遮阳帽；brim 帽檐；sombrero 墨西哥阔边帽；mortarboard 学位帽；bowler hat BrE【英】/derby AmE【美】常礼帽；hard hat 安全帽；beret 贝雷帽；bobble hat BrE【英】绒球帽；cowboy hat 牛仔帽

Sense.DEF: to keep something secret

Sense.LEXUNIT: be wearing your teacher’s/salesman’s etc hat

Variant.LEXVAR: have your teacher’s/salesman’s etc hat on

Sense.DEF: to be performing the duties of a teacher etc, which are not your only duties
Sense.TRAN: 干着老师/销售员等的工作〔指做不止一份工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a manager now and only put my salesman’s hat on when one of our sales reps is having real problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在当经理了﹐只有当我们的销售代表遇到真正的难题时我才做销售工作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I take my hat off to sb
Sense.DEF: used to say you admire someone very much because of what they have done
Sense.TRAN: 我向某人致敬〔表示钦佩某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I take my hat off to Ian – without him we’d have never finished this project on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向伊恩致敬——没有他我们绝不可能准时完成这个项目。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be drawn/pulled/picked out of the/a hat
Sense.DEF: if someone’s name is drawn out of a hat, they are chosen, for example as the winner of a competition, because their name is the first one that is taken out of a container containing the names of all the people involved
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first correct entry out of the hat on September 2nd will win a prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 9月2日第一个被抽中并且答案正确者将赢得奖品。

Sense.DEF: to collect money from a group of people, especially in order to buy someone a present
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指一群人为了给某人买礼物而〕凑钱

Sense.LEXUNIT: throw/toss your hat into the ring
Sense.DEF: to say publicly that you will compete in an election or for a job
Sense.TRAN: 正式宣布参加竞选[应聘]

Crossrefto.REFLEX: at the drop of a hat

Sense.DEF: a band of cloth or leather fastened around a hat as a decoration
a special box used for carrying a hat in
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eggs take three days to hatch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些蛋要三天时间才能孵化。

Sense.DEF: if a young bird, insect etc hatches, or if it is hatched, it comes out of its egg
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔幼禽﹑幼虫等〕孵出﹐破壳而出
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the chicks have hatched out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小鸡都已孵出。

Sense.DEF: to form a plan etc in secret
Sense.TRAN: 策划阴谋/秘密计划/密谋交易等

Sense.DEF: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it

GramExa.GLOSS: a hole in an aircraft etc through which you can escape

Sense.DEF: a small hole in the wall or floor between two rooms, or the door that covers it
something you say before drinking an alcoholic drink quickly
a car with a door at the back that opens upwards
a place for hatching eggs, especially fish eggs
a small axe with a short handle
having an unpleasantly thin face with sharp features
a newspaper article, television programme etc that criticizes someone severely and unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 〔在报纸上﹑电视节目中等的〕尖刻攻击﹐诋毁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were afraid I was going to do a hatchet job on them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们害怕我会在媒体上尖刻地抨击他们。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed to make unpopular changes in an organization
Sense.TRAN: 受雇〔在某机构内〕进行不受欢迎的改革的人﹐“刀斧手”

Sense.DEF: fine lines drawn on or cut into a surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔画或刻在平面上的〕影线﹐阴影线

Sense.DEF: a hatch22
to dislike something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the kind of movie you either love or hate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是那种你要么喜欢要么讨厌的电影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hates his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讨厌自己的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul hates having his picture taken.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗不喜欢别人给他照相。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hate to see you unhappy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿看到你不快乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pam hates it when Lee calls her at work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕姆不喜欢李在上班时给自己打电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny’s mother hates her staying out late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮的母亲不喜欢她晚上在外面待到太晚。

Sense.DEF: to dislike someone very much and feel angry towards them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you hate me so much?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么那么恨我？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hated him for being so happy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恨他这么快乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hated myself for feeling jealous of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恨自己嫉妒她。

GramExa.GLOSS: hate someone very much

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’d hate (for) sb/sth to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not want something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 我不愿某人/某物做某事〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d hate you to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿意你走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d hate for him to think I wasn’t interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他认为我不感兴趣。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I hate to think what/how/where etc
Sense.DEF: used when you feel sure that something would have a bad result, or when an idea is unpleasant to think about
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to think what would have happened if you hadn’t called the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢想如果你没有报警会发生什么事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I hate to say it, but … /I hate to tell you this, but …
Sense.DEF: used when saying something that you do not want to say, for example because it is embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 我真不想说﹐不过…/我不好意思告诉你﹐但…
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to say it, but I was glad when he went home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不好意思说﹐但是我很庆幸他回家去了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are sorry that you have to ask etc
Sense.TRAN: 抱歉问一句/打断你/打扰你等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to ask you this, but would you mind giving me a lift home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不想开口﹐你能让我搭你的车回家吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to interrupt, but it’s urgent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不想打扰你﹐不过这事很紧急。

Exponent.DEF: to dislike someone or something very much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Billy hated his stepfather.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利讨厌他的继父。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hated the fact that his wife was more successful than he was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他恨妻子比他成功。

Exponent.DEF: to hate someone or something. Can’t stand is less formal than hate, and is very common in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 不能忍受〔can’t stand 没有hate正式﹐在日常英语中很常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s OK, but I can’t stand her husband.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还行﹐但是我受不了她丈夫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t bear the thought of life without Nicole.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有妮科尔的生活他想都不敢想。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She can’t stand being on her own.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受不了一个人待着。

Exponent.DEF: to hate something or someone very much. Loathe and detest are a little more formal than hate.
Exponent.TRAN: 厌恶﹐憎恨〔loathe和detest比hate稍正式一些〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He loathed housework.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很讨厌做家务。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Greg had detested his brother for as long as he could remember.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格自记事起就讨厌他的哥哥。

Exponent.DEF: to hate someone or something very much and have no respect for them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He despised the man and could never forgive him for what he had done.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鄙视那个人﹐永远无法原谅他所做的事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They despised the wealth and consumerism of the West.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们鄙视西方的财富和消费主义。

Exponent.DEF: to hate something because you think it is morally wrong
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He abhorred violence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他憎恶暴力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We abhor racism in any form.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们憎恶任何形式的种族歧视。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb hate are. 本图表所示为动词hate构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: an angry unpleasant feeling that someone has when they hate someone and want to harm them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were full of hate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼中充满了仇恨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Williams has spoken of her hate for her husband’s killers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯太太谈起过她对杀害她丈夫的凶手的仇恨。

Sense.DEF: a series of things that a person or group does in order to upset or harm someone they hate
a crime that is committed against someone only because they belong to a particular race, religion etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔针对某种族﹑宗教等的〕仇恨犯罪

Sense.DEF: very bad, unpleasant, or unkind
Sense.TRAN: 可恨的﹐可恶的﹐令人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all the fault of that hateful man!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都是那个可恶的人造的孽！

Sense.DEF: letters that express a lot of hatred towards the person to whom they are sent
Sense.TRAN: 谩骂信件﹐仇恨信件﹐恐吓信件
Sense.EXAMPLE: She complained to the police after receiving hate mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收到恐吓信件后﹐她报了警。

Sense.DEF: a type of yoga in which most of the exercises are done in a standing position, and none are done sitting down. People also breathe in a special way that allows them to relax and meditate while they exercise.
a long pin that is used to make a woman’s hat stay on her head
Sense.TRAN: 〔女士用于使帽子固定在头上的〕长饰针﹐帽针

Sense.DEF: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A look of pure hatred flashed across her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上闪过十足的仇恨表情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his intense hatred of all foreigners
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对所有外国人的深恶痛绝
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Abby made no secret of her hatred for her father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿比并不掩饰她对父亲的仇恨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellis was a sick young man with a deep hatred of women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利斯是个变态的男青年﹐他对女人有着深切的仇恨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the old hatreds and prejudices that simmered below the surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长久以来憋在心中的仇恨与偏见

Sense.DEF: a tall pole with hooks at the top used to hang coats and hats on
someone who makes or sells hats
a series of three successes, especially in sports such as football when the same person scores three times
Sense.TRAN: 连获三胜﹔〔一名运动员在一场足球比赛中进三球的〕帽子戏法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saunders scored a hat trick in the final game of the series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德斯在这一系列比赛的最后一场上演了帽子戏法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hat trick of victories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三连胜

Sense.DEF: behaving in a proud unfriendly way
Sense.TRAN: 倨傲不逊的﹐傲慢的﹐目中无人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a haughty laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傲慢的大笑

Sense.DEF: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

GramExa.PROPFORM: haul sth off/onto/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hauled her backpack onto her back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她背上沉重的背包。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hauled the door shut behind me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用力拽上了门。

Sense.LEXUNIT: haul yourself up/out of etc sth

Subsense.DEF: to move somewhere with a lot of effort, especially because you are injured or tired
Subsense.TRAN: 吃力地挪向/走出〔某处〕等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Patrick hauled himself painfully up the stairs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克拖着沉重的步伐痛苦地走上楼梯。

Subsense.DEF: to succeed in achieving a higher position in society, in a competition etc
Subsense.TRAN: 提高〔社会地位﹑比赛中的排名等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He is confident that the club can haul themselves further up the league.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定那家俱乐部在联赛中的排名还会提前。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone severely because they have done something wrong
to try to hit someone very hard
Sense.TRAN: 猛地重击/挥拳打/踢某人

Sense.DEF: to hurry
to force someone to go somewhere that they do not want to go, especially to prison
Sense.TRAN: 强迫〔某人〕去某处﹔〔尤指〕押送〔某人〕至监狱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police handcuffed him and hauled him off to jail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察给他戴上手铐﹐把他押送至监狱。

Sense.DEF: to officially bring someone to a court of law to be judged
Sense.TRAN: 传讯〔某人〕﹐把〔某人〕送上法庭受审

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Campbell was hauled up in front of the magistrate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎贝尔被移交地方法庭审判。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of illegal or stolen goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gang escaped with a haul worth hundreds of pounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匪徒带着价值几百英镑的赃物逃跑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A haul of stolen cars has been seized by police officers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批被盗汽车被警察截获。

Sense.DEF: something that takes a lot of time and effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last we’ve won our freedom but it’s been a long bitter haul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于赢得了自由﹐但这是一个漫长而艰难的过程。

Sense.DEF: until something that will take a long time is done or achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m in this for the long haul going to stay involved until the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我要坚持到底。

Sense.DEF: over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the long haul, these small increases add up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 久而久之﹐这些小小的增长会积少成多。

Sense.DEF: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net
the business of carrying goods in trucks or trains for other companies
Sense.EXAMPLE: the road haulage industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路货运业

Sense.DEF: a company that carries goods in trucks or trains for other companies
the part of your body that includes your bottom, your hips, and the tops of your legs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They squatted on their haunches playing dice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们蹲着玩掷骰子。

Sense.DEF: one of the back legs of a four-legged animal, especially when it is used as meat
Sense.TRAN: 〔四腿动物的〕一条后腿﹔〔尤指供食用的〕后腿﹐后腿肉

Sense.DEF: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

Sense.DEF: to make someone worry or make them sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clare was haunted by the fear that her husband was having an affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔总是担心丈夫有外遇。

Sense.DEF: to cause problems for someone over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an error that would come back to haunt them for years to come
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会在今后几年不断缠扰他们的一个失误

Sense.DEF: a place that someone likes to go to often

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Café Vienna was a favourite haunt of journalists and actors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维也纳咖啡馆是记者和演员最爱光顾的一个地方。

Sense.DEF: a haunted building is believed to be visited regularly by the soul of a dead person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a haunted house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闹鬼的房子

Sense.DEF: a very worried or frightened expression
sad but also beautiful and staying in your thoughts for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a haunting melody
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萦绕心头的旋律

Sense.DEF: the business of making and selling expensive and fashionable clothes for women
cooking of a very high standard, especially French cooking
a proud, very unfriendly manner
used with past participles to form perfect tenses
Sense.TRAN: 〔与过去分词连用构成动词的完成时态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our guests have arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的客人到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has anyone phoned?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人打过电话来吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been spending too much money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经花掉太多钱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t seen him for 15 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经15年没见他了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hope you’ve read the instructions.’ ‘Yes, of course I have.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我希望你已经看过使用说明了。”“当然看过了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You haven’t done much, have you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没做多少﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better phone to say you’ll be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好打电话去说一声你要晚到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better not tell Jim about our plans just yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好先别把计划告诉吉姆。

Sense.DEF: if someone had done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Had we known about it earlier, we could have warned people of the danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如早点知道这件事的话﹐我们就能提醒人们有危险了。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone or something looks like, what qualities or features they possess etc
Sense.TRAN: 具有〔某种外表﹑特性或特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has dark hair and brown eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头黑发﹐眼睛是棕色的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sullivan’s music does have a certain charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙利文的音乐确实具有某种魅力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to have a lot of patience to be a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当老师必须具备相当的耐心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wild rice has a very nutty flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菰米有很浓的坚果风味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t even have the courtesy to answer my letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他连给我回封信的礼貌都没有。

GramExa.GLOSS: have the skill or special quality needed to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should have seen the way Dad was dancing – I didn’t know he had it in him!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真该看看爸爸跳舞的样子——我还真不知道他有这两下子呢！

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say have got something rather than have something, but in writing they usually prefer to use just have.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中,人们一般说have got something,而不说 have something.但是在书面语中﹐他们往往更喜欢只用have
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He’s got a degree from Bristol University.(spoken, everyday【口语,日常用语】)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有布里斯托尔大学的学位。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He has all the relevant qualifications. (written 【书面语】)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他具备所有的相关资历。

Sense.DEF: to include or contain something or a particular number of things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan has a population of over 120 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本有超过1.2亿的人口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many pages has it got?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多少页？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tank still has water in it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水箱里还有水。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: They used to have a Mercedes Benz.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们曾经拥有一辆奔驰汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has your secretary got a fax machine?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的秘书有传真机吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ever had your own business?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你自己开过公司吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a lovely dog – how long have you had him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只狗真可爱﹐你养了多久了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have the car tonight, Dad?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上我能用一下车吗﹐爸爸？

Sense.DEF: to be holding something or carrying it with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a match?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有火柴吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look out! He’s got a gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心！他有枪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you got any money on you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你身上带钱了吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I don’t have my address book with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恐怕没带通讯录。

Sense.DEF: to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were just having a look around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是四处看看。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you going to have a swim?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要去游泳吗？

Sense.DEF: to eat, drink, or smoke something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat down and had another drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐下来又喝了一杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had been having a cigarette in the toilet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人一直在厕所抽烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I usually have breakfast at about seven o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常7点左右吃早餐。

Sense.DEF: to experience something or be affected by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been having a lot of difficulties with our new computer system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们使用新计算机系统时遇到了重重困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid your son has had a serious accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你儿子遇到严重事故了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is in hospital having treatment for a knee injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在医院接受膝伤的治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you have a good holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你假期愉快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thanks for everything – we had a great time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你——我们玩得很开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He found it quite natural to have people fussing over him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得别人对他关怀备至理所应当。

Sense.DEF: to think of something or to experience a particular feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have any good ideas for presents, let me know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想到送什么礼物好﹐就告诉我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have lots of happy memories of my time in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日本的那段日子给我留下了许多美好的回忆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had an awful feeling of guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一种深深的愧疚感。

Sense.DEF: to suffer from a disease, injury, or pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah’s got a cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉患了感冒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the victims had a broken leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名受害者断了一条腿。

Sense.DEF: to receive something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had lots of phone calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接到很多电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you had any news yet from Graham?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有格雷厄姆的消息了吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I expect he had some help from his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我估计他得到了他父亲的帮助。

Sense.DEF: if you have a particular amount of time, it is available for you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have just 30 seconds to answer the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只有30秒时间回答这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t time to stop and talk just now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这会儿没时间停下来说话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your hair cut/your house painted etc
Sense.DEF: to pay a professional person to cut your hair etc for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do you normally have your hair done?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你通常在哪里理发？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d only just had a new engine put in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚请人换了一台新的引擎。

Sense.DEF: if you have something stolen, broken etc, someone steals, breaks etc something that belongs to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had all her jewellery stolen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所有的首饰都被偷了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mullins had his nose broken in a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马林斯在一场斗殴中鼻子被打骨折了。

Sense.DEF: to have made something ready to be used, or have finished doing something
Sense.TRAN: 将某事准备好/做完/完成等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should have the car ready by Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该在星期一前将车准备好。

Sense.DEF: used to say that your body or something else is in a particular position or state, because you moved or did something
Sense.TRAN: 使保持﹔使在〔某位置或状态〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had my eyes half-closed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我半闭着眼睛。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Janice likes to have the window open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尼丝喜欢开着窗户。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had her back to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她背对着门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always got the stereo playing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是开着立体声音响。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is someone who is your relation or friend
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has an uncle in Wisconsin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一个叔叔在威斯康星州。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was nice for Alice to have friends of her own age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯有同龄的朋友是件好事。

Sense.DEF: to be employed in a particular job or to be responsible for doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boyfriend has a well-paid job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的男友有一份收入丰厚的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The headteacher has responsibility for the management of the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长担负着管理学校的责任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand here talking – I have work to do there is work that I must do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能站在这儿讲话——我有工作要做。

Sense.DEF: to employ or be in charge of a group of workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret Gillies currently has a team of 20 volunteers working for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特•吉利斯目前有一支20人的志愿者队伍在她手下工作。

Sense.DEF: if a shop or a hotel has goods or rooms, they are available for you to buy or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any single rooms?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有单人房间吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t have any sweaters in my size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有我穿的尺码的毛衣。

Sense.DEF: if you have someone with you, they are present with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily I had a friend with me who spoke German.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好当时有个会讲德语的朋友和我在一起。

Sense.DEF: to hold someone violently by a part of their body
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had him by the throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们扼住了他的喉咙。

Sense.DEF: if you have visitors or guests, they have come to your home, office etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t realize you had visitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不知道你有客人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had friends to stay over the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有朋友来过周末。

Sense.DEF: if you have an event such as a meeting, party, or concert, it happens because you have organized it
Sense.TRAN: 举办〔会议﹑聚会﹑音乐会等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a party on Saturday – you’re very welcome to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六我们要搞个聚会﹐非常欢迎你来。

Sense.DEF: to cause a particular result
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mistake that could have disastrous results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能产生灾难性后果的错误
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cardew was having a bad influence on the other students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡迪尤对其他学生产生了不良影响。

Sense.DEF: used to say that an opportunity or choice is available for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have the chance, you should go and see it – it’s a really good film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有机会你应该去看一下﹐这部电影真的不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women managers have a choice as to whether they wear trousers or a skirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女经理可以选择穿裤装或裙装。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year I had the honour of meeting the Duke of Edinburgh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年我有幸见到了爱丁堡公爵。

Sense.DEF: if a woman has a baby, it is born from her body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna insisted on having the baby at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜坚持要在家里生孩子。

Subsense.DEF: to affect someone in a way that makes them start doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within minutes he had the whole audience laughing and clapping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短短几分钟内他就让全体观众发出阵阵笑声和掌声。

Subsense.DEF: to persuade or order someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had me doing all kinds of jobs for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让我替她做各种各样的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll have Hudson show you to your room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会让赫德森带你去你的房间。

Sense.DEF: to finish or settle an argument or a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should throw you out now and have done with it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该把你赶出去﹐这事就了了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are reporting what people say or what a story says
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rumour has it that Kim is not his child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谣传金不是他的孩子。

Sense.DEF: if you have a place, time, or person all to yourself, you do not have to share them with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t wait to have Beth all to himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他巴不得马上就和贝丝单独在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the first time I’d had a room to myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我第一次独自拥有一个房间。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I expect she’s had lots of men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她有过不少男人。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
say this to politely ask someone to give you something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have the bill, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请拿账单给我﹐好吗
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could we have our ball back?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把球还给我们好吗？

Sense.DEF: say this to ask for something that you have chosen in a restaurant or shop
Sense.TRAN: 我/我们想要〔在餐馆点菜或在商店买东西时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a T-bone steak and chips, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来一份丁骨牛排和炸薯条。

Sense.DEF: used to offer something to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have another sandwich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再吃一个三明治吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Won’t you have a drink before you go?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走之前不喝一杯吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please have a seat, and the doctor will be right with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐﹐医生马上就来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will not allow something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re trying to play tricks on me again, but I won’t have it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又想耍弄我了﹐可我是不会让他们得逞的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t have you walking home all by yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能让你独自一人走回家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t have people wandering about on private land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不允许外人在私人领地上溜达。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not sorry that something bad has happened to someone, because they deserved it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not surprised his wife left him – he’s had it coming for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老婆离开他﹐我不觉得奇怪——他早就该落得这种下场。

Sense.DEF: used to say you have suddenly thought of the solution to a problem or that you suddenly understand a situation
used to say that you do not know the answer to a question
Sense.TRAN: 你把我问住了﹐你把我难倒了
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What makes you think women can’t do that kind of work?’ He scratched his head. ‘Well, now, you’ve got me there.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么认为女性不能做那种工作？”他挠了挠头﹐说：“嗯﹐你把我问住了。”

Sense.DEF: used to start to tell someone something when you are annoyed with them
Sense.TRAN: 你给我听着〔表示对某人很恼火〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have you know you’re insulting the woman I love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我听着﹐你在侮辱我爱的女人。

Sense.DEF: to want to make life difficult for someone because you dislike them
Sense.TRAN: 试图刁难某人﹐有意同某人过不去
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dean thinks his teachers have it in for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪安认为他的老师有意和他过不去。

Subsense.DEF: if someone has had it, they are going to fail or die, or be in serious trouble
Subsense.TRAN: 某人完了﹐某人糟了﹐某人大难临头了〔表示某人将失败﹑死亡或陷于大麻烦中〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Press the wrong button and you’ve had it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按错按钮你就完了。

Subsense.DEF: if someone has had it, they are very tired or annoyed and cannot continue with something
Subsense.TRAN: 某人受够了〔表示某人很厌烦或恼怒〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe he’s done it again. I’ve had it with him!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直不相信他又那么干了﹐我受够了！

Subsense.DEF: if something has had it, it no longer works and cannot be repaired
Subsense.TRAN: 某物已经坏了﹐某物不能用了〔表示某物不再运转且无法修理〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The engine’s had it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎坏了。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to agree to something, listen to someone etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to explain to her, but she just wasn’t having any of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我极力向她解释﹐但她根本不听。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has been deceived, for example by being tricked into paying too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: You paid £200? You’ve been had!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你付了200英镑？你上当了！

Sense.DEF: to dislike or be opposed to someone or something for a particular reason
Sense.TRAN: 因〔某种原因〕而不喜欢〔某人/某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what it is, but Roger seems to have something against women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道为什么﹐罗杰好像对女性有偏见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t see what you’ve got against the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你为什么不喜欢这个主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have nothing against foreigners have no reason to dislike them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没什么理由不喜欢外国人。

Sense.DEF: if you have someone in, they are doing some work in your home, for example building work
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had the builders in, so everything’s in a mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家有建筑工人在﹐所以家里一切都是乱糟糟的。

Sense.DEF: to be wearing a piece of clothing or type of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had his best suit on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着自己最好的西装。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimmy had nothing on but his socks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米身上除了袜子外什么也没穿。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have (got) the TV/radio/washing machine etc on
Sense.DEF: if you have your television, radio etc on, you have switched it on and it is working
Sense.TRAN: 开着电视机/收音机/洗衣机等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billie has the radio on all day long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利整天都开着收音机。

Sense.DEF: to be trying to make someone believe something that is not true, especially as a joke
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t believe a word he says. He’s having you on!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话一个字都不要信﹐他在骗你呢！

Sense.DEF: to have arranged to do something, go somewhere etc, especially when this means you cannot do something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔日程上〕已安排好做某事〔尤指因此无法做其他的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I can’t help you this weekend – I’ve got too much on already.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我这个周末不能帮你﹐我已经安排得满满当当了。

Sense.DEF: to know about something bad that someone has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do the police have on him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方掌握了他什么证据？

Sense.DEF: to not be nearly as good as someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 完全比不上某人/某事物﹐远不如某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rock ’n’ roll has got nothing on these African rhythms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇滚乐完全比不上这些非洲韵律。

Sense.DEF: to have a tooth etc removed by a medical operation
to settle a disagreement or difficult situation by talking to the person involved, especially when you are angry with them
Sense.TRAN: （与某人）讲清楚﹐来个了结〔指用对话解决纠纷或困局﹐尤用于生对方的气时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going round to his house to have it out with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要到他家去跟他说清楚。

Sense.DEF: if you have someone over, they come to your house for a meal, drink etc because you have invited them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must have you over for dinner before we leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走之前一定要请你来家里吃一顿饭。

Sense.DEF: to make someone go to a court of law because you think they have committed a crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last year he was had up for drunken driving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去年因醉酒驾车被送上法庭。

Sense.DEF: if you have to do something, you must do it because it is necessary or because someone makes you do it
Sense.TRAN: 必须﹐不得不〔指有必要或被迫做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have to rush – there’s plenty of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不必着急——有的是时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate having to get up early in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌一早就得起床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you earn more than £5,000, you will have to pay tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你收入超过5,000英镑﹐就得交税了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to be at the hospital at 4 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须4点到医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll have to be on a Sunday. I’ll be working every other day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须在星期天﹐其他日子我都上班。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In writing, people often prefer to say someone is forced to do something or is obliged to do something, as these sound more formal than have to do something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面语中,人们往往更喜欢说someone is forced to do something或is obliged to do something﹐因为这两种说法比have to do something听起来更正式
F2NBox.BADEXA: They had to pay tax on the full amount.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔They were obliged to pay tax on the full amount.
F2NBox.BADEXA: Many businesses have had to close.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔Many businesses have been forced to close.

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is important that something happens, or that something must happen if something else is to happen
Sense.TRAN: 必须﹐一定〔指做某事很重要〕﹔只有…（才…）
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has to be an end to the violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须终止暴力行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to believe me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要相信我！
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will have to be a complete ceasefire before the Government will agree to talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有完全停火后﹐政府才会同意举行会谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to be good to succeed in this game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏要过关得有真本事。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone how to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: First of all you have to mix the flour and the butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先要将面粉和黄油混合在一起。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are sure that something will happen or something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: House prices have to go up sooner or later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价迟早会上涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has to be a mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肯定弄错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have got to be joking!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定是在开玩笑吧！
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one else could have done it – it had to be Neville.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能是其他人干的——肯定是内维尔。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something because you think it would be enjoyable or useful
Sense.TRAN: 一定要〔用于提议某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to come and meet my wife some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候一定要来我家见见我太太。

Sense.DEF: used when something annoying happens in a way that things always seem to happen
Sense.TRAN: 非得〔指讨厌的事常常这样发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course it had to happen today, when all the shops are shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏偏赶在今天﹐所有的商店都关门了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that only one thing or person is good enough or right for someone
Sense.TRAN: 只有﹐只能是〔表示只有某一事物或人令某人满意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For Francesca it has to be the Ritz – nowhere else will do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西丝卡一定要住丽思酒店——其他地方都不行。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do you have to do sth?
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to stop doing something that annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lieutenant, do you have to keep repeating everything I’ve just said?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中尉﹐我说什么你都非得重复一遍吗？

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are making an honest statement even though it may be embarrassing for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to say I don’t know the first thing about computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不说﹐我对计算机一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The riverbanks are a haven for wildlife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河的两岸是野生动植物的乐土。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: St Ives, a haven for artists and hippies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣艾夫斯﹐艺术家和嬉皮士的天堂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the middle of the city, this garden is a haven of tranquillity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在市中心﹐这座花园是一处宁静之地。

Sense.DEF: the poor people in a country or society
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country where the have-nots far outnumber the haves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穷人远多于富人的国家

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘have not’

Sense.DEF: a bag that you carry on your back
the rich people in a country or society
Sense.EXAMPLE: the widening gap between the haves and the have-nots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断扩大的贫富差距

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is a lot of damage or a lack of order, especially so that it is difficult for something to continue in the normal way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A strike will cause havoc for commuters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工将给乘车上下班的人造成混乱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: policies that would wreak havoc on the country’s economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会危害该国经济的政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rain has continued to play havoc with sporting events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下雨一直影响着体育比赛的进行。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of ha
a shirt with short sleeves, worn by men, with patterns of Hawaiian things such as flowers, palm trees, and ocean waves
Sense.TRAN: 夏威夷（衬）衫〔一种男式短袖衬衫﹐印有夏威夷常见的花朵﹑棕榈树﹑海浪等图案〕

Sense.DEF: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
a politician who believes in using military force
to watch someone very carefully
Sense.TRAN: 仔细打量某人﹔严密监视某人

Sense.DEF: to be quick to notice things, especially small details
Sense.TRAN: 目光锐利﹔具有鹰一般敏锐的眼力

Sense.DEF: to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them
to cough up phlegm
someone who carries goods from place to place and tries to sell them
quick to notice small details
Sense.TRAN: 目光敏锐的﹐善于观察的

Sense.DEF: supporting the use of military force in order to deal with political problems
a thick rope or steel cable used on a ship
a small tree with small white flowers, red berries, and sharp points
long grass that has been cut and dried, used as food for cattle
to take the opportunity to do something now, because you may not be able to do it later
Sense.TRAN: 晒草要趁太阳好﹔抓紧时机

Sense.DEF: to go to bed
a medical condition, like a bad cold that is caused by breathing in pollendust from plants
the top part of a farm building where hay is stored
the process of cutting and drying long grass to make hay
a haystack
a ride in a cart filled with hay, usually as part of a social event
Sense.TRAN: 乘坐装满干草的大车出游

Sense.DEF: a large, firmly built pile of hay

Crossrefto.REFLEX: like looking for a needle in a haystack

Sense.DEF: to start working in completely the wrong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: My computer’s gone haywire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的计算机出毛病了。

Sense.DEF: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That pile of rubbish is a fire hazard something that is likely to cause a fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那堆垃圾是火灾隐患。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the health hazard posed by lead in petrol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油中的铅对健康构成的威胁

Sense.DEF: a risk that cannot be avoided

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the economic hazards of running a small farm
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经营小农场的经济风险

GramExa.GLOSS: a danger that exists in a job
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Divorce seems to be an occupational hazard for politicians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚对政客们来说似乎是一种职业风险。

Sense.DEF: to say something that is only a suggestion or guess and that might not be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: $50,000? I don’t know. I’m only hazarding a guess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5万美元？我不知道﹐我只是瞎猜。

Sense.DEF: to risk losing your money, property etc in an attempt to gain something
special lights on a vehicle that flash to warn other drivers of danger
dangerous, especially to people’s health or safety

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chemicals in paint can be hazardous to health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆中的化学物质可能对健康有害。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the disposal of hazardous waste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有害废弃物的处理

Sense.DEF: smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a haze of cigarette smoke
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟的烟雾

Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was surrounded by a golden haze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳被一片金色烟霞笼罩。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being very confused and unable to think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drunken haze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒醉时的迷糊

Sense.DEF: to play tricks on a new student or to make them do silly or dangerous things, as part of joining the school or a club at the school
Sense.TRAN: 戏弄〔新生﹐作为入学或入会仪式的一部分〕

Sense.DEF: to become hazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky hazed over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空泛起雾霭。

Sense.DEF: a small tree that produces nuts
the green-brown colour of some people’s eyes
hazel eyes are a green-brown colour
the nut of the hazel1 tree
substances that are dangerous to people’s health
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paint and other chemicals can be taken to a HazMat center for disposal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆和其他化学品可以送到危险品中心处理。

Sense.DEF: air that is hazy is not clear because there is a lot of smoke, dust, or mist in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: hazy sunshine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曚昽的阳光

Sense.DEF: an idea, memory etc that is hazy is not clear or exact
Sense.TRAN: 〔印象﹑记忆等〕模糊的﹐不清楚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My memories of the holiday are rather hazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对那次假期的记忆十分模糊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a little hazy about the details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有点记不清细节了。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=highest common factor【术语】最大公因数

Sense.DEF: HD television or video produces very clear pictures

Head.GRAM: used as the subject of a verb

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s Paul?’ ‘He’s gone to the cinema.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “保罗在哪儿？”“他去看电影了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was he who first suggested the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是他先提出这个想法的。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female. Some people think this use is old-fashioned.
Sense.TRAN: 人﹐他〔泛指男性或女性﹐有人认为这种用法过时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone should do what he considers best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都应按照自己认为最好的去做。

Sense.DEF: used when writing about God
a male person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I discovered that Mel wasn’t a he, but a she.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现梅尔不是男人﹐而是女人。

Sense.DEF: a male animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a he-goat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公山羊

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=His/Her Excellency, used in the title of an ambassador 阁下〔用于大使头衔〕

Sense.DEF: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kissed the top of her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吻了一下她的头顶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They dived head first into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一头跳进水中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was dressed in black from head to foot over all her body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He still has a full head of hair has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依然满头浓发。

Sense.DEF: your mind or mental ability
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem only exists inside his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题只存在于他的脑子里。

GramExa.GLOSS: calculate something mentally
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t do those figures in my head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些数字我心算不了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Use your head to work out the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动动脑筋想出答案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jackie said the first thing that came into her head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰姬想到什么就说了出来。

GramExa.GLOSS: understand something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s over, Jake,’ she said. ‘Try and get that into your head.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “结束了﹐杰克﹐”她说﹐ “尽量想明白这一点吧。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: take/get it into your head (to do sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: decide to do something, especially something stupid
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 突发奇想（要做某事）﹔心血来潮（要做某事）
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At about two in the morning, Alan took it into his head to go for a swim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约凌晨两点的时候﹐艾伦心血来潮要去游泳。

GramExa.PROPFORM: get/put sth out of your head
GramExa.GLOSS: stop thinking or worrying about something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 不再考虑某事﹔不再为某事担心
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to put it out of your head for the time being.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下尽量不要去想这件事。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone think or believe something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使某人思考某事﹔使某人相信某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s put that idea into her head?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怎么会这样想？

GramExa.GLOSS: be able to understand something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just can’t get my head round what’s been going on here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是不明白这里发生了什么事。

Subsense.DEF: to remain calm and sensible in a difficult or frightening situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We need a candidate who can keep his or her head even when clients get aggressive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要找的人选需要在客户生气暴躁时也能保持头脑冷静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Get to sleep early tonight – you’ll need to keep a clear head tomorrow at the trial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚早点睡觉——明天审判时你要保持清醒的头脑。

Subsense.DEF: to become unable to behave calmly or sensibly in a difficult or frightening situation
Subsense.TRAN: 慌了神﹐失去冷静﹐惊慌失措
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be OK as long as you don’t lose your head and forget he’s the real enemy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只要保持冷静、忘记他是真正的对手﹐就没问题的。

Subsense.DEF: to be sensible and able to deal with difficult situations
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wondered what Gemma thought about it all. She seemed to have her head screwed on.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想知道杰玛对整个事情是怎么想的﹐她看上去是个有头脑的人。

Subsense.DEF: a leader or person in charge of a group or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should discuss the matter with your head of department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该和部门主管讨论一下这件事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A meeting of Commonwealth heads of state will be held next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英联邦首脑会议将于下月召开。

GramExa.GLOSS: the person in charge of a group of waiters etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 服务员领班/首席厨师/花匠负责人等

Subsense.DEF: the person in charge of a school
Subsense.EXAMPLE: From now on all violent incidents should be reported directly to the head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在开始﹐所有暴力事件都要直接向校长汇报。

Sense.DEF: the front or the most important position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At the head of the table the place where the most important person sits sat the senior partners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子的上首坐着高级合伙人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band of soldiers marched into the yard, their defeated captain at their head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这队士兵行进到院子里﹐灰心丧气的上尉走在前头。

Sense.DEF: used in particular phrases to talk about someone being crazy or very stupid
Sense.TRAN: 脑子〔用于固定短语中﹐表示某人发疯或很傻〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People going out in conditions like this need their heads examined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种天气出门的人得去检查一下脑子是否正常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You must be off your head if you think that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果那样想肯定是疯了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If I walk in looking like that, they’ll think I’m not right in the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我这副模样走进去﹐他们会认为我脑子不正常。

Sense.DEF: for each person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner works out at $30 a head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这顿晚饭算下来每人30美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: average incomes per head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人均收入

Sense.DEF: the place where a river, valley etc begins
if a problem or difficult situation comes to a head, or something brings it to a head, it suddenly becomes worse and has to be dealt with quickly
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔事情〕到达紧要关头﹔突然恶化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things came to a head in the summer of 1997.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1997年的夏天﹐情况突然恶化。

Sense.DEF: the top of a plant where its flowers or leaves grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was outside cutting the dead heads off the roses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在外面把玫瑰的残花剪掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a head of lettuce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵生菜

Sense.DEF: the length of a head, used to measure height or distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw her father, a head above the rest of the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看见了比其他人高出一头的父亲。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that a horse won or lost a race but only by a small amount

Sense.DEF: the side of a coin that has a picture of a person’s head on it

GramExa.GLOSS: used to decide something, by asking someone which side of a coin they guess will be showing when you throw it in the air and it lands

Sense.DEF: to laugh, shout etc very loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans were screaming their heads off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们高声尖叫。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a good/fine/thick etc head of hair
Sense.DEF: to have a lot of hair on your head

Subsense.DEF: to start working in a quiet determined way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s time you got your head down and did some revision.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该静下心来温习功课了。

Subsense.DEF: to sleep

Sense.DEF: to try to avoid being noticed or getting involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 避免引人注意﹔避免麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do what you’re told and keep your head down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫你做什么你就做什么﹐别惹麻烦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as soon as your head hits the pillow
Sense.DEF: if you fall asleep as soon as your head hits the pillow, you fall asleep as soon as you lie down
to not know what you are doing because you have taken drugs or drunk too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 神志失常﹐精神错乱〔因吸毒或醉酒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was off his head on various drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于吸食了几种毒品﹐他神志不清。

Subsense.DEF: if alcohol goes to your head, it quickly makes you feel drunk
if success goes to someone’s head, it makes them feel more important than they really are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She never let fame go to her head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从不因自己的名气而飘飘然。

Sense.DEF: the wide end of a long narrow tool or piece of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔长而窄的工具或设备〕较宽大的一端

Sense.DEF: to discuss a difficult problem together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next morning, we all put our heads together to decide what should be done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早晨﹐我们大家共同商量该怎么办。

Subsense.DEF: to be too difficult for someone to understand
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The explanation went completely over my head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解释太深奥了﹐我根本听不懂。

Subsense.DEF: to do something without discussing it with a particular person or organization first, especially when you should have discussed it with them
Subsense.TRAN: 越过某人〔行使过分的权力〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: can’t make head or/nor tail of sth
Sense.DEF: to be completely unable to understand something
Sense.TRAN: 完全弄不清某事物﹐完全不能理解某事物

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your head in the clouds
Sense.DEF: to think about something in a way that is not practical or sensible, especially when you think things are much better than they really are

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a (good) head for figures/facts/business etc
Sense.DEF: to be naturally good at doing calculations, remembering facts etc
Sense.TRAN: 擅长计算/记忆/做生意等

Sense.DEF: the ability to look down from high places without feeling ill or nervous
the opinion that you are much better, more important, more skilful etc than you really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose I did do OK, but I’d be silly to get a big head about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我的确做得不错﹐不过我要是因此而自满的话就太愚蠢了。

Sense.DEF: to manage to continue to live on your income or keep your business working when this is difficult because of financial problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔靠自己的收入〕勉强度日﹔〔因财务问题〕勉强维持经营
Sense.EXAMPLE: For years they struggled to keep their heads above water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来他们一直勉强维持着生活。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/stand head and shoulders above sb
Sense.DEF: to be much better than other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: One contestant stood head and shoulders above the rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一位参赛选手表现突出。

Sense.DEF: to show pride or confidence, especially in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you do this, you’ll never be able to hold your head up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这样做﹐你以后就再也抬不起头了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be (like) banging/bashing etc your head against a brick wall
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are making no progress at all in what you are trying hard to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve tried to talk some sense into them, but it’s like banging my head against a brick wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拼命跟他们讲道理﹐但结果是白费唇舌。

Sense.DEF: used to say that two people or groups should be forced to stop arguing and start to behave sensibly
Sense.TRAN: 强行制止某人争吵并使其恢复理智

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone very angrily with no good reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: I offered to help her, but she just bit my head off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提出要帮助她﹐但她却痛骂了我一顿。

Sense.DEF: to make people think about something in the opposite way to the way it was originally intended
Sense.TRAN: 倒过来想某事物﹔使人完全改变思考某事物的思路
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attorney quickly turned his main defense argument on its head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位律师很快扭转了主要的辩护思路。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the freedom to do what they want to do
Sense.TRAN: 放任[听任]某人自由行动

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/fall head over heels in love
Sense.DEF: to love or suddenly start to love someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 深深地爱着/突然爱上 〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam was head over heels in love with his new bride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆深深地爱着他的新娘。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will be punished severely for something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 有人将要受到严厉的惩罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heads will roll for this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人将为此事受到严厉惩罚！

Sense.LEXUNIT: on your own head be it
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they will be blamed if the thing they are planning to do goes wrong
Sense.TRAN: 责任自负﹐一人做事一人当

Sense.DEF: to make you feel confused and annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn that noise down – it’s doing my head in!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把声音关小点﹐吵死人了！

Sense.DEF: to be or get involved in something that is too difficult for you to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: In business, start small and don’t get in over your head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在生意方面﹐从小的做起﹐不要贪大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be over your head in debt
Sense.DEF: to owe so much money that there is no possibility of paying it all back

Sense.LEXUNIT: go head to head with sb
Sense.DEF: to deal with or oppose someone in a very direct and determined way
Sense.TRAN: 与某人正面交锋﹐与某人硬碰硬
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rather than go head to head with their main rivals, they decided to try a more subtle approach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与其和主要对手硬碰硬﹐他们决定倒不如尝试智取。

Sense.DEF: used to warn people that something is falling from above
Sense.TRAN: 当心上面！〔警告别人上面有东西掉下〕

Sense.DEF: the layer of small white bubbles on the top of a glass of beer
a piece of equipment that changes information on a recording tape, a computer hard disk etc into electrical messages that electronic equipment can use
a particular number of cows, sheep etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a farm with 20 head of cattle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养着20头牛的农场

Sense.DEF: pressure that is made when water or steam is kept in an enclosed space

Sense.LEXUNIT: get/build up a head of steam
Sense.DEF: to become very active after starting something slowly
a high area of land that sticks out into the sea – used in names
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beachy Head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比奇角

Sense.DEF: the centre of a swollen spot on your skin
to perform oral sex on someone

Crossrefto.REFLEX: bury your head in the sand
off the top of your head
sb can do sth standing on their head
two heads are better than one

Collocate.EXAMPLE: John turned his head to look at the boy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰转过头去看那男孩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: move it from side to side, especially to show disagreement
Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s too much,’ he said, shaking his head.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “这太过分了。”他摇着头说道。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: move it up and down, especially to show agreement
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The audience nodded their heads enthusiastically.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众热情地点着头。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人头痛/某人的头抽痛
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her head was throbbing and she needed to lie down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头阵阵作痛,得躺下来才行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look up
look down
look down, especially because you are ashamed
especially because you do not understand something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sun beat down on her bare head.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光火辣辣地照在她没戴帽子的头上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His bald head shone with sweat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出了汗,光头闪闪发亮。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with blonde etc hair
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人长着金发/深色头发/灰白头发等的脑袋
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I saw my son’s blond head sticking out from the car window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见儿子满头金发的脑袋从车窗里探出来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Wearing a helmet reduces the risk of head injuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴头盔可以减少头部受伤的风险。

Sense.DEF: to go or travel towards a particular place, especially in a deliberate way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was heading for Cuba.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船正驶向古巴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s about time we were heading home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该回家了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We headed south towards the capital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们朝南向首都进发。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Where are you guys headed?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们要去哪儿？

Sense.DEF: if you are heading for a particular situation, especially a bad one, it seems likely to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forecasters predict the region’s economy is heading for disaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预测专家预言该地区经济即将面临灾难。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Where is your life heading?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的生活何去何从？

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: David was asked to head up the technical team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interim government headed by the former Prime Minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由前首相领导的过渡政府

Subsense.DEF: to be at the top of a list or group of people or things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The movie heads the list of Oscar nominations.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片在奥斯卡提名影片中名列首位。

Subsense.DEF: if a page is headed with a particular name, title, image etc, it has it on the top
Subsense.TRAN: 题目是…﹐标题为…﹔顶端写[印]有…
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The page was headed ‘Expenses’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一页的标题为“开支”。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: officially-headed writing paper
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有正式信头的信纸

Sense.DEF: to be at the front of a line of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a procession headed by the Queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王领头的一列队伍

Sense.DEF: to hit the ball with your head, especially in football
to leave to go to another place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m heading off now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在要走了。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from happening, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 阻止某事﹐防止某事发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President intervened to head off the conflict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统出面调停以阻止冲突发生。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone going somewhere by moving in front of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers headed them off at the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵在边境将他们拦截住。

Sense.DEF: the top of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pithead the top of a coal mine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤矿井口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a letterhead a name and address printed at the top of a letter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信头

Sense.DEF: the place where something begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fountainhead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泉源

Sense.DEF: a pain in your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have a headache, you should take some aspirin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是头痛﹐你该吃点阿司匹林。

Sense.DEF: a problem that is difficult or annoying to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 使人头痛的事﹐棘手的事﹐难题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Security is a big headache for airline operators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对航空公司来说安全问题是件很棘手的事。

F2NBox.HEADING: grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Headache is a countable noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: headache是可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I had a headache (NOT 不说 I had headache).

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a really bad headache.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我头痛得非常厉害。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very bad headache
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The next day he woke up with a splitting headache.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天醒来时他头痛欲裂。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not very serious

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s not coming – she says she’s got a headache.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不来了——她说她头痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: regularly have a headache
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He often gets headaches at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校里常常头痛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The music was starting to give him a headache.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这音乐开始让他头痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you have a headache
it stops

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a strong/heavy headache’. Say 而要说 a bad headache.
Do not say 不要说 ‘a little headache’. Say 而要说 a slight headache or 或 a bit of a headache.

Exponent.DEF: a pain in your head
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Looking at a computer for a long time can give you a headache.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间看计算机会头痛。

Exponent.DEF: a headache and feeling of sickness that you get the day after you have drunk too much alcohol
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The next day I had a terrible hangover.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天我宿醉反应很厉害。

Exponent.DEF: a very bad headache, which makes you feel sick and have difficulty seeing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has suffered from migraines all his life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏头痛折磨了他一辈子。

Sense.DEF: a band that you wear around your head to keep your hair off your face or as a decoration
someone who enjoys heavy metal music and moves their head around violently to the beat of the music
the upright board at the end of a bed where your head is
the boy who is chosen in a British school each year to represent the school
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国学校里每年选出的〕男学生代表

Sense.DEF: to deliberately hit someone with your head
a crazy person
a cold that makes it difficult for you to breathe
the act of counting how many people are present in a particular place at one time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teachers did a head count to check that none of the kids were missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师们清点学生人数以核实没有孩子丢失。

Sense.DEF: the number of people working for a company
something that someone wears on their head, especially for decoration on a special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bride wore white with a pearl headdress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘一身白衣﹐头戴珍珠头饰。

Sense.DEF: having red hair, curly hair etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bald-headed man having no hair in a shiny suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿闪亮西服的秃顶男人

Sense.DEF: having two heads etc
Sense.TRAN: 有两个头的/有三个头的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-headed monster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双头怪兽

Sense.DEF: paper for writing letters that has your name and address printed at the top
an action in football in which you hit the ball with your head
information at the top of a page, especially things such as numbers that appear on each page of a document
information at the beginning of an email message that shows when it was sent, who wrote it etc
if you fall headfirst, your head goes down first, and the rest of your body follows afterwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fell head-first down the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一头栽下楼梯。

Sense.DEF: if you do something head-first, you become involved in it too quickly, without having time to think about it carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: a remark that sent him tumbling head-first into another controversy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让他鲁莽地陷入另一场争论的言论

Sense.DEF: if you play head games with someone, especially someone you are in a romantic relationship with, you deceive them or try to get them to behave as you want them to
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指欺骗或操纵恋爱对象的〕智力游戏﹐心理游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s obviously playing head games with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然在和你玩心理游戏。

Sense.DEF: hats and other things that you wear on your head
the girl who is chosen in a British school each year to represent the school
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国学校里每年选出的〕女学生代表

Sense.DEF: someone who finds people with the right skills and experience to do particular jobs, and who tries to persuade them to leave their present jobs
the title written at the beginning of a piece of writing, or at the beginning of part of a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: chapter headings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 章节标题

Sense.DEF: a name that is given to a group of things or people, that helps to describe them as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: writers who might come under the heading of postmodern fiction writers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以被归为后现代主义小说家的作家

Sense.DEF: a headlight
an area of land that sticks out from the coast into the sea
without a head
Sense.EXAMPLE: a headless corpse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一具无头尸体

Sense.LEXUNIT: run around like a headless chicken
Sense.DEF: to be going from one place to another in a way that is not organized at all
one of the large lights at the front of a vehicle, or the beam of light produced by this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, a figure appeared in my headlights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐有个人影出现在我的车头灯前。

Sense.LEXUNIT: like a rabbit/deer caught in headlights
Sense.DEF: so frightened or confused that you do not know what to do
the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

Sense.DEF: the important points of the main news stories that are read at the beginning of a news programme on radio or television
to be reported in many newspapers and on radio and television
Sense.TRAN: 成了报纸[电台﹐电视]上的新闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scandal that grabbed the headlines for weeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续几周备受媒体关注的丑闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: The former MP found himself back in the headlines again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位前议员发现自己再次登上了新闻头条。

Sense.DEF: to appear as the main performer or band in a show
Sense.TRAN: 扮演主角﹔成为…的主要表演者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eminem is headlining at the festival this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米纳姆是今年会演的主角。

Sense.DEF: to give a headline to an article or story
headline-grabbing news is important and reported in many newspapers and on radio and television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story was headline-grabbing material in the nationals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一消息成为了全国性报纸的重大新闻。

Sense.DEF: the main performer or band in a concert
a way of holding someone around their neck so that they cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: His opponent had him in a headlock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的对手夹住了他的头。

Sense.DEF: if you rush headlong into something, you start doing it too quickly without thinking carefully
with your head first and the rest of your body following
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell headlong into a pool of icy water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一个倒栽葱跌入了冰冷的池水中。

Sense.DEF: very quickly, without looking where you are going
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mortimer almost ran headlong into a patrol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫蒂默慌不择路﹐差点撞到巡逻队。

Sense.DEF: the most important man in a village where a tribe lives
a male teacher who is in charge of a school
a female teacher who is in charge of a school
the main office of a company
the main representative of a country, such as a queen, king, or president, who may not have duties in the country’s government
if two vehicles crash etc head-on, the front part of one vehicle hits the front part of the other
if someone deals with a problem head-on, they do not try to avoid it, but deal with it in a direct and determined way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are trying to tackle car crime head-on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在积极处理汽车罪案。

Sense.DEF: if two people or teams meet head-on in an argument, competition etc, they compete against each other and try to win in a very determined way
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论﹑比赛等〕全力以赴地﹐毫不留情地

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you wear over your ears to listen to the radio, music etc without other people hearing it
something you wear on your head, usually for decoration
Sense.TRAN: 头戴的饰物〔如头巾﹑头盔﹑帽子等〕

Sense.DEF: to have your headquarters at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many top companies are headquartered in northern California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多大公司都把总部设在加利福尼亚北部。

Sense.DEF: the main building or offices used by a large company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the headquarters of the United Nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国总部

Sense.DEF: the place from which military operations are controlled
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队的〕司令部﹐指挥部﹐大本营

Sense.DEF: the top part of a chair or of a seat in a car, plane etc that supports the back of your head
Sense.TRAN: 〔座椅或汽车﹑飞机等座位的〕头靠﹐头垫

Sense.DEF: the amount of space above your head, especially when you are in a car
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指车辆中乘客头顶以上的〕头顶空间

Sense.DEF: the amount of space above a vehicle when it is under a bridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔车顶与桥底之间的〕净空（高度）

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling of extreme pleasure and excitement, especially one that you get soon after using an illegal drug such as ecstasy or cocaine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指服用毒品后骤然感受到的〕极度快感

Sense.DEF: a square piece of cloth that women wear on their heads and tie under their chins
a set of headphones, often with a microphone attached
the position of being in charge of an organization
the job of being in charge of a school
a position in which you turn your body upside down, with your head and hands on the floor and your legs and feet in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you do a headstand?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会倒立吗？

Sense.DEF: an advantage that helps you to be successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Give your children a head start by sending them to nursery school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 送孩子上幼儿园﹐让他们赢在起跑线上。

Sense.DEF: a start in a race in which you begin earlier or further ahead than someone else
a piece of stone on a grave, with the name of the dead person written on it
very determined to do what you want, even when other people advise you not to do it
a warning that something may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s a heads-up for investors in real-estate stocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此提醒房地产股票投资者要当心。

Sense.DEF: a table at a formal meal where the most important people sit, or the people who are giving speeches
Sense.TRAN: 主桌〔正式宴会上最重要的人或要发表讲话的人所坐的桌子〕

Sense.DEF: the teacher who is in charge of a school
competing directly with another person or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Courier companies are going head-to-head with the Post Office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快递公司在与邮政系统正面竞争。

Sense.DEF: the streams that form a river

Subsense.DEF: to make progress towards achieving something – used especially when this is difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Foreign firms have made little headway in the US market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国公司在美国市场进展甚微。

Subsense.DEF: to move forwards – used especially when this is slow or difficult
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指缓慢或艰难地〕向前行进
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stormy weather stopped the ship from making headway.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在暴风雨天气里不能向前开。

Sense.DEF: a wind that blows directly towards you when you are moving
one of the words whose meaning is explained in a dictionary
a heady smell, drink etc is pleasantly strong and seems to affect you strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔气味﹑饮料等〕醇浓的﹐令人陶醉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heady combination of wine and brandy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 醇香醉人的葡萄酒和白兰地混合酒

Sense.DEF: very exciting in a way that makes you feel as if you can do anything you want to
Sense.TRAN: 使人飘飘然的﹐使人兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the heady atmosphere of the early sixties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代初期的狂热气氛

Sense.DEF: if a wound or a broken bone heals or is healed, the flesh, skin, or bone grows back together and becomes healthy again
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took three months for my arm to heal properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的胳膊三个月之后才痊愈。

Sense.DEF: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过自然力量或祈祷〕医治﹔治愈
Sense.EXAMPLE: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自称可以治病的传道士

Sense.DEF: to become mentally or emotionally strong again after a bad experience, or to help someone to do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔在精神或感情上〕（使）复原﹐（使）坚强起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trauma of divorce can often be healed by successful remarriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚带来的创伤常常能通过后来的美满再婚治愈。

Sense.DEF: if an argument or disagreement between people heals or you heal it, the people stop arguing or disagreeing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our main goal must be to heal the divisions in our society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的最大目标必定是消除社会分歧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

Sense.DEF: if a wound or an area of broken skin heals over, new skin grows over it and it becomes healthy again
Sense.TRAN: 〔伤口或破损的皮肤〕愈合﹐痊愈

Sense.DEF: someone who is believed to be able to cure people using natural powers, rather than by using medicine
Sense.TRAN: 用自然力〔而非药物〕的治疗师

Sense.DEF: something that makes a bad experience seem less painful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time is a great healer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间是一剂良药。

Sense.DEF: the treatment of illness using natural powers or prayer rather than medicine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The medical establishment is taking healing increasingly seriously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗机构越来越重视自然疗法。

Sense.DEF: the process of becoming healthy and strong again
Sense.EXAMPLE: the healing process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康复过程

Sense.DEF: the general condition of your body and how healthy you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m worried about my husband’s health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心我丈夫的健康状况。

Sense.DEF: the work of providing medical services to keep people healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to spend more on health and education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已经承诺增加医疗和教育经费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: health insurance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保险
Sense.EXAMPLE: nurses and other health workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士和其他医务人员

Sense.DEF: when you have no illness or disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even if you haven’t got much money, at least you’ve got your health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使你没有太多钱﹐但起码你拥有健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we last met, he was glowing with health was clearly very healthy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上一次见面的时候﹐他容光焕发。

Sense.DEF: how successful something such as a business, an organization, or a country’s economy is
Sense.TRAN: 〔经济〕运行状况﹔〔机构〕运转状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: The monthly trade figures are seen as an indicator of the health of the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月的贸易数字被视为经济状况的指标。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Physical exercise is essential to good health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育锻炼对于身体健康极为重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At the age of 70, her health is excellent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她70岁了,身体非常好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He wanted to join the army but his health was too poor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想参军,但是身体太差。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He retired early due to ill health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于身体不好﹐他提前退休。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone is becoming more ill

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is no doubt that smoking can seriously damage your health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐吸烟会严重损害健康。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause danger to your health
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Being overweight endangers your health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥胖危害健康。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: gets worse
care from doctors, nurses etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many Americans cannot afford even basic health care.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多美国人连基本的医疗费都支付不起。
