Collocate.EXAMPLE: He missed a lot of time at work through health problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于健康问题,他许多时候没去上班。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that could damage your health
a warning printed on a product that could harm you
be healthy/unhealthy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her parents were elderly and in poor health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母上了年纪,身体不好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eating plenty of vegetables is good for your health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量食用蔬菜有利健康。

Sense.DEF: an area of government and law concerned with people’s health and safety, especially at work
Sense.TRAN: 〔指政务和法律范畴﹐尤指工作场所的〕卫生与安全
Sense.EXAMPLE: health and safety regulations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生与安全条例

Sense.DEF: the service that is responsible for looking after the health of all the people in a country or an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised wide-ranging health care for all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府许诺提供广泛的全民医疗保健服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: health care workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健工作人员

Sense.DEF: a building where several doctors work, and where people can go for medical treatment
a place where people who have paid to become members can go to do physical exercise
a place where people pay to stay so that they can do physical exercise, eat healthy food, and have beauty treatments
Sense.TRAN: 养生中心﹐健康会馆〔指人们锻炼﹑吃健康食品﹑做美容的地方〕

Sense.DEF: food that contains only natural substances, and that is good for your health
likely to make you healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: healthful mountain air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有利于健康的山区空气

Sense.DEF: someone such as a doctor, nurse, dentist etc, whose job involves people’s health
a public service that is responsible for providing people with medical care
Sense.EXAMPLE: reforms to the health service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共医疗保健服务的改革

Sense.DEF: a place where people pay to stay so that they can do physical exercise, eat healthy food, and have beauty treatments
Sense.TRAN: 养生中心﹐健康会馆〔指人们锻炼﹑吃健康食品﹑做美容的地方〕

Sense.DEF: travelling to a foreign country in order to receive cheap or free medical treatment – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 医疗旅游〔指去国外接受廉价或免费医疗﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: having a holiday that involves taking part in sports activities or doing things such as having beauty treatments
Sense.TRAN: 〔提供健身活动和美容服务的〕健身旅游（业）

Sense.DEF: a nurse in Britain who visits people in their homes
physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy baby boy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康的男婴
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到现在﹐我的身体一直非常健康。

Sense.DEF: good for your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy lifestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康的生活方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康的饮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of healthy eating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康饮食的重要性

Sense.DEF: showing that you are healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face had a healthy glow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上容光焕发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of our kids have healthy appetites they like to eat a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的孩子胃口都很好。

Sense.DEF: used to describe an attitude, feeling, or behaviour that is natural, normal, and sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think it’s healthy for her to spend so much time alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她太多时间独处不正常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a healthy disrespect for silly regulations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对荒唐规定的合乎情理的藐视

Sense.DEF: a healthy company, society, relationship, economy etc is working effectively and successfully
Sense.TRAN: 运作良好的﹔兴旺发达的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy economy with a well-trained workforce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有训练有素的劳动力的繁荣经济

Sense.DEF: large and showing that someone is successful – used about amounts of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy profit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可观的利润
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy bank balance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大笔银行结存

Exponent.DEF: having good health
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A good diet keeps you healthy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好饮食使人健康。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They tested the drug on healthy volunteers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将该药品在健康的志愿者身上进行了试验。

Exponent.DEF: used especially when describing or asking about how someone feels or looks
Exponent.TRAN: 健康的〔尤用于描述或询问健康状况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得身体不舒服。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How was James – did he look well?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯怎么样——他看上去身体好吗？

Exponent.DEF: used in a reply to a question about your health, or when talking about someone else’s health – used only in replies, not in questions or statements
Exponent.TRAN: 很好〔用于在别人问你身体如何时作答,或谈论别人的健康状况时﹔fine只用于回答,不用于提问或陈述〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Hi, Tom, how are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “嘿,汤姆,你好吗？”“很好,谢谢。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had a bad cold, but she’s fine now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她之前得了重感冒,不过现在好了。

Exponent.DEF: not ill or injured – very commonly used in everyday spoken English
Exponent.TRAN: 没病的﹔没受伤的﹔安然无恙的〔在日常英语口语中十分常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look pale – are you feeling all right?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你脸色苍白——你感觉还好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s had an accident but he’s OK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遇到了意外,不过他没事。

Exponent.DEF: less ill than you were, or no longer ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling a lot better now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在感觉好多了。

Exponent.DEF: healthy, especially because you exercise regularly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因经常锻炼而〕健壮的,健康的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She keeps fit by cycling everywhere.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去哪里都骑自行车,以此来保持健康。

Exponent.DEF: healthy and fit
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jogging keeps me in pretty good shape.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢跑让我保持身体健康。

Exponent.DEF: healthy and strong, and not likely to become ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a robust constitution a strong and healthy body.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他体格强健。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: robust plants
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 茁壮的植物

Exponent.DEF: to look very healthy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She looked a picture of health as she posed for the cameras.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摆姿势拍照的时候显得非常健康。

Sense.DEF: a large untidy pile of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rubbish heap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾堆

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a heap of stones where the building used to be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那栋建筑物的原址上有一堆石头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The envelopes for posting lay in a heap on her desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 待寄信件杂乱地堆在她的书桌上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We piled the branches into heaps for burning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把树枝堆起来烧。

Sense.DEF: a lot of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children have heaps of energy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们精力充沛。

GramExa.GLOSS: much better, bigger etc

Sense.DEF: to fall down and lie without moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: They finally collapsed in a heap on the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最终瘫倒在草地上。

Sense.DEF: an old car that is in bad condition

Sense.LEXUNIT: at the top/bottom of the heap
Sense.DEF: high up and successful or low down and unsuccessful in an organization or in society
Sense.TRAN: 在〔机构或社会的〕顶层/底层
Sense.EXAMPLE: The very poor are at the bottom of the heap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫苦大众处于社会底层。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be struck all of a heap
Sense.DEF: to be suddenly very surprised or confused
Sense.TRAN: 被突然惊呆﹐被弄得不知所措

Sense.DEF: to put a lot of things on top of each other in an untidy way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean heaped logs on the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼把木头堆放在火上。

Sense.DEF: to put a lot of something on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a glass of whisky and heaped his plate with food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给他一杯威士忌﹐并给他的盘子盛满食物。

Sense.DEF: to praise, insult etc someone a lot
Sense.TRAN: 对某人极力称赞/百般侮辱等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He heaped all the blame on his secretary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把所有责任都推在秘书身上。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is as much as a spoon can hold
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add three heaped teaspoons of sugar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入满满三茶匙的糖。

Sense.DEF: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blanche heard a crash as the back door was flung open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布兰奇听见后门哗啦一声被推开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did anyone see or hear anything last night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚有没有人看见或听见什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old Zeke doesn’t hear too well any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老齐克的耳朵已不灵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny could hear them arguing outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮能听到他们在外面争论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She heard Tom go upstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听见汤姆上了楼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t hear what they were saying most of the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数时间我都听不到他们在说什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want to be heard to criticize him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想被人听见自己批评他。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse hear with listen to, which means ‘hear and pay attention to’. 不要混淆hear和listen to﹐listen to指听见并加以注意: You should listen to my advice (NOT 不说 You should hear my advice). 你应该听从我的建议。

Sense.DEF: to listen to what someone is saying, the music they are playing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie did not wait to hear an answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉没等着听答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you hear that programme on whales the other night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前两天晚上你有没有收听那个有关鲸的节目？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want to hear what the doctor has to say.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想听听医生有什么话要说。

GramExa.PROPFORM: I hear what you say/what you’re saying
GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that you have listened to their opinion, but do not agree with it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hear what you say, but I don’t think we should rush this decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见你说的了﹐但我认为我们不该草率作出这个决定。

Sense.DEF: to be told or find out a piece of information
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard a rumor that he was getting married soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到传闻﹐说他马上要结婚了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m so sorry to hear he died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说他去世了我很难过。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’ll be pleased to hear that she can leave hospital tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道明天可以出院﹐她会很高兴的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teresa heard about the decision later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷莎后来听说了那个决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard of a job which would be just right for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说有个工作很适合你。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This was the first I’d heard of any trouble in the area I had just heard news of trouble for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我第一次听说该地区发生麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was last heard of in Washington he was in Washington the last time someone had information about him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们最后听到他的消息时他在华盛顿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t hear anything of him these days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些日子我们没有听到他的任何消息。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you have been told something or know it already
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a nasty infection going round, so I hear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说最近有一种严重的传染病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you hear what happened to Julia?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有听说朱莉娅怎么了？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard it said that they met in Italy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说他们是在意大利相识的。

Sense.DEF: to listen to all the facts in a case in a court of law in order to make a legal decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院于周二审理了此案。

Sense.DEF: to know that someone or something exists because they have been mentioned to you before
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you know Jill Marshall?’ ‘No, I’ve never heard of her.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道吉尔·马歇尔吗？”“不知道﹐我从未听说过她。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: not hear the last of sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will continue to complain about something or cause problems
Sense.TRAN: 某人还会投诉﹔某人还会带来更多麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll sue him. He hasn’t heard the last of me yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要起诉他﹐这事还没完呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you could hear a pin drop
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how quiet a place is
Sense.TRAN: 〔安静得〕听得见针落地的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could have heard a pin drop in there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里安静得连针落地的声音都可以听见。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you refuse to agree with a suggestion or proposal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said we should go back, but Dennis wouldn’t hear of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说我们应该回去了﹐但丹尼斯不听。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I/he etc will never hear the end of it
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will continue to talk about something for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 我/他等将听到没完没了的唠叨
Sense.EXAMPLE: If my Mum finds out, I’ll never hear the end of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果妈妈知道了﹐她会唠叨个没完。

Sense.DEF: to imagine you can hear a sound when really there is no sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no one there. I must be hearing things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里什么人也没有﹐我一定是产生幻听了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are giving someone an order and they must obey you
Sense.TRAN: 听见了吗？明白了吗？〔强调别人必须遵守你的命令〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want you to leave right now. Do you hear?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你现在就离开﹐明白了吗？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how noisy a place is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just shut up, Tom. I can’t hear myself think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我闭嘴﹐汤姆﹐太吵了。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce an important official announcement
Sense.TRAN: 请大家注意听！〔用于发表重要的正式通告时〕

Sense.DEF: used in a discussion or meeting to say that you agree with what the speaker is saying
Sense.TRAN: 好哇！好哇！〔在讨论会或会议上对某人所说的话表示赞同的呼喊声〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: have you heard the one about…
Sense.DEF: used when asking someone if they know a joke
used when you do not believe someone’s excuse or explanation
Sense.TRAN: 这借口[解释]我以前已听过了〔表示不相信〕﹐别跟我来这一套

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone deserves praise, or to ask people to show their approval of someone by clapping
Sense.TRAN: 让我们为某人鼓掌喝彩

Exponent.DEF: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to shout – I can hear you!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不着大声喊——我听得见！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Voices could be heard in the distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 能听见远处的说话声。

Exponent.DEF: to pay attention to something, using your ears
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was listening to the news on the car radio.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在听车载广播播放的新闻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He never listens to anything I say.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管我说什么他从来都不听。

Exponent.DEF: to hear something with difficulty
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I got closer, I could make out a human voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走近一些,听出是人的声音。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I could just make out what he was saying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能勉强听出他在说些什么。

Exponent.DEF: to accidentally hear another person’s conversation
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I overheard her say to her friend that she had lost something.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无意中听到她对朋友说她丢了东西。

Exponent.DEF: to hear something that someone says
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t catch your name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉,我没听清你的名字。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I caught the last few minutes of the programme.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到了最后几分钟的节目内容。

Exponent.DEF: to listen to a programme – often used in announcements on the radio
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tune in for all the latest news and views from around the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 敬请收听世界各地的最新新闻与观点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people tune in to the show every week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周都有数以千计的人收听该节目。

Sense.DEF: to receive news or information from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you ever hear from Jack?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有收到过杰克的来信？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police want to hear from anyone who has any information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方希望向知情者了解情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I look forward to hearing from you hope to receive news from you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我盼望着你的来信。

Sense.DEF: to listen to someone giving their opinion in a radio or television discussion programme
Sense.TRAN: 听﹐收听〔电台或电视的讨论节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to hear from some of the victims of violent crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听几位暴力犯罪受害者讲述其经历的机会

Sense.DEF: to listen to all of what someone wants to tell you without interrupting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just hear me out, will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就听我说完﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who hears something
the sense which you use to hear sounds

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has remarkable hearing for a lady of her age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对于她这样年纪的女性来说﹐她的听力很不一般。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a child with a hearing disability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有听力障碍的儿童

Sense.DEF: a meeting of a court or special committee to find out the facts about a case
Sense.EXAMPLE: a court hearing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庭审
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disciplinary hearing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪律聆讯

Sense.DEF: an opportunity for someone to explain their actions, ideas, or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s give both sides a fair hearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们给双方公平的解释机会。

Sense.DEF: if you say something in someone’s hearing, you say it where they can hear you
Sense.TRAN: 在某人听力所及的范围内
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some words we don’t use in the children’s hearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些词语我们当着孩子的面是不说的。

Sense.DEF: a small object which fits into or behind your ear to make sounds louder, worn by people who cannot hear well

Subsense.DEF: not able to hear well
people who are not able to hear well

Sense.DEF: to listen
something that you have heard about from other people but do not know to be definitely true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t take any notice of it – it’s just hearsay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会在意﹐这只不过是传闻而已。

Sense.DEF: a large car used to carry a dead body in a coffin at a funeral
the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise is good for the heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼对心脏有好处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you hear my heart beating?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能听见我的心跳吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her cheeks were hot and her heart was pounding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸颊发烫﹐心怦怦直跳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart raced. Were we going to land safely?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心跳得厉害。我们能安全着陆吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel had no history of heart problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔没有心脏病史。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffers from a rare heart condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患有罕见的心脏病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing and heart rate were now normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的呼吸和心率现在都正常了。

Sense.DEF: the part of you that feels strong emotions and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart was full of anger and grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的内心充满愤怒和悲伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plight of the refugees had tugged at the nation’s heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民们的困境牵动了全国民众的心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor had an extremely kind heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位医生有一颗特别善良的心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could hardly speak for the ache in her heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她难以表达心中的痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would break Kate’s heart make her extremely sad to leave the lovely old house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开那美丽的老房子会让凯特心碎的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left the country with a heavy heart great sadness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心情沉重地离开了那个国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edith loved her boy with all her heart and soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊迪丝全心全意地爱她的儿子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still pretty innocent then when it came to affairs of the heart matters relating to love and sex.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到爱情﹐我当时还是那么单纯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman with a heart of gold very kind character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有着一颗金子般的心的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I think he’s got a heart of stone very cruel character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我觉得他铁石心肠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m glad I followed my heart rather than my head for once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴这一回我顺从了感情而不是理智。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father told me never to let my heart rule my head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲告诫我永远不要让感情左右理智。

GramExa.GLOSS: having a kind, unkind, cruel etc character
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 好心肠的/冷酷无情的/硬心肠的等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He thinks of himself as a warm-hearted and caring human being.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为自己是个热心肠﹑有爱心的人。

Sense.DEF: the part of your chest near your heart
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his hand on his heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用手按着心口。

Sense.DEF: a shape used to represent a heart
with great sincerity and strength of feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leonard spoke from the heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦纳德说的是真心话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要衷心地感谢你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sang the songs straight from the heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深情演唱了那些歌曲。

Sense.DEF: if you know, feel, or believe something in your heart, you are secretly sure about it although you may not admit it
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her heart she knew she would never go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心底里明白自己决不会走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deep in his heart, he wanted Laura back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在内心深处﹐他希望劳拉回来。

Sense.DEF: the most important or central part of a problem, question etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: difficult issues at the heart of science policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学政策的核心难题
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must get to the heart of the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须抓住问题的核心。

Sense.DEF: confidence and courage
Sense.EXAMPLE: This inspiring service gave us new heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项激励人心的工作给了我们新的勇气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We mustn’t lose heart when people complain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们抱怨的时候我们千万不要失去信心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to take a bit of heart from the fact that we won.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须从取胜这一事实中获得一些信心。

Sense.DEF: if you are a particular kind of person at heart, that is the kind of person that you really are even though you may appear or behave differently
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may be a working class boy at heart, but his lifestyle has been transformed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本质上可能是工人阶级的孩子﹐但生活方式已经转变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s face it, we’re all romantics at heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对事实吧﹐我们本质上都是浪漫的人。

Sense.DEF: the middle part of an area furthest from the edge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a house in the heart of London
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦市中心的一幢房子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old house at the heart of an ancient forest
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地处古老森林中心的一幢老房子

Sense.DEF: very important to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President liked to go to Williamsburg, a place close to his heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统喜欢去威廉斯堡﹐那是他非常喜爱的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money is dear to Kathleen’s heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳打心眼里喜欢钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the hearts and minds of sb
Sense.DEF: the thoughts, emotions, and attitudes a group of people have about a particular subject, which is a combination of their strong emotional feelings and their calm and sensible thoughts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president must try to win the hearts and minds of the voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统必须设法赢得选民在思想与感情上的支持。

Sense.DEF: when you know something by heart, you remember all of it exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few days of phoning Stephanie, he knew her number by heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给斯蒂芬妮打了几天电话后﹐他记住她的电话号码了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Actors have to learn their lines by heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员必须记住台词。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone suddenly lost hope and began to feel unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her heart sank when she saw the number of books she had to read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到有那么多书要读﹐她的心直往下沉。

Sense.DEF: with all your strength, energy, or emotion
Sense.TRAN: 全心全意地﹐真心实意地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hates Los Angeles with all his heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他实在是讨厌洛杉矶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sang the hymn with all our hearts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们虔诚地唱了赞美诗。

Sense.DEF: to consider what someone says to you very seriously, often because it upsets you
Sense.TRAN: 把某事放在心上﹔为某事耿耿于怀
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne took his criticisms very much to heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮非常在意他的批评。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took Stephen’s warnings to heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们牢记着斯蒂芬的警告。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s heart goes out to sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone feels a lot of sympathy towards another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart goes out to the families of the victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常同情受害者的家人。

Subsense.DEF: a heart shape printed in red on a playing card
the suitset of playing cards that have these shapes on them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the ace of hearts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红桃A

Subsense.DEF: one of the cards in this set
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Have you got any hearts?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有红桃吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth to your heart’s content
Sense.DEF: to do something as much as you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had lazed around the pool to her heart’s content.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽情地在池塘边消磨时光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog can run to its heart’s content out there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗可以在外面跑个痛快。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone suddenly feels a moment of fear or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 某人心跳停顿了一下〔表示突然感到惊恐或兴奋〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart missed a beat as he saw the body of a small child at the water’s edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到水边有一具幼儿的尸体﹐他心跳都停顿了一下。

Sense.DEF: to want something very much
Sense.TRAN: 非常想得到某物﹐渴望得到某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father bought him the bike he had set his heart on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲给他买了辆他一心想要的自行车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had set her heart on becoming a hairdresser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一心想成为美发师。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a man/woman etc after my own heart
Sense.DEF: someone who likes the same things or behaves in the same way that you do
Sense.TRAN: 和我趣味相投[情投意合]的男人/女人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff really is a man after my own heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫真是个与我情投意合的男人。

Sense.DEF: if you cry, sing etc your heart out, you do it with all your energy or emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found me crying my heart out and was so kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现我在号啕大哭﹐对我很体贴。

Sense.LEXUNIT: your heart’s desire/everything your heart could desire
Sense.DEF: the one thing you want most, or everything that you could possibly want
Sense.TRAN: 最渴望的事/一切可能的愿望
Sense.EXAMPLE: To have a baby was her heart’s desire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生个孩子是她最大的心愿。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have the heart to do something
Sense.DEF: to be unable to do something because it will make someone unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have the heart to tell her that her beautiful vase was broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不忍心告诉她她那只漂亮的花瓶打碎了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not really want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人的心不在此事上〔指并非真心想做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s getting bored with the job and her heart’s not in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这工作感到厌烦﹐她的心已经不在这上面了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth out of the goodness of your heart
Sense.DEF: to do something out of kindness, not because you have been asked or expect a reward
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these people were helping us out of the goodness of their hearts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些人都是出于好意帮助我们。

Sense.DEF: if people take someone to their hearts, they like them very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fans have taken Hudson to their hearts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影迷非常喜欢赫德森。

Sense.DEF: the firm middle part of some vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLE: artichoke hearts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋蓟心

Sense.DEF: to start to love someone very much

Sense.LEXUNIT: my heart was in my mouth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you suddenly felt very afraid
Sense.TRAN: 我的心都快跳出来了〔指突然感到害怕〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s heart is in the right place
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is really a kind person and has the right feelings about something important
Sense.TRAN: 某人心地是善良的﹐某人的用心是好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think his idea will work, though his heart’s in the right place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的想法行不通﹐虽然他的本意是好的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it does your heart good to see/hear sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something makes you feel happy
Sense.TRAN: 很高兴看到/听到某事物

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone suddenly feels happy and full of hope
Sense.TRAN: 某人的心怦怦乱跳〔指突然感到高兴﹑充满希望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I couldn’t live without you,’ he said and Jane’s heart leapt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “没有你我活不下去。”他说。一听此言﹐简心如鹿撞。

Sense.DEF: to feel happy and confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team are in good heart and ready for the season’s matches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队情绪高昂﹐已准备好迎接本赛季的比赛。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to be too strict or unkind – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 发发善心吧！做做好事吧！〔幽默用法〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: know the way to sb’s heart
Sense.DEF: to know the way to please someone – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 知道如何讨好某人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not really feel any sympathy towards someone
Sense.TRAN: （某人）真可怜 〔反语﹐表示并非真的同情某人〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: strike at the heart of sth
wear your heart on your sleeve

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her heart was beating fast.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的心跳得很快。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it beats very strongly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He reached the top, his heart pounding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到达顶部﹐心怦怦直跳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it beats very fast

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should not take this medication if you have heart problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病患者不能服用这种药。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Smoking increases the risk of heart disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟会增加罹患心脏病的风险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something wrong with your heart
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The baby was born with a heart condition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个婴儿生来就有心脏病。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the number of times someone’s heart beats per minute

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eating oily fish can help maintain a healthy heart.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食用高脂鱼类有利于心脏健康。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an unhealthy heart

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of great sadness and anxiety
a sudden serious medical condition in which someone’s heart stops working normally, causing them great pain
to make someone suddenly feel frightened, surprised, or shocked, or to suddenly feel this way
Sense.TRAN: 把某人吓得要死/吓得要心脏病发作
Sense.EXAMPLE: You almost gave me a heart attack there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你差点吓得我心脏病发作！

Sense.DEF: the action or sound of your heart as it pumps blood through your body

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a heartbeat away from sth
Sense.DEF: to be very close to a situation or position
Sense.TRAN: 〔状态或位置〕非常接近某事物

Sense.DEF: very quickly, without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things can change in a heartbeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况会瞬间发生变化。

Sense.DEF: the main origin of activity or excitement in a place or organization
great sadness or disappointment
making you feel extremely sad or disappointed
Sense.TRAN: 使人心碎[悲伤﹐极度失望]的

Sense.DEF: extremely sad because of something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 极度伤心的﹐心碎的﹐悲伤的

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant burning feeling in your stomach or chest caused by acid from your stomach
an illness which prevents your heart from working normally
to make someone feel happier and more hopeful
a serious medical condition in which someone’s heart stops working properly, often resulting in death
very strongly felt and sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heartfelt apology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真诚的道歉

Sense.DEF: the area of floor around a fireplace in a house
your home and family
with energy and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Great to see you,’ she said heartily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “见到你很高兴。”她热情地说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hugh laughed heartily at the joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休听了那个笑话开怀大笑。

Sense.DEF: completely or very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a book I heartily recommend to all hill walkers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向所有山区健行者大力推荐这本书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Madge had become heartily sick of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛奇已经十分厌倦这个城市了。

Sense.DEF: to eat a large amount
the central part of a country or area of land
the most important part of a country or area for a particular activity, or the part where a political group has most support
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或地区的〕心脏地带﹐最重要地区﹔〔某政党占优势的〕根据地﹐大本营
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Democratic heartlands of the Deep South
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党南部腹地的大本营

Sense.DEF: cruel and not feeling any pity
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you be so heartless?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能如此无情呢？

Sense.DEF: a machine that pumps blood and oxygen around someone’s body during a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔手术时用来维持血液和氧气供应的〕人工心肺机

Sense.DEF: the central area of England, which is very industrial. This expression is used especially to make the area sound more attractive to tourists.
Sense.TRAN: 英格兰之心﹐英格兰的心脏〔指英格兰工业很发达的中心地区〕

Sense.DEF: making you feel great pity
Sense.TRAN: 使人极度伤心的﹐令人悲痛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: heartrending stories of children being taken from their parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于孩子被人从父母身边夺走的悲伤故事

Sense.DEF: the process of examining very carefully your feelings about something or your reasons for doing something
very exciting or frightening
Sense.TRAN: 使人非常兴奋的﹔令人非常害怕的

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong love or sympathy
a famous actor, singer etc who is very attractive to women
a conversation in which two people say honestly and sincerely what they really feel about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you have a heart-to-heart with him and sort out your problems?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不和他坦诚地谈谈﹐把问题解决掉呢？

Sense.DEF: making you feel happy because you see other people being happy or kind to each other
Sense.TRAN: 令人欣喜的﹐暖人心房的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heartwarming sight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖人心房的一幕

Sense.DEF: happy and friendly and usually loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hearty laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开怀大笑

Sense.DEF: strong and healthy
a hearty meal is very large
with a friendly, noisy, and happy manner that is not sincere
warmth or the quality of being hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ice needs heat to melt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰需要热才能融化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Insulating the attic is a good way to reduce heat loss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为阁楼安装隔热层是减少热量流失的好方法。

Sense.DEF: very hot weather or a high temperature
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat was making them tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热的天气令他们疲倦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angela liked to rest during the heat of the day the hottest part of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安杰拉喜欢在一天中最热的时段休息一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters were beaten back by the intense heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员被高温迫得后退。

Sense.DEF: the level of temperature used when cooking or heating something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cook the chicken portions over a high heat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用旺火烹煮鸡肉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When the milk comes to the boil, turn off the heat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶煮沸后把火关掉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Now reduce the heat and cover the pan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在把火关小﹐盖上锅盖。

Sense.DEF: strong feelings, especially anger or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的感情﹔〔尤指〕愤怒﹐激动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reconciliation services can take the heat out of reduce the anger in the dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调解服务可以缓和纠纷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Quick decisions had to be made in the heat of the negotiations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时谈判处于白热阶段﹐必须快速作出决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In the heat of the moment when feelings were very strong Nick threatened to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克一时冲动﹐扬言要辞职。

Sense.DEF: strong pressure on someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat is on there is a lot of pressure as schools struggle to finish their entries by the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各学校要赶在截止日期之前完成参赛作品﹐压力很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team turned up the heat used more effort against their opponents in the last few minutes to score two more goals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在比赛的最后几分钟﹐该队加紧进攻再进两球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of heat, and it affected our relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力很大﹐这影响了我们的关系。

Sense.DEF: the system in a house or other building that keeps it warm in the winter, or the warmth from this system
Sense.TRAN: 供暖系统﹐暖气设备﹔暖气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you turn up the heat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把暖气开大点好吗？

Sense.DEF: a part of a race or competition whose winners then compete against each other in the next part
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill finished second in his heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔在分组赛中名列第二。

Sense.DEF: if a female animal is on heat, her body is ready to have sex with a male

Crossrefto.REFLEX: if you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen

Sense.DEF: to make something become warm or hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heat the milk until it boils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把牛奶煮开。

Sense.DEF: to heat food thoroughly
to become warm or hot, or to make something become warm or hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stove takes a while to heat up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉子要过一会儿才能热起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I heated up the remains of last night’s supper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把昨天晚饭剩下的饭菜热了一下。

Sense.DEF: if a situation heats up, it becomes dangerous or full of problems
a heated swimming pool, room etc is made warm using a heater
an argument etc that is full of angry and excited feelings
Sense.TRAN: 激烈的争论/辩论/讨论等

Sense.DEF: a machine for making air or water hotter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you turn the heater off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你关掉加热器了吗？

Sense.DEF: weakness and sickness caused by doing too much work, exercise etc in hot weather
an area of open land where grass, bushes, and other small plants grow, especially in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指英国杂草和灌木丛生的〕荒野﹐荒地

Sense.DEF: not connected with or belonging to the Christian religion or any of the large established religions
someone who is not connected with the Christian religion or any of the large established religions – used to show disapproval
someone who refuses to believe in something – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 无信仰的人〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a low plant with small purple, pink, or white flowers which grows on hills
a Heath Robinson machine, system etc is very complicated in an amusing way but not at all practical
Sense.TRAN: 〔机械﹑系统等〕设计复杂有趣但不实用的

Sense.DEF: a system for making a room or building warm
heatproof material cannot be damaged by heat
part of a machine that takes heat from one place to another

painful or
itchy
red spots on someone’s skin caused by heat
not easily damaged by heat

a heat-seeking weapon is able to find and move towards the hot gases from an aircraft or
rocket
and destroy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔武器〕热自导引的﹐跟踪热源的

Sense.DEF: fever and weakness caused by being outside in the heat of the sun for too long
a period of unusually hot weather, especially one that continues for a long time
to pull or lift something very heavy with one great effort

GramExa.PROPFORM: heave sb/sth out of/into/onto etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan heaved his suitcase onto his bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦把他的手提箱拖到床上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary heaved herself out of bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽硬撑着起了床。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He heaved on the steering wheel and swung the car into a side street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用力打方向盘﹐把车驶入了一条小路。

Sense.DEF: to throw something heavy using a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: John heaved the metal bar over the fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰把金属棒扔过了篱笆。

Sense.DEF: to breathe in and then breathe out noisily and slowly once
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebecca heaved a sigh of relief .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽贝卡宽慰地舒了一口气。

Sense.DEF: to move up and down with very strong movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael’s shoulders heaved with silent laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔憋着不笑出声来﹐双肩直抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea heaved up and down beneath the boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船的下面大海波涛汹涌。

Sense.DEF:
to
vomit
to appear, especially by getting closer from a distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few moments later a large ship hove into view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿﹐远处出现一艘大船。

Sense.DEF: if a ship heaves to, it stops moving
a strong pulling, pushing, or lifting movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave the door a good heave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用力推了一下门。

Sense.DEF: a strong rising or falling movement
used as an encouragement to a person or group of people who are pulling something, especially on ships
Sense.TRAN: 用力拉呀〔尤在船上使用〕

Sense.DEF: to end a relationship with someone, or to make someone leave their job
Sense.TRAN: 与某人断绝关系﹔解雇某人

Sense.DEF: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

Sense.DEF: an extremely enjoyable situation or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sitting by the pool with a good book is my idea of heaven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐在水池边看一本好书就是我心目中的极乐之事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put a baseball in his hand and he’s in heaven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给他一个棒球他就觉得美极了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Living on the farm for Jim was heaven on earth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对吉姆来说﹐农场生活就是人间天堂。

GramExa.GLOSS: a happy and successful marriage

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed or angry
Subsense.TRAN: 天哪﹐哎呀〔表示厌烦或生气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, for heaven’s sake, Mark, do you have to make everything into a joke?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐天哪！马克﹐你什么事都非得开玩笑吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize a question, request, order, or opinion
Subsense.TRAN: 看在上帝的份上〔用以强调问题﹑要求﹑命令或观点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For heaven’s sake, let’s all get to sleep.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在上帝的份上﹐我们都睡觉吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not know something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He won’t tell me what he thinks. Heaven knows why.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会告诉我他是怎么想的。谁知道是为什么。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Subsense.TRAN: 确实﹐的确﹐无疑〔用以加强语气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sue can’t take a holiday yet, though heaven knows she needs a rest.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管休非常需要休息﹐可她还不能休假。

Subsense.DEF: used to express sympathy for someone who is in a dangerous or difficult situation
Subsense.TRAN: 愿上天保佑某人〔用于对有危险或处于困境的人表示同情〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘The two boys are going to the dentist on Thursday.’ ‘Heaven help the dentist.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这两个男孩星期四要去看牙医。”“愿上天保佑那位牙医。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you will be very angry with someone if they do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Heaven help him if he ever comes back here again!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他再回到这里来﹐我一定饶不了他！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you very much hope something will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 但愿不要这样﹐但愿不会发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you do financially if, heaven forbid, your husband died?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你丈夫去世了——但愿不会这样——你经济上怎么办？

Sense.DEF: used when asking a surprised and angry question
Sense.TRAN: 到底[究竟]什么/怎么/为什么等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where in heaven’s name have you been?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底去哪里了？

Sense.DEF: the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked up towards the heavens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仰望苍穹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just then, the heavens opened it started to rain heavily .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐下起了倾盆大雨。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 竭尽全力﹐用尽各种方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would move heaven and earth to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会竭尽全力帮助她。

Sense.DEF: extremely pleasant, enjoyable, or beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 极好的﹔令人非常愉快的﹔非常美丽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That smells heavenly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那味道真好闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found a tiny hotel in a heavenly spot with a beautiful bay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一个环境宜人的地方发现一家小旅馆﹐旁边还有美丽的海湾。

Sense.DEF: existing in or belonging to heaven
Sense.EXAMPLE: God’s heavenly kingdom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天国

GramExa.GLOSS: God
all the angels

Sense.DEF: existing in or relating to the sky or stars

EXAMPLE.GLOSS:
the Moon,
planet s
, and stars

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天体

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise, especially when you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 天哪！ 我的天！〔尤在气 恼时表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good Heavens, what a mess!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪！多乱呀！

Sense.DEF: happening fortunately at exactly the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heaven-sent opportunity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天赐良机

Sense.DEF: towards the sky
in large amounts, to a high degree, or with great severity
Sense.TRAN: 很多地﹐大量地﹔非常﹔严重地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I became heavily involved in politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我深陷政治之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report was heavily criticized in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报道遭到了新闻界的严厉批评。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavily populated area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口密集地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: thousands of heavily armed troops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全副武装的数千人的部队
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife was heavily pregnant at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时他妻子已经待产。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s been raining heavily all day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨已经下了整整一天了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul was drinking heavily by then.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时保罗喝酒喝得很厉害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain is heavily dependent on imports for its raw materials.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的原材料严重依赖进口。

Sense.DEF: if you sleep heavily, you cannot be woken easily
to breathe slowly and loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Breathing heavily, I stopped and sat down to rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喘着粗气﹐停住坐下来休息。

Sense.DEF: having a large broad body that looks strong
if you do or say something heavily, you do it slowly and with a lot of effort, especially because you are sad or bored
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因伤心或无聊而〕行动[言语]缓慢地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was walking heavily, his head down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他低着头走﹐步履沉重而缓慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emily sighed heavily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉重重地叹了口气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I suppose so,’ she said heavily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想是这样的。”她沉重地说。

Sense.DEF: to do something a lot or be very interested in it
Sense.TRAN: 沉湎于某事物﹔对某事物非常着迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sid was heavily into drugs by the time he left school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德毕业时已经沉迷于毒品。

Sense.DEF: very busy or full of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city was heaving with shoppers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市挤满了购物者。

Sense.DEF: weighing a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wardrobe was too heavy for me to move on my own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣橱太重﹐我一个人移不动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavy suitcase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉重的手提箱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The males are seven times heavier than the females.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄性的重量是雌性的七倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How heavy is the parcel how much does it weigh? ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个包裹有多重？

Sense.DEF: great in amount, degree, or severity
Sense.TRAN: 很多的﹐大量的﹔程度大的﹔严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic going into London was very heavy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往伦敦的交通非常繁忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy rain has caused flooding in many areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨在很多地区造成水灾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy fighting was reported near the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报道边境附近发生了激烈的战斗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy drinking during pregnancy can damage your baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀孕期间大量喝酒会伤害到胎儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to be a heavy smoker .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾经烟瘾很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the heavy burden of taxation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉重的税务负担
Sense.EXAMPLE: If found guilty, they face heavy fines or even prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如被裁定有罪﹐他们将面临巨额罚款﹐甚至可能入狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were heavy casualties on both sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都伤亡惨重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: England’s heavy defeat in yesterday’s match
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队在昨天比赛中的惨败
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s in bed with a heavy cold .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因重感冒而卧床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the film’s heavy use of special effects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中特技效果的大量运用

Sense.DEF: needing a lot of physical strength and effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: My son does most of the heavy outdoor work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分户外粗活是我儿子干的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a bad back and can’t do any heavy lifting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的背不好﹐不能提重物。

Sense.DEF: not easy or entertaining and needing a lot of mental effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want something to read on holiday - nothing too heavy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想找点东西假期里看﹐要不太费脑子的。

Sense.DEF: difficult to understand or deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found his latest novel a bit heavy going .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他最新的小说有点难懂。

Sense.DEF: to use a lot or too much of something
Sense.TRAN: 大量[过度]消耗[使用]某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s rather heavy on oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车油耗很大。

Sense.DEF: full of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apple trees were heavy with fruit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果树上果实累累。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden was heavy with the scent of summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里满是夏日的芳香。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Of course,’ she said, her voice heavy with sarcasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “当然。”她说道﹐语气中充满了挖苦的意味。

Sense.DEF: a time in which you have a lot to do
Sense.TRAN: 紧张[工作繁重]的日程/时间表/一天等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go to bed. We’ve got a heavy day tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们睡觉吧﹐明天还有很多事要做呢。

Sense.DEF: breathing that is slow and loud
to make something that you are doing seem more difficult or complicated than it really is – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 将某事复杂化 对某事小题大做〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does he need to make such heavy weather of a simple task?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么简单的工作他为什么要弄得那么复杂？

Sense.DEF: large and powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: tanks and other heavy weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦克及其他重型武器
重炮
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company which manufactures heavy machinery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产重型机械的一家公司

Sense.DEF: heavy materials, clothes, shoes, or objects are thick or solidly made
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavy winter coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件厚重的冬衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sound of heavy boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿沉重靴子走路时的脚步声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melt the butter in a heavy pan over a medium heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油放在厚锅里用中火熔化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy velvet curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚实的天鹅绒窗帘

Sense.DEF: solid and making your stomach feel full and uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavy meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顿油腻的饭菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy fruitcake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不易消化的水果蛋糕

Sense.DEF: if your eyes are heavy, it is difficult to keep them open, usually because you are tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes felt heavy with fatigue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他疲惫不堪 眼皮都抬不起来了。

Subsense.DEF: large, broad, and solid
Subsense.EXAMPLE: his heavy features
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他粗线条的五官
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kyle is a tall man with a heavy build a large broad body .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔高大健壮。

Subsense.DEF: used to politely describe someone who is fat

Sense.DEF: hitting something or falling with a lot of force or weight
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sound of heavy footsteps in the hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门厅里沉重的脚步声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali caught him with a heavy blow to the jaw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里一记重拳打在他的下巴上。

Subsense.DEF: soil that is heavy is thick and solid
a sports ground or race track that is heavy is muddy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a very heavy pitch
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常泥泞的球场
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The going was heavy it was muddy for the horse races at Cheltenham yesterday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天切尔滕纳姆的赛马场地很泥泞。

Sense.DEF: strong and usually sweet

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the heavy scent of the lilies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 百合花的浓郁芳香

Sense.DEF: too warm and not at all fresh because there is no wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even at dusk the air was still heavy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至在黄昏时空气仍然闷热。

Sense.DEF: a relationship or situation that is heavy involves serious or strong feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want things to get too heavy at such an early stage in their relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不希望刚开始和他交往就投入太多感情。

Sense.DEF: to start behaving in a threatening or strict way
Sense.TRAN: （对某人）露出凶恶的态度﹐严厉起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came round and started getting heavy about the money I owed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来到我的住处﹐开始恶狠狠地向我讨债。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people do not speak and feel sad, anxious, or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 令人心情沉重[难堪]的静默/气氛
Sense.EXAMPLE: A heavy silence fell upon the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里顿时静下来﹐气氛沉重。

Sense.DEF: clouds that look dark and grey as though it will soon rain
Sense.TRAN: 阴沉的天空/密布的乌云

Sense.DEF: someone who does not wake easily
Sense.TRAN: 睡觉时不易醒的人﹐睡得很沉的人

Sense.DEF: remarks that very clearly say the opposite of what you really feel
sea with big waves
feeling very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was with a heavy heart that Kate said goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特怀着沉重的心情告别。

Sense.DEF:
a very important
date an occasion when you meet someone you like in a romantic way
with a
boyfriend
or
girlfriend
– usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔男女间的〕重要约会〔一般为幽默用法〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: time hangs/lies heavy on your hands
Sense.DEF: if time hangs or lies heavy on your hands, it seems to pass slowly because you are bored or have nothing to do
Sense.TRAN: 时间过得很慢/度日如年

Sense.DEF: to be very involved in an activity, especially one that is not good for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric was real heavy into drugs for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克曾一度沉溺于毒品。

Sense.DEF: a large strong man who is paid to protect someone or to threaten other people
a man who telephones a woman and does not speak, but breathes loudly, in order to get sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔电话中〕对女子发出粗重喘息声进行性骚扰的男子

Sense.DEF: thick cream
heavy-duty materials are strong and thick and not easily damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy-duty canvas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结实的帆布

Sense.DEF: heavy-duty machines or equipment are designed to be used for very hard work
very complicated, serious, or extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today, she was going to do some heavy-duty cleaning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天﹐她准备进行一次彻底的打扫。

Sense.DEF:
an
hgv
Sense.TRAN: 大型货运卡车﹐载重货车

Sense.DEF: taking too much action or extreme action, especially without thinking about other people’s feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heavy-handed style of management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高压管理方式

Sense.DEF: very sad
a person or company that has a lot of power, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商界或政界中〕举足轻重的人物[公司]﹐巨头﹐大亨

Sense.DEF:
a
baseball
player who hits the ball very hard
industry that produces large goods such as cars and machines, or materials such as coal, steel, or chemicals

a type of
rock
music with a strong beat, played very loudly on electric
guitars

a metal that has a high
density
, such as gold,
mercury
, or
lead
. Many heavy metals are poisonous.
sexual activities that do not involve actually having sex
someone who is heavy-set is large and looks strong or fat
someone or something that is very important or has a lot of influence
Sense.TRAN: 重量级人物﹐有影响力的人物[事物]﹐要人
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the heavyweights of the movie industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影业巨子之一

Sense.DEF:
a
boxer
who weighs more than 86.18 kilograms, and who belongs to the heaviest weight class of boxers
Sense.TRAN: 重量级拳击手〔体重在86.18公斤以下﹐属于最重的级别〕

Sense.DEF: connected with the Hebrew language or people
Sense.TRAN: 希伯来语的﹔希伯来人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hebraic literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希伯来文学

Sense.DEF: the language traditionally used by the Jewish people
a member of the Jewish people in ancient times
used to show that you are annoyed or to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 唉﹐见鬼〔用以表示烦恼或加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh heck! I’ve lost my keys!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真见鬼！我的钥匙丢了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you believe him?’ ‘Heck, no.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你相信他吗？”“鬼才信他呢。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: did he heck/will it heck etc
Sense.DEF: used to say in a strong way that someone did not do something, something will not happen etc
Sense.TRAN: …才怪呢〔强调某人不会做某事﹐某事不会发生等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did he offer to pay for it?’ ‘Did he heck.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他有没有提出要付钱？”“有才怪呢。”

Sense.DEF: used like ‘hell’ to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: It cost a heck of a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这花了一大笔钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where the heck are we?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到底在哪里？

Sense.EXAMPLE: He sure as heck didn’t tell me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当然没告诉过我。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will do something even though you really should not do it
Sense.TRAN: 管它呢﹐不管它〔用以表示将会做不应做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s rather expensive, but what the heck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个相当贵﹐不过管它呢。

Sense.DEF: for fun, or for no particular reason
to interrupt and try to embarrass someone who is speaking or performing in public
Sense.TRAN: 打断〔公开演讲或表演的人〕﹐（对…）起哄

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring area, equal to 10,000 square metres
very busy or full of activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忙乱了一整天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hectic social life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁忙的社交生活

Sense.DEF: if your face is a hectic colour, it is very pink
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hectic flush on her cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双颊的潮红

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone in an angry threatening way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hectoring tone of voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威吓的口气

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘he had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time I got there he’d gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去到那里时﹐他已经走了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘he would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’d help if he could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信如果他能帮忙的话一定会帮的。

Sense.DEF: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another
Sense.TRAN: 〔用低矮的灌木或树筑起的〕树篱

Sense.DEF: something that protects you against possible problems, especially financial loss
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为避免金钱损失的〕防范措施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buying a house will be a hedge against inflation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买房子是应对通货膨胀的一种防范手段。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: look as if you’ve been dragged through a hedge backwards

Sense.DEF: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又在闪烁其词了﹐你究竟有没有钱？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

Sense.DEF: to reduce your chances of failure or loss by trying several different possibilities instead of one
Sense.TRAN: 多处下注以减少风险﹐对冲风险
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good idea to hedge your bets by applying to more than one college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同时向几所大学提出申请是个保险的好主意。

Sense.DEF: to try to protect yourself against possible problems, especially financial loss
Sense.TRAN: 采取措施避免〔尤指经济损失〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smart managers will hedge against price increases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精明的经营者会采取措施防范价格上涨带来的损失。

Subsense.DEF: to be surrounded or enclosed by something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The building was hedged in by trees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑四周林木围绕。

Subsense.DEF: if you feel hedged in by something, you feel that your freedom is restricted by it

Sense.DEF:
an organization that makes
investments
for people and organizations with large amounts of money, not the general public, in ways that often involve big risks
Sense.TRAN: 对冲基金〔为有大额资金的个人及组织进行投资的机构〕

Sense.DEF:
a small brown European animal whose body is round and covered with sharp needle-like
spines
a line of bushes growing along the edge of a field or road
someone who believes that pleasure is the most important thing in life
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning
Sense.TRAN: 注意〔别人的建议或警告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she had only heeded my warnings , none of this would have happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是她当初听从我的警告﹐这一切都不会发生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pay heed to sth/take heed of sth
Sense.DEF: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
Sense.TRAN: 注意某事﹔慎重考虑某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

Sense.DEF: not paying attention to something
Sense.TRAN: 不注意某事物﹐不理会某事物﹐对某事物掉以轻心
Sense.EXAMPLE: O’Hara rode on, heedless of danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥哈拉不理会危险﹐继续骑马前行。

Sense.DEF: the curved back part of your foot
the raised part on the bottom of a shoe that makes the shoe higher at the back
Sense.EXAMPLE: black boots with high heels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有高跟的黑靴子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her low-heeled blue shoes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的蓝色低跟鞋

Sense.DEF: the part of a sock that covers your heel
the part of your hand between the bottom of your thumb and your wrist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Using the heel of your hand, press the dough firmly into shape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用手掌根使劲把面团压成形。

Sense.DEF: a pair of women’s shoes with high heels
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whenever she wore heels she was taller than the men she worked with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿上高跟鞋就会比男同事都高。

Sense.DEF: if a person or animal is at your heels, they are following closely behind you
Sense.TRAN: 紧跟着某人﹐紧随某人之后
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could hear the dog trotting at his heels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能听见那条狗小跑着紧紧跟在他身后。

Subsense.DEF: very soon after something
Subsense.TRAN: 紧接着某事﹐在某事后不久
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The decision to buy Peters came hard on the heels of the club’s promotion to Division One.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部队刚升至甲级就作出了购买彼得斯的决定。

Subsense.DEF: following closely behind someone, especially in order to catch or attack them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指为捉拿或袭击而〕紧跟某人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: With the enemy army hard on his heels, he crossed the Somme at Blanche-Taque.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌军穷追不舍﹐他在布朗什－塔克渡过了索姆河。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to behave in the way that you want them to
Sense.TRAN: 使某人就范﹐使某人顺从

Subsense.DEF: if a dog comes to heel, it comes back to its owner when the owner calls it
if someone comes to heel, they start to behave in the way that you want them to

Sense.DEF: to start running away
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as he saw me he took to his heels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看到我﹐他拔腿就逃。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly turn away from someone, especially in an angry or rude way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指生气地﹑无礼地〕突然转身
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before anyone could say a word, he turned on his heel and walked out of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还没等人说出一句话﹐他转身就走出了房间。

Sense.DEF: completely controlled by a government or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: a people under the heel of an increasingly dictatorial regime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日益专制的政府统治下的一个民族

Sense.DEF: a man who behaves badly towards other people

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be/fall head over heels in love

Sense.DEF: used to tell your dog to walk next to you
to put a heel on a shoe
if something heels over, it leans to one side as if it is going to fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship was heeling over in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在风中向一侧倾斜。

Sense.DEF:
a movement in
skateboarding
in which you push your heel down hard on the
skateboard
as you jump upwards off the board. The board turns around sideways in a complete circle and you land on it again when it has finished turning.
Sense.TRAN: 脚跟翻〔滑板运动的一种技巧〕

Sense.DEF: shoes with one or more wheels in the heel, so that you can roll along when you want to
Sense.TRAN: 暴走鞋〔鞋跟底下有至少一个滑轮﹐需要时可滑行〕

Sense.DEF: to lift something heavy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hefted his bag into the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自己的包扛到车里。

Sense.DEF: to lift or hold something in order to judge how heavy it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quinn hefted the package in his hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奎因提起包裹掂了掂分量。

Sense.DEF: big and heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall hefty man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个高大健壮的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hefty tome large thick book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大开本厚书
Sense.EXAMPLE: hefty camera equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笨重的照相器材

Sense.DEF: a hefty amount of something, especially money, is very large
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hefty fine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额罚款

Sense.DEF: a hefty blow, kick etc is done using a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: He aimed a hefty kick at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对着门猛踢了一脚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hefty shove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一记猛推

Sense.DEF: a situation in which one state or country controls others

a young cow that has not yet given birth to a
calf
how tall someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s about the same height as his sister now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆现在身高和他姐姐差不多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: State your age, height, and weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说出你的年龄﹑身高和体重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: buildings of different heights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高矮不一的建筑

GramExa.PROPFORM: six feet/ten metres etc in height
GramExa.EXAMPLE: None of these sculptures was less than three metres in height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些雕塑的高度无一低于3米。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a height of six feet/ten metres etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sunflowers can grow to a height of 15 feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向日葵可以长到15英尺。

Sense.DEF: the distance something is above the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a miracle she didn’t break her neck falling from that height.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从那么高的地方掉下来居然没有摔断脖子﹐真是个奇迹。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a height of 2,500 feet/10,000 metres etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aircraft was flying at a height of 10,000 metres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在一万米高空飞行。

GramExa.GLOSS: move higher or lower in the sky
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane was rapidly losing height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在急速下降。

Subsense.DEF: a place or position that is a long way above the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bird that opens shellfish by dropping them from a height onto rocks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把贝类从高处抛向岩石来把壳打开的一只鸟

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rachel had always been scared of heights .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔过去一直恐高。

GramExa.GLOSS: not be afraid of heights

Subsense.DEF: a particular high place – used especially in place names
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Golan Heights
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈兰高地

Subsense.DEF: a very high level of achievement or success
Subsense.TRAN: 新的/巨大的/令人目眩的等高度[成就]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He reached the dizzy heights of the national finals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成绩斐然﹐进入了全国总决赛。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: They took ice dancing to new heights .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将冰上舞蹈提升到一个新的层次。

Subsense.DEF: a very great level or degree
Subsense.EXAMPLE: War fever had reached new heights.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好战情绪达到了新的高点。

Sense.DEF: the busiest or most extreme part of a period or activity
Sense.TRAN: 某事物最繁忙的时候[季节]﹔某事物的高潮[顶点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the height of the tourist season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游旺季的高峰期

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at the height of your success/fame/powers etc
Sense.DEF: to be more successful, famous etc than at any other time
Sense.TRAN: 处于成功/名声/权力等的巅峰
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Beatles were at the height of their fame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时正是披头士乐队最出名的时候。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the height of fashion/stupidity/luxury etc
Sense.DEF: to be extremely fashionable, stupid etc
Sense.TRAN: 是最时髦的/愚蠢的/奢侈的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flared trousers were considered to be the height of fashion in those days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喇叭裤那时被认为是最时髦的服装。

Sense.DEF: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

GramExa.GLOSS: make people realize something more clearly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 提高（某人对某物的）意识
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The case has heightened public awareness of the problem of sexual harassment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这宗案件提高了公众对性骚扰问题的认识。

Sense.DEF: very shocking and immoral
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heinous crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滔天罪行

Sense.DEF: extremely bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food in the cafeteria is pretty heinous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家食堂的食物很糟糕。

Sense.DEF: the person who has the legal right to receive the property or title of another person when they die

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John was the sole heir to a vast estate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰是一大笔遗产的唯一继承人。

GramExa.GLOSS: the person who will become king or queen

Sense.DEF: the person who will take over a position or job after you, or who does things or thinks in a similar way to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jonson was his political heir as leader of the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼森是他的政治接班人﹐他将担任该党派的领袖。

Sense.DEF: an heir whose right to receive the family property, money, or title cannot be taken away
someone who seems very likely to take over a person’s job, position etc when that person leaves
Sense.TRAN: 〔职位等的〕热门接班人﹐预计接班人

Sense.DEF: a woman who will receive or has received a lot of money or property after the death of an older member of her family
a valuable object that has been owned by a family for many years and that is passed from the older members to the younger members
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family heirloom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件传家宝

Sense.DEF: an heirloom vegetable or plant is one of a kind that was first grown many years ago, and has now become rare or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔蔬菜或植物〕珍稀的﹐老品种的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sell many kinds of heirloom seeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售各种稀有老品种的种子。

Sense.DEF: a prize given each year to the best college football player in the US
Sense.TRAN: 海斯曼奖[杯]〔每年颁发给美国最优秀的大学美式足球运动员〕

Sense.DEF: an act of stealing something very valuable from a shop, bank etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jewelry heist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珠宝盗窃

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
hold
a type of aircraft with large metal blades on top which turn around very quickly to make it fly
an area where helicopters can land
parents who try too hard to protect their children and organize their lives, even when their children have left school
a garden plant with nice-smelling pale purple flowers

a small airport for
helicopters

the sport of flying a
helicopter
to a place in the mountains where you can
ski
on deep snow that no one else has skied on
Sense.TRAN: 直升机滑雪〔乘直升机到高山上滑雪〕

Sense.DEF:
a gas that is lighter than air and is used to make
balloons
float. It is a chemical
element
：symbol He
Sense.TRAN: 氦〔一种化学元素﹐符号为He〕

Sense.DEF: a line that curves and rises around a central line

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘he will’ or 或 ‘he shall’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, he’ll be there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐他会去那里的。

Sense.DEF: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为基督教和伊斯兰教中所指的〕地狱

Sense.DEF: a place or situation in which people suffer very much, either physically or emotionally
Sense.EXAMPLE: War is hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争是人间地狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother made my life hell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲让我生活得很痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These past few days have been a living hell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去的几天简直是活受罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She must have gone through hell every day, the way we teased her about her weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天的日子一定不好过﹐我们总是拿她的体重开玩笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They described the war zone as sheer hell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把交战区描述成十足的地狱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He says his time in jail was hell on earth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他在牢里是置身人间地狱。

Sense.DEF: a situation, experience, or place that is very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic was hell this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今早的交通状况很糟糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘How was your exam?’ ‘Sheer hell!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你考得怎样？”“糟透了！”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very surprised or angry
Sense.TRAN: 到底什么/怎么/为什么/哪里等？〔表示惊讶或愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How the hell are we going to do that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到底怎么办？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the idea that something is very big, very good, very bad etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve come one hell of a long way to get here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走了老远的路才到这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Envy like yours is a hell of a good motive for murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那种嫉妒心构成了谋杀的充分理由。

Sense.DEF: used when you are very angry with someone
Sense.TRAN: 见鬼去吧！〔表示对某人很生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If John doesn’t like it, he can go to hell!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果约翰不喜欢这样﹐让他见鬼去吧！

Sense.DEF: to feel or look very ill or tired
Sense.TRAN: 感觉/看起来不舒服[疲惫]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been feeling like hell all week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整整一星期都感到很不舒服。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat/surprise/scare the hell out of sb
Sense.DEF: to beat, surprise etc someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 把某人打得/惊得/吓得半死
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have only one aim: to beat the hell out of the opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只有一个目标: 把对手打得屁滚尿流。

Sense.DEF: for no serious reason, or only for fun
Sense.TRAN: 只是为了好玩﹐玩玩而已
Sense.EXAMPLE: They shot people just for the hell of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们朝人射击只是为了好玩。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will do something and not worry about any problems it causes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine poured herself a large glass of whisky – what the hell, it was Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩给自己倒了一大杯威士忌﹐管它呢﹐今天是圣诞节。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not care about someone or something any more
Sense.TRAN: 让某人/某事物见鬼去吧〔表示不在乎某人或某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to live for the present, and to hell with the consequences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想为现在而活﹐管它以后怎样。

Sense.DEF: to run, fight etc very quickly or very much
Sense.TRAN: 拼命地跑/痛得要命/拼命地打等
Sense.EXAMPLE: My new shoes hurt like hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新鞋夹脚﹐痛得要命。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not agree with what someone has said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You keep out of this, Ma.’ ‘Like hell I will.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈﹐这件事你就别管了。”“我决不会不管的。”

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is the worst you can imagine
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the flatmate from hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是最差劲的室友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the holiday from hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是最糟的一次度假。

Sense.DEF: very guilty, shy etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常内疚的/腼腆的/生气的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I had your problems, I’d be mad as hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如我遇到你那样的问题﹐非气炸不可。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 的确﹐确实〔强调某事物的真实性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t scare easily, but I was sure as hell scared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会轻易感到害怕﹐不过我刚才确实很怕。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone in an unpleasant or angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t like him, and gave him hell at the slightest opportunity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢他﹐一有机会就要他不好过。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get the hell out of here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们赶紧离开这里吧！

Sense.DEF: used to say that people will be very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they find us there’ll be hell to pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们发现我们﹐那可就麻烦了。

Sense.DEF: to go through a very difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d go to hell and back for that boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了那个男孩﹐我赴汤蹈火也愿意。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people suddenly become very noisy or angry
Sense.TRAN: 突然喧闹起来﹐一片混乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists woke him with the news and all hell broke loose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们叫醒他﹐把消息告诉了他﹐顿时就炸开了锅。

Sense.DEF: in spite of any problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided I would get the job done by Friday, come hell or high water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定无论如何都要在星期五之前完成这项工作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go to hell in a handbasket
Sense.DEF: if a system or organization has gone to hell in a handbasket, it has stopped working well and is now working very badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统或机构〕陷入绝境﹐败落不堪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The education system in this country has gone to hell in a handbasket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的教育体系已经山穷水尽。

Sense.DEF: used to express great annoyance or surprise
Sense.TRAN: 见鬼了〔表示极度厌烦或惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: to make something stop working or happening as it should
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cold weather played hell with the weekend sports schedule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷的天气打乱了周末的体育活动安排。

Sense.DEF: not polite to protest strongly and angrily about a situation
to run as fast as possible
someone who does exactly what they want and does not care what happens as a result
Sense.TRAN: 我行我素的人﹔做事不顾后果的人

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will never happen
to be blamed or punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll catch hell when your Mom comes home!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你母亲回家后有你受的！

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not a hope in hell (of doing sth)

Sense.DEF: used to express anger or annoyance
Sense.TRAN: 见鬼﹐该死〔表示愤怒或气恼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh hell! I’ve left my purse at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真该死！我把钱包落在家里了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Sense.TRAN: 见鬼﹐该死〔用来加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, hell, I don’t know!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见鬼﹐我不知道！

Sense.DEF: very determined to do something, especially something that other people do not approve of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: young people who are hell-bent on having a good time
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不顾一切要好好享受一番的青年人

Sense.DEF: a Greek, especially an ancient Greek
connected with the history, society, or art of the ancient Greeks
a very dirty, ugly, and unpleasant place
Sense.TRAN: 地狱般的地方﹐环境极其恶劣的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school was a hell-hole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那学校就像地狱一样。

Sense.DEF: extremely bad or difficult
Sense.TRAN: 糟透的﹐极坏的﹔非常困难的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a hellish day at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天上班糟透了。

Sense.DEF: used as a greeting when you see or meet someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, John! How are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐约翰！你好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stanley, come and say hello to your nephew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦利﹐过来和你的侄子打声招呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, hello there ! I haven’t seen you for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐你好！好久不见了。

Sense.DEF: used when answering the telephone or starting a telephone conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello - may I speak to Anne?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐请问安妮在吗？

Sense.DEF: used when calling to get someone’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 喂〔用以引起别人的注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello! Is there anybody home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂！屋里有人吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you think someone is not acting sensibly or has said something stupid
Sense.TRAN: 喔唷〔表示认为别人行为不明智或说话愚蠢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You didn’t remember her birthday? Hello!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不记得她的生日啦？喔唷！

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised or confused by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello! What’s happened here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿！出什么事了？

Sense.DEF: to have a quick conversation with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Promise you’ll look in and say hello when you have time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 答应我﹐有时间的话你来看看我﹐打个招呼。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something is very good, bad, big etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常﹐极其〔用于加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got a helluva temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脾气大得很。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a helluva nice guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个非常好的人。

Sense.DEF: the wheel or control which guides a ship or boat

Subsense.DEF: in charge of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We have a new prime minister at the helm.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有新首相执政。

Subsense.DEF: guiding a ship or boat
to start being in charge of something such as a business or organization
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wright took the helm at the food retailer in December 2001.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特于2001年12月开始掌管这家食品零售公司。

Subsense.DEF: to start guiding a ship or boat

Sense.DEF:
a strong hard hat that soldiers,
motorcycle
riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads
wearing a helmet
someone who guides a ship or boat
to make it possible or easier for someone to do something by doing part of their work or by giving them something they need
Sense.EXAMPLE: If there’s anything I can do to help, just give me a call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果需要我帮忙﹐就给我打个电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I helped her to carry her cases up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮她把箱子拎上了楼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She helped him choose some new clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她帮他挑了一些新衣服。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: herbal products that help you to relax and sleep
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有助于放松和睡眠的草药产品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was coming to help clean the machines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要来帮忙擦洗机器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I help you with the washing up?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来帮你洗碗好吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father said he’s going to help me with the fees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲说费用问题他会帮我解决的。

GramExa.GLOSS: help someone put on or take off a piece of clothing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here, let me help you on with your coat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐我帮你穿上外套吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: help someone get to a particular place, especially because they are old, ill, or hurt
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 帮助某人去某地〔尤指受助者年老﹑生病或受伤等〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She helped the old man across the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她搀扶老人过马路。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation better, easier, or less painful
Sense.TRAN: 使〔形势〕改善﹐使好转﹔减轻〔痛苦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crying won’t help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哭是无济于事的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you get rid of your car you could be helping the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你处理掉汽车﹐说不定会有助于改善环境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It helps my concentration if I listen to music while I’m working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我工作时听音乐更容易集中思想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It helped a lot to know that someone understood how I felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道有人理解我的感受﹐我感觉好多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eight hours of deep sleep helped enormously .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八小时的酣睡非常有好处。

Subsense.DEF: to take some of what you want, without asking permission – used especially when offering food to someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Please help yourself to some cake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请随便吃些蛋糕。

Subsense.DEF: to steal something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Obviously he had been helping himself to the money.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然一直在偷钱。

Sense.DEF: used to call people and ask them to help you when you are in danger

Variant.LEXVAR: sb can’t help but do sth

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is unable to change their behaviour or feelings, or to prevent themselves from doing something
Sense.TRAN: 某人忍不住做某事﹐某人不能停止做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t help it if she was being irrational.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不理智的时候自己也无法控制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Stop biting your nails.’ ‘I can’t help it .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别咬指甲啦。”“我忍不住。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t help the way I feel about you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法抑制对你的感情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lee could not help but agree with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李只得同意了她。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb can’t help feeling/thinking/wondering etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t help feeling that there has been a mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总觉得什么地方出了错。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t help thinking about the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不禁回想起过去。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I couldn’t help myself/she couldn’t help herself etc
Sense.DEF: to be unable to stop yourself from doing something you should not do
Sense.TRAN: 我/她等忍不住[无法控制自己]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew she sounded just like her mother but she couldn’t help herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道自己的语气与母亲一模一样﹐但就是无法控制自己。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is nothing you can do to change a bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said she had to leave him for a while; it couldn’t be helped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她不得不暂时离开他﹔那是没办法的事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is helping the police with their enquiries
Sense.DEF: the police are interviewing someone about a crime, especially because they believe that this person may have committed the crime
help and support

GramExa.PROPFORM: give/lend/offer etc sb a helping hand
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been giving me a helping hand with the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直在帮我照顾孩子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not if I can help it
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not going to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you going to watch the school play?’ ‘Not if I can help it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你会去看学校话剧表演吗？”“能不去就不去。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something bad may happen to someone
Sense.TRAN: 上帝保佑他/他们等〔用于表示可能会有不好的事发生在某人身上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Good luck.’ ‘God help me, I think I’m going to need it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “祝你好运。”“上帝保佑我﹐我想我真的需要好运。”

Sense.DEF: used when making a serious promise, especially in a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 我发誓﹔上天作证〔尤在法庭上发誓时用〕

Exponent.DEF: to make it easier for someone to do something, by doing something for them or giving them something they need
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is there anything I can do to help?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么可以帮忙的吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dad, I can’t do my homework. Will you help me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸﹐我不会做家庭作业﹐帮帮我好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to help someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was employed to assist the manager in his duties.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受聘协助经理处理工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some of the guests assisted with the preparation of the food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些客人帮忙准备食物。
