Exponent.DEF: to help someone to do something – used especially when saying that something helps your body to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 帮助﹐援助〔尤指对身体有好处〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Coffee can aid concentration.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡有助于集中注意力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fennel aids the digestion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 茴香帮助消化。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of materials to aid the teacher.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多材料是老师用得上的。

Exponent.DEF: to help someone, especially because there are not enough people to do all the work, or they need someone to give them something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因人手不够或别人缺乏某物而〕分担…工作﹐帮一把
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Organizing the school trip will be a lot of work, so I need some volunteers to help out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织学校旅游事情很多﹐因此我需要一些志愿者来帮帮忙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My parents have helped us out on several occasions by sending us money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母几次寄钱为我们救急。

Exponent.DEF: to help someone to do something, especially by carrying or lifting things
Exponent.TRAN: 帮助某人〔尤指提拎东西〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a hand moving these boxes?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我搬一下这些箱子吗？

Exponent.DEF: to help someone, especially when there are not enough people to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scott is moving on Saturday and we promised to lend a hand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特星期六要搬家﹐我们答应去帮忙。

Sense.DEF: to make a process or activity happen more quickly or easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked a few questions to help the conversation along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提了一些问题来引导谈话进行。

Sense.DEF: to help someone because they are busy or have problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need anyone to help out in the shop?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 店里的事你需要有人帮一把吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I helped her out when Stella became ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉生病时我分担了她的工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was helping him out with his mortgage repayments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在帮助他偿还抵押贷款。

Sense.DEF: things you do to make it easier or possible for someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for all your help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你所有的帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you want any help with the washing-up?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要人帮忙洗碗吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could do with some help to bring the bags in from the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要人帮忙把袋子从车里拿进来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He asked for my help in getting an interview with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他请我帮忙争取一个采访她的机会。

GramExa.PROPFORM: with the help of sb/with sb’s help
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We manage, with the help of a nurse who comes daily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一位护士每天都来﹐在她的帮助下﹐我们勉强应付。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is a help to you, they are useful and make it easier for you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: That map isn’t much help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张地图不太管用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to make myself understood with the help of a phrase book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在短语手册的帮助下我勉强让别人明白了我的意思。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be of great/little/no/some etc help (to sb)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me know if I can be of any help to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我能帮上你的忙就说一声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any information would be a great help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何信息都会非常有用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ve been a real help to me, Carrie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是帮了我大忙了﹐卡丽。

Sense.DEF: advice, treatment, information, or money which is given to people who need it
Sense.TRAN: 援助﹐资助〔指建议﹑治疗﹑资料或金钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of these children need professional help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多这样的儿童需要专业人士的帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may be able to ask for help with the rent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许能要求租金上的援助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We received no help from the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有得到警察的帮助。

Sense.DEF: a part of a computer program that helps someone using it by giving additional information
Sense.TRAN: 帮助〔指计算机程序所提供的使用说明〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s servant or servants

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 给予某人帮助,帮助某人
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you want me to give you some help?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要我帮忙吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He asked for help with the cleaning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他请人帮忙打扫。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the older patients need help with walking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些年长患者走路需要搀扶。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gets no help from her husband.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得不到丈夫的帮助。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The taxi driver offered his help and we accepted.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车司机主动帮忙,我们接受了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government should do more to provide help for people who are looking for work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府应采取更多措施,向求职者提供帮助。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: publicly ask for help
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police are appealing for help to track down the killer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方发出呼吁,要求协助追查杀人凶手。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: persuade someone to help you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She enlisted the help of a private investigator to find her missing son.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她请了一名私人侦探来帮她寻找失踪的儿子。

Sense.DEF: a department of a company that people call for help, especially with computer problems
Sense.TRAN: 用户服务部〔公司部门﹐尤指提供计算机技术帮助的部门〕

Sense.DEF: someone who helps another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was a classroom helper at the local primary school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是当地小学的课室助理。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed to do some of the work in someone else’s home
providing useful help in making a situation better or easier
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your advice; it’s been very helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你的建议﹐它非常有用。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is helpful (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is helpful to discuss your problems with your friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和朋友商量自己的问题很有帮助。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is helpful for family members to gain a basic understanding of the illness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭成员了解这一疾病的基本知识很有帮助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is helpful if we address a few key questions here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们在这里解决一些关键问题会很有用的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hope this leaflet has been helpful in answering your questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望这份传单对回答你们的问题有帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our sales staff are there to give you helpful advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的销售人员随时为你们提供有用的建议。

Sense.DEF: always willing to help people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a helpful child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个乐于助人的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m only trying to be helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想帮忙。

Sense.DEF: the amount of food that someone gives you or that you take
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double helping of pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双份馅饼

Sense.DEF: unable to look after yourself or to do anything to help yourself
Sense.TRAN: 无法照顾自己的﹔无助的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to feel depressed and helpless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始觉得沮丧﹑无助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vicious attack on a helpless victim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对无助受害者的残暴攻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: Newman threw out a hand in a helpless gesture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽曼伸出手做了个无助的手势。

Sense.DEF: unable to control a strong feeling that you have
Sense.TRAN: 不能自已的﹐情不自禁的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was near to death, and I was helpless with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他即将死去﹐我无法抑制心中的恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We both collapsed into helpless giggles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都控制不住地咯咯发笑。

Sense.DEF: a telephone number that you can ring if you need advice or information
a helpful partner, usually a wife
a screen that appears when you ask for help in using a computer program, showing extra information or advice
done quickly, in a disorganized way
Sense.TRAN: 匆匆忙忙地﹐手忙脚乱地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran helter-skelter down the slope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他匆匆忙忙地跑下山坡。

Sense.DEF:
a tall structure in a
fairground
which you sit on at the top and slide round and round to the bottom
the edge of a piece of cloth that is turned under and stitched down, especially the lower edge of a skirt, trousers etc
to turn under the edge of a piece of material or clothing and stitch it in place
to keep pausing before saying something, and avoid saying it directly
to surround someone or something closely
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were hemmed in on all sides by the soldiers and the dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被士兵和狗团团围住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The market place is hemmed in by shops and banks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场周边商店和银行林立。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they are not free to do what they want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hem in the child with endless rules and restrictions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用没完没了的规定来限制那个孩子。

Sense.DEF: a strong man with powerful muscles

a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the
equator
Sense.TRAN: 〔地球的〕半球〔尤指北半球或南半球〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Northern hemisphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北半球

Sense.DEF: one of the two halves of your brain

half of a
sphere an object which is round like a ball
the length of a dress, skirt etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Short hemlines are in this spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今春流行短裙。

Sense.DEF: a very poisonous plant, or the poison that is made from it
Sense.TRAN: 毒芹﹔由毒芹提取的毒药

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
haemoglobin

the American spelling of
haemophilia

the American spelling of
haemophiliac

the American spelling of
haemorrhage

the American spelling of
haemorrhoids

a type of plant that is used to make rope and sometimes to produce the drug
cannabis
Sense.TRAN: 大麻〔用以制绳﹐有时制成毒品〕

Sense.DEF: an adult female chicken
a fully grown female bird
for this reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运输成本是企业的一大支出﹐因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

Sense.LEXUNIT: ten days hence/five months hence etc
Sense.DEF: ten days from now, five months from now etc
from this time on
Sense.TRAN: 从今以后﹐今后﹐从现在起
Sense.EXAMPLE: multiple sclerosis (henceforth referred to as MS)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多发性硬化（以下称为MS）

Sense.DEF: a faithful supporter of a political leader or a criminal, who is willing to do illegal things or use violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治领导人或罪犯的〕忠实支持者﹐党羽﹐喽﹐狗腿子﹐心腹

Sense.DEF: a small building where chickens are kept

a series of boat races for
rowing boats
, held every year on the River Thames near the town of Henley in the south of England. Henley is also a fashionable social event, especially for rich and
upper-class
people.
Sense.TRAN: 亨利赛船会〔每年在英格兰南部亨利镇附近的泰晤士河上举行的划船比赛〕

Sense.DEF: a reddish-brown substance used to change the colour of hair or skin
Sense.TRAN: 散沫花染料〔红褐色﹐用作头发﹑皮肤的染色剂〕

Sense.DEF: a party for women only, that happens just before one of them gets married
Sense.TRAN: 〔一位女性即将结婚前举行的〕女性聚会

Sense.DEF: a man who is henpecked is always being told what to do by his wife, and is afraid to disagree with her
Sense.EXAMPLE: a henpecked husband
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怕老婆的丈夫

Sense.DEF:
relating to your
liver

a disease of the
liver
that causes fever and makes your skin yellow. There are several types of hepatitis: hepatitis A, which is less severe, and hepatitis B and C, which are much more serious.
a shape with seven straight sides
a women’s sports competition involving seven running, jumping, and throwing events
belonging to or connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at her watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看了一下表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her room was pleasant and airy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的房间既舒适又通风。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She makes her own clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自己做衣服。

Sense.DEF: connected with a country, ship, car etc that has already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 她的﹔它的〔指已提及的国家﹑船只﹑车辆等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her top speed is about 110 miles an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的最高时速大约为110英里。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane? I don’t really know her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简？我不太认识她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret wants me to go with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特想让我和她一起去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give her the keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把钥匙给她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it was her, but I’m not sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得是她﹐但不肯定。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a country, ship, car etc that has already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 她〔指已提及的国家﹑船只﹑车辆等〕﹔它
Sense.EXAMPLE: God bless this ship and all who sail in her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿上帝保佑这条船和船上所有的人。

Sense.DEF: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

Sense.DEF: to say publicly that someone or something will be good or important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When it opened, the hospital was heralded as a new way forward in nursing care.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该医院开业时被誉为护理业向前迈进的新的一步。

Sense.DEF: someone who carried messages from a ruler in the past
a sign that something is soon going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bowl of daffodils, the first bright heralds of spring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盆水仙花﹐春天的第一个鲜明的预兆

Sense.DEF:
the study of
coats
of arms
a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

Sense.DEF: plants that are herbaceous have soft stems rather than hard stems made of wood
part of a garden where people grow plants that live for many years and do not need to be replaced
Sense.TRAN: 〔花园中种植的多年生植物的〕绿草带﹐绿缘

Sense.DEF: made of herbs
Sense.EXAMPLE: herbal remedies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草药
Sense.EXAMPLE: herbal tea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花草茶

Sense.DEF:
someone who grows, sells, or uses
herbs
,especially to treat illness
Sense.TRAN: 种草药的人﹔草药商﹔草药医生

Sense.DEF: the practice of treating illness using plants
medicine made from plants
a substance used to kill unwanted plants
an animal that only eats plants
needing great strength or determination
Sense.TRAN: 需要花很大力气 [决心]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a herculean task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰巨的任务

Sense.DEF: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
Sense.TRAN: 〔同一种类并一同活动的〕兽群﹔牧群

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a herd of cattle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群牛
GramExa.EXAMPLE: herds of elephants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数群大象

Sense.DEF: people generally, especially when thought of as being easily influenced by others
Sense.TRAN: 〔易受人支配的〕民众﹐老百姓﹐芸芸众生
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to be an individual; it’s no use running with the herd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须特立独行﹐随大溜没有用处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the herd instinct the need to behave in the same way as everyone else does
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 群集本能

Sense.DEF: to bring people together in a large group, especially roughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were herded together .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人们被集合起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to be herded around with a lot of tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想和许多游客一起被带到这里那里的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The visitors were herded into two large halls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客们被赶进两个大厅里。

Sense.DEF: to make animals move together in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was Tom’s duty to herd the cows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆的职责是放牛。

Sense.DEF: used to say that trying to control or organize a group of people is very difficult
a man who looks after a herd of animals
in this place
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们在这里干什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we eat here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这里吃好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come here for a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这里来一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This switch here controls the lights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此处的这个开关控制电灯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My friend here will show you the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这位朋友会给你指路的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was she doing up here in the woods?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在树林里干什么？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you close the window? It’s cold in here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把窗关上好吗？这里很冷。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on. I’m over here .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐我在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be back here tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚你回这里吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no good pubs round here .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一带没有好的酒吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s settle the matter here and now .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在就解决此事吧。

F2NBox.HEADING: grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘in here’ when you are talking about a town or country, or an institution such as a university. Just say here .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示城镇﹑国家或大学等机构﹐不要说in here﹐而只说here即可
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The people here have got just about enough to live on.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人们生活只够维持温饱。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use in here when referring to what is inside a building, room, cupboard etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指建筑物﹑房间﹑橱柜等的里面﹐要用in here。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use ‘here is/are ...’ to say what is in a place. Use there is/are ... here .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一处有什么不要用here is/are ... ﹐而要用there is/are ... here
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are many species of birds here.

Sense.DEF: at this point in time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spring is here at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天终于来临。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here is your chance to change your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变你生活的机会来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here is where the trouble starts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻烦是从这里开始的。

Sense.DEF: scattered around or happening in several different places
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house just needs a bit of paint here and there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子只是有些地方需要重新粉刷。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are giving something to someone, or showing something to them
Subsense.TRAN: 给你〔用于把某物给某人或向某人展示时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Here’s the money you lent me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是你借给我的钱。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Here are some pictures of John when he was little.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有一些约翰小时候的照片。

Subsense.DEF: used when you have found something you were looking for
Subsense.TRAN: 在这儿〔用于找到某物时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen my pen? Oh, here it is.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看见我的钢笔了吗？哦﹐在这儿呢。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving or offering something to someone
Sense.TRAN: 给你〔用于给别人东西时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here, have my chair﹐I don’t mind standing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐坐我的椅子吧。我可以站着。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving something to someone
Sense.TRAN: 给你〔用于把某物给某人时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here you are, a boxful of tools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给你一盒工具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Here you go.’ Callum handed her a glass of orange juice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “给你。”卡勒姆递给她一杯橙汁。

Sense.DEF: at this point in a discussion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here I’d like to add a note of caution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到这里我要加一句忠告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no space to discuss this issue here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里没有讨论这一问题的篇幅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure what you mean here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一点上我不明白你的意思。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to try to do something difficult or dangerous, and you do not know what will happen
Sense.TRAN: 我这就开始！我现在就试试看！〔用于做困难或危险的事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never ridden a motorbike before, so here goes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未骑过摩托车﹐现在就试试看吧！

Sense.DEF: used when you are starting to do something or when something is starting to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, here we go, the game’s starting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐开始了﹐比赛这就开始。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to drink something to wish someone good luck, show your respect for them etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔敬酒时说的祝词〕为某人/某事干杯﹐祝某人/某事〔健康﹑成功等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s to the happy couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为这幸福的一对干杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s to your new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为你的新工作干杯。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something has arrived
Sense.TRAN: 他/她等[某人/某事等]来了
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here they are, late as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们来了﹐照例又迟到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ah, look - here’s the postman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐瞧！邮递员来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony’s here for his messages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼来收他的留言。

Sense.DEF: used when you have finally arrived somewhere you were travelling to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here we are - home at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到了﹐终于到家了。

Sense.DEF: used when you can see something or someone arriving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here comes lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭来了。

Sense.DEF: used to get someone’s attention or to show that you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 喂〔用来引起别人注意或表示不高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here! Just what do you think you’re doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂！你认为你这是在干什么？

Sense.DEF: used when something unpleasant is beginning to happen again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of us are peaceful and decent, but here we go again, in our fifth war of this century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中的大多数人爱好和平﹑品行端正﹐但是我们又一次陷入战争﹐这已经是本世纪的第五次战争了。

Sense.DEF: if something is here to stay, it has become a part of life and will continue to be so
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物〕已经成为生活中的一部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mobile phones are definitely here to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手机绝对是生活中必不可少的。

Sense.DEF: in many different places
Sense.TRAN: 到处﹐各处﹔在许多不同的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the weekend driving the kids here, there, and everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我周末开车带着孩子们四处跑。

Sense.DEF: not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You never liked him much, did you?’ ‘What I think about him is neither here nor there. He’s your friend.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你从来都不太喜欢他﹐是不是？”“我对他的看法无关紧要。他是你的朋友。”

Sense.DEF: the present time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To be able to live fully in the here and now, one must first learn how to honour the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人如果要完完整整地活在当下﹐首先必须学会尊重过去。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb/sth is here to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say what someone or something’s duty or purpose is
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物的职责[用途]就是做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re here to serve you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的职责就是为你服务。

Sense.DEF: used to describe the present situation, especially one you did not expect to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here I am in Fiji!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在竟然到斐济了！

Sense.DEF: somewhere near the place where you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be a pub hereabouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近肯定有酒吧。

Sense.DEF: from this time
after death
Sense.EXAMPLE: his belief in God and a life hereafter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对上帝和来世的信仰

Sense.DEF: in a later part of an official or legal document
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式或法律文件中〕在下文中﹐此后
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Ulster Democratic Unionist Party (hereafter UDUP)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰民主统一党（以下简称UDUP）

Sense.DEF: a life after death
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in the hereafter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你相信有来世吗？

Sense.DEF: as a result of this statement – used in official situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hereby agree to the conditions of this contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同意此合同的条款﹐特此声明。

Sense.DEF: a quality or illness that is hereditary is passed from a parent to a child before the child is born
a hereditary position, rank, or title can be passed from an older to a younger person in the same family, usually when the older one dies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hereditary peer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世袭贵族

Sense.DEF: the process by which mental and physical qualities are passed from a parent to a child before the child is born
in this place, situation, document etc
Sense.TRAN: 在此处﹔在这种情况下﹔在本文中
Sense.EXAMPLE: the conditions stated herein
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本文所列条件
Sense.EXAMPLE: Herein lies a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里存在一个问题。

Sense.DEF: later in this official statement, document etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式声明﹑文件等中〕在下文中
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Council of the Law Society (hereinafter called the Council)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师公会理事会（以下简称理事会）

Sense.DEF: relating to or belonging to this document
Sense.TRAN: 关于本文件﹔在本文件中
Sense.EXAMPLE: This Agreement commences on the date of signature hereof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本协议自签字之日起生效。

Sense.DEF: a belief that disagrees with the official principles of a particular religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was executed for heresy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因信奉异教而被处死。

Sense.DEF: a belief, statement etc that disagrees with what a group of people believe to be right
Sense.EXAMPLE: To come to work without a shirt and tie was considered heresy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上班不穿衬衫不打领带曾被视为离经叛道。

Sense.DEF: someone who is guilty of heresy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cranmer was put to death as a heretic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克兰默被当成异教徒处死。

Sense.DEF: to this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A copy of the document is hereto appended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此附上本文件的副本。

Sense.DEF: before this time
Sense.EXAMPLE: In recent years we have seen greater emphasis than heretofore on the voice of the consumer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来我们发现消费者的意见比过去受到重视。

Sense.DEF: at or after this moment
with this letter or document
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enclose a copy of this report herewith for your information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我随函附上这份报道以供参考。

Sense.DEF: property that is heritable can be passed from the older members of a family to the younger ones
the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of preserving the national heritage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护民族遗产的重要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the cultural heritage of Italy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利的文化遗产

Sense.DEF: a heritage vegetable or plant is one of a kind that was first grown many years ago, and has now become rare or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔蔬菜或植物〕珍稀的﹐老品种的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We grow heritage varieties of vegetables.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们种植各种稀有蔬菜。

Sense.DEF: a living thing that has both male and female sexual organs
very tightly closed so that air cannot get in or out
someone who lives alone and has a simple way of life, usually for religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指出于宗教原因的〕隐士﹐独居修道士﹔遁世者

Sense.DEF: a place where a hermit lives or has lived in the past

a kind of
crab
that lives in the empty shells of other sea creatures
a medical condition in which an organ pushes through the muscles that are supposed to contain it
a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had dared to speak out against injustice, and overnight he became a national hero .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敢于站出来抨击不公正的现象﹐一夜之间就成了国家英雄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father was a war hero , a former fighter pilot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲是一位战争英雄﹐曾经是战斗机飞行员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unsung heroes who drove convoys of aid to Bosnia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运载援助物品到波斯尼亚的那些无名英雄

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hero of the Great War
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位第一次世界大战的英雄

Sense.EXAMPLE: A man hailed as a hero for 50 years has been unmasked as a traitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50年来一直被誉为英雄的人被揭发为叛徒。

Sense.DEF: the man or boy who is the main character in a book, film, play etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phileas Fogg, hero of Jules Verne’s ‘Around the World in Eighty Days’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斐利斯•福格﹐儒勒•凡尔纳《八十天环游地球》的男主人公

Sense.DEF: a man who is admired very much for a particular skill or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When I was small, Uncle Fred was my hero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候﹐弗雷德叔叔是我的偶像。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Einstein is the hero of those who explore science at its deepest level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱因斯坦是探索科学最深层秘密的人心目中的偶像。

Sense.DEF:
a long thin
sandwich
filled with meat, cheese etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔夹有肉﹑奶酪等的〕长面包三明治﹐潜艇三明治

Sense.DEF: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: her heroic efforts to save her family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拯救家人的英勇行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lawrence’s heroic struggle against his destiny
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦斯与命运的勇敢抗争
Sense.EXAMPLE: She portrayed him as a heroic figure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把他描述为英雄人物。

Sense.DEF:
a heroic story, poem etc has a hero in it, usually from ancient
legends
Sense.TRAN: （关于）英雄的〔一般为古代传说中的英雄〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: on a heroic scale/of heroic proportions
Sense.DEF: very large or great
Sense.EXAMPLE: a battle on a heroic scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的战争

Sense.DEF: a pair of lines in poetry which end with the same sound and have five beats in each line
Sense.TRAN: 英雄偶句〔两行相互押韵﹑每行含有五个抑扬音步的诗〕

Sense.DEF: brave actions or words, often ones that are meant to seem impressive to other people
Sense.TRAN: （为哗众取宠而说的）豪言壮语﹔逞英雄行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s present need is not heroics, but calm diplomacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国当前需要的不是逞英雄﹐而是冷静的外交。

Sense.DEF:
a powerful and illegal drug made from
morphine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heroin addict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洛因瘾君子

Sense.DEF: a woman who is admired for doing something extremely brave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a heroine of the French Resistance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国抵抗运动的一位女英雄

Sense.DEF: the woman or girl who is the main character in a book, film, play etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mira, the fictional heroine of ‘The Women’s Room’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈拉﹐小说《女厕》的女主人公

Sense.DEF: a woman who is admired very much for a particular skill or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oprah is my heroine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥普拉是我的偶像。

Sense.DEF: very great courage
Sense.TRAN: 英雄气概﹔大无畏精神﹐英勇
Sense.EXAMPLE: stories of heroism and self-sacrifice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于英勇无畏和自我牺牲的故事

Sense.DEF: a large bird with very long legs and a long beak, that lives near water
great admiration for someone who is thought to be very brave, good, skilful etc – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 英雄[偶像]崇拜〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a very infectious disease that causes spots on the skin, for example on the sexual organs or face
a long thin silver sea fish that can be eaten
a pattern consisting of a continuous line of V shapes, used in cloth etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔织物等上的〕鲱骨式图案﹐人字形图案

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bent and touched his mouth to hers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯身吻她的嘴唇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are my gloves. Hers are in the drawer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我的手套﹐她的在抽屉里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea was hers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主意是她出的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul’s a friend of hers .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗是她的朋友。

Sense.DEF: used to show that the woman or girl who does something is affected by her own action
Sense.EXAMPLE: She cut herself on some broken glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎玻璃把她割伤了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made herself a cup of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给自己煮了杯咖啡。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about one particular woman or girl
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It must be true that she’s leaving because she told me so herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的确是要走了﹐因为这是她亲口对我说的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ornate Town Hall was opened by Queen Victoria herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华丽的市政厅是维多利亚女王亲自揭幕的。

Subsense.DEF: used after ‘like’, ‘as’, or ‘except’ instead of ‘her’
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She met other mothers in the same situation as herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她碰到和她处于同样境况的母亲们。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Miss Bennet lives by herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝内特小姐一个人住。

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The little girl wrote the letter all by herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小女孩自己一个人写了这封信。

Sense.DEF: if a woman or girl is not herself, she does not feel or behave as she usually does, for example because she is upset or ill
Sense.TRAN: （她）〔因情绪或身体欠佳等〕感觉不妥﹔行为反常
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must forgive her - she’s not herself at present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要原谅她——她目前情绪反常。

Sense.DEF: if a woman or girl has something to herself, she does not have to share it with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alice had the house to herself while her parents were away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母不在的时候﹐这房子就归艾丽斯独住。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring the
frequency
of
sound waves

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘he is’
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一位作家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在看书。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘he has’
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s bought a new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他买了一辆新汽车。

Sense.DEF: when someone is uncertain or slow in doing or saying something
uncertain about what to do or say because you are nervous or unwilling
Sense.TRAN: 犹豫的﹐迟疑的﹐有疑虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gail gave me a hesitant little smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖尔迟疑地对我微微一笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They seemed hesitant about coming in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们似乎犹豫着该不该进来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is hesitant to draw conclusions until the study is over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿在研究结束之前下结论。

Sense.DEF: to pause before saying or doing something because you are nervous or not sure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kay hesitated for a moment and then said ‘yes’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯迟疑了片刻﹐然后说“是的”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was still hesitating over whether to leave or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还在犹豫要不要离开。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is correct or right for them to do something and they do not have to worry about offending anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t hesitate to contact me if you need any more information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你需要更多资料﹐尽管和我联系。

Sense.DEF: when someone hesitates
Sense.EXAMPLE: After some hesitation one of them began to speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹豫了一会儿之后﹐他们中有一个人开口了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He agreed without hesitation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫不犹豫地同意了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have no hesitation in doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would have no hesitation in recommending Philip for the position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常愿意推荐菲利普担任这一职务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a slight hesitation in Jamie’s voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰米的话音里有一丝犹豫。

Sense.DEF:
thick rough cloth sometimes used for making
sacks
other, opposite, different

GramExa.GLOSS: attracted to the opposite sex

Sense.DEF: heterodox beliefs, practices etc are not approved of by a particular group, especially a religious one
Sense.TRAN: 异教的﹐异端的﹐非正统的

Sense.DEF: consisting of parts or members that are very different from each other
Sense.TRAN: 由全然不同的部分 [成员]组成的﹐混杂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heterogeneous collection of buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风格各异的一组建筑

Sense.DEF: sexually attracted to people of the opposite sex
anxious, upset, or slightly angry
Sense.TRAN: 焦虑不安的﹐慌张的﹐有点生气的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike tends to get het up about silly things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克总是为无聊的小事感到紧张。

Sense.DEF: heuristic education is based on discovering and experiencing things for yourself
helping you in the process of learning or discovery
Sense.TRAN: 〔对学习或发现〕有启发作用的

Sense.DEF: the study of how people use their experience to find answers to questions or to improve performance
to cut something with a cutting tool
Sense.EXAMPLE: hewn stone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切割好的石头

Sense.DEF:
an evil
curse
that brings trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s trying to put a hex on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他在施咒害我。

Sense.DEF: hexadecimal numbers are based on the number 16 and are mainly used on computers
a shape with six sides
a line of poetry with six main beats

an
allen key
a shout used to get someone’s attention or to show surprise, interest, or annoyance
Sense.TRAN: 嘿﹐喂〔用来引起注意或表示惊讶﹑兴趣或恼怒的喊声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, wait a minute!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐等一下！

Sense.DEF: hello
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, what’s up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐怎么了？

Sense.DEF: said when you do not think something is important
Sense.TRAN: 但是﹐咳〔表示认为某事无关紧要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would have liked to go, but hey, it's no big deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本想去的﹐不过﹐咳﹐也没什么大不了。

Sense.DEF: the time when someone or something was most popular, successful, or powerful
Sense.TRAN: 最兴盛[最成功﹐最强大]的时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greta Garbo in her heyday
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巅峰时期的葛丽泰•嘉宝

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens so easily that it seems to be magic
Sense.TRAN: 嘿〔用于表示某事忽然发生﹐像变魔术一般〕

Sense.DEF: a large road vehicle used for moving goods
Sense.TRAN: 大型货运卡车﹐载重货车

Sense.DEF: hello
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi! How are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨！你好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi there! I haven’t seen you for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿！好久不见。

Sense.DEF:
a break or
interruption
in an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talks between the two countries have resumed after a six-year hiatus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的谈判在中断了六年以后又恢复了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hiatus in research
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究的中断

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a brief hiatus in the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争曾一度停歇。

Sense.DEF: a space where something is missing, especially in a piece of writing
if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter
a tropical plant with large brightly coloured flowers
a sudden repeated stopping of the breath, usually caused by eating or drinking too fast

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t drink so fast - you’ll get hiccups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别喝这么快——会打嗝的。

Sense.DEF: a small problem or delay

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hiccup in the negotiations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判中出现的小问题

Sense.DEF: to have hiccups
someone who lives in the countryside, and is thought to be uneducated or stupid
a red mark on someone’s skin caused by someone else sucking it as a sexual act
a North American tree that produces nuts, or the wood that comes from this tree

the past tense of
hide

the past participle of
hide
difficult to see or find
Sense.EXAMPLE: the use of hidden cameras
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐藏式摄像机的使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some areas can hold hidden dangers for dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些区域可能对狗有隐伏的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hidden meaning behind his words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的言外之意
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be on the lookout for hidden costs in hotel bills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心酒店账单中有隐性收费。

Sense.DEF: not easy to notice or realize
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants each pupil to have the chance to discover hidden talents .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望每个学生都有机会发现自己的潜能。

Sense.DEF: the secret purpose behind a plan or activity that you do not tell other people about – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 隐秘的动机﹔不可告人的目的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters suspected a hidden political agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民怀疑背后有暗藏的政治目的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was there a hidden agenda behind this decision?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定的背后有没有什么不可告人的目的？

Sense.DEF: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marcia hid the pictures in her desk drawer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马西娅把照片藏在她书桌的抽屉里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was accused of trying to hide evidence from the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控试图对警方隐瞒证据。

Sense.DEF: to cover something so that it cannot be seen clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church roof was half hidden by trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂顶部半掩在树木中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her tangled hair hid her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱糟糟的头发遮住了她的脸。

Sense.DEF: to go or stay in a place where no one will see or find you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick, he’s coming! We’d better hide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快﹐他来了! 我们最好躲起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harry hid under the bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里躲在床下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Weiss spent two years hiding from the Nazis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦斯躲藏了两年逃避纳粹的追捕。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone in a place where other people will not find them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old woman hid him in her cellar for three days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个老妇人把他藏在地窖里三天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to hide him from the soldiers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得把他藏起来﹐不让士兵找到。

Sense.DEF: to keep your real feelings, plans, or the truth secret, so that they cannot be known by other people
Sense.TRAN: 掩盖〔真实感情〕﹔隐瞒〔计划﹑真相等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She laughed to hide her nervousness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她笑了笑以掩饰自己的紧张。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He took off his ring to hide the fact that he was married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摘下戒指﹐想隐瞒自己已婚的事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told the jury that he is innocent and has nothing to hide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉陪审团自己是清白的﹐没什么要隐瞒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to hide anything from me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要试图向我隐瞒什么。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: hide your light under a bushel

Exponent.DEF: to make something difficult to see or find, or to not show your true feelings
Exponent.TRAN: 把〔某物〕藏起来﹔掩盖〔真实感情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hid the gun in his pocket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把枪藏在口袋里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tried to hide her anger.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图掩饰自己的愤怒。

Exponent.DEF: to hide something, especially by carefully putting it somewhere. Also used when talking about hiding your feelings, especially in negative sentences.
Exponent.TRAN: 隐藏〔某物〕﹐隐匿﹔隐瞒〔感情,尤用于否定句中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Several kilos of drugs were concealed in the back of the truck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车后部藏有几公斤毒品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He could not conceal his feelings any longer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他再也无法掩饰自己的感情。

Exponent.DEF: to put something over another thing that you do not want people to see, in order to hide it completely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People cover up cracks with wallpaper or tiles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们用壁纸或瓷砖来遮盖裂缝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I used some make-up to cover up the spots.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用了些化妆品来遮盖斑点。

Exponent.DEF: to make someone or something seem like a different person or thing, so that other people cannot recognize them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She managed to get into the camp by disguising herself as a soldier.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她假扮成士兵﹐设法混进了军营。

Exponent.DEF: to hide something by covering it with materials that make it look like the things around it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We camouflaged the plane by covering it with leaves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用树叶作伪装盖住飞机。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The troops used charcoal to camouflage their faces.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们用木炭把脸涂黑进行伪装。

Exponent.DEF: to make it difficult to see something clearly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The view was obscured by mist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄雾中景色朦胧。

Exponent.DEF: to make something less noticeable, for example a taste, a smell, a sound, or a feeling
Exponent.TRAN: 盖住〔味道﹑气味﹑声音等〕﹔掩饰〔情感〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The lemon helps to mask the taste of the fish.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 柠檬可以遮盖鱼味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Helen had turned on the radio to mask the noise of the traffic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦打开收音机来盖住来往车辆的嘈杂声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He did little to mask his contempt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并不掩饰自己的轻蔑。

Sense.DEF: a place from which you can watch animals or birds without being seen by them
Sense.TRAN: 〔可观察鸟兽行动的〕隐匿处﹐埋伏处

Sense.DEF: an animal’s skin, especially when it has been removed to be used for leather
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指已剥取用于制皮革的〕兽皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: ox hide gloves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛皮手套

Sense.DEF: to punish someone severely – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 剥了某人的皮〔指严厉惩罚某人﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone when they are in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would say anything in court to try and save his own hide save himself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了保全自己﹐在法庭上他什么话都会说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not see hide nor hair of sb
Sense.DEF: to not see someone anywhere for a fairly long time
Sense.TRAN: 许久没有见到某人的踪影
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen hide nor hair of him for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经好久没有见过他了。

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which one player shuts their eyes while the others hide, and then goes to look for them
a place where you can go when you want to be alone
having old-fashioned attitudes and ideas – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: hidebound reactionaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古板的反动分子

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant or ugly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hideous dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条很难看的连衣裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: hideous crimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑恶的罪行
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinnertime that day was hideous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天的晚餐很不愉快。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上留下了丑陋的疤痕。

Sense.DEF: a place where someone goes because they do not want anyone to find them
when someone stays somewhere in secret, especially because they have done something illegal or are in danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因犯法或躲避危险的〕藏匿﹐躲藏

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in/go into/come out of hiding
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went into hiding in 1973.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1973年他躲了起来。

Subsense.DEF: a severe physical punishment
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get a good hiding when you come home!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到家后会挨一顿臭揍的！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re not too big for a hiding, you know.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐你还小﹐我还可以揍你。

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when you defeat someone in a sports game

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on a hiding to nothing
Sense.DEF: to be completely wasting your time trying to do something
Sense.TRAN: 白白浪费时间﹐白费功夫

Sense.DEF: a place where you can hide or where you can hide something
if a system, organization etc is hierarchical, people or things are divided into levels of importance
Sense.TRAN: 按等级划分的﹔等级制度的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hierarchical society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等级社会

Sense.DEF: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rigid social hierarchy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格的社会等级制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

Sense.DEF: the most important and powerful members of an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the church hierarchy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会高层

Sense.DEF: a picture or symbol used to represent a word or part of a word, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system
Sense.TRAN: 象形文字〔指单一的图像或符号〕

Sense.DEF: pictures and symbols used to represent words or parts of words, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system
a piece of high quality electronic equipment for playing recorded music
things that are higgledy-piggledy are mixed together in an untidy way
Sense.TRAN: 乱七八糟的﹐杂乱无章的

Sense.DEF: measuring a long distance from the bottom to the top
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the highest mountain in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是日本最高的山。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The camp was surrounded by a high fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地四周围着高高的栅栏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: waves up to 40 metres high
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高至40米的浪头

Sense.EXAMPLE: a ten-foot high statue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10英尺高的雕像
Sense.EXAMPLE: How high is the Eiffel Tower?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃菲尔铁塔有多高？

GramExa.GLOSS: as high as your chest etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The grass was knee-high.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 草有齐膝高。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use high to describe people, animals, trees and plants. Use tall. 形容人﹑动物﹑树木﹑植物不要用high﹐要用 tall: You’re getting very tall (NOT 不说 You’re getting very high). 你长得很高。 | a tall palm tree (NOT 不说 a high palm tree) 高高的棕榈树

Sense.DEF: in a position that is a long way, or a longer way than usual, above the ground, floor etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apartment had spacious rooms with high ceilings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那间公寓房间宽敞﹐屋顶很高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high shelf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个高的架子
Sense.EXAMPLE: high altitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高海拔地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was already high in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳已经当空照了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: High up among the clouds, we saw the summit of Qomolangma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在高高的云团中﹐我们看到了珠穆朗玛峰的顶峰。

Sense.DEF: a high amount, number, or level is large, or larger than usual
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量﹑数字﹑水平〕高的﹐超乎寻常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Temperatures remained high for the rest of the week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一周余下的几天里气温仍然很高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lower-paid workers often cannot afford the high cost of living in the capital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收入较低的工人往往承受不了首都的高昂生活费用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High levels of car use mean our streets are more congested than ever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的大量使用意味着我们的街道变得比以前更拥挤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: high crime rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高犯罪率
Sense.EXAMPLE: high interest rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利率

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you want better public services, you’ll have to pay higher taxes – it’s as simple as that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要有更好的公共服务﹐就要支付更高的税金——道理就是这么简单。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was approaching at high speed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那列火车正在高速驶来。

GramExa.GLOSS: a very large part of a number
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A high proportion of women with children under five work full-time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大一部分孩子不足五岁的妇女在做全职工作。

Sense.DEF: a high standard, quality etc is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high performance computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高性能电脑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a range of high quality goods at low prices
Our aim is to provide the highest quality service to all our customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标就是为所有顾客提供最优质的服务。

GramExa.GLOSS: very good levels of work, achievement, behaviour etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The general standard of the entries was very high.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛作品的总体水准非常高。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our guests expect us to maintain high standards .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的客人期望我们保持高水准。

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of a particular substance or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Choose foods that are high in fiber and low in calories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要选择高纤维低热量的食品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Red meat tends to have a high fat content.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 红肉脂肪含量往往较高。

Sense.DEF: having an important position in society or within an organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社会或机构中〕职位高的﹐高级的﹐重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high rank in the US Navy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国海军中的高级军衔
Sense.EXAMPLE: the City’s highest honour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市的最高荣誉

GramExa.GLOSS: in a powerful position
GramExa.EXAMPLE: someone high up in the CIA
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央情报局的某位高层官员

GramExa.GLOSS: an important position
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both of them held high office in the Anglican Church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两人都位居圣公会高层。

GramExa.GLOSS: rich people of the highest social class

Sense.DEF: advanced and often complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can offer all the benefits of the latest high technology .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以提供最新高科技的益处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the world of high finance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级金融界

GramExa.GLOSS: animals etc that are more intelligent or advanced than others
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 高等动物/哺乳动物/生物等

Sense.DEF: strong approval of someone or something, or an expression of strong approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always had a high opinion of her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对她的工作一直评价很高。

GramExa.GLOSS: respect them very much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As an educationalist, he was held in very high esteem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名教育家﹐他受到人们的高度尊敬。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Romsey earned high praise from his boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗姆西赢得了老板的高度赞扬。

Sense.DEF: important and needing to be done or dealt with quickly
Sense.TRAN: 被列为重要[优先处理]事项
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people feel that education needs to be given higher priority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人认为教育应该是当务之急。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arms control is high on the agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军备控制排在议程表的前列。

Sense.DEF: when someone hopes or expects that something will be very good or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: My expectations of the place were never very high, but I didn’t think it would be this bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对此处从未抱太高期望﹐不过也没想到会这么糟糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Like many young actors, I had high hopes when I first started out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如许多青年演员一样﹐我刚开始的时候也抱有很高期望。

Sense.DEF: near or above the top of the range of sounds that humans can hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always had difficulty reaching the high notes when singing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我唱高音总是有困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high squeaky voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又高又尖的嗓音

Sense.DEF: an especially good part of an activity or event
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或事情的〕高潮﹐最精彩部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: The visit to the ancient capital city was one of the high points of the tour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参观古都是这次旅游中最精彩的内容之一。

Subsense.DEF: an area of land that is higher than the area surrounding it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Villagers herded the livestock to high ground to keep them safe during the floods.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水期间﹐村民们把牲畜赶到高地上以确保它们的安全。

Subsense.DEF: a better, more moral, or more powerful position in an argument or competition
Subsense.TRAN: 〔辩论或比赛中的〕优势﹐有利条件
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Neither side in this conflict can claim the moral high ground .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲突双方在道德上都不占优势。

Sense.DEF: feelings of happiness and energy, especially when you are having fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a bright sunny day and we set off in high spirits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天阳光明媚﹐我们兴高采烈地出发了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think they intended any harm – it was just high spirits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他们没有恶意——他们只是太兴奋了。

Sense.DEF: happy and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still high from the applause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我依然沉浸在掌声带来的兴奋中。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a strange and excited way as the result of taking drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔吸食毒品后〕极度兴奋的﹐陶醉的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people there were high on cocaine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的大多数人吸食了可卡因﹐精神极度亢奋。

GramExa.GLOSS: take a drug to make yourself high

Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve was as high as a kite strongly affected by drugs or alcohol .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫吸了毒感觉飘飘欲仙。

Sense.DEF: having risen to a high level
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river is at its highest in spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河春季水位最高。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is high time sb did sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something should be done now
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s high time you got a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该找份工作了。

Sense.DEF: the middle or the most important part of a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: high summer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛夏

GramExa.GLOSS: 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

Sense.DEF: a strong wind
a situation in which people are told to be ready because there is a strong possibility of an attack or of something dangerous happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops were put on high alert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队奉命处于高度戒备状态。

Sense.DEF: the enjoyable life that rich and fashionable people have
Sense.TRAN: 〔富人及时尚人士的〕奢华生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all stuck here, while he’s off living the high life in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都困在这里﹐他却远在纽约过着奢华的生活。

Sense.DEF: very exciting events or situations
Sense.TRAN: 充满戏剧性的事件/极刺激的历险
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life with moments of high drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有刺激经历的人生

Sense.LEXUNIT: end/finish/begin etc (sth) on a high note
Sense.DEF: to end, finish something etc in a successful way
Sense.TRAN: 圆满结束/成功开始（某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team finished their tour on a high note in Barbados.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的巡回赛在巴巴多斯画上了圆满的句号。

Sense.DEF: ideas about personal behaviour based on the belief that people should always behave in an honest and morally good way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of high moral principles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有崇高道德准则的人

Sense.DEF: talking or behaving as if you think you are better or more important than other people
Sense.TRAN: 盛气凌人的﹐不可一世的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get high and mighty with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在我面前神气活现的。

Sense.DEF: to give your opinion about something in a way that shows you think you are definitely right and that other people are wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she’d get down off her high horse for a moment, she might realize there’s more than one point of view here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她不这么自以为是的话﹐她可能会意识到别人对这个问题有其他看法。

Sense.DEF: cheese, meat etc that is high is not fresh and has a strong smell or taste
Sense.TRAN: 〔奶酪﹑肉类等〕不新鲜的﹐馊臭的

Sense.DEF: special occasions
a naturally pink or red face
in an angry or offended way – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 愤然﹔怒气冲冲〔常为幽默用法〕

Subsense.DEF: a very formal style of language, especially used in literature
a form of a language used for formal purposes that is often different from the ordinary form used by most people
Subsense.TRAN: 高地德语/标准荷兰语等

Section.SECHEADING: buildings/mountains etc 建筑物/高山等

Exponent.DEF: measuring a long distance from the bottom to the top – used about mountains, walls, and buildings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the highest mountain in the world
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最高的山
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The castle was surrounded by high walls.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡的四周围着高墙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a high cliff
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的悬崖

Exponent.DEF: high – used about people, trees, plants, and buildings – used especially about things that are high and narrow.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人﹑树木﹑植物和建筑物﹐尤指细长物〕高的﹐高大的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: tall marble columns
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的大理石柱子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A cat was hiding in the tall grass.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的草丛中躲着一只猫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tall modern building
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢现代化的高楼

Exponent.DEF: very impressive because of being very big and tall – used about mountains, buildings, trees, and animals
Exponent.TRAN: 〔山﹑建筑物﹑树木﹑动物〕雄伟的﹐壮丽的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the majestic mountains of the Himalayas
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 壮丽的喜马拉雅山脉

Exponent.DEF: used about a building or mountain that looks extremely tall and impressive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a soaring skyscraper
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高耸入云的摩天大楼

Exponent.DEF: extremely high, in a way that seems impressive but also often rather frightening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sky was shut out by the towering walls of the prison.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空被高耸的监狱围墙挡住了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: towering trees
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 参天大树

Exponent.DEF: very high and impressive – used in literature
Exponent.TRAN: 巍峨的﹐高耸的〔用于文学作品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the lofty peaks in the far distance
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处巍峨的群峰

Exponent.DEF: a high-rise building is a tall modern building with a lot of floors containing apartments or offices
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a high-rise apartment block
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高层公寓楼

Exponent.DEF: higher than most sounds or voices
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has a rather high-pitched voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声调相当高。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bats make high-pitched squeaks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蝙蝠发出吱吱的尖叫声。

Exponent.DEF: high and unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her voice became more shrill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音变得刺耳起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bird has rather a shrill cry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只鸟的叫声相当刺耳。

Exponent.DEF: extremely high and loud, in a way that is unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a piercing scream
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳的尖叫声

Exponent.DEF: making very high noises that are not loud
Exponent.TRAN: 轻声而尖利的﹐嘎吱作响的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a squeaky gate
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吱嘎作响的大门
Exponent.EXAMPLE: squeaky floorboards
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘎吱作响的地板
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a squeaky little voice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖细的嗓音

Sense.DEF: at or to a level high above the ground, the floor etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kicked the ball high into the air, over the heads of the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球高高地踢向空中﹐越过了人群。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hotel Miramar is situated high above the bay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米拉马尔酒店高高地坐落在海湾之上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ski lift whisks you high into the mountains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪缆车会把你迅速送到高高的山上。

Sense.DEF: at or to a high value, cost, amount etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: If prices shoot up any higher, no one will be able to afford to live in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果物价继续上涨﹐这一地区就没人住得起了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom scored higher than anyone else in the class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在班上的得分最高。

Sense.DEF: with a high sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: A strange cry rang high into the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的叫声划破了夜空。

Sense.DEF: at or to a high rank or level of achievement, especially within a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems that the higher you rise, the less time you have to actually do your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎职位越高﹐参与实际工作的时间越少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents always encouraged me to aim high .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母一直鼓励我要志存高远。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is left high and dry, they are left without any help or without the things that they need
if a boat, area etc is left high and dry, it is left on land because the water that surrounded it has gone down
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The once-thriving port of Rye was left high and dry as sea levels retreated.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一度繁荣的拉伊港由于海平面下降变成了旱港。

Sense.DEF: to try to find someone or something by looking everywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: We looked high and low for Sandy but couldn’t find her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到处寻找桑迪﹐但找不到她。

Sense.DEF: the highest price, number, temperature etc that has ever been recorded, or that has been recorded within a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑数字﹑温度等的〕最高点﹐最高水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Highs of 40˚C were recorded in the region last summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年夏天该地区记录到的最高温度达40摄氏度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price of oil reached a new high this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周的石油价格创出了新高。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great happiness or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re bound to be on a high after such an incredible victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得如此巨大的胜利他们肯定会兴奋不已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the emotional highs and lows of a new romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新恋情带来的情感跌宕起伏

Sense.DEF: a feeling of pleasure or excitement produced by some drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些毒品带来的〕快感﹐飘飘欲仙的感觉

Sense.DEF:
an area of high
pressure
that affects the weather

Sense.TRAN:
a short form of 缩略式=
high school
, used in the name of a school 高中﹔中学〔用于校名〕

Sense.DEF: from someone in a position of authority – used humorously

Sense.EXAMPLE: An order came from on high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上头有命令。

Subsense.DEF:
at a high temperature as measured by an electric
oven
etc

Subsense.DEF: in a high place or heaven

Sense.DEF: of a particular height

Sense.EXAMPLE: a 7000 metre-high mountain

Sense.DEF:
an alcoholic drink, especially
whisky
or
brandy
mixed with water or
soda

Sense.DEF: lights at the front of a car that are on as brightly as possible
born into the highest social class
a piece of tall wooden furniture with many drawers
a highbrow book, film etc is very serious and may be difficult to understand

Sense.DEF: someone who is highbrow is interested in serious or complicated ideas and subjects

Sense.DEF: a special tall chair that a young child sits in to eat
the part of the Church of England that is closest in its beliefs to the Roman Catholic Church
of good quality and style, and usually expensive

Sense.DEF: the most important leaders of a country’s army, navy etc

Sense.DEF: a group of people working for a government or an international organization to deal with a specific problem

Sense.DEF: a group of people with official duties concerning the relationship of one Commonwealth country with another
Sense.TRAN: 〔英联邦国家互相派驻处理外交关系的〕高级专员公署

Sense.DEF: a court of law that is at a higher level than ordinary courts and that can be asked to change the decisions of a lower court
a high-definition television or computer shows images very clearly
relating to products or services that are more expensive and of better quality than other products of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: high-end computer memory chips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高端电脑存储芯片

Sense.DEF:
college or university education as opposed to school or
high school
different types of advanced mathematics that are studied and taught at universities
someone who has a high rank in an organization

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谣传高层人物想把日程提前。

Sense.DEF: a substance that explodes with great power and violence
highfalutin language or behaviour seems silly although it is intended to be impressive – used to show disapproval
high fidelity recording equipment produces sound that is very clear
the action of hitting someone’s open hand with your own above your heads to show that you are pleased about something
someone who is extremely successful in their job or in school

Sense.DEF: high-flown language sounds impressive but does not have much real meaning
of the best quality

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质牛肉

Sense.DEF: using your authority in an unreasonable way
Sense.TRAN: 专横的﹐高压的﹐盛气凌人的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她憎恶他专横的态度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: high-handed and insensitive management decisions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专横﹑冷漠的管理决策

Sense.DEF: women’s shoes with high heels
noisy or excited behaviour when people are having fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: youthful high jinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人的狂欢作乐

Sense.DEF: a sports event in which someone runs and jumps over a bar that is raised higher each time they jump
if someone is for the high jump, they will be punished for something they have done wrong
relating to the Scottish Highlands or its people
Sense.TRAN: 苏格兰高地的﹔苏格兰高地人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Highland pipers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰高地的风笛手

Sense.DEF: in or relating to an area with a lot of mountains
Sense.EXAMPLE: the highland capital of Quito

Sense.DEF: someone from the Scottish Highlands
an area in the north of Scotland where there are a lot of mountains
an area of a country where there are a lot of mountains

Sense.DEF: in a powerful position or job, or involving people who are in powerful positions or jobs

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高层管理人员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high-level conference on arms control
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于军备控制的高层会议

Sense.DEF: at a high degree or strength

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该病毒对青霉素表现出很强的抗药性。

Sense.DEF: involving very technical or complicated ideas

to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
Sense.TRAN: 使…突出﹐使注意力集中于
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

Sense.DEF: to mark written words with a special coloured pen, or in a different colour on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔用色笔〕标出﹔〔在计算机上用不同颜色〕突出显示

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用光标将你要打印的文件的名称标出来。

Sense.DEF: to make some parts of your hair a lighter colour than the rest
Sense.TRAN: 将〔部分头发〕染成浅色﹐挑染

Sense.DEF: the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 11点30分我们将播放足总杯第三轮比赛的精彩片段。

Sense.DEF: areas of hair that have been made a lighter colour than the rest
a light bright area on a painting or photograph
Sense.TRAN: 〔绘画﹑照片上的〕强光部分﹐明亮部分

Sense.TRAN: 〔用来在书﹑文章等上标出重点的〕荧光笔

Sense.DEF: very

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a highly successful politician
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位非常成功的政治家

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom’s mother was highly critical of the school’s approach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

Sense.DEF: to a high level or standard

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个受过高水平教育的女人。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收入丰厚的专家

Sense.DEF: in an important or powerful position
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly placed government official

Sense.DEF: nervous and easily upset or excited

Sense.DEF: if you think highly of someone or something, you think they are very good and you admire them
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人﹑某事物〕非常赞许地﹐极为称赞地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always thought very highly of Michael.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对迈克尔的评价一直很高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly regarded author
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极受人尊敬的一位作家

Sense.DEF: needing a lot of care or attention

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要经常打理的发型

Sense.DEF: a very formal church ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以仁爱为题的情操高尚的讲道

Sense.DEF: used to speak to or about a prince or princess
Sense.TRAN: 殿下〔用于称呼或提到王子或公主〕

Sense.DEF: a highly praised film about the American Old West. The expression ‘high noon’ is sometimes used to describe an important moment in the history of something, especially its most successful point.

Sense.EXAMPLE: The 1987 election marked the high noon of Margaret Thatcher’s government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987年大选是玛格丽特•撒切尔政府的辉煌时刻。

Sense.DEF: high-octane petrol is of a very high quality
cars, computers etc that are able to go faster, do more work etc than normal ones

Sense.DEF: a high-pitched voice or sound is very high

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大马力的汽车

Sense.DEF: very important or successful

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位成功的出版商

Sense.DEF: a high-pressure job or situation is one in which you need to work very hard

the most important

in some religions

the most important

someone who has a high rank in an organization

the period of time during which the water in a river or the sea is at its highest level because of the

the mark that shows the highest level that the sea or a river reaches
the time when someone or something is most successful

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃雷拉总统任期内最成功的时期

a tightly stretched rope or wire high above the ground that someone walks along as part of a

performance
a piece of cloth covering the head and neck, which some Muslim women wear

Sense.DEF: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship

an American spelling of

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林间远足

Sense.DEF: a large increase in prices, wages, taxes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑工资﹑税款等的〕大幅度上升

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president has proposed a hike in the minimum wage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统提议大幅度提升最低工资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several airlines have proposed fare hikes, effective October 1.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几家航空公司已打算大幅提高机票价格﹐自10月1日起实施。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away
to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His dream is to hike the Appalachian Trail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的梦想是在阿巴拉契亚山道上徒步旅行。

Sense.DEF: to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount
Sense.TRAN: 大幅度提高〔价格﹑税款等〕

Sense.DEF: to lift up a piece of your clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hiked her skirt up to climb the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提起裙子上楼。

Sense.DEF: to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount
Sense.TRAN: 大幅度提高〔价格﹑税款等〕

Sense.DEF: someone who walks long distances in the mountains or country for pleasure
the activity of taking long walks in the mountains or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to do some hiking this summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年夏天我们要去远足。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Utah is a great place to go hiking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹他州是徒步旅行的绝好去处。

Sense.DEF: extremely funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hilarious story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极有趣的故事

Sense.DEF: laughter, or a feeling of fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eva joined in the hilarity as much as anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃和其他人一样尽情欢笑。

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is higher than the land around it, like a mountain but smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their house is on a hill overlooking the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子建在可以俯视大海的小山上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cart was making its way up the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆马车正在爬上山丘。

Sense.DEF: a slope on a road
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a steep hill ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前面有个陡坡。

Sense.DEF: no longer young, and therefore no longer attractive or good at doing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kathleen thinks she’s over the hill, but she’s only 32.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳觉得自己已经老了﹐可是她才32岁。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it doesn’t amount to a hill of beans
Sense.DEF: it is not important

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She pushed her bicycle up the steep hill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推着自行车登上陡峭的山坡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hills with slopes that are not steep
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He loved the green rolling hills of Dorset.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢多塞特青翠起伏的山峦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bus started going up the long hill into town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车开始爬上长长的山路进城。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: walk or drive up a hill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She climbed the hill out of the village.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爬上了村外的那座山。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s best to use a low gear when you are going down steep hills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下陡坡时最好用低速挡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The view from the top of the hill was beautiful.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶景色旖旎。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the top part of a hill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A tank appeared over the brow of the hill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶出现了一辆坦克。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the hill towns of Tuscany
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 托斯卡纳的山城

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rural area where there are a lot of hills

Sense.DEF: an insulting word meaning an uneducated poor person who lives in the mountains
Sense.TRAN: 山里人﹐乡巴佬〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: a little hill
the sloping side of a hill
a town in the hills in South Asia
the top of a hill
the activity of walking on hills for pleasure
having a lot of hills
the handle of a sword or knife, where the blade is attached
completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m backing the PM to the hilt on this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一问题上我全力支持首相。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you in love with him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爱上他了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you ask him yourself?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不自己问他？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He repeated what she had told him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她告诉他的话重复了一遍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew it was him as soon as I heard his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一听声音就知道是他。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female. Some people think this use is old-fashioned.
Sense.TRAN: 他﹔她〔统指男女﹐有些人认为此用法已过时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can convince a child you love him, you can teach him anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能让一个孩子相信你爱他﹐你就可以教他任何东西。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that the man or boy who does something is affected by his own action
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In despair, the young boy had hanged himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝望中﹐那男孩上吊自尽了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His name is James but he calls himself Jim.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字叫詹姆斯﹐但他称自己为吉姆。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He poured himself a glass of orange juice.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给自己倒了杯橙汁。

Subsense.DEF: used after words such as ‘everyone’, ‘anyone’, and ‘someone’ to talk about people in general being affected by their own actions
Subsense.TRAN: 自己〔用于everyone﹐anyone﹐someone之类的词语之后〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everyone should learn to respect himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都应学会尊重自己。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about one particular man or boy
Subsense.TRAN: 他自己﹐他本人〔用于强调〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was the President himself who opened the door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是总统本人开的门。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It must be true – he said so himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肯定是真的﹐是他亲口说的。

Subsense.DEF: used after ‘like’, ‘as’, or ‘except’ instead of ‘him’
Subsense.TRAN: 他〔用于like, as, except之后﹐代替him〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The other passengers were all refugees like himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他乘客和他一样都是难民。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s lived by himself since his wife died.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从妻子死后他一直独居。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Winston was sitting all by himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温斯顿一个人坐着。

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was the first time he felt he had achieved something by himself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他第一次感觉到自己独力干出了一些成绩。

Sense.DEF: if a man or boy is not himself, he does not feel or behave as he usually does, for example because he is upset or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔因情绪或身体欠佳等〕感觉不妥﹔行为反常
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick hasn’t seemed himself lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克近来似乎不大对劲。

Sense.DEF: if a man or boy has something to himself, he does not have to share it with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: John at last had a bedroom all to himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰终于自己有了一间卧室。

Sense.DEF: relating to the back part of an animal with four legs

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 后腿/后足/后臀及后腿/后肢

Crossrefto.REFLEX: talk the hind legs off a donkey

Sense.DEF:
a female
deer
to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career has been hindered by injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于受伤﹐他的事业受到了阻碍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: policies that will hinder rather than help families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对家庭有害无益的政策
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with prevent to make it impossible for someone to do something 不要与prevent（阻止）混淆:His poor health prevented him from going to work (NOT 不说 His poor health hindered him from going to work). 他身体不好﹐因而无法外出工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say something gets in the way of something rather than hinders it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们常说get in the way of,而不说hinder
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This could get in the way of rescue attempts.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能会妨碍救援行动。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Poor English got in the way of his progress.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语不好妨碍了他的进步。

Sense.DEF: an official language in India
the back part of an animal with four legs
something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something
Sense.TRAN: 起阻碍作用的人[事]﹔阻碍者﹔障碍物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The floods have been a major hindrance to relief efforts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水是救灾工作的一大障碍。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国工业界﹐学位反倒是个累赘。

Sense.DEF: the act of making it difficult for someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visitors are allowed to wander without hindrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客可以随意走动。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand a situation only after it has happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With hindsight, I should have seen the warning signs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事后想来﹐我是应该看见那些警示牌的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With the benefit of hindsight, it’s easy to criticize.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事后指责自然容易。

Sense.DEF: someone whose religion is Hinduism

the main religion in India, which includes belief in
reincarnation
a piece of metal fastened to a door, lid etc that allows it to swing open and shut
to attach something, using a hinge
if a result hinges on something, it depends on it completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: His political future hinges on the outcome of this election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政治前途取决于这次选举的结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case against him hinged on Lewis’ evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的指控是否成立﹐最终取决于刘易斯的证词。

Sense.DEF: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “听着﹐我不能告诉你。”“得了﹐给我一点暗示吧。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miles had been dropping heavy hints about the cost of petrol.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈尔斯一直在露骨地暗示汽油的费用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣﹐但他不明白我的意思。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount or sign of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘When?’ he asked with a hint of impatience﹐
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “什么时候？”他带着一丝不耐烦问道。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We shall have to turn back if there’s the slightest hint of fog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要有一丁点起雾的迹象我们就得往回走。

Sense.DEF: a useful piece of advice about how to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: helpful hints on looking after house plants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于打理室内植物的好建议

Sense.DEF: to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you hinting at?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在暗示什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hinted strongly that he might be prepared to send troops in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明确暗示他可能要派部队进驻。

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is far from the coast, large rivers, or the places where people live
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rural hinterland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内地乡村

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=home information pack房屋信息包

Sense.DEF: one of the two parts on each side of your body between the top of your leg and your waist
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood there with her hands on her hips glaring at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在那里﹐双手叉腰瞪着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old lady had fallen and broken her hip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那老妇人摔了一跤﹐髋部骨折。

Sense.DEF:
the red fruit of some kinds of
roses
doing things or done according to the latest fashion
Sense.EXAMPLE: McMillan’s novel gets my vote for hippest book of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为麦克米伦的小说是今年最时髦的书。

Sense.DEF: to learn about a new product, idea etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more people are getting hip to e-banking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人开始了解电子银行业务。

Sense.DEF: used as a shout of approval
Sense.TRAN: 加油！好哇！〔表示赞许的喊声〕

Sense.DEF: a small container for alcoholic drinks, that fits into your pocket
Sense.TRAN: 〔可放在裤子后袋里的〕扁平小酒瓶

Sense.DEF: a type of popular dance music with a regular heavy beat and spoken words
Sense.TRAN: 嘻哈乐〔节奏强烈﹑说唱形式的一种流行伴舞音乐〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of popular
culture
that began among young African-Americans in big cities, which includes hip hop music, dancing, and
graffiti
art
Sense.TRAN: 嘻哈文化〔包括嘻哈乐﹑舞蹈和涂鸦艺术〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially in the 1960s, who opposed violence peacefully and often wore unusual clothes, had long hair, and took drugs for pleasure
a hippopotamus
a back pocket in a pair of trousers or a skirt
the promise made by doctors that they will obey the principles of the medical profession
Sense.TRAN: 希波克拉底誓言〔医生保证遵守医疗行业操守的誓言〕

Sense.DEF: a large grey African animal with a big head and mouth that lives near water

another spelling of
hippie
someone who is considered fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Legendary hipsters Stomp bring street theater to Boston this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时髦而富有传奇色彩的Stomp乐团本周将把他们的街头剧表演带到波士顿。

Sense.DEF:
trousers that fit tightly over your
hips
and do not cover your waist
to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

Subsense.DEF: to employ someone for a short time to do a particular job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Employers hire skilled people on fixed-term contracts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主以签订固定期限的合同来雇用有技能的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A City lawyer has been hired to handle the case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 聘请了一位伦敦商业区的律师来处理这一案件。

Subsense.DEF: to employ someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Businesses may only hire foreign workers where an American cannot be found.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在找不到美国人的情况下企业才可能雇用外国工人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the power to hire and fire employ and dismiss people
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聘用和解雇的权力

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to borrow something for a short time in exchange for money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a little company that hires out boats to tourists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家向游客出租小船的小公司

Sense.DEF: to arrange to work for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were so poor they had to hire themselves out on the farms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们实在太穷﹐只得在农场打工。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car hire company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车租赁公司

GramExa.EXAMPLE: boats for hire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可供出租的小船

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crane is on hire from a local firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吊车是从当地一家公司租来的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed to help on a farm
someone who will work for anyone who will pay them – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 受雇听人使唤者〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a way of buying expensive goods by regularly paying small amounts over a period of time
having a lot of hair on your body and face
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体和面部〕多毛的﹐毛茸茸的

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leo took off his coat and sat down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利奥脱掉大衣坐了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love his sense of humour, don’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢他的幽默感﹐你呢？
