Sense.EXAMPLE: Even his own mother would not have recognized him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使他的亲生母亲也会认不出他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eyesight is better than his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的视力比他的好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis denies that the child is his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯否认那孩子是他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My relatives all live in the States – his are in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的亲戚都住在美国——他的亲戚都在法国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Garry introduced us to some friends of his .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖瑞把我们介绍给他的一些朋友。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Perhaps he’s ashamed of that car of his.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能他对自己的那辆车感到丢脸。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with someone who may be male or female. Some people think this use is old-fashioned.
Sense.TRAN: 他的﹔她的〔统指男女﹐有些人认为此用法已过时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone had his own work to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都有自己的工作要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the obligations of a doctor to his patients
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生对病人的义务

Sense.DEF: from or relating to countries where Spanish or Portuguese are spoken, especially ones in Latin America
Sense.TRAN: 来自说西班牙语[葡萄牙语]国家的﹔与说西班牙语[葡萄牙语]国家有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miami’s Hispanic community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈阿密的西裔美国人社区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hispanic Studies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙语国家研究

Sense.DEF: someone who comes from a country where Spanish or Portuguese is spoken, especially one in Latin America
Sense.TRAN: 来自说西班牙语[葡萄牙语]国家的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: In California, Hispanics make up 19.2 percent of the population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在加利福尼亚﹐西裔美国人占总人口的19.2%。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a loud whisper
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Get out!’ she hissed furiously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “出去！”她低声怒喝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hissed at me to be quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生气地低声要我安静。

Sense.DEF: to make a noise which sounds like ‘ssss’
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat backed away, hissing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫咝咝叫着退开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snakes only hiss when they are afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇只在恐惧时才发出声。

Sense.DEF: if a crowd hisses a speaker, they interrupt them with angry sounds to show that they do not like them
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不满而对演讲人〕发嘘声﹐（对…）报以嘘声
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was booed and hissed during a stormy meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在闹哄哄的会议中被人喝倒彩﹑发嘘声。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She heard a faint hiss as the metal struck the water.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听见金属碰到水时发出轻微的咝咝声。

Sense.DEF: a sudden moment of unreasonable anger and annoyance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Williams threw a hissy fit when she decided her hotel room wasn’t big enough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯发觉她的宾馆房间不够大﹐耍起了脾气。

Sense.DEF:
a chemical substance produced by your body during an
allergic
reaction

a
bar chart
someone who studies history, or the history of a particular thing

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 艺术/文学/军事等历史学家

Sense.DEF: a historic place or building is very old
Sense.EXAMPLE: the restoration of historic buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对历史建筑的修复
Sense.EXAMPLE: ancient historic sites
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的历史遗址
Sense.EXAMPLE: our historic monuments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们古老的纪念碑

Sense.DEF: a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history
Sense.TRAN: 历史上重要的﹐将载入史册的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a historic meeting of world leaders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有历史意义的世界领导人会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It is a historic moment ,’ he told journalists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是历史性的一刻。”他告诉新闻记者。

Sense.DEF: having taken place or existed in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s unlikely that the share price will exceed historic levels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价不太可能超过历史水平。

Sense.DEF: historic times are the periods of time whose history has been recorded
Sense.TRAN: 有历史记载的﹐有史以来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extinct volcanoes are those that have not erupted in historic times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死火山指有史以来没有喷发过的火山。

Sense.DEF: relating to the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: places of historical interest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史名胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

Sense.DEF: connected to the study of history
historical events, facts, people etc happened or existed in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was King Arthur a real historical figure?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚瑟王是真实的历史人物吗？

Sense.DEF: describing or based on events in the past
Sense.TRAN: 描写历史事件的﹔基于史实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a historical novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史小说

RunOn.EXAMPLE: How historically significant is this discovery?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一发现具有多大的历史意义？

Sense.DEF: the present tense, used in some languages to describe events in the past to make them seem more real
Sense.TRAN: 历史现在时〔在一些语言中﹐叙述过去发生的事情时使用现在时以求生动〕

Sense.DEF: all the things that happened in the past, especially the political, social, or economic development of a nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Throughout history the achievements of women have been largely ignored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从古至今﹐妇女的成就都被大大地忽视了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the post-war history of Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的战后历史

Sense.EXAMPLE: No man in recent history has done more to rebuild the Democratic Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对重建民主党的贡献在近代史上无人能及。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the early history of Scotland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰的早期历史
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other meteor storms have occurred in recorded history .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在有记载的历史上发生过其他的流星暴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a museum devoted to local history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专门介绍当地历史的博物馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the darkest episodes in American history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国历史上最黑暗的事件之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interesting period in Egyptian history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃及历史上一段有趣的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decision that changed the course of history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变历史进程的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: a college steeped in history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一所历史悠久的学院
Sense.EXAMPLE: History shows that the usual response to violent protest is repression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史表明﹐一般对待暴力抗议的回应就是镇压。

Sense.DEF: the events that took place from the beginning and during the development of a particular place, activity, institution etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the worst disaster in the history of space travel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航天史上最严重的灾难

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 1970s were the most successful in the theater’s long history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代是该剧院悠久历史中最成功的时期。

Sense.DEF: the study of past events as a subject in school or university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a degree in European history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲史学位

Sense.EXAMPLE: a history lesson
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堂历史课

Sense.DEF: an account of past events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a history of World War II
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战史
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a potted history very short of Gielgud’s life ( BrE 【英】 )
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔古德小传

Sense.DEF: a record of something that has affected someone or been done by them in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your doctor will ask for your medical history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生会询问你的病历。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there any history of heart disease in your family?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有家族心脏病史吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The defendant had a history of violent assaults on women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告曾有暴力袭击妇女的数次前科。

Sense.DEF: to do something important that will be recorded and remembered
Sense.TRAN: 创造历史﹐做出名垂青史的重要事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lindbergh made history when he flew across the Atlantic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林德伯格飞越大西洋﹐创造了历史。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth will go down in history
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is important enough to be remembered and recorded
Sense.EXAMPLE: This day will go down in history as the start of a new era in South Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天将作为南非新时代的开始而被载入史册。

Sense.DEF: used to say that things often happen in the same way as they did before
the record of past events
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mozart’s genius earned him a place in the history books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特的天赋使他名垂青史。

Sense.DEF: used to say that everyone knows the rest of a story you have been telling
Sense.TRAN: 接下来的事就谁都知道了

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important any more
Sense.TRAN: 那已是往事了〔表示某事已不再重要〕

Sense.DEF: very loud and emotional behaviour that is intended to get sympathy and attention – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔为引起他人同情和注意的〕矫揉造作﹐装腔作势〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to touch someone or something quickly and hard with your hand, a stick etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised the hammer and hit the bell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举起钟锤敲钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The robbers hit him over the head with a baseball bat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劫匪用棒球棒击打他的头部。

Sense.DEF: to move into something or someone quickly and with force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tanks exploded as the plane hit the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机坠地时油箱发生爆炸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was hit by a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被汽车撞了。

Sense.DEF: to move a part of your body quickly against something accidentally, causing pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceiling’s low, so be careful you don’t hit your head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花板很低﹐小心别撞头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slipped and hit her head on the sidewalk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她滑了一跤﹐头撞在人行道上。

Subsense.DEF:
if you hit a ball or other object, you make it move forward quickly by hitting it with a
bat
, stick etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hit the ball as hard as you can.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用最大的力气击球。

Subsense.DEF:
to get points by hitting a ball in a game such as
baseball
or
cricket
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Last year, Griffey hit 49 home runs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年格里菲击出了49个本垒打。

Sense.DEF: to press a part in a machine, car, etc to make it work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria hit the brakes just in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚及时踩了车。

Sense.DEF: to attack something or wound someone with a bomb, bullet etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our ship was badly hit and sank within minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的船遭到重创后﹐没过几分钟便沉没了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A second shot hit her in the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二枪击中了她的背部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb failed to hit its target .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹没有命中目标。

Sense.DEF: if something bad hits a place or a person, it suddenly happens and affects people badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village has been hit by a devastating drought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个村庄遭受了严重的干旱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurricane Louis is expected to hit at the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飓风“路易斯”预计本周末来袭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has been hard hit by the drop in consumer confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司因为消费者信心下滑遭受了沉重的打击。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The south of the country is the worst hit by the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的南部受经济衰退的冲击最为严重。

Sense.DEF: to experience trouble, problems etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: hit a snag/problems/a bad patch etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father hit a bad patch, he had to sell the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲遇到了大麻烦﹐只得把房子卖掉。

Sense.DEF: to reach a particular level or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales have hit the 1 million mark .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额达到100万大关。

GramExa.PROPFORM: hit a peak/an all-time high etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Earnings hit a peak in the early 1980s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代初利润达到最高水平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oil prices have hit rock-bottom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价已降到最低点。

Sense.DEF: if a fact hits you, you suddenly realize its importance and feel surprised or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to pinpoint a moment when it hit me that I was ‘a success’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法准确说出是在哪一刻我突然意识到自己是个“成功人士”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was gone before they knew what had hit them realized what had happened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还没意识到发生了什么﹐他就已经走了。

Sense.DEF: if a smell or sight hits you, you suddenly smell or see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell of stale smoke hit him as he entered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他进去的时候一股难闻的烟味扑鼻而来。

Sense.DEF: to arrive at a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hit the main road two kilometres further on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们往前走了两公里后到了大路上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll look for work as soon as I hit town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一到镇上就会去找工作。

Sense.DEF: to begin a journey
if a product hits the shops, it becomes available to buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to get a copy of the book before it hit the shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书上市前我设法弄到了一本。

Sense.DEF: to be reported widely on television, in newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple hit the headlines last year when their relationship broke down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对夫妻去年因为关系破裂而上了报纸头条。

Sense.DEF: to start drinking too much alcohol regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: After his marriage failed, he hit the bottle big time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他婚姻失败后便开始酗酒。

Sense.DEF: to fall to the ground in order to avoid something dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔为躲避危险之物而〕扑倒在地
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first instinct was to hit the dirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一反应就是扑倒在地上。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly not be able to make any progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt I’d hit a wall with my playing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我的演奏技巧突然停滞不前。

Sense.DEF: if a plan, project etc hits the buffers, it fails
Sense.EXAMPLE: Croft’s comeback hit the skids yesterday when she lost in the quarter-finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天克罗夫特在四分之一决赛中落败﹐她东山再起的计划落空了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: hit sb when they are down
Sense.DEF: to upset or harm someone when they are already defeated
Sense.TRAN: 乘人之危打击某人﹐对某人落井下石

Sense.DEF: to do something that you know will upset someone in the most damaging way
Sense.TRAN: 攻击某人的要害﹐打某人的痛处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hit your husband where it hurts – in his wallet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要击中你丈夫的要害——瞄准他的钱包！

Sense.DEF: if two people hit it off, they like each other as soon as they meet
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew you’d hit it off with Mike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就知道你与迈克会一见如故的。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very famous, successful, and rich
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 25-year-old painter hopes to hit it big in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位25岁的画家希望能在纽约一举成名。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something successfully without any delay
Sense.TRAN: 立刻着手顺利地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Law graduates are expected to hit the ground running.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们期望法律系学生一毕业就能过得顺风顺水。

Subsense.DEF: to win a lot of money
to have a big success
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Owens hit the jackpot in his first professional game with the Cowboys.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文斯在加盟牛仔队后的第一场职业赛中便大获成功。

Sense.LEXUNIT: hit the nail on the head
Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone has said is exactly right
Sense.TRAN: 正中要害﹐一针见血﹐一语中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve hit the nail on the head there, David.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说到点子上了﹐戴维。

Subsense.DEF: if a remark, criticism etc about you hits home, you realize that it is true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Graham didn’t reply, but she could see her words had hit home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆没有回答﹐但她能看出自己的话说到点子上了。

Subsense.DEF: if a blow or kick hits home, it hits the thing it is aimed at

Sense.DEF: to have exactly the good effect that you wanted, especially when you are hungry or thirsty
Sense.TRAN: 恰到好处﹔切合需要﹔让人吃饱喝足

Sense.DEF: to be very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ranieri returned, saw the mess, and hit the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉涅里回来看到一片狼藉的情景便大发雷霆。

Sense.DEF: to go to bed

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone quickly and hard with your hand, a stick etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hit him hard in the stomach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他狠狠地打他的肚子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t like to see people hitting a dog.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢看到别人打狗。

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone deliberately many times, especially very hard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girl had been beaten to death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩被殴打致死。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was beating the donkey with a stick.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在用棍子打驴。

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone with your hand or a weapon. Strike is more formal than hit and is mainly used in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用手﹑武器〕打﹐击﹐撞〔strike比hit更正式﹐主要用于书面英语中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her husband struck her twice across the face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的丈夫打了她两个耳光。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police say that the man had been struck on the head.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说该男子头部遭击打。

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone hard with your closed hand, especially in a fight
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I punched him on the nose.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一拳打在他鼻子上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was screaming and punching him with her fists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一边尖叫,一边用拳头打他。

Exponent.DEF: to punch someone very hard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I just want to thump him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我真想狠狠地揍他。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt someone badly in a violent attack, by hitting them many times
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If I tell the police, they'll beat me up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我告诉警察﹐他们会把我毒打一顿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had been beaten up and tortured with lighted cigarettes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被毒打﹐并遭受用香烟烫的酷刑。

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone with your open hand, especially because you are angry with them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had a big row and she ended up slapping him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们大吵了一架﹐最后她掴了他一巴掌。

Exponent.DEF: to hit someone, especially a child, with your open hand in order to punish them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Should a parent ever smack a child?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母该不该打孩子？

Section.SECHEADING: to hit something 击打某物

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jack hit the ball and it flew over the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克击球﹐球飞过了围栏。

Exponent.DEF: to hit a door or window with your closed hand in order to attract the attention of the people inside
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone was knocking on the door.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在敲门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I knocked loudly but no one came.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大声敲门﹐可是没人过来应门。

Exponent.DEF: to hit a surface. Strike is more formal than hit and is mainly used in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 打﹐击﹐撞〔strike比hit更正式,主要用于英语书面语中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ball struck the side of the goal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球打在球门的侧面。

Exponent.DEF: to hit something very hard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Edmonds whacked the ball into the air.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德蒙兹猛力把球击向空中。

Exponent.DEF: to hit something hard, especially in a way that causes damage
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police had to bash the door down to get in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方只得破门而入。

Exponent.DEF: to gently hit something with your fingers, often in order to attract someone’s attention
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常为引起某人注意而用手指〕轻叩﹐轻拍
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tapped him on the shoulder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我轻轻拍了拍他的肩膀。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard someone tapping on the window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见有人在轻轻地敲窗户。

Exponent.DEF: to knock quickly or hit something several times
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He rapped the table with his pen to bring the meeting to order.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用笔敲了敲桌子﹐要大家保持会场秩序。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly hit something hard, in a way that makes a loud noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her father banged his fist down on the table angrily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲气愤地一拳砸到桌上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The door suddenly banged shut.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 门突然砰的一声关上了。

Exponent.DEF: to hit something many times with a lot of force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I could hear the sea pounding on the rocks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见海浪猛烈地拍击着岩石。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She pounded on the door and shouted wildly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她捶着门疯狂地叫喊。

Exponent.DEF: to hit something quickly many times making a loud continuous noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rain was hammering on the roof.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨噼噼啪啪地打在屋顶上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A crowd of people were outside hammering on the door angrily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一群人在外面怒气冲冲地砰砰打门。

Section.SECHEADING: to hit something accidentally 意外撞到某物

Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a bad bruise where I hit my leg against the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我腿上撞到桌子的地方青肿得厉害。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car hit a tree.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车撞到了一棵树。

Exponent.DEF: to hit a part of your body against something, especially because you do not see or notice it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因没看见或没注意而〕猛碰﹐撞
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Careful you don’t bump your head – the ceiling’s very low.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心别撞头——天花板很低。

Exponent.DEF: to hit something hard, so that you hurt yourself or damage something
Exponent.TRAN: 撞击〔致使自己受伤或撞坏某物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He banged into the car in front.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撞上了前面那辆车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I bashed my knee climbing over a gate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我攀爬大门时撞伤了膝盖。

Exponent.DEF: to hit your toe against something and hurt it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I stubbed my toe on the piano leg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一不小心﹐脚趾踢到了钢琴腿。

Sense.DEF: to attack or criticize a person or group that has attacked or criticized you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The actress hit back at claims that she had threatened a member of staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位女演员对她威胁一名工作人员的说法予以反驳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: United were a goal down, but hit back with an equalizer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队曾落后一球﹐但进了一球扳平了比分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hit back by calling his critics ‘lazy’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回击他的批评者﹐称他们 “懒散”。

Sense.DEF: to have an idea or discover something suddenly or unexpectedly
Sense.TRAN: 突然想出〔主意〕﹐无意中发现〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then we hit on the idea of asking viewers to donate money over the Net.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后我们突然想出了让电视观众通过网络捐钱的主意。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone in a way that shows you are sexually attracted to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave has hit on most of the women in the department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫挑逗过部门里的大多数女性。

Sense.DEF: to try to hit someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he felt someone grab him, he hit out wildly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得有人抓住了他﹐便奋力回击。

Sense.DEF: to express strong disapproval of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bishop hit out at the government’s policy on the homeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主教猛烈抨击政府对无家可归者的政策。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did he hit you up for cash again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又问你要钱了吗？

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something interesting, exciting, or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 把〔有趣的﹑刺激的﹑吓人的事等〕告诉〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next morning, Steve hit me with the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早晨﹐史蒂夫把真相告诉了我。

Sense.DEF: to punish or try to harm someone by doing something that will cause problems for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过制造麻烦〕惩罚﹔伤害〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next day, we found they’d hit us with a lawsuit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天﹐我们发现他们要起诉我们。

Sense.DEF: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful
Sense.TRAN: 风行一时的事物〔如电影﹑戏剧﹑歌曲等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the hit musical ‘Phantom of the Opera’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风靡一时的音乐剧《歌剧魅影》

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Beatles’ greatest hits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 披头士乐队最受欢迎的歌曲

Sense.EXAMPLE: Which band had a hit with ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《波希米亚狂想曲》是哪支乐队风行一时的歌曲？

GramExa.GLOSS: be liked by them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hoped the new museum will be a big hit with families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们希望新博物馆会受到众多家庭的喜爱。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something that is aimed at something else touches it, reaches it, or damages it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our ship took a direct hit and sank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的船被直接击中下沉了。

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when someone visits a website
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The site had 2,000 hits in the first week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该网站在第一周内有2,000次点击量。

Subsense.DEF: a result of a computer search, especially on the Internet
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指在因特网上的〕搜索结果
Subsense.EXAMPLE: thousands of irrelevant hits
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几千个不相关的搜索结果

Sense.DEF: to be badly affected in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The region’s economy will take a hit if the airbase is closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果该空军基地被关闭﹐该地区的经济将受到严重影响。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of pleasure obtained from taking an illegal drug
a murder that has been arranged to happen
done in a way that is not planned or organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign was rather a hit-and-miss affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次运动欠缺周详的计划。

Sense.DEF: a hit-and-run accident is one in which a car driver hits someone and does not stop to help
Sense.TRAN: 〔交通事故中司机〕肇事逃逸的

Sense.DEF: to get free rides from the drivers of passing cars by standing at the side of the road and putting a hand out with the thumb raised

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He plans to hitch right round the coast of Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他计划就环绕爱尔兰海岸搭便车旅行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hitched a ride with a trucker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们搭乘了一位卡车司机的便车。

Sense.DEF: to move a piece of clothing you are wearing so that it is higher than it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hitched her skirt above her knees and knelt down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把裙子提到膝盖上﹐然后跪了下来。

Sense.DEF: to get married
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got hitched without telling their parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有告诉父母就结婚了。

Sense.DEF: to lift yourself into a higher position by pushing with your hands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gail hitched herself up onto the high stool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖尔爬上了高凳。

Subsense.DEF: to fasten something to something else, using a rope, chain etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hitched our pickup to his trailer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我们的小卡车挂在他的拖车上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a goat hitched to a fence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拴在篱笆上的山羊

Subsense.DEF: to fasten an animal to something with wheels so that the animal can pull it forwards
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I hitched up the horse and drove out into the fields.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把马套上车﹐赶着它往田里走。

Sense.DEF: a small problem that makes something difficult or delays it for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In spite of some technical hitches, the first program was a success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管出现了一些小小的技术故障﹐第一个节目还是很成功。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole show went without a hitch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整场演出进行得非常顺利。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually prefer to use (small/minor) problem rather than hitch , which sounds slightly informal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语书面语中,人们一般更喜欢用 (small/minor) problem ,而不用hitch﹐hitch听上去略微有些不正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There was some minor technical problems when the product was first released.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 该产品刚推出时出现一些小小的技术问题。

Sense.DEF: a type of knot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a half hitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半结

Sense.DEF: to travel to places by getting free rides from drivers of passing cars

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spent her gap year hitchhiking around the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在上大学前的空档年搭便车环游世界各地。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I picked up a hitchhiker on our way back.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在回来的路上捎了一个搭便车的人。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
high-tech
here
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coloured fish darted hither and thither backwards and forwards .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五彩斑斓的鱼游来游去。

Sense.DEF: up to this time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

Sense.DEF: the names of people, organizations etc that a person or group plans to harm
Sense.TRAN: 〔有计划地针对某些人或组织等的〕打击名单﹐袭击名单

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was on a terrorist’s hit list.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上了恐怖分子的袭击名单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company drew up a hit list of shops it expects to close.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司列出了一份分店的名单﹐打算向它们开刀﹐予以关闭。

Sense.DEF: a criminal who is employed to kill someone

another spelling of
high-tops
a list that shows which popular records have sold the most copies
a group of criminals who are employed to kill someone
Sense.TRAN: 职业杀手团伙﹐受雇杀人小集团

Sense.DEF:
a type of
virus a very small living thing that causes disease
that enters the body through blood or sexual activity, and can develop into
aids
Sense.TRAN: 人类免疫缺陷病毒﹐艾滋病病毒

GramExa.GLOSS: having or not having HIV in your body
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 艾滋病病毒检测呈阳性的/阴性的

Sense.DEF:
a small box where
bees
are kept, or the bees that live in this box
a place that is full of people who are very busy
Sense.TRAN: 人群繁忙的场所﹐熙熙攘攘的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: This marketplace was once a hive of activity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个市场曾经熙熙攘攘。

Sense.DEF: a skin disease in which a person’s skin becomes red and sore
to sell one part of a business
Sense.EXAMPLE: the trend for television companies to hive off their advertising departments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视公司出售广告部门的趋势

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘hello’
a sound that you make to express doubt, a pause, or disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 唔﹐嗯﹐哼﹐呣〔表示怀疑﹑停顿或不赞同的轻哼声〕
the abbreviation of 缩写=His/Her Majesty 陛下
Sense.EXAMPLE: HM the Queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王陛下

Sense.DEF: used before the name of a ship in the British navy
Sense.TRAN: 英国皇家海军舰艇〔用于舰艇名前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: HMS Belfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国皇家海军战舰“贝尔法斯特”号

Sense.DEF:
a British college or university examination, usually in a technical or business subject. HNCs are lower in level than
hnds
.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学科技或商务学科的〕国家高级证书（考试）〔其等级低于HND（国家高级文凭）〕

Sense.DEF: a British college or university examination, usually in a technical or business subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学科技或商务学科的〕国家高级文凭（考试）

Sense.DEF:
a
prostitute
an offensive word for a woman or girl who you do not respect because she is too willing to have sex with many different people
a collection of things that someone hides somewhere, especially so they can use them later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discovery of a hoard of gold coins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批秘藏金币的发现

Sense.DEF: to collect and save large amounts of food, money etc, especially when it is not necessary to do so
Sense.TRAN: 贮藏﹐囤积〔尤指没有必要这么做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: families who hoarded food during the strike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工期间囤积食品的家庭

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m a hoarder when it comes to clothes.

Sense.DEF: a large board fixed high on a wall outside on which large advertisements are shown
Sense.EXAMPLE: advertising hoardings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大幅大幅的广告牌

Sense.DEF: a high fence around a piece of land where something is being built
a thin layer of ice that forms on objects outside when it is very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light hoarfrost covered the fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一层薄薄的冰霜覆盖了田野。

Sense.DEF: if you are hoarse, or if your voice is hoarse, you speak in a low rough voice, for example because your throat is sore
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was hoarse from laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑得嗓子都沙哑了。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 沙哑的嗓音/耳语/呻吟等

Sense.DEF: a hoary joke, remark etc is so well-known that people no longer find it amusing or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not that hoary old chestnut old idea, joke, remark etc again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再说那老掉牙的话了。

Sense.DEF: grey or white in colour, especially through age
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因年迈而变得〕灰白[花白]的

Sense.DEF: a false warning about something dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bomb hoax
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚假炸弹恐吓
Sense.EXAMPLE: hoax calls telephone calls giving false information to the police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶作剧报警电话

Sense.DEF: an attempt to make people believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elaborate hoax
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精心设计的骗局

Sense.DEF:
the flat top of a
cooker
to walk with difficulty, especially because your legs or feet hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hobbled into the room on crutches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拄着T形拐杖一瘸一拐地走入屋内。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make sure that a plan, system etc cannot work successfully
Sense.TRAN: 妨碍〔计划﹑系统等的运作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many start-ups are hobbled by a lack of sufficient capital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多新公司由于资金不足而陷入困境。

Sense.DEF: to loosely fasten two of an animal’s legs together, to stop it from running away
Sense.TRAN: 〔松松地〕捆缚〔动物〕的腿〔以防止其跑掉〕

Sense.DEF: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are your hobbies?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有些什么爱好？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan’s hobbies include reading, cooking, and drama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊的业余爱好包括阅读﹑烹饪和戏剧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Retirement gave him the time to pursue his hobbies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休以后他有充裕的时间来做自己喜欢做的事。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a magazine for aircraft modelling hobbyists
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本为飞机模型制作爱好者办的杂志

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often talk about what they do in their free time rather than use the word hobbies .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示业余爱好常说(what they do) in (their) free time﹐而不用单词hobbies
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What do you do in your free time?
In my free time, I like reading and cooking.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我空闲时喜欢阅读和烹饪。

Sense.DEF: a subject that someone has strong opinions about and that they talk about too much
Sense.TRAN: 过多谈论[反复唠叨]的话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid safe driving isn’t Jaqui’s only hobbyhorse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕安全驾驶不是雅基唯一过多谈论的话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vicky was on her hobbyhorse again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 薇姬又在谈她的老话题了。

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned toy made of a horse’s head on a stick
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童夹在胯下当马骑的〕竹马﹐马头杆

Sense.DEF:
a
goblin
hobnailed boots have large nails fastened to the bottom to make them last longer
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使靴子耐穿在靴底〕钉了平头钉的

Sense.DEF: to spend time talking to people who are in a higher social position than you
Sense.TRAN: 〔与比自己社会地位高的人〕交谈﹐攀谈

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spent the first day hobnobbing with the management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一天他就和管理层交谈套近乎。

Sense.DEF: someone who travels around and has no home or regular job
a situation in which there is only one thing you can do, so you do not really have any choice at all
a German white wine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of hock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯莱茵白葡萄酒

Subsense.DEF: in debt

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fashion chain is still in hock to the banks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家时装连锁店仍欠着银行的债。

Subsense.DEF: something that is in hock has been sold temporarily because its owner needs some money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s a musician, but his guitar is in hock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是乐手﹐可他把吉他典当了。

Sense.DEF: a piece of meat from above the foot of a pig
Sense.EXAMPLE: pork hocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪腿肉

Sense.DEF: the middle joint of an animal’s back leg
to sell something temporarily because you need some money
a game played on grass by two teams of 11 players, with sticks and a ball
a game similar to hockey, but played on ice
a method or belief that you think is based on false ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks psychology is a load of hocus-pocus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为心理学是一套骗人的把戏。

Sense.DEF: a box with a long handle, used for carrying bricks
a lot of things mixed up together in no order
Sense.TRAN: 杂乱无章的一堆东西﹔大杂烩

Sense.DEF:
a garden tool with a long handle, used for removing
weeds unwanted plants
from the surface of the soil
a large pig that is kept for its meat
to do something thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go the whole hog and order champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们索性点香槟吧。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly do an activity in an uncontrolled way
someone who takes too much of something that should be shared
Sense.EXAMPLE: You greedy hog!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个贪婪鬼！

Sense.DEF: to keep, use, or have all of something that should be shared
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much longer are you going to hog the bathroom?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还要占用浴室多久啊？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been hogging the limelight having all the attention, praise etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是抢风头。

Sense.DEF: New Year’s Eve and the parties that take place at that time in Scotland
a large container for holding beer, or the amount that it holds
stupid or untrue talk
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a load of hogwash!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一派胡言！

Sense.DEF: used to represent the sound of laughter
used to say that you are bored
to lift or pull something up with a sudden movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hoicked her skirt up and began to dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把裙子往上一提﹐跳起舞来。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 草民﹐乌合之众〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be hoist with/by your own petard
Sense.DEF: to be harmed or embarrassed by the plans you had made to hurt other people – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 搬起石头砸自己的脚﹐害人反害己〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boat hoist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吊艇机

Sense.DEF: a movement that lifts something up
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me a hoist onto your shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我扛到肩膀上吧。

Sense.DEF: expressing emotions in an old-fashioned or silly way
Sense.TRAN: 〔表达感情时〕装腔作势的﹔陈词滥调的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hokey song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首风格陈旧的无聊歌曲

Sense.DEF: something that seems true or impressive but that is wrong or not sincere
Sense.TRAN: 空话﹐废话﹐胡扯﹐花言巧语
Sense.EXAMPLE: All that talk is just a bunch of hokum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那统统不过是一堆空话而已。

Subsense.DEF: to have something in your hand, hands, or arms
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Could you hold my bag for me?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我拿着包吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was holding a knife in one hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手中拿着一把刀。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I held the baby in my arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把宝宝抱在怀里。

GramExa.GLOSS: hold each other’s hands
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sat holding hands under a tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们手拉着手坐在树下。

GramExa.GLOSS: with your arms around someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Max held her close and wiped away her tears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯抱紧她并给她擦去眼泪。

Subsense.DEF: to move your hand or something in your hand in a particular direction
Subsense.TRAN: 使〔手﹑手持之物〕处于某种位置

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He held out his hand to help her to her feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸出手帮助她站起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hold the picture up so we can see it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把图片举高好让我们看到。

Sense.DEF: to have a meeting, party, election etc in a particular place or at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: This year’s conference will be held at the Hilton Hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的会议将在希尔顿酒店召开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A thanksgiving ceremony was held to mark the occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举行了一个感恩仪式以庆祝这一特别的时刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The funeral was held on a grey day in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葬礼在11月的一个阴天举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In April, the President held talks with Chinese leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月﹐总统和中国领导人举行了会谈。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 使某物保持在某种位置上
Sense.DEF: to make something stay in a particular position
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕保持〔在某种位置上〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We used rolled-up newspapers to hold the windows open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用卷起的报纸抵住窗户让它们开着。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remember to hold your head up and keep your back straight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住要抬头挺胸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A couple of screws should hold it in place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个螺钉就可以把它固定住了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Lift your head off the floor and hold this position for five seconds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把头抬离地面﹐保持这个姿势五秒钟。

Subsense.DEF: to have a particular job or position, especially an important one
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you really think he’s capable of holding such a responsible position?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的认为他能担任这个责任重大的职位吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was the first woman to hold the office of Australian state premier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是第一位担任澳大利亚州总理的女性。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The governor had held the post since 1989.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位州长自1989年起一直在任。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whoever is elected will hold office have an important political position for four years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当选者任期为四年。

Subsense.DEF: to have a particular title or record, because you have won a competition, are the best at something etc
Subsense.TRAN: 拥有〔头衔﹑称号〕﹔保持〔纪录〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The programme still holds the record for the longest running TV series.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目仍然保持着播放时间最长的电视系列节目这一纪录。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The last Briton to hold the title was Bert Nicholson.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一名拥有该称号的英国人是伯特•尼科尔森。

Sense.DEF: to keep something to be used when it is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further copies of the book are held in the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书在图书馆还存有一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weapons were held at various sites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武器存放在不同地点。

Sense.DEF: to agree not to give something such as a ticket, a place at a restaurant, a job etc to anyone except a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某人〕保留〔票﹑餐厅座位﹑工作等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can hold the reservation for you until next Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以把您的预订保留到下星期五。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t expect them to hold the job open for much longer – you’ll have to decide whether you want it or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要以为他们还会保留这个空缺职位很长时间——你必须决定要不要接受。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone somewhere, and not allow them to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are holding two men in connection with the robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方拘留了同抢劫案有关联的两名男子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A senior army officer was held hostage for four months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名高级军官被扣押为人质达四个月。

GramExa.GLOSS: keep someone somewhere and not allow them to communicate with anyone

Sense.DEF: to have a particular opinion or belief
Sense.TRAN: 持有﹐怀有〔某种观点或信念〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experts hold varying opinions as to the causes of the disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家们对该病的病因各持不同意见。

GramExa.GLOSS: be the opinion of a lot of people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This view is not widely held.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 持这种观点的人并不多见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was held to be one of the most talented actors of her time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被认为是她那个时代最有天赋的演员之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge held that the child’s interests in this case must come first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官认为﹐该案必须首先考虑孩子的利益。

Sense.DEF: to say or decide that someone should accept the responsibility for something bad that happens
Sense.TRAN: 认为某人应该（为某事）负责﹐要某人（对某事）负责
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anything happens to her, I’ll hold you personally responsible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她出了什么事﹐我就唯你是问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may have had a terrible childhood, but he should still be held accountable for his own actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的童年也许是很不幸﹐但他仍然要为自己的行为负责。

Sense.DEF: to officially own or possess money, a document, a company etc
Sense.TRAN: 持有﹐拥有〔金钱﹑证件﹑公司等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He holds shares in ICI.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他持有帝国化学工业集团的股份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you hold a valid passport?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你持有有效护照吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a privately held company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私有公司

Sense.DEF: to have the space to contain a particular amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie theater holds 500 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家电影院能容纳500人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tank should hold enough to last us a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油箱应该可以存足够的油﹐让我们用上几天。

Sense.DEF: to be strong enough to support the weight of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careful! I’m not sure that branch will hold you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心！我觉得那根树枝承受不了你的重量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge didn’t look as though it would hold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座桥似乎要撑不住了。

Sense.DEF: to stay at a particular amount, level, or rate, or to make something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）保持〔某种数量﹑水平或速度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank is holding interest rates at 4%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行将利率维持在4%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since then, the pound has held steady against the dollar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那时起﹐英镑对美元的汇率一直保持稳定。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone stay interested
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使某人保持兴趣/注意力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Colourful pictures help hold the students’ interest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩缤纷的图片有助于使学生保持兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to continue to be true, good, available etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I said yesterday holds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨天说的仍然有效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does your invitation still hold?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的邀请还算数吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Twenty years on, his advice still holds good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了二十年﹐他的建议依然适用。

GramExa.GLOSS: continues to be good
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If our luck holds, we could reach the final.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果继续走运﹐我们有望进入决赛。

Sense.DEF: used in particular phrases to tell someone to wait or not to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些短语中〕停止﹔别做〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a tuna fish sandwich please – and hold the mayo do not give me any .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我来一份金枪鱼三明治——不要蛋黄酱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hold it! We’re not quite ready.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等！我们还没准备好呢。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone to do something more slowly or carefully

Sense.DEF: to behave as if you are proud of yourself or respect yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: They may have lost the game, but I still think they’ve earned the right to hold their heads high today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们也许是输掉了这场比赛﹐但我仍然认为今天他们有权利昂首挺胸。

Subsense.DEF: to deliberately not breathe out for a short time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hold your breath and count to ten.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏住呼吸数到十。

Subsense.DEF: to not breathe out and try not to make a sound because you do not want to be noticed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Julie shrank back against the wall and held her breath.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉缩到墙边﹐屏住呼吸。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not expect something to happen, even though someone has said it will
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He promised he’d phone, but I’m not holding my breath.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他答应要打电话的﹐不过我可不指望他会打。

Subsense.DEF: to not shoot at someone when you were going to
to not criticize, attack, or oppose someone when you were going to
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The President urged his party to hold fire on the issue a few days longer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统敦促他的政党在这个问题上再忍耐几天﹐不要“开火”。

Sense.DEF: to wait until the person you have telephoned is ready to answer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Stevens is busy at the moment – would you like to hold?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文斯先生现在正忙﹐你要等吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please hold the line while I transfer you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请稍等﹐我给您转接。

Sense.DEF: if an army holds a place, it controls it or defends it from attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: The French army held the town for three days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法军在这个镇防守了三天。

Sense.DEF: to make a musical note continue for a particular length of time
if the future holds something, that is what may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of workers are waiting to see what the future holds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几千名工人对未来的局势拭目以待。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many church services hold little appeal for modern tastes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多教堂的礼拜仪式对于现代人缺乏吸引力。

Sense.DEF: to successfully defend yourself or succeed in a difficult situation, competition etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在困境﹑比赛等中〕固守阵地﹐（与某人）针锋相对
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a good enough player to hold his own against the Americans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个优秀的球员﹐有足够的能力与美国人较量。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not hold a candle to sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be much worse than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 远比不上某人/某物﹐无法与某人/某物相比

Sense.DEF: to be left as the only person responsible for dealing with a difficult situation, especially something someone else started
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was left holding the financial baby when his musical partner joined another band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐搭档加入了另一支乐队﹐所以在经济上他不得不独力承担。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of influence or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Among people here, traditional values still hold sway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里的人中﹐传统的价值观仍占主导地位。

Sense.DEF: to get the attention of everyone while you are talking, especially when you are trying to entertain people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joey would walk into the bar and hold court all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔伊进了酒吧就会成为人们整晚注意的焦点。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop talking or to not tell someone about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I reckon you’ve just got to learn to hold your tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你要学会管好你的嘴巴。

Sense.DEF: to have all the advantages in a situation in which people are competing or arguing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘There’s not much we can do. They seem to hold all the cards,’ said Dan gloomily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们没什么办法了﹐他们好像已经占了绝对优势。”丹沮丧地说。

Sense.DEF: to keep believing strongly in something
to have a conversation
to be responsible for something while the person usually responsible for it is not there
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s holding the fort while the manager’s on holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理休假﹐她负责处理事务。

Sense.DEF: to be winning in a competition, game etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Celtic held the lead in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上半场比赛中﹐凯尔特人队领先。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is so determined to do something that you cannot prevent them from doing it
to be able to drink a lot of alcohol without getting drunk or ill
if an excuse, a statement etc does not hold water, it does not seem to be true or reasonable
Sense.TRAN: 〔借口﹑陈述等〕站不住脚﹐不可信

Sense.DEF: to care about something or someone a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were facing the loss of everything we held dear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们面临着失去全部所爱的可能。

Sense.DEF: if a car holds the road well you can drive it quickly around bends without losing control
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车急转弯时〕抓地性能良好

Exponent.DEF: to have something in your hand, hands, or arms
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Maria came in holding a letter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚手里拿着一封信走进来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I hold the baby?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以抱抱宝宝吗？

Exponent.DEF: to hold something very tightly and not let it go
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gripped her arm so she couldn’t walk away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他紧紧抓住她的胳膊不让她走开。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jenny gripped the side of the boat to steady herself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮紧紧抓住船帮来稳住自己。

Exponent.DEF: to hold something tightly, especially because you do not want to drop or lose it
Exponent.TRAN: 紧握﹐紧抓〔尤因不想摔掉或失去某物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A businessman hurried past, clutching his briefcase.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个生意人手中紧抓着公文包匆匆走过。

Exponent.DEF: to hold someone or something tightly, closing your fingers or arms around them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was clasping a bunch of small summer flowers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧紧握着一束夏天的小花。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He clasped her in his arms and kissed her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将她紧紧搂在怀里亲吻她。

Exponent.DEF: to take something in your hand or hands and hold it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I took hold of the handle and pulled as hard as I could.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抓住把手狠命一拉。

Exponent.DEF: to take hold of something firmly, especially in a determined way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She grasped the lowest branch and pulled herself up into the tree.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧紧抓住最下面那根树枝﹐纵身一跃爬到树上。

Exponent.DEF: to take hold of something suddenly and often violently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He grabbed my bag and ran off with it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抢过我的包就逃走了。

Exponent.DEF: to take hold of something suddenly and often violently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A police officer ran after him and seized the gun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警察在后面追他﹐并夺下他的枪。

Exponent.DEF: to hold on to something or someone tightly to support yourself
Exponent.TRAN: 紧紧抓住某物〔以免自己跌倒〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hung on to the rail at the back of the motorbike.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他紧紧抓住摩托车的后扶手。

Exponent.DEF: to continue to hold something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Greg was struggling to keep hold of the dog.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格拼命抓着那条狗不松手。

Sense.DEF: to continue to dislike someone or not forgive them because of something bad they have done in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某事〕对〔某人〕怀恨在心﹐对〔某人〕有怨愤
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t still hold that against him, surely?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会还对他怀恨在心﹐是吧？

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something stop moving forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police in riot gear held back the demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配有防暴装备的警察挡住了示威者。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from feeling or showing a particular emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: She struggled to hold back her tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力忍住眼泪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anger flooded through her. She couldn’t hold it back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怒火中烧﹐无法控制。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone or something from making progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: They felt the British economy was being held back by excessive government controls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们感到﹐由于政府过度控制﹐英国的经济发展受到了阻碍。

Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to do something, especially because you are being careful, or to make someone unwilling to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the current situation many investors are holding back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在目前形势下﹐许多投资者退缩了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to tell him but pride held her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想告诉他﹐可是自尊让她犹豫了。

Sense.DEF: to keep something secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell me all about it – don’t hold anything back!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这事全部告诉我﹐什么都别隐瞒！

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something stay on something, and stop them from moving away or escaping
Sense.TRAN: 控制﹔固定〔以防某物移走或某人逃脱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to hold the tent down with rocks to stop it blowing away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好用石块将帐篷压住免得被吹走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took three strong men to hold him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个壮汉才制住了他。

Sense.DEF: to prevent the level of something such as prices from rising
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will aim to hold down prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将力求抑制价格上涨。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in keeping a job for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never held down a job for longer than a few weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来没有把一份工作保住几周以上。

Sense.DEF: to keep people under control or limit their freedom
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people were held down for centuries by their conquerors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个民族被征服者压制了几个世纪。

Sense.DEF: to give your opinion on a subject, especially for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The speaker was holding forth on the collapse of modern society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 演说者正在就现代社会的崩溃大发议论。

Sense.DEF: to delay doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buyers have been holding off until the price falls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买家们一直按兵不动﹐等待价格下跌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hold off making your decision until Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到星期一再作决定吧。

Subsense.DEF: to prevent someone who is trying to attack or defeat you from succeeding
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Not even a gun could hold him off forever.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使用枪也不能永远挡住他。

Subsense.DEF: to prevent someone from coming towards you or succeeding in speaking to you
Subsense.TRAN: 阻止某人靠近﹔阻止某人和你谈话
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s already a crowd of reporters outside – I’ll try to hold them off for a while.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面已经有一群记者了——我会想法挡住他们一会儿。

Sense.DEF: if rain or bad weather holds off, it does not start, although it looked as if it would
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain held off until after the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场雨直到比赛结束才开始下。

Subsense.DEF: to wait for a short time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hold on, I’ll just get my coat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一等﹐我去拿外衣。

Subsense.DEF: used when you have just noticed, heard, or remembered something interesting or wrong
Subsense.TRAN: 等一下﹐等等〔表示注意到﹑听到或记起令人感兴趣或不妥的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hold on a minute! Isn’t that your brother’s car over there?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下！那边不是你兄弟的车吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone on the telephone to wait until the person they want to talk to is available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you hold on? I’ll try to find her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请别挂好吗？我去找找她看。

Sense.DEF: to have your hands or arms tightly around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold on tight!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓紧了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hold on to my arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓紧我的胳膊。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something that is very difficult to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: San Francisco held on to win 4-2.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧金山队顽强拼搏﹐以4比2赢了比赛。

Sense.DEF: to keep something rather than losing it, selling it, or giving it to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers held on to the bridge for three more days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们又把这座桥守了三天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll hold on to these old records for now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我会暂时保留这些老唱片的。

Sense.DEF: to think or say that something is possible or likely to happen, especially something good
Sense.TRAN: 抱有希望﹔提供机会﹔使有可能

GramExa.PROPFORM: not hold out much hope/hold out little hope
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Negotiators aren’t holding out much hope of a peaceful settlement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判人员对和平解决并不抱很大希望。

GramExa.PROPFORM: hold out the prospect/promise of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: alternative methods which hold out the promise of improved health
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可望改善健康状况的另类方法

Sense.DEF: if a supply of something holds out, there is still some left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water supplies won’t hold out much longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供水维持不了多久了。

Sense.DEF: to continue to successfully defend a place that is being attacked
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels held out for another night but then fresh forces arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子又守了一个晚上﹐但是接着增援部队到了。

Sense.DEF: to try to prevent yourself from doing something that someone is trying to force you to do
Sense.TRAN: 坚持〔不做别人强迫之事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know how much longer I could hold out against their relentless questioning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于他们没完没了的盘问我不知道自己还能坚持多久。

Sense.DEF: to not accept anything less than you have asked for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Transport workers are holding out for a 20% pay rise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运输业工作者坚持要求加薪20%。

Sense.DEF: to not tell someone about something important
Sense.EXAMPLE: She must have been holding out on him all these years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来她肯定一直瞒着他。

Sense.DEF: to do or deal with something at a later time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The matter was held over for further review.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事被搁置起来待进一步审议。

Sense.DEF: to use something bad that you know about someone to make them do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knows I’ve been in prison and is holding it over me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道我曾坐过牢﹐便以此要挟我。

Sense.DEF: if a play, film, concert etc is held over, it is shown for longer than planned because it is very popular
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电影﹑音乐会等因受欢迎〕公演时间被延长

Sense.DEF: if you hold to a belief, principle, promise etc, you believe it or behave according to it
Sense.TRAN: 信奉〔信念﹑原则等〕﹔信守〔诺言〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He admitted he did not hold to the traditional view of God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认自己不认同对上帝的传统看法。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do what they have promised
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll ask him tomorrow.’ ‘OK, but I’m going to hold you to that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我明天问他。”“好吧﹐不过我要你说话算数。”

Sense.DEF: to prevent your opponent in a sports game from getting more than a particular number of points
Sense.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛中〕不让对手超过〔某一得分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norway held Holland to a 2-2 draw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挪威队以2比2逼平荷兰队。

Sense.DEF: if a group or an organization holds together, or if something holds it together, it stays strong and does not separate into different parts or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: Against all expectations, the coalition held together well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和各种预料截然相反﹐这个联盟很团结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In those days the Church held the community together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个年代﹐教会将社区团结在一起。

Sense.DEF: to remain whole and good enough to use, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Incredibly, the raft held together till we reached the opposite shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真令人难以置信﹐筏子一直把我们载到对岸还没散架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wondered how the structure was held together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道这个结构是怎么结合在一起的。

Sense.DEF: to support something and prevent it from falling down
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof is held up by massive stone pillars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶是用几根粗大的石柱支撑住的。

Sense.DEF: to delay someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I’m late – I was held up at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起我来晚了﹐我给工作耽搁了。

Sense.DEF: to rob or try to rob a place or person by using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two armed men held up a downtown liquor store last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚两名持枪男子抢劫了市中心一家售酒的商店。

Sense.DEF: to not become weaker
Sense.EXAMPLE: His physical condition has held up well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身体保养得非常好。

Sense.DEF: to use someone or something as a good example or as proof of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school is held up as a model for others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校被树为其他学校的榜样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This incident will be held up as proof that tougher controls are needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该事件将作为需要采取更严格的控制措施的明证。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not approve of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He says he doesn’t hold with all this politically correct stuff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他并不赞成这些政治上正确的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t hold with hitting children in any circumstances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在任何情况下我都不赞同打孩子。

Sense.DEF: the action of holding something with your hands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She released her tight hold on the dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她松开被她紧紧牵着的狗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He tightened his hold , refusing to let her go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓得更紧了﹐不让她走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you keep hold of my hand when we cross the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过马路时你一定要抓住我的手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took hold of her hand and gently led her away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抓住她的手﹐小心地带她离开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grab hold of the rope and pull yourself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓住绳子爬上来。

Sense.DEF: to find or borrow something so that you can use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to get hold of a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得找一辆车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to get a hold of a copy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法弄到了一本。

Sense.DEF: to find and speak to someone about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must get hold of Vanessa to see if she can babysit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须找到瓦妮莎﹐看看她能不能帮忙照看一下孩子。

Sense.DEF: control, power, or influence over something or someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He struggled to get a hold of his emotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽力控制住自己的情绪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always kept a tight hold on our finances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直牢牢控制着我们的经济收入。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized that the woman had a hold over my father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到那女人控制着我父亲。

Subsense.DEF: if something is on hold, it is going to be done or dealt with at a later date rather than now
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The plans are on hold until after the election.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些计划被推迟到选举以后。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Since having the kids, my career has been put on hold .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从有了孩子﹐我的事业被搁置下来。

Subsense.DEF: if you are on hold, you are waiting to talk to someone on the telephone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We try not to keep people on hold for more than a couple of minutes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量不让打电话的人等候超过几分钟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The agent put me on hold while she consulted a colleague.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经纪人让我等着﹐她去问一个同事。

Sense.DEF: to start to have a definite effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fever was beginning to take hold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发烧开始厉害起来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get hold of an idea/an impression/a story etc
Sense.DEF: to learn or begin to believe something
Sense.TRAN: 得到[开始相信]某个想法/印象/说法等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where on earth did you get hold of that idea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这想法到底是哪里来的？

Sense.DEF:
a particular position that you hold an opponent in, in a fight or a sport such as
wrestling
Sense.TRAN: 〔摔跤等运动中的〕擒拿招式﹐擒拿技法

Sense.DEF: somewhere you can put your hands or feet to help you climb something
Sense.TRAN: 支撑点﹔落脚点〔指攀爬时供手攀﹑脚踩之处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cliff was steep and it was difficult to find a hold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖陡峭﹐很难找到攀踏的地方。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a ship below the
deck11
where goods are stored
when there are no rules or limits on what you are allowed to do
Sense.TRAN: 无规则的﹐无限制的﹐为所欲为的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems there are no holds barred when it comes to making a profit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赚钱谋利似乎可以不择手段。

Sense.DEF: a large bag used for carrying clothes and other things when you are travelling
someone who owns or controls something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 800 m world record holder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 800米世界纪录保持者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买季票的人对火车票价上涨极为愤怒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: British passport holders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国护照持有人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: holders of ordinary shares
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通股持有人

Sense.DEF: something that is used to hold an object

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 烛台/香烟烟嘴/试管夹等

Sense.DEF:
something which a person owns, especially land or
shares
in a company
Sense.TRAN: 财产〔尤指地产或公司的股份〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has decided to sell its 21% holding in the firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决定出售其在该公司21%的股份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: companies with large property holdings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有大量不动产的公司

Sense.DEF: a company that completely or partly owns other companies, as well as doing business itself
the path that an aircraft flies along while it is waiting for permission to land
Sense.TRAN: 待降[等待]航线〔指飞机等待降落时的航线〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you cannot act because you are waiting for the result of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My career is in a holding pattern right now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的事业目前处于待定状态。

Sense.DEF: an action, feeling, or idea that has continued from the past into the present

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her fear of dogs is a holdover from her childhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她害怕狗﹐从小就怕。

Sense.DEF: a situation that stops something from happening or making progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: traffic hold-ups on the highway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路上的交通堵塞
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the odd hold-up, we finished on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管偶尔有些阻滞﹐我们还是准时完成了。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to rob a place or person by threatening them with a weapon
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bank hold-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行持械抢劫案

Sense.DEF: an empty space in something solid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a huge hole in the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上有个大坑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I began digging a hole for the plant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始挖洞种那棵植物。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say there is a hole ‘on’ something. Say there is a hole in something. 表示某物上有个洞﹐不要说on﹐而要说in。

Sense.DEF: a space in something solid that allows light or things to pass through

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They climbed through a hole in the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从栅栏的缺口爬了过去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These socks are full of holes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双袜子满是破洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: bullet holes made by bullets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹孔

Sense.DEF: a place where someone or something should be, but is missing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their departure will leave a gaping hole in Grand Prix racing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的离去将给汽车大奖赛留下一个巨大的空白。

Sense.DEF: a weak part or fault in something such as an idea or plan
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑计划等的〕漏洞﹐破绽﹐问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theory is full of holes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该理论漏洞百出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you have holes in your game, work on them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你运动技能上有不足的地方﹐就要在这方面下功夫。

Sense.DEF: the home of a small animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rabbit hole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兔窝

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to get out of this hole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得离开这个破地方。

Subsense.DEF: a hole in the ground that you try to get the ball into in the game of golf

one part of a
golf course
with this kind of hole at one end

Sense.DEF: when someone hits the ball in golf from the starting place into the hole with only one hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球运动中的〕一杆进洞

Sense.DEF: to use a large part of an amount of money, food etc
Sense.TRAN: 用去某物的一大部分﹐大量消耗某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Holidays can make a big hole in your savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 度假会花去你一大笔存款。

Sense.DEF: to be in a difficult situation
to owe money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was something like $16,000 in the hole already.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经负债大概1.6万美元了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: need/want sth like a hole in the head
Sense.DEF: used to say that you definitely do not need or want something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need this conversation like a hole in the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝对不需要这次谈话。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: square peg in a round hole

Exponent.DEF: an empty space in the surface of something, which sometimes goes all the way through it
Exponent.TRAN: 洞﹐孔﹐坑〔有时贯穿整个物体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A fox had dug a hole under our fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只狐狸在我们的栅栏下挖了个洞。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rain was coming in through a hole in the roof.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水从屋顶的一个洞里漏进来。

Exponent.DEF: an empty area between two things, into which you can put something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are there any empty spaces on the bookshelf?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 书架上有空当吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a parking space
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车位

Exponent.DEF: an empty area between two things or two parts of something, especially one that should not be there
Exponent.TRAN: 〔两物之间或某物的两部分之间不该存在的〕缺口﹐裂缝
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has a gap between his two front teeth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的两颗门牙之间有条缝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I squeezed through a gap in the hedge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从树篱的缺口钻了过去。

Exponent.DEF: a hole that something can pass through or that you can see through, especially at the entrance of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指入口处可穿过或可看见他物的〕洞﹐缺口
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The train disappeared into the dark opening of the tunnel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车从黑漆漆的隧道入口驶入﹐消失不见了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I looked through the narrow opening in the wall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我透过墙上的窄缝望去。

Exponent.DEF: a small hole where something has been damaged or broken that lets liquid or gas flow in or out
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a leak in the pipe
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 管子上的裂缝
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plumber's coming to repair the leak.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 管道工会来修理漏处。

Exponent.DEF: a small hole in a tyre through which air escapes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My bike’s got a puncture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的自行车轮胎扎破了。

Exponent.DEF: a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The snake slid into a crack in the rock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇钻进了岩石的裂缝里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was peering through the crack in the curtains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她透过窗帘的缝隙看着。

Exponent.DEF: a straight narrow hole that you put a particular type of object into
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have to put a coin in the slot before you dial the number.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨号前得往投币口塞一枚硬币。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A small disk fits into a slot in the camera.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小光盘可以插入摄像机的光盘槽中。

Exponent.DEF: a round hole in the ground made by an explosion or by a large object hitting it hard
Exponent.TRAN: 〔炸弹爆炸或大型物体撞击地面造成的〕（圆）坑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a volcanic crater
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火山口

PIC.HEADING: HOLE 洞﹐裂口
PIC.PICCONTENT: gap 缺口；crack 裂缝；slot 投币口；hole 坑

Sense.DEF: to hit the ball into a hole in golf
Sense.EXAMPLE: He holed the putt with ease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻松地推球入洞。

Sense.DEF: if a ship is holed, something makes a hole in it
to hit the ball into a hole in golf
to hide somewhere for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gunmen are still holed up in the town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个持枪歹徒仍然躲在镇上。

Sense.DEF: a machine in or outside a bank from which you can obtain money using a special card
a small dark shop or restaurant
full of holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: holey sweaters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网眼毛衣

Sense.DEF: a time of rest from work, school etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school holidays start tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校假期从明天开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m away on holiday until the 1st of June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我外出休假﹐6月1日回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He came to stay with us in the school holidays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校放假期间他来跟我们住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a holiday from her usual responsibilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她暂时放下日常工作去度假

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, when someone is temporarily away from their work or studies, people often say they are off , rather than on holiday . Note, however, that off can also mean that someone is away from their work or studies because they are sick.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中﹐表示暂时性的休假﹐人们常说off﹐而不说on holiday。但是要注意﹐off也可表示因生病而休假
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s Kate?’ ‘She’s off this week.’

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you travel to another place for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to Spain for our holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要去西班牙度假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He caught malaria while on holiday in Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在非洲度假时染上了疟疾。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had a proper holiday for two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经两年没有好好度假了。

Sense.DEF: a day fixed by law on which people do not have to go to work or school
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 4th of July is a national holiday in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月4日是美国的法定假日。

Subsense.DEF: the period between Thanksgiving and New Year
Subsense.TRAN: 假期季节〔从感恩节到新年的这段时间〕

Subsense.DEF: the period in the summer when most people take a holiday
Subsense.TRAN: 休假旺季〔指夏天大多数人休假的时间段〕

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Holidays is usually used after ‘the’, ‘my’, ‘your’ etc when it refers to a single period when you are travelling or are not working or studying.
F2NBox.TRAN: holidays一般用于the﹐my﹐your等词之后﹐指某人的一次休假
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Soon it will be the holidays.
Where do you want to go for your holidays?

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children were excited about going on holiday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们对要去度假很兴奋。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers cannot take holidays during term time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师在学期中间不能休假。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I booked the holiday online.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在网上完成了与度假相关的各种预订。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They went on a camping holiday in France.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去法国野营度假。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a holiday in which you pay a price that includes travel, room, and food
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔旅行社安排一切的〕包价旅游﹐一揽子旅游
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company organizes package holidays to Spain and Greece.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本公司提供赴西班牙及希腊的包价旅游服务。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were going to a house on the coast for their summer holidays.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们打算去海滨的一座别墅过暑假。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why not try a winter holiday for a change?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不改变一下﹐在冬天休假？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I first visited Orkney on a family holiday when I was a boy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次去奥克尼岛是小时候全家一起去度假。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a holiday you take every year
the best holiday you can imagine
a place with many hotels where a lot of people go on holiday
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a holiday resort in Spain
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙的一处度假胜地

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a town or country where a lot of people go on holiday
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Marmaris is one of Turkey’s most popular holiday destinations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔马里斯是土耳其最受欢迎的旅游目的地。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a magazine that shows what holidays you can take
photographs that you take when you are on holiday
a brief romantic relationship with someone you meet on holiday
a holiday in a country other than the one you live in
a very good or expensive holiday that you will only take once
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一辈子只享受一次的假期

Sense.DEF: to spend your holiday in a place - used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 度假〔尤用于新闻报道中〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re holidaying in Majorca.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在马略卡岛度假。

Sense.DEF: a place where people go for their holidays and where activities are organized for them
a house that someone owns where they go during their holidays
someone who has travelled to a place on holiday
showing that you think you are morally better than other people - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自命清高的﹐道德上自视甚高的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of being pure and good in a religious way
used as a title for talking to or about the Pope
Sense.TRAN: 陛下﹐圣座〔对教皇的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: considering a person or thing as a whole, rather than as separate parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a holistic approach to design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计的整体方法

Sense.DEF: medical treatment based on the belief that the whole person must be treated, not just the part of their body that has a disease

a creamy sauce made with butter, eggs, and
lemon
to shout loudly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I heard someone hollering at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见有人对我大叫。

Sense.DEF: having an empty space inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hollow tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空心树

Sense.DEF: eyes etc where the skin sinks inwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was short and thin, with hollow eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又矮又瘦﹐双眼凹陷。

Sense.DEF: a hollow sound is low and clear like the sound made when you hit something empty
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hollow thump as the cars collided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆相撞时发出了空洞的撞击声。

Sense.DEF: words, events, or people that are hollow have no real worth or value
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑事件或人〕虚假的﹐无价值的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won, but it was a hollow victory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赢了﹐但那是一个没有实际意义的胜利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even as he spoke, Ivan was well aware of the hollow ring to his words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是在演讲时﹐伊万也十分清楚自己的言辞是多么空洞无力。

Sense.DEF: a hollow laugh or voice makes a weak sound and is without emotion
a place in something that is at a slightly lower level than its surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a slight hollow in the middle of each cake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每一块蛋糕中间挖一个浅浅的洞。

Sense.DEF: to make the surface of something curve inwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过几个世纪的踩踏﹐台阶上出现了凹痕。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole or empty space by removing the inside part of something

Sense.TRAN: 冬青树﹔〔用作圣诞节装饰的〕冬青树叶及浆果

Sense.DEF: a tall thin garden plant with many flowers growing together
a part of Los Angeles in California where films are made, often used to refer to the film industry in general
Sense.TRAN: 好莱坞〔常用来指美国电影业〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is one of Hollywood’s major stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是好莱坞的巨星之一。

Sense.DEF:
the main character in the stories by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. He is very clever and he always notices very small details and then uses them to guess what has happened. He is known for wearing a
deerstalker a type of hat
, smoking a
pipe
, and playing the
violin
. People often think he uses the phrase ‘Elementary, my dear Watson’ when he is explaining to his friend, Dr Watson, how easy it is to understand something. In fact, this phrase does not appear in any of the stories. Nevertheless, people sometimes use it to emphasize how simple a solution to a problem is.
Sense.TRAN: 歇洛克·福尔摩斯〔英国小说家阿瑟·柯南·道尔爵士所著侦探小说的主要人物。人们误以为Elementary, my dear Watson（很简单﹐亲爱的华生）是福尔摩斯的口头禅﹐有时会以此来强调解决问题的方法非常简单〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is great destruction and a lot of people die
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear holocaust
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核灾难

Sense.DEF: the killing of millions of Jews and other people by the Nazis during the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 〔第二次世界大战期间纳粹党对犹太人等进行的〕大屠杀

Sense.DEF:
a kind of photograph made with a
laser
that looks as if it is not flat when you look at it from an angle
holidays
a black and white cow
Sense.TRAN: 霍斯坦种乳牛﹐黑白花牛﹐荷兰牛

Sense.DEF: a leather object for carrying a small gun, that is worn on a belt
connected with God and religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: the holy city of Varanasi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣城瓦拉纳西

Sense.DEF: very religious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a holy man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个虔诚的信徒

Sense.DEF: used to express feelings such as surprise or fear
Sense.TRAN: 天啊﹐上帝呀〔表示惊讶﹑恐 惧等〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who causes problems for other people
the holy book of the Christian religion
the Christian ceremony in which people eat bread and drink wine as signs of Christ’s body and blood
Jesus, his mother Mary, and her husband Joseph
Sense.TRAN: 圣家庭〔指耶稣﹑圣母马利亚以及马利亚的丈夫约瑟〕

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to or about the Pope

God in the form of a
spirit
according to the Christian religion
something that people want very much, but which is very difficult or impossible to achieve
Sense.TRAN: 难以实现[无法实现]的梦想

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nuclear fusion is the Holy Grail of energy production.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核聚变是能源生产方面一个遥不可及的梦想。

Sense.DEF: the cup believed to have been used by Christ before his death
Sense.TRAN: 〔据信耶稣离世前使用的〕圣杯

Sense.DEF: the parts of the Middle East where most of the events mentioned in the Bible happened
Sense.TRAN: 圣地 〔指中东的一些地区﹐《圣经》上记载的大部分事件发生于此〕

Sense.DEF: a special place where only a few people are allowed to go
Sense.TRAN: 最神圣的地方〔指只许少数人进入的地方〕

Sense.DEF: the most holy part of a Jewish temple
the authority of the Pope, and everything he is responsible for
Sense.TRAN: 圣座﹐宗座〔罗马教皇的圣职〕

Sense.DEF:
God in the form of a
spirit
according to the Christian religion
a war that is fought to defend the beliefs of a religion

water that has been
blessed
by a priest
the week before Easter in the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 受难周〔基督教复活节前的一周〕

Sense.DEF: writing or instructions that people treat as if it were completely true in every detail
Sense.TRAN: 字字句句都正确的权威著作[指示]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lenin’s word was by no means accepted as holy writ.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列宁的话根本没有被当成绝对正确的真理。

Sense.DEF: the Bible
something you do to show respect for someone or something you think is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film pays homage to Martin Scorsese’s ‘Mean Streets’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该影片向马丁·斯科塞斯的《穷街陋巷》致敬。

Sense.DEF: a man, especially one who is strong

a soft hat for men, with a wide
brim edge
Sense.TRAN: 霍姆堡毡帽〔一种男用宽边软毡帽〕

Sense.DEF: the house, apartment, or place where you live
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a beautiful home in California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在加州有个美丽的家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good luck in your new home!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你在新家一切顺利！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last night we stayed at home and watched TV.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们待在家里看电视。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was spending more and more time away from home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不在家的时间越来越多。

GramExa.GLOSS: do your work at home instead of at a company office

Sense.EXAMPLE: A family of birds made their home started living under the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一窝鸟在屋顶下安了家。

PIC.HEADING: HOMES(ANIMALS)（动物的）窝
PIC.PICCONTENT: stable 马厩；hutch 兔笼；kennel 狗窝；barn 畜棚；pigsty 猪圈；hive 蜂箱

Sense.DEF: the place where a child lived with his or her family
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack left home when he was 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克16岁离开家独立生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Were you still living at home with your parents ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时你仍和父母住在一起吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie moved out of the family home a year ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽一年前搬离了父母的家。

Sense.DEF: the place where you came from or where you usually live, especially when this is the place where you feel happy and comfortable
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人感到亲切﹑愉快的〕家﹐家乡﹐故乡
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was born in Italy, but she’s made Charleston her home .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出生在意大利﹐但在查尔斯顿安了家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The folks back home don’t really understand what life is like here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家乡的父老乡亲并不了解这里的生活是怎样的。

Sense.DEF: the country where you live, as opposed to foreign countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: auto sales at home and abroad
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内外市场的汽车销量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been travelling, but he’s kept up with what’s going on back home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在旅行﹐不过他一直关注着国内发生的事情。

Subsense.DEF: to feel comfortable in a place or with a person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m already feeling at home in the new apartment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在新公寓里已经习惯了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a while we began to feel at home with each other.
