GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿我们就无拘无束起来。

Subsense.DEF: to feel happy or confident about doing or using something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Practise using the video until you feel quite at home with it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 练习练习怎么用这台录像机﹐直到熟练为止。

Sense.DEF: a house, apartment etc considered as property which you can buy or sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attractive modern homes for sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的现代化住宅待售。

Sense.DEF: a place where people who are very old or sick, or children who have no family, are looked after
Sense.TRAN: 〔老人或病人的〕疗养所﹔〔儿童的〕养育院
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old people’s home
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人院
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could never put Dad into a home .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不会把爸爸送进养老院。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who is visiting you that they should relax
Sense.TRAN: 请随便﹐别拘礼〔招呼客人时说〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit down and make yourself at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐﹐别客气。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel relaxed by being friendly towards them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We like to make our customers feel at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望给客人宾至如归的感觉。

Subsense.DEF: the place where something was first discovered, made, or developed
Subsense.TRAN: 某事物的发祥地﹐某事物的发源地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: America is the home of baseball.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国是棒球的发源地。

Subsense.DEF: the place where a plant or animal grows or lives
Subsense.TRAN: 〔植物或动物的〕产地﹐生长[栖息]地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: India is the home of elephants and tigers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度出产大象和老虎。

Sense.DEF: if a sports team plays at home, they play at their own sports field

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birmingham Bullets are at home to Kingston.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯明翰子弹队在主场与金斯顿队对阵。

Sense.DEF: a place that you think is as pleasant and comfortable as your own house
Sense.TRAN: 像家一样舒适自在的地方

Sense.DEF: used to say how nice it is to be in your own home
Sense.TRAN: 可爱的家〔表示在家里愉悦的心情〕

Sense.DEF: a place where animals with no owners are looked after
Sense.TRAN: 流浪狗/猫之家﹐流浪狗/猫收容所

Sense.DEF: to find a place where something can be kept
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you find a home for the piano?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能找个地方放钢琴吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: what’s that when it’s at home?
Sense.DEF: used humorously to ask what a long or unusual word means
Sense.TRAN: 说白了是什么意思？〔幽默用法﹐询问长的或不常用单词的意思〕

Sense.DEF: a place in some games or sports which a player must try to reach in order to win a point

Exponent.DEF: the house, apartment, or place where you live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More and more people are working from home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人在家办公。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was past midnight by the time I got home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到家时已过午夜。

Exponent.DEF: a building that someone lives in, especially a building intended for one person, couple, or family
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall we meet at your house?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你家碰头好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you seen Dave’s new house – it’s huge!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过戴夫的新房子吗——好大啊！

Exponent.DEF: the house, apartment, or room where someone lives
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We went to Sara’s place after the movie.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看完电影我们去了萨拉家。

Exponent.DEF: the house or apartment where someone lives, especially a large or official one
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大型的或官员的〕住宅﹐官邸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister’s official residence is 10 Downing Street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相官邸在唐宁街10号。

Exponent.DEF: a house that someone owns by the sea, in the mountains etc, where they go for their holidays
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They bought a luxury holiday home in Spain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在西班牙买了一幢豪华的度假别墅。

Sense.DEF: to or at the place where you live
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is Sue home from work yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休下班回到家了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They brought the baby home from the hospital on Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们周五把孩子从医院接回了家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed home last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们昨晚待在家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going home now. See you tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在要回家了﹐明天见。

GramExa.GLOSS: arrive at your home
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was midnight by the time we got home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家时已经半夜了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What time are you coming home?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候回家来？

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use a preposition such as ‘at’ or ‘to’ before home when it is an adverb. home作副词用时﹐它的前面不用at﹐to等介词: Then we went home (NOT 不说 went at home). 然后我们就回家了。 | He returned home (NOT 不说 returned to home). 他回到了家。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take home £120 per week/$600 a month etc
Sense.DEF: to earn a certain amount of money after tax has been taken off
Sense.TRAN: 〔税后〕挣得每周120英镑/每月600美元等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average worker takes home around $300 a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通工人每周的税后净收入约为300美元。

Subsense.DEF: to make sure that someone understands what you mean by saying it in an extremely direct and determined way
Subsense.TRAN: 直接明确阐述某事〔使人充分理解〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We really need to drive this message home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确实需要明确表达这一信息。

Subsense.DEF: to hit or push something firmly into the correct position
Subsense.TRAN: 将某物敲/推/锤击等至合适的位置

Sense.LEXUNIT: bring sth home to sb/come home to sb
Sense.DEF: to make you realize how serious, difficult, or dangerous something is
Sense.TRAN: 使某人充分意识到某事〔的严重性﹑难度或危险性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The episode has brought home to me the pointlessness of this war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段经历让我充分意识到这场战争是毫无意义的。

Sense.DEF: if a remark, situation, or experience hits home, it makes you realize how serious, difficult, or dangerous something is
Sense.TRAN: 〔言语等〕正中要害﹔〔形势﹑经历〕使人豁然省悟
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could see that her remark had hit home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看得出她说中了要害。

Sense.DEF: to have succeeded in doing something
to have succeeded in doing the most difficult part of something
Sense.TRAN: 成功完成最困难的部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I last five years with no symptoms, I’ll be home free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果五年不出现症状﹐我就没事。

Sense.DEF: relating to or belonging to your home or family

GramExa.GLOSS: the address or telephone number of your house

Sense.EXAMPLE: These children need a proper home life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子需要正常的家庭生活。

Sense.DEF: done at home or intended for use in a home
Sense.EXAMPLE: good old-fashioned home cooking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味的传统家常菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: a home computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家用电脑

Sense.DEF: played or playing at a team’s own sports field, rather than an opponent’s field

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The home team took the lead after 25 minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 25分钟以后主队领先。

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular country, as opposed to foreign countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meat was destined for the home market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些肉供应国内市场。

Sense.DEF: to aim exactly at an object or place and move directly to it
Sense.TRAN: 对准并靠近〔某事物或地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bat can home in on insects using a kind of ‘radar’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蝙蝠能凭借某种“雷达”准确找到并飞向昆虫。

Sense.DEF: to direct your efforts or attention towards a particular fault or problem
Sense.TRAN: 将注意力集中于〔某一缺陷或问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He homed in on the one weak link in the argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞄准论据中的一个薄弱环节。

Sense.DEF: the place that someone returns to in order to rest, learn new things, or exchange information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band’s home base is Seattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支乐队的大本营在西雅图。

Sense.DEF: the main office of a company
the place where you stand to hit the ball in baseball
someone who enjoys being at home

a friend or someone from the same area or
gang
as you - used especially by young people
Sense.TRAN: 街坊﹔同乡﹔同伙〔尤为年轻人用语〕

Sense.DEF: beer made at home
someone who is buying a home
an occasion when someone comes back to their home after a long absence
an occasion when former students return to their high school or college
the study of cooking, sewing, and other skills used at home, taught as a subject at school
the people who stay and work in their own country while others go abroad to fight in a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film is set on the home front in 1943.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影的背景是在1943年的大后方。

Sense.DEF:
a female
homey
made or produced in your own country, town etc
Sense.TRAN: 本国制造[出产]的﹔本地制造[出产]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: homegrown rock stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本土摇滚明星

Sense.DEF: homegrown vegetables and fruit are grown in your own garden
Sense.TRAN: 〔蔬菜﹑水果〕自家园子里种植的

Sense.DEF: someone who helps ill or old people in their homes with cleaning, cooking etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助病人或老人的〕居家护理助手

Sense.DEF: a set of documents that a person in England and Wales must show to people who want to buy their home. These include documents showing who owns the home, and how much energy it uses.
Sense.TRAN: 房屋信息包〔指英格兰和威尔士的房屋卖主须向买家出示的一整套文件〕

Sense.DEF: the country where someone was born
a large area of land where a particular group of people can live

actions taken by the US government after the
terrorist
attacks of September 11th, 2001 to prevent
terrorism
within the US. These actions include watching people who are thought to be involved in
terrorist
activities, and putting them in prison if necessary. They also include preparations for using the army, police, doctors etc immediately if there is a terrorist attack.
without a home
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

Sense.DEF: people who have nowhere to live, and who often live on the streets
Sense.TRAN: 无家可归者﹐流浪街头者

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you borrow in order to buy a home
simple in a way that makes you feel comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modern hotel with a homely atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简朴舒适的现代化宾馆

Sense.DEF: a homely person is warm and friendly and enjoys home life
Sense.TRAN: 亲切友好并热爱家庭生活的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Keane is a comfortable, homely person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基恩太太平易近人﹐亲切好客。

Sense.DEF: not very attractive
made at home and not bought from a shop
Sense.EXAMPLE: homemade cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自制的蛋糕

Sense.DEF: a woman who works at home cleaning and cooking etc and does not have another job
a film you make, often of a family occasion, that is intended to be shown at home
Sense.TRAN: 〔只在家里放映的〕自制影片﹐记录家庭活动的影片

Sense.DEF:
a room in someone’s home where that person works, which usually has equipment such as a computer,
fax
machine etc
the British government department that deals with keeping order in the country, controlling who enters the country etc
a system of medicine in which a disease is treated by giving extremely small amounts of a substance that causes the disease
someone who owns their home

the first page of a website, which often contains
links
to other pages on that website
the place where you stand to hit the ball in baseball, and the last place the player who is running must touch in order to get a point
a home run in baseball
a classroom where students have to go at the beginning of every school day
Sense.TRAN: 〔学生每天上课前必须去的〕点到室

Sense.DEF: the right of a country or area to have its own government and laws

a long hit in
baseball
which allows the player who hits the ball to run around all the
bases
and get a point
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think I could hit a home run .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我打不出本垒打。

Sense.DEF: to teach children at home instead of sending them to school
Sense.TRAN: （对…进行）家中教学〔指不送孩子到学校接受教育〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She and her husband homeschool their three kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和丈夫在家教自己的三个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did you decide to homeschool?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么决定自己在家里教孩子？
Sense.EXAMPLE: homeschooled students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家接受教育的学生

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组实行家中教学的家庭

Sense.DEF: the British Government minister who is in charge of the Home Office
feeling unhappy because you are a long way from your home
homespun ideas are simple and ordinary
homespun cloth is woven at home
a farm and the area of land around it
a piece of land, usually for farming, given to people in the past by the US government
to live and work on a homestead
Sense.TRAN: 在分到的土地上生活和劳作

Sense.DEF: the last part of a race where there is a straight line to the finish
the last part of an activity or journey
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动的〕最后一部分﹔〔行程的〕最后阶段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: as the election campaign headed into the home stretch
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着选举活动进入最后阶段

Sense.DEF: the place where you were born and spent your childhood

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hired a car and drove up to his home town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他租了一辆车开回老家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s written for her hometown newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为家乡的报纸写过稿。

Sense.DEF: a true but unpleasant fact that someone tells you about yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔由别人告知的关于自己的〕使人不愉快的事实
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time someone told him a few home truths .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在该有人给他讲点实话了。

Sense.DEF: a film you make, often of a family occasion, that is intended to be shown at home
Sense.TRAN: 〔只在家里放映的〕自制影片﹐记录家庭活动的影片

Sense.DEF: towards home
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned and made her way homeward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身往家走去。

Sense.DEF: going towards home
work that a student at school is asked to do at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: For homework, finish the exercise on page 14.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭作业是完成第14页的练习。

Sense.DEF: if you do your homework, you prepare for an important activity by finding out information you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s worth doing a bit of homework before buying a computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买电脑之前做点准备工作是值得的。

F2NBox.HEADING: Grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Homework is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: homework是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: systems to ensure that homework is completed
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 确保家庭作业完成的方法

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Paul, have you done your homework?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗﹐你家庭作业完成了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The teacher gave them some homework to do by Monday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师给他们布置了一些家庭作业﹐星期一之前要完成。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I often have to help her with her homework.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我常常得帮助她做功课。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give it to the teacher
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You must hand in your homework by Friday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五之前必须交家庭作业。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 生物/历史/法语等家庭作业
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The science homework was really hard.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然课的家庭作业太难了。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make/write your homework’. Say 而要说 do your homework .

Sense.DEF: someone who does their job in their home
pleasant, like home
Sense.TRAN: 舒适自在的﹐像在家里一样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant has a relaxed homey atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐馆有一种宾至如归的自在气氛。

Sense.DEF:
a friend or someone who comes from your area or
gang
likely to murder someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a homicidal maniac
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀人狂

Sense.DEF: the crime of murder
the police department that deals with murders
Sense.TRAN: 凶杀科〔指警方负责处理谋杀案件的部门〕

Sense.DEF: advice about how to behave that is often unwanted
a speech given as part of a Christian church ceremony
a bird or animal that has a homing instinct has a special ability that helps it find its way home over long distances
a special part of a weapon that helps it to find its target

Sense.DEF:
a
pigeon
that is able to find its way home over long distances
a member of a group of animals which includes human beings and also the animals from whom humans developed

a food made from crushed dried
corn 2

a very offensive word for a

same

words spelled the same way

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of

a British spelling of
homeopathy
consisting of people or things that are all of the same type
Sense.TRAN: 由同种族人组成的﹔由同类组成的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同种族人组成的社会

Sense.DEF: to change something so that its parts become similar or the same
Sense.TRAN: 使成均质﹔使均匀﹐使纯一
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to homogenize the various school systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一各类不同学制的计划

Sense.DEF: homogenized milk has had the cream on top mixed with the milk
a word that is spelled the same as another, but is different in meaning, origin, grammar, or pronunciation. For example, the noun ‘record’ is a homograph of the verb ‘record’.
a word that is spelled the same and sounds the same as another, but is different in meaning or origin. For example, the noun ‘bear’ and the verb ‘bear’ are homonyms.

hatred and fear of
homosexuals

Sense.DEF: a word that sounds the same as another but is different in spelling, meaning, or origin. For example, ‘knew’ and ‘new’ are homophones.
the type of human being that exists now
if someone, especially a man, is homosexual, they are sexually attracted to people of the same sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth’s brother was homosexual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝的弟弟是同性恋。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性恋关系

Sense.DEF:
a short form of
honey
, used to address someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐宝贝〔用于称呼心爱的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, hon.

Sense.DEF: an important person who controls something, especially a business

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板

Sense.DEF: to improve your skill at doing something, especially when you are already very good at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set about honing his skills as a draughtsman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他着手提高自己的绘画技艺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: finely honed extremely well-developed intuition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极度发达的直觉

Sense.DEF: to make knives, swords etc sharp
someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a hard-working, honest man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他勤奋老实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann had an honest face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

Sense.DEF: not hiding the truth or the facts about something
Sense.TRAN: 坦诚的﹐直率的﹐不隐瞒真相的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want my honest opinion?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不想听听我的真实意见？
Sense.EXAMPLE: an honest answer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦率的回答
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s be honest: the only reason she married him was for his money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐她嫁给他就是为了他的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At least he was honest with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起码他对你是诚实的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was always very honest about her feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从不隐瞒自己的感情。

Sense.DEF: used when you tell someone what you really think
Sense.EXAMPLE: To be honest, I don’t like him very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老实说﹐我不太喜欢他。

Sense.DEF: used to try to make someone believe you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to hurt him, honest!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是故意伤害他的﹐真的！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something you say is true
Sense.TRAN: 确实﹐千真万确〔用于强调所说的话是真实的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Honest to God, I wasn’t there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时确实不在那儿。

Sense.DEF: honest work is done using your own efforts and without cheating
Sense.TRAN: 用正当手段的﹐努力认真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bet he’s never done an honest day’s work in his life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢说他这辈子从未认认真真工作过一天！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just trying to earn an honest living .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想要堂堂正正谋生。

Sense.DEF: honest people are not famous or special, but behave in a good, socially acceptable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came from a good honest working-class background.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出身于一个正派的工薪阶层家庭。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make an honest woman (out) of sb
Sense.DEF: to marry a woman because you have had a sexual relationship with her
Sense.TRAN: 和发生了性关系的女人结婚

Section.SECHEADING: not cheating, stealing, lying etc不欺骗﹑不偷盗﹑不撒谎等

Exponent.DEF: always saying what is true, and not cheating, stealing etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I liked them because they were good honest people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢他们是因为他们是正直的好人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can trust Noah – he’s totally honest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以信任诺厄——他绝对诚实。

Exponent.DEF: known to be honest and good in your business or work – used about people, companies, or organizations
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人﹑公司或机构〕声誉好的﹐有信誉的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to buy from a reputable company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好向声誉好的公司购买。

Exponent.DEF: honest and legal – used about the way something is done, organized etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔做事﹑组织等的方式〕光明正大的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The deal was entirely above board.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔生意做得完全光明正大。

Exponent.DEF: always behaving in an honest way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an upright citizen
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正直的公民
Exponent.EXAMPLE: George was an upright man from a military family.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治出身于军人家庭﹐为人正直。

Section.SECHEADING: not hiding the truth or the facts 不隐瞒真相或事实

Exponent.DEF: saying what you really think and not hiding the truth or the facts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m going to ask you something, and I want you to be honest with me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要问你点事——希望你对我说真话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an honest answer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦率的回答

Exponent.DEF: honest and saying what you really think
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t help you if you’re not straight with me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不和我说实话﹐我是帮不了你的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need a straight answer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要诚实的回答。

Exponent.DEF: willing to talk about what you think, feel etc in an honest way, rather than trying to hide it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People have become more open about their feelings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对自己的感受已变得更为坦诚了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s very easy to talk to because she’s so open.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常坦诚﹐所以好说话。

Exponent.DEF: speaking honestly and directly about something, especially something that people find difficult to discuss
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In his book, he’s brutally frank about his experience with his illness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在书中﹐他对自己的患病经历直言不讳。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a frank discussion about sex
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对性的坦率讨论

Exponent.DEF: saying exactly what you think in an honest clear way, even when this might annoy or upset people
Exponent.TRAN: 坦率的﹐直言的〔可能令人生气〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Not everyone liked his direct manner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 并非每个人都喜欢他率直的态度。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She can be very direct.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有时相当直截了当。

Exponent.DEF: speaking in a completely honest way, even if it upsets people, when it would be better to be more careful or polite
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry if I was a bit blunt with you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我有些唐突请见谅。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His hard tone and blunt words were hurtful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他严厉的语调和生硬的言辞很伤人。

Exponent.DEF: talking and behaving in an honest way, even when it is difficult to do this, in a way that people respect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to be upfront about your financial problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好坦率说出自己的财务问题。

Exponent.DEF: honest about the facts, or about your opinions and feelings, even if other people disapprove of them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’d always been completely candid about his past.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的过去一向毫不讳言。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true, even though it may seem surprising
Sense.TRAN: 真的﹐的确〔强调所说的话是真实的﹐即使可能让人吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I honestly don’t know how old my parents are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确实不知道我父母的年纪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can honestly say that I never worry about him now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确实可以说我不会再为他劳神操心了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are shocked or annoyed by something someone has said or done
Sense.TRAN: 真是的﹐真不像话〔用以表示震惊或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Honestly! Do you ever listen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太不像话了！你到底有没有听？

Sense.DEF: used to try to make someone believe that what you have just said is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t me, honestly!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不是我﹐真的！

Sense.DEF: in an honest way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell me honestly, Kate, what do you think of John?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟我说实话﹐凯特﹐你认为约翰怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We talked openly and honestly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开诚布公地谈了谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No, I don’t,’ she answered honestly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不。”她诚实地回答道。

Sense.DEF: simple and good
Sense.EXAMPLE: plain honest-to-goodness home cooking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简朴的家常菜

Sense.DEF: the quality of being honest
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politician of rare honesty and courage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone that what you are saying is what you really think
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not, in all honesty, a very good start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐开始并不很顺利。

Sense.DEF: a box for people to put money in to pay for something, when there is no one there to take the payment
Sense.TRAN: 诚实盒〔购物没有人收钱时自己放钱进去的收款箱〕

Sense.DEF:
a sweet sticky substance produced by
bees
, used as food
used to address someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐宝贝〔用于称呼心爱的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi, honey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐亲爱的。

Sense.DEF: an attractive woman

a
bee
that makes honey

a structure made by
bees
, which consists of many six-sided cells in which honey is stored
something that is arranged or shaped in this pattern
Sense.TRAN: 蜂巢式排列物﹔蜂巢[窝]状物

Sense.DEF: filled with many holes, hollow passages etc
a sticky substance that some insects leave on plants
Sense.TRAN: 蜜露〔一些昆虫分泌的黏性物质〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of
melon
with yellow skin and green flesh
honeyed words or honeyed voices sound soft and pleasant, but are often insincere

tasting like
honey
or covered in honey
a holiday taken by two people who have just got married

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went to Italy on our honeymoon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去了意大利度蜜月。

Sense.DEF: the period of time when a new government, leader etc has just started and no one criticizes them
Sense.TRAN: 〔新政府﹑新领导人等上任初期的〕和谐时期﹐蜜月期
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 1987, the honeymoon was over .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1987年﹐蜜月期已经过去。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere for your honeymoon
something that is attractive to a lot of people
a climbing plant with pleasant-smelling yellow or pink flowers
Sense.TRAN: 忍冬〔一种有香味﹑开黄色或粉红色花的攀缘植物〕

Sense.DEF: a loud noise made by a car horn

a loud noise made by a
goose

if a car horn or a
goose
honks, it makes a loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several drivers honked their horns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个司机按了喇叭。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a white person, used by black people. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 白鬼子〔黑人对白人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF:
a cheap bar where
country music
is played
Sense.TRAN: 演奏乡村音乐的低级酒吧

Sense.DEF: a type of piano music that is played in a loud cheerful way

the American spelling of
honour

the American spelling of
honourable
if you leave the army with an honorable discharge, your behaviour and work have been very good
a sum of money offered to a professional for a piece of advice, a speech etc
an honorary title, rank, or university degree is given to someone as an honour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brown received an honorary doctorate from Seoul University.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗获得了首尔大学的荣誉博士学位。

Sense.DEF: an honorary position in an organization is held without receiving any payment
an honorary member of a group is treated like a member of that group but does not belong to it

someone who receives an honour or
award
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests clapped and cheered for the honorees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾客们为获奖者鼓掌欢呼。

Sense.DEF: an expression or title that is used to show respect for the person you are speaking to
a list of the best students in a school or college
an agreement between members of a group to obey rules, although no one checks to make sure that they are being followed
Sense.TRAN: 诚信制度〔指无人监督﹑自觉遵守规章的做法〕

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel very proud
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 100 players competed for the honour of representing the county in the National Finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 100多位选手为争取代表郡参加全国总决赛的荣誉进行角逐。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is an honour to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is an honor to have you here, sir.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 先生﹐大驾光临﹐深感荣幸。

Sense.DEF: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was prepared even to die in order to defend the honour of his family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了捍卫家族荣誉﹐他甚至愿意献出生命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对法国队来说﹐打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

Subsense.DEF: in order to show how much you admire and respect someone
Subsense.TRAN: 为了表示对某人/某事物的崇敬
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The stadium was named in honour of the club’s first chairman.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该体育馆以俱乐部的第一任主席命名以示纪念。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A special dinner will be held in her honour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将举办一次特别晚宴向她致敬。

Subsense.DEF: to celebrate an event
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An oak tree was planted in honour of the occasion .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种下了一棵橡树以纪念这一盛会。

Sense.DEF:
something such as a special title or
medal
given to someone to show how much people respect them for what they have achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reverend Peters was nominated for the honour by colleagues at Walworth Methodist Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼德斯牧师获沃尔沃思循道宗教会同仁提名角逐这一称号。

GramExa.GLOSS: most important honour
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The medal is the highest honour the association can bestow give .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这奖章是该协会可授予的最高荣誉。

Sense.DEF: strong moral beliefs and standards of behaviour that make people respect and trust you
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was a man of honour and great integrity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是个高尚正直的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her actions were always guided by a deep sense of honour strong desire to do what is morally right .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的行为一直受到强烈道德感的指引。

GramExa.GLOSS: something that you feel you must do because of your moral principles
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It had become a point of honour not to tell him about Lori.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不把洛丽的情况告诉他已经事关道义。

Subsense.DEF: if you pass a university degree with honours, you pass it at a level that is higher than the most basic level
if you finish high school or college with honors, you get one of the highest grades
the highest or second highest level of degree at a British university
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英国大学中的〕一级/二级荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to or about a judge
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, Your Honour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是﹐法官大人。

Sense.DEF: the seat or place which is given to the most important guest or object
Sense.TRAN: 贵宾席﹐上座﹔最重要位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: The vase she gave me occupies the place of honor in my living room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她送我的花瓶放在我的起居室最尊荣的位置。

Sense.DEF: if someone is buried with full military honours, there is a military ceremony at their funeral
to pour the drinks, serve food etc at a social occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社交场合上〕尽主人之谊〔指倒酒﹑布菜等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz, would you do the honors?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹﹐你能招待一下客人们吗？

Sense.DEF: a very serious promise that what you are saying is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t try to see you again. I give you my word of honour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会再见你﹐我发誓。

Sense.DEF: to bring admiration and respect to your country, school, family etc because of your behaviour or achievements
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an honour to his family and his country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是家族和国家的光荣。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/feel honour bound to do sth
Sense.DEF: to feel that it is your moral duty to do something
Sense.TRAN: 在道义上有责任做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We felt honor bound to attend their wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们参加他们的婚礼是义不容辞的。

Subsense.DEF: if you swear on your honour to do something, you promise very seriously to do it
if you are on your honour to do something, you are being trusted to do it

Sense.DEF: used to say that the people or teams in a competition, game etc have done as well as each other or have the same score
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛双方〕实力相当﹔比分相同

Sense.DEF: if a woman loses her honour, she has sex with a man she is not married to

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a great honour to meet my hero in person.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲眼见到我的偶像真是莫大的荣幸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very special honour that is not given to many people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Being asked to paint a portrait for the queen is a rare honour for any artist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 获请为女王画肖像对任何画家来说都是一项殊荣。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that you are not sure that you should be proud of

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As a young man, he had the honour of meeting Winston Churchill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时有幸见到过温斯顿·丘吉尔。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying that you feel proud that someone has decided to do something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 为某人做某事使之感到荣幸﹐给面子为某人做某事
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Will you do me the honour of becoming my wife?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能否有幸娶你为妻？

Sense.DEF: to feel very proud and pleased
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt very honoured to be included in the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能加入这支球队﹐我深感荣幸。

Sense.DEF: to show publicly that someone is respected and admired, especially by praising them or giving them a special title

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was honored with an award for excellence in teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因教学出色而获表彰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two firefighters have been honoured for their courage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名消防队员因非凡的勇气获得嘉奖。

Sense.DEF: to do what you have agreed to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once again, the government has failed to honour its promises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府又一次食言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We pray that both sides will continue to honour their commitment to the peace agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祈盼双方继续履行对和平协定作出的承诺。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone with special respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a marriage, you need to honour one another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻中双方应该互相尊重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was treated like an honored guest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受到了贵宾般的待遇。

Sense.DEF: if your bank honours a cheque that you have given someone, it pays the money to that person

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb has decided to honour us with their presence
Sense.DEF: used humorously when someone arrives late, or to someone who rarely comes to a meeting, class etc
Sense.TRAN: 某人决定赏光出席了〔幽默用法﹐用于迟到者、不常参加会议或上课者等〕

Sense.DEF: an honourable action or activity deserves respect and admiration
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为或活动〕光荣的﹐值得尊敬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father didn’t think acting was an honorable profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲认为当演员不是受人尊敬的职业。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is morally correct and shows you have high moral standards
Sense.TRAN: 品行高洁的﹐品德高尚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a principled and honourable man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讲求原则﹑品德高尚的人

Sense.DEF: an honourable arrangement or agreement is fair to everyone who is involved in it
used in Britain in the titles of children whose father is a lord and in the titles of judges and Members of Parliament
Sense.TRAN: 尊敬的〔在英国对贵族子女﹑法官和议员的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: used in the US when writing to or about a judge or important person in the government
Sense.TRAN: 尊敬的〔在美国对法官或政府要员的尊称〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: the Honourable Gentleman/the Honourable Lady/my Honourable Friend/the Honourable Member
Sense.DEF: used by British members of parliament when talking to or about each other in the House of Commons
Sense.TRAN: 尊敬的议员〔英国下议院议员相互之间的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: a special honour in a competition for work that was of high quality but did not get a prize
Sense.TRAN: 〔给比赛中未获正式名次但有优异表现者颁发的〕荣誉奖

Sense.DEF: when a woman living in a country or society with very strict rules about women’s moral behaviour is murdered by her father or brother because she has had sex with someone that she is not married to
Sense.TRAN: 名节处死〔在女性礼教很严格的国家或社会中由父﹑兄等处死被认为败坏名节的女性〕

Sense.DEF: a British university degree that is above the basic level in one or two particular subjects
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学的〕荣誉学位﹐优等学位

GramExa.GLOSS: a degree in two main subjects
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔两门学科并重的〕联合荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: a list of important people in Britain to whom titles are given as a sign of respect
strong alcohol, especially alcohol that has been made illegally

an insulting word for a young woman who wears clothes that allow large parts of her body to be seen and uses a lot of
make-up
in order to look sexually attractive

Subsense.DEF: a part of a coat, jacket etc that you can pull up to cover your head
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you put your hood up if you’re cold?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你冷的话为什么不把风帽拉起来？

Subsense.DEF: a cloth bag that goes over someone’s face and head so that they cannot be recognized or cannot see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was abducted by four men wearing hoods.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被四个蒙面男子劫持。

Sense.DEF: the metal covering over the engine on a car

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Check under the hood and see what that noise is.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打开引擎盖查查是什么声音。

Sense.DEF:
a cover fitted above a
cooker
to remove the smell of cooking
Sense.TRAN: 〔炉灶上方的〕排风罩﹐抽油烟罩

Sense.DEF:
a folding cover on a car or
pram
, which gives protection from the rain
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车或婴儿车上用于挡雨的〕折叠式车篷﹐篷盖

Sense.DEF:
a
neighbourhood

a
hoodlum
used to refer to a period of time or a state
Sense.EXAMPLE: during his childhood when he was a child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的童年时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: parenthood the state of being a parent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母身份

Sense.DEF: the people who belong to a particular group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the priesthood all the people who are priests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体教士

Sense.DEF: having or wearing a hood
Sense.TRAN: 带风帽的﹔有罩的﹔戴着风帽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hooded cape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带风帽的斗篷

Sense.DEF:
a loose jacket or top made of soft material, which has a
hood
a young person who wears a hoodie – sometimes used expressing disapproval because some people connect wearing hoodies with bad or criminal behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 穿风帽夹克的年轻男子〔有时含贬义﹐因有人将穿风帽夹克和不良行为及犯罪联系起来〕

Sense.DEF: a criminal, often a young person, who does violent or illegal things
to trick someone in a clever way so that you can get an advantage for yourself
stupid talk
the hard foot of an animal such as a horse, cow etc
if you do something on the hoof, you do it quickly while doing something else at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 顺便﹐顺带着〔做某件事情〕

Sense.DEF: to run or walk quickly
a dancer, especially one who works in the theatre
noisy talk or excitement about something unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s all the hoo-ha about?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干什么这么吵闹呀？

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of metal or plastic that you use for hanging things on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom hung his coat on the hook behind the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆把外套挂在门后的衣钩上。

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of thin metal with a sharp point for catching fish
to allow someone or help someone to get out of a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t prepared to let her off the hook that easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿意如此轻易地放过她。

Sense.LEXUNIT: leave/take the phone off the hook
Sense.DEF:
to leave or take the telephone
receiver the part you speak into
off the part where it is usually placed so that no one can call you
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不想接听电话而〕摘下电话听筒

Sense.DEF: if your telephone is ringing off the hook, a lot of people are calling you
Sense.TRAN: 〔大量电话打进来时〕铃声大作﹐铃声不断

Sense.DEF: something that is attractive and gets people’s interest and attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: You always need a bit of a hook to get people to go to the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想让人们去戏院总得有一些吸引人的招数。

Sense.DEF: if you are going to do something by hook or by crook, you are determined to do it, whatever methods you have to use
Sense.TRAN: 千方百计地﹔不择手段地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are going to get these guys, by hook or by crook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方无论如何也要抓住这些家伙。

Sense.DEF:
a way of hitting your opponent in
boxing
, in which your elbow is bent
if someone believes something hook, line, and sinker, they believe a lie completely
Sense.TRAN: 完全地﹐无保留地〔相信谎言〕

Sense.DEF: to catch a fish with a hook
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hooked a 20-pound salmon last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上周钓到一条20磅重的鲑鱼。

Sense.DEF: to fasten or hang something onto something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just hook the bucket onto the rope and lower it down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要把桶拴在绳子上往下送就可以了。

Sense.DEF: to bend your finger, arm, or leg, especially so that you can pull or hold something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth hooked her arm through Tony’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝挽住了托尼的手臂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to hook his leg over the branch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图用腿钩住树枝。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in making someone interested in something or attracted to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: cigarette ads designed to hook young people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专为吸引年轻人而设计的香烟广告

Sense.DEF: to connect a piece of electronic equipment to another piece of equipment or to an electricity supply
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got a CD player, but it’s not hooked up yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一台激光唱片播放机﹐不过还没有接通电源。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computers from different manufacturers can often be hooked together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同厂家生产的电脑往往可以互连。

Sense.DEF: to throw or kick a ball so that it moves in a curve

Subsense.DEF: to start having a sexual relationship with someone
to meet someone and become friendly with them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you ever hook up with Maisy while you were there?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在那里的时候有没有和梅西交往？

Subsense.DEF: to agree to work together with another organization for a particular purpose
Subsense.TRAN: 与…挂钩〔指与某个组织合作〕

Sense.DEF: to help someone get something that they need or want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think you can hook me up with some tickets for tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看能不能帮我弄几张今晚的票？

Sense.DEF: a pipe for smoking drugs, that consists of a long tube and a container of water
a small metal hook and ring used for fastening clothes
curved outwards or shaped like a hook
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hooked nose
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鹰钩鼻

Sense.DEF: if you are hooked on a drug, you feel a strong need for it and you cannot stop taking it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know a girl who got hooked on cocaine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认识一个染上可卡因毒瘾的姑娘。

Sense.DEF: if you are hooked on something, you enjoy it very much and you want to do it as often as possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got hooked on TV when I was sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生病时看电视上了瘾。

Sense.DEF: having one or more hooks
a woman who has sex with men for money
a temporary connection between two pieces of equipment such as computers, or between a piece of equipment and an electricity or water supply
to stay away from school without permission
a noisy violent person who causes trouble by fighting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: football hooligans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球流氓

Sense.DEF: a large ring made of wood, metal, plastic etc

a large ring that children used to play with in the past, or that
circus
animals are made to jump through
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时儿童当玩具的〕环﹔〔马戏团中供动物钻过的〕大圈

Subsense.DEF:
the ring that you have to throw the ball through to score points in
basketball

the game of
basketball

Sense.DEF: if someone makes you jump through hoops, they make you do lots of difficult or boring things before you are allowed to do what you want to do
Sense.TRAN: 经受考验[磨炼]﹐克服许多困难

Sense.DEF:
an
earring
that is shaped like a ring
in the shape of a hoop, or containing something in the shape of a hoop
Sense.EXAMPLE: hooped earrings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圈状耳环

Sense.DEF: excitement about something which attracts a lot of public attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the hoopla that surrounded the trial
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 围绕这次审判的纷纷议论

Sense.DEF: a game in which prizes can be won by throwing a ring over an object from a distance
shouted when you are very glad about something
Sense.TRAN: 好哇〔表示高兴的呼喊声〕

Sense.DEF: a young man from the highest social class, who is often loud and noisy in his way of behaving and enjoying himself, and is regarded by most people as very stupid
Sense.TRAN: 爱喧闹干蠢事的上流社会男青年﹐招摇的纨绔子弟

Sense.DEF: a shout or laugh that shows you think something is funny or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔认为某事可笑或愚蠢时发出的〕嘘叫声﹐嘲笑声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hoots of laughter rose from the audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众发出了哄笑声。

Sense.DEF:
a sound that an
owl
makes
a short clear sound made by a vehicle or ship, as a warning
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车喇叭﹑轮船汽笛的〕鸣响声〔以示警告〕

Sense.DEF: to be very funny or amusing

Sense.LEXUNIT: don’t give a hoot/don’t care two hoots
Sense.DEF: to not care at all about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 一点也不在乎﹐完全不放在心上

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was clear that Owen didn’t care two hoots about her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然欧文完全不在乎她。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or ship hoots, it makes a loud clear noise as a warning
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车〕鸣（喇叭）﹔〔船〕鸣（笛）〔以作警告〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car behind was hooting at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身后的汽车冲着我鸣喇叭。

Sense.DEF:
if an
owl
hoots, it makes a long ‘oo’ sound
to laugh loudly because you think something is funny or stupid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had the audience hooting with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他令观众哄堂大笑。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
hooch
a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise and is used on cars, ships, or in factories
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车的〕喇叭﹔〔船或工厂的〕汽笛

Sense.DEF: a nose
an offensive word for a woman’s breasts
Sense.TRAN: 奶子﹐乳房〔此词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF:
a
vacuum cleaner

to clean a floor,
carpet
etc using a
vacuum cleaner a machine that sucks up dirt
Sense.TRAN: 用真空吸尘器清洁〔地板﹑地毯等〕

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
hoof
to move by jumping on one foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little girl hopping and skipping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩

Sense.DEF: if a bird, an insect, or a small animal hops, it moves by making quick short jumps
Sense.TRAN: 〔鸟﹑昆虫或小动物快速小步〕跳跃

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere quickly or suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hop in – I’ll drive you home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上车吧﹐我送你回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick hopped out of bed and quickly got dressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克跳下床飞快地穿上衣服。

Sense.DEF: to get on a plane, bus, train etc, especially after suddenly deciding to do so
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指突然决定〕跳上飞机/公共汽车/火车等
Sense.EXAMPLE: So we hopped a bus to Phoenix that night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是我们当晚便跳上了去凤凰城的公共汽车。

Sense.DEF: used to rudely tell someone to go away
very angry
to do something when someone is not expecting it and is not ready
a short jump

Subsense.DEF: parts of dried flowers used for making beer, which give the beer a bitter taste
the tall plant on which these flowers grow

Sense.DEF: a single short journey by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a short hop from Cleveland to Detroit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从克利夫兰到底特律的航程很短。

Sense.DEF: a social event at which people dance
to want something to happen or be true and to believe that it is possible or likely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hope that more women will decide to join the course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望更多的女性会决定参加这一课程。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I do hope everything goes well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真心希望一切顺利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hoped that the job would be filled by a local person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望该职位由当地人来担任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s just hope someone finds her bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望有人找到她的提包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope to God I haven’t left the car window open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿我没有忘记关车窗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joan’s hoping to study law at Harvard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼盼望能到哈佛大学攻读法律。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were hoping for good weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们盼望着好天气。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liam decided to ignore the warning and just hope for the best hope that a situation will end well when there is a risk of things going wrong .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利亚姆决定不理会警告﹐只希望事情顺利。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I rang my parents, hoping against hope hoping for something that is very unlikely to happen or be true that they hadn’t left yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给父母打电话﹐抱着一丝希望﹐但愿他们还没走。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 you ‘hope something would happen’. Say that 而要说 you hope something will happen: I hope the weather will be nice (NOT 不说 I hope the weather would be nice). 我希望有个好天气。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope something that has been mentioned happens or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do we get paid this week?’ ‘I certainly hope so!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们这星期能拿到工资吗？”“当然希望如此！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope something that has been mentioned does not happen or is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I’m busy that day, or at least I hope not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想那天我不会很忙﹐至少我希望不会忙。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope something will happen, especially because you are depending on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m hoping the car will be fixed by Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常希望能在星期五之前修好汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were hoping to see you today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们本来以为今天能见到你的。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to be polite and to make sure that you are not interrupting or offending someone
Sense.TRAN: 我希望〔用于表示礼貌﹐确保自己没有打断别人的话或冒犯别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope I’m not interrupting you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望没有打断你的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you don’t mind me asking, but why are you moving?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你不介意我问一下﹐你为什么搬家？

Sense.LEXUNIT: I should hope so (too)/I should hope not
Sense.DEF: used to say that you feel very strongly that something should or should not happen
Sense.TRAN: 我（也）希望如此/我不希望这样
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They’ll get their money back.’ ‘I should hope so too, after being treated like that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们会把钱要回来的。”“我也希望如此﹐他们已经吃够苦头了。”

Sense.DEF: a feeling of wanting something to happen or be true and believing that it is possible or likely
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I first arrived in New York, I was full of hope for the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我初到纽约时﹐对未来充满希望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President has expressed the hope that relations will improve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统表达了改善关系的愿望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: hopes for an end to the fighting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结束战斗的愿望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rita has hopes of studying to be a nurse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽塔希望学习护士专业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Should they hang on in the hope that the shares will go up in value?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是否应该还抱有希望﹐认为股价会上升？

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the hope of doing sth
GramExa.GLOSS: because you hope that you will do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shoppers flocked to the sales in the hope of finding a bargain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购物者蜂拥来到特卖会﹐希望淘到便宜货。

Sense.DEF: something that you hope will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told him all her secret hopes and fears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把隐藏在心里的所有期望和担忧都告诉了他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My hope is that by next summer I’ll have saved enough money to go travelling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望明年夏天我能攒够钱去旅行。

Sense.DEF: a chance of succeeding or of something good happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the rush hour, and there was no hope of getting a seat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是高峰时间﹐不可能有座位。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a desperate plan, with little hope of success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个孤注一掷的计划﹐成功的可能性很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s still a faint hope a very small chance that the two sides will reach an agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方还是有一丝希望达成协议。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that there is no chance of something happening

GramExa.PROPFORM: not a hope in hell (of doing sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: not even the smallest chance of success
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They don’t have a hope in hell of winning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们压根儿没有希望获胜。

GramExa.GLOSS: used humorously to say that there is no chance that something will happen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Your dad might lend you the car.’ ‘Some hope!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你爸也许会把车借给你。”“想得美！”

Sense.DEF: to be someone’s last, only etc chance of getting the result they want
Sense.TRAN: 是某人最后/唯一/最好的希望
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please help me. You’re my last hope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请帮帮我﹐你是我最后的希望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joshua’s only hope of survival was a heart transplant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔舒亚唯一存活的希望就是心脏移植。

Sense.DEF: if a situation is beyond hope, it is so bad that there is no chance of any improvement
Sense.TRAN: 没有好转的希望﹐无可救药

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the houses were beyond hope of repair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些房屋已经没有修复的希望了。

Sense.DEF: to be confident that someone or something will be successful
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某物抱有很高期望
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather looked good, so we had high hopes for today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气看起来不错﹐所以我们对今天充满期望。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that you keep hoping that something will happen – often used humorously when saying that it seems unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 我/我们仍怀有希望〔常为幽默用法﹐表示某事似乎不可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you think your son will ever get a job?’ ‘We live in hope!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得你儿子能找到工作吗？”“只要活着﹐就有希望！”

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – meanings 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The situation looked bad, but we still had hope that things would get better soon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 局势看来不妙﹐但我们仍希望很快会好转。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The research has given hope to thousands of sufferers of the disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究给千千万万该病的患者带来了希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop hoping
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After so long without any word from David, Margaret was starting to lose hope.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么长时间没有戴维的消息﹐玛格丽特渐渐放弃了希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone feel that what they want is likely to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to raise your hopes too much.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让你抱太大希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you think something is likely
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Negotiators did not hold out much hope of a peaceful solution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判人员对和平解决不抱太大希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hope for one thing that everything else depends on
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After a difficult year, the company is pinning its hopes on its new range of products.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经历了艰难的一年后﹐公司此刻对新的产品系列寄予厚望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: keep hoping that something will happen, even though it seems unlikely
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They clung to the hope that one day a cure would be found.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还抱着希望﹐认为有一天会找到治疗方法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make what someone wants seem impossible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ending of the talks has dashed any hopes of peace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判的终结粉碎了和平的希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: people have much less hope of doing something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Hopes are fading that rescuers will find any more survivors.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援人员找到更多幸存者的希望渐趋渺茫。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded full of hope.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音听起来充满希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a little hope, or something that gives you a little hope
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new treatment gives patients a glimmer of hope.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新疗法给患者带来一线希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the things someone hopes for
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We talked about all our hopes and dreams for the future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈了对未来的种种期望和梦想。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the things someone hopes for and is afraid of

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to give people false hopes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想让人空怀希望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hope for something that is impossible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He traveled south in the vain hope of finding work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他远赴南方找工作﹐希望很渺茫。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My only hope is that someone may have handed in the keys to the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我唯一的希望就是有人可能已经把钥匙交给警察了。

Sense.DEF: used to describe something that you want to happen and think is possible or likely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was at home when the desperately hoped-for call came through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在家时接到了满心期待的电话。

Sense.DEF: believing that what you hope for is likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 抱有希望的﹐持乐观态度的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone’s feeling pretty hopeful about the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都对未来充满希望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m hopeful that we can find a solution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对我们能找到解决方法感到乐观。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is still hopeful of playing in Saturday’s game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍抱有希望﹐认为自己能参加星期六的比赛。

Sense.DEF: making you feel that what you hope for is likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The vote is a hopeful sign that attitudes in the church are changing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票结果是个好兆头﹐表明教会的态度正在转变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things might get better, but it doesn’t look very hopeful right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况也许会好转﹐但目前看来希望不大。

Sense.DEF: someone who is hoping to be successful, especially in acting, sports, politics etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指演艺﹑体育﹑政界等〕希望获得成功的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of young hopefuls were auditioned for the role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几千名雄心勃勃的年轻人参加了这一角色的试演。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Republican presidential hopefuls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有望获胜的共和党总统候选人

Sense.DEF: a way of saying what you hope will happen, which some people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 有望﹐可望〔有人认为此用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopefully, I’ll be back home by ten o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有望10点前回到家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By then the problem will hopefully have been solved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 届时该问题有望得到解决。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows that you are hopeful
Sense.TRAN: 怀有希望地﹐充满希望地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will there be any food left over?’ he asked hopefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “会有吃的东西剩下吗？”他满怀希望地问道。

Sense.DEF: if something that you try to do is hopeless, there is no possibility of it being successful
Sense.TRAN: 没有成功可能的﹐无望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried to stop the flames from spreading, but we knew it was hopeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们试图阻止火势蔓延﹐但我们知道这是不可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting your work published often seems a hopeless task .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想让自己的作品出版似乎总是徒劳的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept on struggling forward, even though I knew it was hopeless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然知道无望﹐我还是奋力挣扎向前。

Sense.DEF: a hopeless situation is so bad that there is no chance of success or improvement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation is not as hopeless as it might seem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况并不像看上去那么毫无希望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the millions who live in hopeless poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数生活在贫困深渊中的人们

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a hopeless cook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是个糟糕的厨师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My brother was always pretty hopeless at ball games.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟玩球类游戏向来不行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m hopeless with machinery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对机械一窍不通。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a hopeless memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记性很差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public transport system was absolutely hopeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共交通系统实在太糟了。

Sense.DEF: feeling no hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: I began to feel lonely and hopeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始感到寂寞绝望。

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to say that someone’s bad behaviour cannot be changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, James, you really are a hopeless case it seems impossible to change your behaviour !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎﹐詹姆斯﹐你真是无药可救！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a hopeless romantic, always convinced that one day she would meet the man of her dreams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个彻头彻尾的浪漫主义者﹐总是深信有一天会遇到梦中情人。

Sense.DEF: used when emphasizing how bad a situation is, and saying that it will not get better
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况〕没有希望地﹐无望地﹔完全地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found ourselves hopelessly outnumbered by the enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现敌人的人数远远超过了我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt hopelessly confused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全糊涂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was trying to find the museum, but I got hopelessly lost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想找到博物馆﹐却完全迷路了。

Sense.DEF: to have or develop very strong feelings of love for someone
feeling that you have no hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When will I see you again?’ he asked hopelessly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我什么时候能再见到你？”他绝望地问道。

Sense.DEF: happy and excited, especially after taking drugs
a hopped-up car, engine etc has been made much more powerful
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑引擎等〕功率增大了的﹐马力加大的

Sense.DEF:
a large
funnel 1 1
a children’s game in which each child has to jump from one square drawn on the ground to another
a large crowd moving in a noisy uncontrolled way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were hordes of people inside the station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站里有一群群乱哄哄的人。

Sense.DEF: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could see a ship on the horizon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能看见地平线上有一艘船。

Sense.HINTTRAN: do not say 不要说 ‘in the horizon’. Say 而要说 on the horizon.

Sense.DEF: the limit of your ideas, knowledge, and experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑知识和经验的〕范围﹐界限﹔眼界

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

Sense.DEF: to seem likely to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business is good now, but there are a few problems on the horizon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前的生意很好﹐但有几个问题已初露端倪了。

Sense.DEF: flat and level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horizontal surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水平面

Sense.DEF: a horizontal line or surface
a horizontal position
Sense.EXAMPLE: eleven degrees below the horizontal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水平位置以下11度

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance produced by your body that influences its growth, development, and condition

Sense.TRAN: 激素替代疗法﹐荷尔蒙替代疗法

Subsense.DEF: the hard pointed thing that grows, usually in pairs, on the heads of animals such as cows and goats
the substance that animals’ horns are made of
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a knife with a horn handle
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把有角质柄的刀

Subsense.DEF:
a part of an animal’s head that sticks out like a horn, for example on a
snail

Sense.DEF: the thing in a vehicle that you use to make a loud sound as a signal or warning

GramExa.GLOSS: make a noise with your horn

Subsense.DEF: a musical instrument like a long metal tube that is wide at one end, that you play by blowing

a
trumpet

a
french horn
a musical instrument made from an animal’s horn

Sense.DEF:
a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying
gunpowder
etc
to reduce the amount of money you spend

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the horns of a dilemma
Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which you have to choose between two equally unpleasant or difficult situations

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take the bull by the horns

Sense.DEF: to interrupt or try to take part in something when you are not wanted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t try and horn in on our fun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想挤进来扫我们的兴。

Sense.DEF: a tropical bird with a very large beak
having horns or something that looks like horns
Sense.EXAMPLE: horned cattle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有角的牛
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horned toad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 角蟾

Sense.DEF: a large black and yellow flying insect that can sting
a situation in which there is a lot of trouble and quarrelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new production targets have stirred up a hornets’ nest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的生产指标引起一片哗然。

Sense.DEF:
a traditional dance performed by
sailors
, or the music for this dance
glasses with frames made of plastic that looks like horn
sexually excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: feeling horny
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到欲火中烧的

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s horny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他很性感。

Sense.DEF: skin that is horny is hard and rough
made of a hard substance like horn
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bird’s horny beak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟的角质喙

Sense.DEF:
a description of your character and the things that will happen to you, based on the position of the stars and
planets
at the time of your birth
frightening and terrible
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horrendous experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffered horrendous injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: extremely unreasonable or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: horrendous debts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额债务
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic was horrendous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通状况糟透了。

Sense.DEF: very bad - used, for example, about things you see, taste, or smell, or about the weather
Sense.TRAN: 糟糕的﹐令人不快的﹐极讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather has been really horrible all week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个星期天气都很糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horrible smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极难闻的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food looked horrible, but it tasted OK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那食物看上去很糟﹐可吃起来还不错。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant and often frightening, worrying, or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹐吓人的﹐令人恐惧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horrible dream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噩梦
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a horrible feeling that we’re going to miss the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一种很不好的感觉﹐我们要赶不上飞机了。

Sense.DEF: rude and unfriendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a horrible person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个粗鲁的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a horrible thing to say!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话真粗鲁！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why are you so horrible to me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对我为什么这么凶？

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The plan had gone horribly wrong.

Exponent.DEF: very bad and unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s that horrible smell?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么气味这么难闻？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This fish tastes horrible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这鱼真难吃。

Exponent.DEF: horrible, especially in a way that makes you feel slightly sick
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to take two spoons of some disgusting medicine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得吞下两勺很难吃的药。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The stench in the room was revolting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里恶臭难当。

Exponent.DEF: very unpleasant – often used about a taste that stays in your mouth
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指口中的余味〕令人极为不快的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cheap wine sometimes leaves a nasty taste in your mouth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价葡萄酒有时会留下很不好的余味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the nasty smell of bad eggs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 变质鸡蛋的恶臭

Exponent.DEF: horrible and making you feel that you are going to vomit – used especially about a smell
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the nauseating smell of stale beer and cigarette smoke
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 走味的啤酒和香烟烟雾令人作呕的气味

Exponent.DEF: horrible – used especially when there is decay or waste
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指因腐烂或有废弃物而〕难吃的﹔难闻的,恶臭的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a foul smell coming from the water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水中泛出一股恶臭。

Section.SECHEADING: experience, situation, event 经历﹑状况﹑事件

Exponent.DEF: very bad and unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For one horrible moment, I thought I was going to fall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一刹那很可怕﹐我觉得自己要跌倒了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The refugees were living in dreadful conditions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些难民的生活环境非常糟糕。

Exponent.DEF: very unpleasant and shocking – used especially about events where people are hurt
Exponent.TRAN: 令人极不愉快的﹐严重的〔尤指有人受伤的事件〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s been a nasty accident on the motorway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上发生了严重的事故。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a nasty cut
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的割伤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The news came as a nasty shock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 消息传来﹐令人极为震惊。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horrid smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极难闻的气味

Sense.DEF: behaving in a nasty unkind way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so horrid!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那么凶！

Sense.DEF: extremely bad, in a way that is frightening or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹐恐怖的﹐令人恐惧的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a horrific plane crash
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的飞机失事

Sense.EXAMPLE: His injuries were horrific.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伤势很重。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very shocked and upset or afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry was horrified by what had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利对所发生的事感到毛骨悚然。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was horrified to discover that he loved Rose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现他爱罗丝﹐她感到很震惊。

Sense.DEF: extremely bad, especially in a way that is frightening or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹐恐怖的﹐令人震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: murder, rape and other horrifying crimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀﹑强奸及其他骇人听闻的罪案
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s horrifying to see how much poverty there is here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到这里如此贫困令人震惊。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of shock and fear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff watched in horror as he set himself alight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工惊恐地看着他自焚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people recoil with horror when they see a big spider like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人看到这样一只大蜘蛛时都会吓得往后退。

GramExa.GLOSS: making someone shocked or afraid
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To my horror, I realised my shirt was wet with blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现自己的衬衫被鲜血沾湿﹐大为惊恐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have seen the look of horror on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真该看看他脸上恐惧的表情。

Sense.DEF: something that is very terrible, shocking, or frightening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the horrors of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的恐怖

Sense.DEF: when a situation or event is very unpleasant or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的令人震惊[恐怖]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dense smoke surrounded them, adding to the horror of the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓烟包围了他们﹐情形变得更加恐怖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only when the vehicle was lifted did the full horror of the accident become clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当车辆被吊起来时才知道事故到底有多可怕。

Sense.DEF: to be afraid of something or dislike it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a horror of snakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很怕蛇。

Sense.DEF: a young child who behaves badly
Sense.TRAN: 淘气鬼﹐讨厌鬼〔指小孩子〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel unreasonably frightened or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 令某人感到非常恐惧[紧张]

Sense.DEF: used to say how bad something is - often used humorously when you think something is not really very bad
Sense.TRAN: 老天爷呀﹐吓死人啦〔常为幽默用法﹐用于认为某事物并不真的糟糕时〕

Sense.DEF: a film in which strange and frightening things happen
a report about bad experiences, bad conditions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: horror stories about patients being given the wrong drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关给病人吃错药的骇人报道

Sense.DEF: a story in which strange and frightening things happen
suddenly very shocked and frightened
Sense.TRAN: 大吃一惊的﹔惊恐万状的

Sense.DEF: food that is served in small amounts before the main part of the meal
a large strong animal that people ride and use for pulling heavy things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horse and cart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆马车
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lee had never ridden a horse before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李以前从未骑过马。

Sense.DEF: horse races
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim likes a bet on the horses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆喜欢赌马。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of sports equipment in a
gymnasium
that people jump over
if you hear or get information straight from the horse’s mouth, you are told it by someone who has direct knowledge of it
the process of matching people with suitable jobs or activities
a competition or an election that only two etc competitors can win
Sense.TRAN: 只有两个/三个/四个队[候选人]等有获胜机会的比赛[竞选]

Sense.LEXUNIT: a horse of a different color
Sense.DEF: something that is completely different from another thing
sensible judgment gained from ex-perience

Crossrefto.REFLEX: never/don’t look a gift horse in the mouth
put the cart before the horse

Sense.DEF: to play roughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop horsing around – you’ll break something!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别胡闹了﹐你会打破东西的！

Sense.DEF: riding a horse
a large vehicle for carrying horses, often pulled by another vehicle
a large tree that produces shiny brown nuts and has white or pink flowers
a nut from this tree
horse-drawn vehicles are pulled by a horse
a large fly that bites horses and cattle

the hair from a horse’s
mane
and tail, sometimes used to fill the inside of furniture

Sense.DEF: someone who rides horses
the skill involved in riding horses
rough noisy play in which people push or hit each other for fun
a unit for measuring the power of an engine, or the power of an engine measured like this
Sense.TRAN: 马力〔功率单位或以此单位计算的引擎功率〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-hundred horsepower engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两百马力的发动机
Sense.EXAMPLE: the superior horsepower of a Volkswagen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大众汽车的强劲动力

Sense.DEF: a sport in which horses with riders race against each other
a plant whose root has a very strong hot taste
the activity of riding horses
nonsense
a U-shaped piece of iron that is fixed onto the bottom of a horse’s foot
an object in the shape of a horseshoe that is a sign of good luck
a sports event in which people compete to show their skill in riding horses
when the people, especially business people or politicians, who are involved in a discussion try hard to gain an advantage for their own side - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商界或政界人士为己方利益的〕讨价还价〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a large vehicle for carrying horses, pulled by another vehicle
a woman who rides horses
very interested in horses and riding
a face etc that is like a horse’s
the practice or science of growing flowers, fruit, and vegetables
a long rubber or plastic tube that can be moved and bent to put water onto fires, gardens etc

tights
,
stockings
, or socks - used especially in shops
Sense.TRAN: 连裤袜﹔长筒袜﹔短袜〔尤用于商店〕

Sense.DEF: to wash or pour water over something or someone, using a hose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you hose down the car for me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我冲洗一下汽车好吗？

Sense.DEF: to cheat or deceive someone
a long hose

a general word for
tights
,
stockings
, or socks, used in shops and in the clothing industry
Sense.TRAN: 袜类〔用于商店及制衣业〕

Sense.DEF: a special hospital for people who are dying
friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors
Sense.TRAN: 好客的﹐殷勤的﹐热情友好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local people were very kind and hospitable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人非常友好热情。

Sense.DEF: used for describing an environment in which things can grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Sahara is one of the world’s least hospitable regions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒哈拉沙漠是世界上最不适宜植物生长的地区之一。

Sense.DEF: a large building where sick or injured people receive medical treatment
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are building a new hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在建一家新医院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She visited him in hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去医院探望他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two people are in the hospital with serious burns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两人因严重烧伤而住院。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pain got worse and she had to go to the hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛得更厉害了﹐只得去医院看病。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 被送往/紧急送往/用飞机送往医院
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Three people were taken to hospital after a crash on the motorway.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路撞车事故发生后﹐有三人被送往医院。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was admitted to hospital suffering from chest pain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为胸口痛﹐被收治入院。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be allowed to leave a hospital because you are better
for people with mental illnesses
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was admitted to a secure psychiatric hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一家防范严密的精神病院收治。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for women having babies

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What do older people think of hospital care?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人如何看待医院护理？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the period someone spends in hospital
Collocate.EXAMPLE: New surgical techniques mean a hospital stay of less than 48 hours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的外科技术意味着住院时间少于48小时。

Sense.DEF: friendly behaviour towards visitors
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks for your hospitality over the past few weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你几周来的热情款待。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when thanking someone for their hospitality, you usually say thanks for having me/us .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐对别人的热情款待表示感谢一般说thanks for having me/us
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Thanks for having us . We had a great time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你（们）的款待﹐我们过得非常愉快。

Sense.DEF: services such as food and drink that an organization provides for guests at a special event
Sense.EXAMPLE: the use of a yacht for corporate hospitality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司在游艇上款待客人
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a reception in the hospitality suite before the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛开始之前在迎宾套房内举行了一场招待会。

Sense.DEF: if someone is hospitalized, they are taken into a hospital for treatment
someone at a party, meal etc who has invited the guests and who provides the food, drink etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our host greeted us at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人在门口迎接我们。

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces and talks to the guests on a television or radio programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game show host
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏节目主持人

Sense.DEF: a country, city, or organization that provides the necessary space, equipment etc for a special event
Sense.TRAN: 主办者[国﹐城市﹐机构]﹐东道主

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the host city for the next Olympic Games
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下届奥林匹克运动会的主办城市

GramExa.GLOSS: provide the place, food etc for a special meeting or event
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gallery is playing host to an exhibition of sculpture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家美术馆正在举办雕塑展。

Sense.DEF: a large number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: A host of show business celebrities have pledged their support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多演艺圈名人允诺支持。

Sense.DEF: the bread that is used in the Christian ceremony of Communion

an animal or plant on which a smaller animal or plant is living as a
parasite
to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which country is going to host the next World Cup?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

Sense.DEF: to introduce a radio or television programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next week’s show will be hosted by Sarah Cox.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周的节目将由萨拉·考克斯主持。

Sense.DEF: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group are holding two tourists hostage keeping them as hostages .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这伙人挟持了两名游客作为人质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family taken hostage at gunpoint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在枪口下被劫为人质的一家人

Sense.DEF: to be influenced and controlled by something, so that you are not free to do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our country must not be held hostage to our past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的国家决不要被过去所束缚。

Sense.DEF: something that you have promised to do that may cause you problems in the future
a place where people can stay and eat fairly cheaply
Sense.TRAN: 〔提供廉价食宿的〕旅舍﹐招待所

Sense.DEF:
a
youth hostel
a place where people who have no homes can stay

a
pub
or hotel
a woman at a party, meal etc who has invited all the guests and provides them with food, drink etc
a woman who introduces and talks to the guests on a television or radio show
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目的〕女主持人

Sense.DEF: a woman who shows people to seats in a restaurant in the US

a woman whose job is to entertain men at a
nightclub
angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them
Sense.TRAN: 怀有敌意的﹐敌对的﹐不友善的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his hostile attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敌对的态度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy feels hostile towards his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩对父亲怀有敌意。

Sense.DEF: opposing a plan or idea very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Senator Lydon was hostile to our proposals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱登参议员强烈反对我们的议案。

Sense.DEF: belonging to an enemy
Sense.EXAMPLE: hostile territory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌方领土

Sense.DEF: used to describe conditions that are difficult to live in, or that make it difficult to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔生存环境〕恶劣的﹔〔条件〕不利的﹐造成阻碍的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a guide to surviving in even the most hostile terrain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝地生存指南
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sales increased last year despite the hostile economic environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管去年的经济环境不佳﹐销售量还是有所增加。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a company tries to buy another company that does not want to be bought
when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: hostility towards foreigners
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对外国人的敌意

GramExa.EXAMPLE: hostility toward Jews
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对犹太人的敌意

GramExa.GLOSS: hostility that is clearly shown
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They eyed each other with open hostility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们带着公然的敌意看着对方。

Sense.DEF: strong or angry opposition to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reform program was greeted with hostility by conservatives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革方案遭到保守派人士的强烈反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a lot of public hostility to the tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众强烈反对这项税。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pictures of refugees aroused popular hostility felt by a lot of people towards the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民照片激起了广大民众对这场战争的反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Republican hostility toward slavery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党对奴隶制的反对

Sense.DEF: fighting in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cessation of hostilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停战

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
ostler

Subsense.DEF: something that is hot has a high temperature - used about weather, places, food, drink, or objects
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a hot day in July
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月炎热的一天
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s so hot in here. Can I open the window?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里太热了﹐我开开窗好吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Be careful, the water’s very hot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心﹐水很烫。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bar serves hot and cold food .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家小吃店供应冷热食品。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: people who live in hot countries where the weather is usually hot
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在热带国家的人们

GramExa.GLOSS: used about weather that is very hot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scorching hot week in August
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月里炎热的一周

GramExa.GLOSS: used about weather that is very hot and uncomfortable
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔天气〕闷热的﹐热得令人发昏的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The office gets unbearably hot in summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在夏天﹐办公室里热得让人受不了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used about liquid that is extremely hot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coffee was scalding hot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡很烫。

GramExa.GLOSS: used about food that is nice and hot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Serve the soup piping hot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤要热腾腾地端上来。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to describe an object or surface that is very hot
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔物体或表面〕炽热的﹐热得发红的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The handle was red hot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个把手烫得发红。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to describe metal that is extremely hot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He held the metal in the flame until it became white hot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把金属放在火中烧至白热。

Subsense.DEF: if you feel hot, your body feels hot in a way that is uncomfortable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was hot and tired after the journey.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行回来我觉得又热又累。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The wine made her feel hot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝下的酒让她觉得很热。

Subsense.DEF: if clothes are hot, they make you feel too hot in a way that is uncomfortable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This sweater’s too hot to wear inside.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件毛衣在室内穿太热了。

Sense.DEF: food that tastes hot has a burning taste because it contains strong spices
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot curry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种辛辣的咖喱

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is hot is very popular or fashionable, and everyone wants to use them, see them, buy them etc
Sense.TRAN: 很受欢迎的﹐红极一时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the hottest young directors in Hollywood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞最受欢迎的青年导演之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael Owen is already one of soccer’s hottest properties actors or sports players who are very popular .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔·欧文已经是足球界最红的人物之一。
