Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie is going to be this summer’s hot ticket an event that is very popular or fashionable, and that everyone wants to go and see .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影将是今年夏天的大热门。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be the hottest thing since (sliced bread)
GramExa.GLOSS: used about someone or something that is very good and popular, so that everyone wants them

Sense.DEF: very good, especially in a way that is exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot young guitar player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位优秀的年轻吉他手
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot piece of software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卓越的软件
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new film is hot stuff very good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新电影棒极了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s pretty hot at swimming, too.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她也很擅长游泳。

GramExa.GLOSS: not very good
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the tracks on the record are great, but others are not so hot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张唱片有些曲目很好﹐有些却不怎么样。

GramExa.GLOSS: used about someone or something that people think is very good
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真他妈的棒

Subsense.DEF: someone who is hot is very attractive sexually
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The girls all think he’s hot stuff .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们都认为他很性感。

Subsense.DEF: a film, book, photograph etc that is hot is sexually exciting
Subsense.EXAMPLE: his hot and steamy first novel
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他热辣大胆的第一部小说

Subsense.DEF: a meeting with someone who you feel very attracted to sexually
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She has a hot date with Michel.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和米歇尔有一场激情约会。

Subsense.DEF: to be sexually attracted to someone

Sense.DEF: difficult or dangerous to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: If things get too hot a situation becomes too difficult or dangerous to deal with , I can always leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是事态发展过于严峻﹐我总可以抽身退出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilkinson found his opponent a little too hot to handle too difficult to deal with or beat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔金森发现自己的对手有点难对付。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The climate was too hot politically to make such radical changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在如此糟糕的政治气候下无法进行这样激进的变革。

Sense.DEF: a subject that a lot of people are discussing, especially one that causes a lot of disagreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The affair was a hot topic of conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事成了热门话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the hottest issues facing medical science
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学所面临的最有争议的话题之一

Sense.DEF: in an important position and responsible for making difficult decisions
if someone is in hot water, they are in trouble because they have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance minister found himself in hot water over his business interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政部长因染指商业利益而陷入尴尬的境地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She got herself in hot water with the authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和当局惹上了麻烦。

Subsense.DEF: to become angry - used especially when people get angry in an unreasonable way about something that is not important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand why people are getting so hot under the collar about it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白为什么人们为这件事如此愤怒。

Subsense.DEF: someone who has a hot temper becomes angry very easily

Sense.DEF: upset and confused because you have too much to think about or because you are in a hurry
Sense.TRAN: 烦躁不安的﹐焦急的﹔被搞糊涂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were struggling with bags and cases, looking hot and bothered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们吃力地拎着大包小包﹐神色慌张。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/hold sth in your hot little hand
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you have something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have the report in your hot little hands by Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一这份报告一定会交到你手里。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 最近的/令人激动的消息
Sense.DEF: hot news is about very recent events and therefore interesting or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to hear about all the latest hot gossip ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不想听听最新的小道消息？

Sense.DEF: if news or a newspaper is hot off the press, it has just recently been printed

Subsense.DEF: following someone quickly and closely because you want to catch them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因想抓住某人而〕紧追其后﹐穷追不舍
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The car sped away, with the police in hot pursuit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车飞驰而去﹐警察在后面紧追不舍。

Subsense.DEF: close to and likely to catch someone you have been chasing
Subsense.TRAN: 紧紧跟着某人﹐快要逮住某人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The other car was hot on his tail.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一辆汽车紧紧跟着他。

Subsense.DEF: following very close behind someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Bass’s dog was already hot on his heels.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴斯太太的狗已经紧紧跟着他了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come/follow hot on the heels of sth
Sense.DEF: to happen or be done very soon after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息是紧接在另一场坠机事故之后传来的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: hot on the trail of sth
Sense.DEF: very close to finding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: journalists hot on the trail of a news story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上就要发现新闻的记者

Sense.DEF: to keep changing your mind about whether you like or want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps blowing hot and cold about the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对要不要举行婚礼犹豫不决。

Sense.DEF: to experience a strange feeling in which your body temperature suddenly changes, because you are very frightened, worried, or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害怕﹑担心或震惊而〕感到浑身一阵热一阵冷

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t feel too hot/so hot/very hot
Sense.DEF: I feel slightly ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not feeling too hot today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天不太舒服。

Subsense.DEF: to know a lot about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s pretty hot on aircraft.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对飞机很精通。

Subsense.DEF: to be very strict about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company is very hot on security.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司戒备森严。

Sense.DEF: to be ready for something and want it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe is hot for a product like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲急需这样的产品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was hot for revenge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他复仇心切。

Subsense.DEF: to be ready to do something or be involved with something
to feel sexually excited and want to have sex with someone

Sense.DEF: if the competition between people or companies is hot, they are all trying very hard to win or succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Competition for the best jobs is getting hotter all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的工作岗位的争夺日趋激烈。

Sense.DEF: the person, team, horse etc that people think is most likely to win
Sense.TRAN: 最被看好的选手﹐最热门的参赛者

Sense.DEF: a good piece of advice about the likely result of a race, business deal etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot tip on the stock market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资股市的好建议

Sense.DEF: goods that are hot have been stolen

music that is hot has a strong exciting
rhythm

Sense.LEXUNIT: more sth than you’ve had hot dinners
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has had a lot of experience of something and has done it many times
Sense.TRAN: 做某事比你吃过的饭还多
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s delivered more babies than you’ve had hot dinners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接生过的孩子比你吃过的饭还多。

Sense.DEF: money that is frequently moved from one country to another in order to make a profit
Sense.TRAN: 〔在各国间频繁流动以获利的〕游资﹐热钱

Exponent.DEF: used especially when you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I feel really hot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得很热。

Exponent.DEF: a little hot, especially in a way that feels comfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you warm enough?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你够暖和吗？

Exponent.DEF: very hot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must be boiling in that sweater!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿这件毛衣肯定热死了！

Exponent.DEF: feeling very hot because you are ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His head ached and he felt feverish.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头痛﹐感觉发烧了。

Exponent.DEF: used especially when you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hot day
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热的一天
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s too hot to do any work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天太热﹐根本无法工作。

Exponent.DEF: a little hot, especially in a way that seems pleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a warm summer’s evening
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 温暖的夏夜

Exponent.DEF: very hot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The weather was boiling hot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气奇热无比。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a boiling hot day
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热的一天

Exponent.DEF: very hot and dry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a baking hot afternoon
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 灼热的午后
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s baking out there in the garden – I need a drink.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里太热了——我要喝点东西。

Exponent.DEF: very hot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was another scorching hot July day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 又是一个7月里的大热天。

Exponent.DEF: hot and damp
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong gets very humid at this time of year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年这时香港都变得又潮又热。

Exponent.DEF: used especially when you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The office was uncomfortably hot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里热得难受。

Exponent.DEF: a little hot, especially in a way that seems pleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s nice and warm by the fire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉火边暖洋洋的。

Exponent.DEF: very hot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s boiling in here. Can I open the window?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里太热了﹐我开开窗好吗？

Exponent.DEF: much too hot in a way that is uncomfortable – used about rooms and buildings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The inside of the shed was like an oven.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 棚屋里热得像火炉。

Section.SECHEADING: food/liquid/something you touch 食物/液体/触摸之物

Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hot drink
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热饮
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hot meals
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热腾腾的饭菜

Exponent.DEF: a little hot, especially in a way that seems pleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bread was still warm from the oven.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这面包刚烤完不久﹐还是温的呢。

Exponent.DEF: very hot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The water’s boiling hot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水是滚烫的。

Exponent.DEF: slightly warm, but not hot enough – used about liquids
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cup of lukewarm coffee
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯微温的咖啡
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bath water was lukewarm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗澡水不冷不热。

Sense.DEF: if something hots up, there is more activity or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things generally hot up a few days before the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛的前几天气氛通常会变得热烈起来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the speed of something increases
things that someone says that are intended to sound impressive, but do not really mean anything or are not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theory was dismissed as a lot of hot air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一理论被认为是空话而没人理会。

Sense.DEF:
a large
balloon
filled with hot air, used for carrying people up into the sky
a place where a lot of a particular type of activity, especially bad or violent activity, happens
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的温床〔尤指坏事或暴力活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The university was a hotbed of radical protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所大学是激进抗议活动的温床。

Sense.DEF: having very strong emotions such as anger or love, that are difficult to control
Sense.TRAN: 热血沸腾的﹐情感强烈的﹐激昂的

Sense.DEF: a problem or subject that causes a lot of arguments or strong feelings between people
Sense.TRAN: 〔引起众多争论或激烈情绪的〕热门话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your letter certainly hit a hot button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的信毫无疑问成了大家热议的话题。

Sense.DEF: if things are selling like hot cakes, they are very popular and people are buying a lot of them very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copies of the book are selling like hot cakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书非常抢手。

Sense.DEF:
a
pancake
a hot drink made with chocolate powder and milk or water
a number of things mixed up without sensible order or arrangement
Sense.TRAN: 杂乱的一大堆东西﹐大杂烩

Sense.DEF: a round sweet bread roll with a mark in the shape of a cross on top, that is traditionally eaten just before Easter
Sense.TRAN: 〔按传统在复活节前吃的〕十字甜面包

Sense.DEF: a desk that is used by different workers on different days, instead of by the same worker every day
hot food cooked and served in a deep covered dish

a cooked
sausage
in a long piece of bread

to do dangerous and exciting tricks or movements in sports such as
skiing
or
surfing
Sense.TRAN: 〔滑雪或冲浪时〕表演特技[惊险动作]

Sense.DEF: a building where people pay to stay and eat meals
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve booked the flights and the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已订好机票和酒店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be staying at the Hotel Ibis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将住在宜必思酒店。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We stayed in a hotel near the airport.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在机场附近的一家宾馆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He checked into the hotel a little after 2 pm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两点刚过﹐他登记入住了宾馆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: leave a hotel

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was watching TV in her hotel room.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在宾馆房间看电视。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: rooms in a hotel
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price includes hotel accommodation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个价格包含酒店住宿费用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Hotel guests have free use of the gym and pool.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 住店客人可免费使用健身房和游泳池。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She always stays in five-star hotels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是住五星级宾馆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an expensive and comfortable hotel
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a luxury hotel in central London
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦市中心的豪华宾馆

Exponent.DEF: a building where people pay to stay and eat meals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re staying at a hotel in Salzburg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在萨尔茨堡的一家酒店。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Plaza Hotel in New York
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约的广场饭店

Exponent.DEF: a hotel for people travelling by car, usually with a place for the car near each room
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Palm Court Motel on Highway 23
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 23号公路上的棕榈阁汽车旅馆

Exponent.DEF: a small hotel, especially an old one in the countryside. Also used in the names of some big modern hotels
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指乡村古老的〕小旅馆﹐客栈〔也用于一些现代化大酒店的店名中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an 18th-century country inn
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家18世纪的乡村客栈
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Holiday Inn
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假日酒店

Exponent.DEF: a private house or small hotel, where you can sleep and have breakfast
Exponent.TRAN: 提供住宿和早餐的（家庭）旅馆
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a nice bed and breakfast in the village.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里有一家不错的提供早餐的家庭旅馆。

Exponent.DEF: a private house where people can pay to stay and have meals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We stayed in a well-run guesthouse near the sea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在一家经营得不错的海边家庭旅馆。

Exponent.DEF: a very cheap hotel where people can stay for a short time while they are travelling. Hostels are used especially by young people.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔提供廉价食宿的〕旅舍/青年旅舍
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New Zealand has a network of small hostels, ideal for backpackers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新西兰拥有廉价旅舍的网络﹐非常适合背包客。

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or manages a hotel

a sudden hot feeling, especially one that women have during their
menopause
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指妇女更年期出现的〕潮热﹐热潮红

Sense.DEF: to walk or run quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hotfooted it out of there as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我急忙离开那里。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Karl arrived hotfoot from the airport.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔急匆匆从机场赶来。

Sense.DEF: someone who does things too quickly without thinking
a heated building, usually made of glass, where delicate plants can grow
a situation or place where there is a lot of activity and ideas
Sense.TRAN: 活跃的气氛/百花齐放的环境等

Sense.DEF:
one or more keys that you can press on a computer
keyboard
to make the computer quickly do a particular set of actions
a special telephone line for people to find out about or talk about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Call our crime hotline today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天就请拨打我们的犯罪举报热线电话。

Sense.DEF:
a
hyperlink
that allows you to move from one place in a computer document to another, or to a particular place in a different document, especially on the Internet
in an excited or angry way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rumor has been hotly denied.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传言遭到坚决否认。

Sense.DEF: done with a lot of energy and effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most hotly contested congressional elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞争最激烈的国会竞选之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man ran out of the store, hotly pursued chased closely by security guards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个人跑出商店﹐保安人员在后面紧追不放。

Sense.DEF:
very short tight women’s
shorts

a metal surface, usually on a
cooker
, that can be heated so that you can cook a pan of food on it
a mixture of meat, potatoes, and onions, cooked slowly together
Sense.TRAN: 罐焖菜肴〔内有肉﹑马铃薯和洋葱〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment with a small container, used to boil water
a subject or problem that no one wants to deal with, because it is difficult and any decision might make people angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue has become a political hot potato .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该问题已经成了政治上的烫手山芋。

Sense.DEF: an old car that has been fitted with a powerful engine to make it go faster
Sense.TRAN: 改装车〔指旧车改装成的大马力汽车〕

Sense.DEF: to be sexually attracted to someone
Sense.TRAN: 对某人具有强烈的情欲

Sense.DEF: someone who is very successful and confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hotshot lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位业绩卓著的律师

Sense.DEF:
a place where there is a lot of heat or
radiation
Sense.TRAN: 过热点﹐过热部位﹔辐射热点〔指辐射特别强烈的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many microwaves heat unevenly, leading to hot spots in the milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多微波炉加热不均匀﹐导致牛奶中有过热部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hot spots of radioactivity were found near the power station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发电站附近被发现有辐射热点。

Sense.DEF: a place that is popular for entertainment or a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 受欢迎的娱乐[活动]场所
Sense.EXAMPLE: They played regularly at legendary hot spots such as the UFO Club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们经常在飞碟俱乐部等著名娱乐场所演出。

Sense.DEF: a place where there is likely to be fighting or a particular problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report identified eight pollution hot spots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份报告确认了八个污染热点地区。

Sense.DEF:
a part of a computer image on the screen that you can
click
on to make other pictures, words etc appear
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上的〕热点区〔点击就会出现其他图片﹑文字等〕

Sense.DEF:
a place in a public building where there is a computer system with an
access point
, which allows people in the building with a
wireless
computer or
bluetooth mobile phone
to connect to a service such as the Internet
a place where a fire can spread from
a place where hot water comes up naturally from the ground
having a tendency to become angry easily
someone who is very sexually attractive
a heated bath that several people can sit in together
a rubber container full of hot water, used to make a bed warm

to start the engine of a vehicle using the wires of the
ignition
system instead of a key
Sense.TRAN: 热线发动〔汽车引擎〕﹐使〔汽车引擎〕短路点火

Sense.DEF:
other spellings of
humus 1
a dog that is fast and has a good sense of smell, used for hunting
a dog
to keep following someone and asking them questions in an annoying or threatening way
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the court case, Lee was hounded relentlessly by the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 案件审结后﹐李不断受到新闻界的骚扰。

Sense.DEF: to make things so unpleasant for someone that they are forced to leave a place, job etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family were hounded out of their home by 18 months of abuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭受了18个月的骚扰之后﹐那家人不得已搬家了。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour, and 24 hours in one day.
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interview will last about two hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试大概要持续两小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I study for an hour every night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每晚学习一小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back in three hours .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我三小时以后回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three hours later he was back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三小时后他回来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her bag was stolen within hours of her arrival.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她才到没几个小时﹐手提包就被偷了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You weren’t interested in my story a half hour ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半小时之前你还对我讲的事情不感兴趣呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes about a quarter of an hour to walk into town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步行进城大约需要一刻钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After four hours of talks, an agreement was reached.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过四小时的商谈﹐一项协议达成了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is only an hour’s drive from the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家宾馆离机场只有一小时的车程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top speed of 120 miles an hour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 120英里的最高时速
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was freelance work, paid by the hour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是自由工作﹐按小时计酬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-hour delay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五小时的延误

Sense.DEF: a fixed period of time in the day when a particular activity, business etc happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一活动﹑业务等的固定〕时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: hours of business 9.00-5.00
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营业时间: 9点－5点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please call during office hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在办公时间来电。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the advantages of flexible working hours
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹性工作时间的好处

GramExa.GLOSS: the time when you can visit someone in hospital
after the time when a business, especially a bar, is supposed to close
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 办公[营业]时间之后﹔〔尤指〕酒吧关门后

Sense.DEF: used to say how long someone works or does things every day, or when they work or do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long hours worked by hospital doctors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院医生很长的工作时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many hospital staff have to work unsocial hours work in the evenings so that they cannot spend time with family or friends .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多医院员工必须在非正常时间上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew that he kept late hours stayed up late .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道他晚睡。

GramExa.PROPFORM: work all the hours God sends
GramExa.GLOSS: work all the time that you can
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 利用一切可能的时间工作

Sense.DEF: a particular period or point of time during the day or night

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the early/small hours (of the morning)
GramExa.GLOSS: between around midnight and two or three o’clock in the morning
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a knock on the door in the early hours of the morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨时分有人敲门。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Who can be calling at this late hour ? used when you are surprised or annoyed by how late at night or early in the morning something is
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会这么晚打电话来呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The park is open during daylight hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园白天开放。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few people dared to venture out during the hours of darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有人敢在夜里冒险外出。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you are complaining about how early or late something is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had to get up at some ungodly hour to catch a plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得一大早就起床去赶飞机。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at all hours/at any hour (of the day or night)
GramExa.GLOSS: at any time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you have a problem, you know you can call at any hour of the day or night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果遇到问题﹐你知道你可以随时打电话来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s up studying till all hours until unreasonably late at night .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直学习到深夜。

Sense.DEF: a long time or a time that seems long
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to spend hours filling in forms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得花很长时间填表。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’ll keep the children amused for hours on end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可以让孩子们玩乐好几个小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a really boring lecture that went on for hours and hours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分枯燥﹑没完没了的讲座
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lay awake for hour after hour for many hours, continuously .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她躺着﹐久久无法入睡。

Sense.DEF: the time of the day when a new hour starts, for example one o’clock, two o’clock etc

GramExa.GLOSS: if a clock strikes the hour, it rings, to show that it is one o’clock, seven o’clock etc
every hour at six o’clock, seven o’clock etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are flights to Boston every hour on the hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个整点都有航班飞往波士顿。

GramExa.GLOSS: used on national radio or television in order to give the time without saying which hour it is, because the broadcast may be coming from a different time zone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 整点差/过10/20分钟等〔用于全国广播或电视﹐因为节目也许来自另一时区〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s twelve minutes before the hour, and you’re listening to Morning Edition on NPR.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是整点差12分﹐您正在收听的是全国公共广播电台的早间节目。

Sense.DEF: used to give the time in official or military reports and orders
Sense.TRAN: 13时/15时30分/18时 05分等〔官方或军队在报告或命令中使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The helicopters lifted off at 0600 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机6时起飞。

Sense.LEXUNIT: by the hour/from hour to hour
Sense.DEF: if a situation is changing by the hour or from hour to hour, it is changing very quickly and very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: This financial crisis is growing more serious by the hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场金融危机正在迅速加剧。

Sense.DEF: the period in the middle of the day when people stop work for a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I usually do the crossword in my lunch hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常在午餐时间做填字游戏

Sense.DEF: an important moment or period in history or in your life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This was our country’s finest hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我国最辉煌的时刻。

GramExa.GLOSS: a time when someone needs help, is very successful etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人需要帮助的时刻/光荣的时刻等

Sense.DEF: important at a particular time, especially the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the burning questions of the hour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前急需解决的问题之一

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who does something very brave, is very successful etc at a particular time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 当时的英雄/当时得意的人

Sense.DEF: a glass container for measuring time in which sand moves slowly from the top half to the bottom in exactly one hour

a woman who has an hourglass figure has a narrow waist in comparison with her chest and
hips
the shorter of the two pieces on a clock or watch that show you the time
happening or done every hour
Sense.TRAN: 每一小时的﹔每小时一次的
Sense.EXAMPLE: hourly news broadcasts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时一次的新闻广播
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buses run at hourly intervals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时有一班公共汽车开出。

Sense.DEF: the amount you earn or charge for every hour you work
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are paid an hourly rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们按小时获取报酬。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据库每小时更新一次。

Subsense.DEF: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a four-bedroom house
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢有四间卧室的房子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: every room in the house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子的每个房间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We met at Alison’s house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是在艾利森家相识的。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you all come over to our house for coffee?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们全都上我们家来喝咖啡如何？

GramExa.GLOSS: leave your house and go to live in another one

Subsense.DEF: all the people who live in a house
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He gets up at six and disturbs the whole house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他6点钟起床﹐把全家人都吵醒。

Subsense.DEF: a large public building used for a particular purpose
used in the names of large buildings, especially offices
Subsense.TRAN: 大楼﹐大厦〔用于大型建筑名称﹐尤其是办公楼〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the BBC television studios at Broadcasting House
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于广播大厦的英国广播公司电视演播室

Subsense.DEF: a building used for a particular purpose

PIC.HEADING: HOUSES 房屋
PIC.PICCONTENT: motor home/RV AmE【美】房车；bungalow BrE【英】/ranch house AmE【美】平房；terraced house BrE【英】/row house AmE【美】排屋；semi-detached BrE【英】半独立式房屋；apartment block BrE【英】/apartment building AmE【美】公寓楼；cottage 村舍；thatched roof 茅草屋顶；chateau 庄园；mansion 大厦；castle 城堡；tower 塔楼

Sense.DEF: a group of people who make the laws of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president will address both houses of Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统将向参众两院发表讲话。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 下议院/上议院/众议院/议会

Sense.EXAMPLE: the speaker of the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会议长

Sense.DEF: a company, especially one involved in a particular area of business
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s oldest publishing house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国历史最悠久的出版社
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small independent software house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家小型的独立软件公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: an auction house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家拍卖行
Sense.EXAMPLE: a famous Italian fashion house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家著名的意大利时装公司

Subsense.DEF: the part of a theatre, cinema etc where people sit
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The show has been playing to full houses .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该演出一直场场爆满。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house was half empty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院的座位有一半空着。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house lights went down and the music started.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院观众席的灯光暗了下去﹐音乐响起。

Subsense.DEF: the people who have come to watch a performance

GramExa.GLOSS: a large or small audience
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 满座/座无虚席/观众寥寥无几
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The show has been playing to packed houses since it opened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧目自开演以来一直座无虚席。

Sense.DEF: if you work in house, you work at the offices of a company or organization, not at home
used to say that someone should improve the way they behave before criticizing other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔在批评别人之前〕把自己的事管好

Sense.DEF: to make a lot of people laugh, especially when you are acting in a theatre
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在戏院表演时〕博得满堂大笑

Sense.DEF: if drinks or meals are on the house, you do not have to pay for them because they are provided free by the owner of the bar, restaurant etc
ordinary wine that is provided by a restaurant to be drunk with meals
Sense.TRAN: 店酒〔顾客没有特殊要求时餐馆供应的普通葡萄酒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A glass of house red, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来一杯你们店的红葡萄酒。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get on/along like a house on fire
Sense.DEF: to quickly have a very friendly relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔和某人〕很快成为好朋友﹐一见如故

Sense.DEF: to start to live in a house, especially with another person
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某处〕定居﹐〔尤指和另外一个人一起〕建立家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two of them set up house in Brighton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩在布赖顿建立了家庭。

Sense.DEF: to regularly do all the cleaning, cooking etc in a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: His daughter keeps house for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他女儿为他料理家务。

Sense.DEF: in some schools, one of the groups that children of different ages are divided into to compete against each other, for example in sports competitions
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校里为进行体育比赛等而分的〕组

Sense.DEF: an important family, especially a royal family
Sense.EXAMPLE: the House of Windsor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温莎王室

Sense.DEF: a church

used to mean the people who are voting in a formal
debate
when you are stating the proposal that is being discussed
Sense.TRAN: 在正式辩论中参加投票的人

Crossrefto.REFLEX: eat sb out of house and home

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with a place to live

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The refugees are being housed in temporary accommodation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民被安置在临时住处。

Sense.DEF: if a building, place, or container houses something, it is kept there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The collection is currently housed in the British Museum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该藏品目前由大英博物馆收藏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the plastic case that houses the batteries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存放电池的塑料盒

Sense.DEF: to be kept as a prisoner by a government, staying inside your house rather than in a prison
a river boat that you can live in
not able to leave your house, especially because you are ill or old
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因生病或年老而〕出不了门的

Sense.DEF: a man who is employed to do general work at someone’s house
a thief who enters someone else’s house by breaking locks, windows etc

a pet animal that is housebroken has been trained not to make the house dirty with its
urine
and
faeces
Sense.TRAN: 〔宠物经训练后〕不在室内随地便溺的

Sense.DEF: a visit that someone, especially a doctor, makes to a person in that person’s home as part of their job
Sense.TRAN: 上门工作﹔〔尤指医生〕出诊﹐上门看病

Sense.DEF: a long loose coat worn at home to protect clothes while cleaning etc
a common type of fly that lives in people’s houses
a large number of people or things in your house
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grew up in a houseful of women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一个满屋子女人的家庭里长大。

Sense.DEF: a friend or relative who is staying in your house for a short time
all the people who live together in one house
Sense.TRAN: 一家人﹐同住一幢房子的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: A growing number of households have at least one computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的家庭拥有至少一台电脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Families are classified by the occupation of the head of the household the person who earns the most money and is most respected in a house .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭按一家之主的职业来分类。

Sense.DEF: relating to looking after a house and the people in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: washing powder and other household products
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣粉及其他家用产品

Sense.EXAMPLE: household chores
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家务杂活

Sense.DEF: to be very well known
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coca-Cola is a household name around the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可口可乐是全世界家喻户晓的名字。

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or is in charge of a house
a husband who stays at home and does the cooking, cleaning etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔不外出工作〕在家操持家务的丈夫

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed to manage the cleaning, cooking etc in a house or hotel
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with housewife a woman who looks after her house rather than going out to work . 不要和housewife（家庭主妇）混淆。

Sense.DEF: the work and organization of things that need to be done in a house, hotel etc, for example cooking and buying food
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company in charge of the catering and housekeeping at the college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责该大学饮食和后勤的公司

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is kept and used to pay for food and other things needed in the home
jobs that need to be done to keep a system working properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔维持某个系统正常运转的〕内务工作

Sense.DEF: a female servant who cleans someone’s house
someone who has nearly finished training as a doctor and is working in a hospital

a small black and white European bird of the
swallow
family
a male teacher who is in charge of one of the houses groups of children of different ages in a school
a person who you share a house with but who is not a member of your family
a female teacher who is in charge of one of the houses groups of children of different ages in a school
a type of popular dance music
Sense.TRAN: 豪斯音乐﹐货仓音乐〔一种流行舞曲〕

Sense.DEF: a plan that is so badly arranged that it is likely to fail
the part of the British or Canadian parliament whose members are elected by the people
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国或加拿大议会中的〕下议院

Sense.DEF: the part of the British parliament whose members are not elected but have positions because of their rank or title
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会中的〕上议院﹐贵族院

Sense.DEF: the larger of the two parts of the US Congress or of the parliament of Australia or New Zealand
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国﹑澳大利亚﹑新西兰国会中的〕众议院

Sense.DEF: a group of people who stay as guests in someone’s house and have a party there
Sense.TRAN: 〔参加某人家庭聚会的〕留宿客人﹐全体宾客

Sense.DEF: a telephone that can only be used to make calls within a building, especially a hotel
a plant that you grow inside your house for decoration
spending a lot of time on keeping your house clean and tidy
space in a house for a person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子中住人或摆放东西的〕空间

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not like something and do not want it
Sense.TRAN: 不要某物﹐不喜欢某物〔用于强调〕

Sense.DEF: to look after someone’s house while they are away
inquiries etc that are made by visiting each house in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 挨家挨户的询问/搜查/收集等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The abduction sparked a house-to-house search in the Willenhall area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绑架案引发了威伦霍尔地区挨家挨户的搜查。

Sense.DEF: the top part of a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: a view over the housetops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俯瞰屋顶的景致

Sense.DEF:
a pet animal that is house-trained has been trained not to make the house dirty with its
urine
and
faeces
Sense.TRAN: 〔宠物经训练后〕不在室内随地便溺的

Sense.DEF: small things used in the home, for example plates, lamps etc, or the department of a large shop that sells these things
Sense.TRAN: 家庭用品﹔〔百货公司的〕家庭用品部

Sense.DEF: a party that you give to celebrate moving into a new house
Sense.TRAN: 〔迁入新居后举行的〕乔迁聚会﹐温居宴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you coming to Jo’s house-warming on Friday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周五你去参加乔的温居宴吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house-warming party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场庆祝乔迁的聚会

Sense.DEF: a married woman who works at home doing the cooking, cleaning etc, but does not have a job outside the house
work that you do to take care of a house, for example washing, cleaning etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent all morning doing the housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个上午都在做家务。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t like doing housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不爱干家务。

F2NBox.HEADING: grammar 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Housework is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: housework是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the belief that housework is women’s work
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为家务劳动专属于妇女的观念

Sense.DEF: the houses or conditions that people live in
Sense.TRAN: 住房﹔住房条件﹐居住环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: health problems caused by bad housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住房条件差引起的健康问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scheme to provide affordable housing for local people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为当地民众提供平价住宅的计划

Sense.DEF: the work of providing houses for people to live in
Sense.EXAMPLE: government housing policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的住房政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: public services such as education, housing and transport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如教育﹑住房和交通等的公共服务

Sense.DEF: a protective cover for a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: the engine housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机机壳

Sense.DEF: an organization in Brit-ain, formed by a group of people working together to build or buy homes for themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的一种以建房或购房自用为目的的〕住房协会﹐房屋协会

Sense.DEF: a large number of houses that have been built together in a planned way
a group of houses or apartments, usually built with government money, for poor families
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般由政府出资建造﹐供低收入家庭居住的〕住宅区

Sense.DEF: a city and port in the US state of Texas, where NASA, the US government space centre, is based
Sense.TRAN: 休斯敦〔美国得克萨斯州的一座港口城市 美国航空航天局所在地〕

Sense.DEF:
people say this humorously when something goes wrong. These words were first spoken by one of the
astronauts
on the unsuccessful Apollo 13 space
mission
.
Sense.TRAN: 休斯敦﹐我们遇到了麻烦〔此话原为失利的阿波罗13号航天任务中一名宇航员所言﹐现为幽默用法﹐表示遇到了麻烦〕

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
heave
a small dirty place where someone lives, especially a very poor person
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指穷人居住的狭小肮脏的〕陋屋﹐破屋

Sense.DEF:
if a bird, insect, or
helicopter
hovers, it stays in one place in the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: flies hovering above the surface of the water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盘旋在水面上方的苍蝇

Sense.DEF: to stay nervously in the same place, especially because you are waiting for something or are not certain what to do
Sense.TRAN: 徘徊﹐走来走去〔尤指因等待或拿不定主意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her younger brother hovered in the background watching us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的弟弟在后面走来走去﹐观察着我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I noticed several reporters hovering around outside the courtroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现几个记者在法庭外面徘徊。

Sense.DEF: if a level, price etc hovers around a certain amount, it stays close to that amount, only changing slightly up or down
Sense.TRAN: 〔水平﹑价格等在某数量上下〕摇摆不定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dollar has been hovering around the 110 yen level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元一直在110日元水平附近徘徊。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that travels just above the surface of land or water, travelling on a strong current of air that the engines produce beneath it

a
lane
on main roads that can only be used by vehicles carrying three or more passengers when there is a lot of traffic
used to ask or talk about the way in which something happens or is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you spell your name?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的名字怎么拼写？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I help you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么帮你？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to help in some way, but I’m not sure how.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想帮点忙﹐可不知道该怎么做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He explained how the system worked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲解了该系统是如何运转的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We both used to work at the airport – that’s how we met.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都曾经在机场工作过﹐我们就是这么认识的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how to get to your house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道怎么去你家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan showed me how to load the gun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦教我怎么给枪装上子弹。

Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on how best the best way to invest your money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何以最好方式进行投资的建议
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a number of suggestions as to how the service could be improved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有一些关于如何改进服务的建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This still leaves the question of how local services should be funded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这仍然没有解决如何为地方公共服务业提供资金的问题。

GramExa.PROPFORM: how on earth/in the world etc
GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis when you are surprised, angry etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 到底[究竟]如何〔在惊讶﹑愤怒等时用于强调〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How on earth did you find out?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底是怎么发现的？

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about the amount, size, degree etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: How big is the state of Louisiana?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易斯安那州有多大？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many kids do they have now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现在有几个孩子？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long have you been learning English?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你学英语多久了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know how old it is?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道它年代有多久远吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They couldn’t tell exactly how far away the bridge was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说不清那座桥确切有多远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wondered how much Angela already knew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想搞清楚安杰拉已经知道了多少。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask the price of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much are the tickets?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些票多少钱？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask about someone’s health, especially when you meet them
Subsense.TRAN: 怎么样？〔尤用于见面时询问健康状况〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hi Laurie, how are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks. How are you?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嘿﹐劳里﹐你好吗？”“挺好﹐谢谢﹐你呢？”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Has Ros had the baby yet? How is she?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯生孩子了吗？她怎么样了？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s your ankle this morning?’ ‘Better, thanks.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “今天上午你的脚踝情况如何？”“好些了﹐谢谢。”

Subsense.DEF: used when you meet someone, to ask for news about their life, work etc
Subsense.TRAN: 怎么样〔用于询问生活﹑工作情况等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So how’s it going at work these days? Still enjoying it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来工作怎么样？仍然干得很开心吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘ How are things with you?’ ‘Fine.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你过得好吗？”“挺好的。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How are you doing?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你过得好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone about their opinion or experience of something
Sense.TRAN: 怎么样〔用于询问看法﹑经历〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How was the film?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s your steak?’ ‘Mmm, it’s good.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “牛排味道怎么样？”“嗯﹐不错。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did your exams go?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你考试考得怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you feel about seeing Peter again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见到彼得你感觉如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s that? Does that feel comfortable?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么样？那样感觉舒服吗？

Sense.DEF: used after certain adjectives or verbs to refer to an event or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些形容词或动词之后﹐指某一事件或情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s amazing how they’ve managed to get everything finished so quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们这么快就全部完成了﹐真是让人吃惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I remember how she always used to have fresh flowers in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还记得以前她家总是有鲜花。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the quality you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: How lovely to see you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到你真高兴！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘John’s been in an accident.’ ‘Oh, how awful!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “约翰出事了。”“啊﹐太糟了！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t realize how difficult it was to get tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时没有意识到弄几张票这么困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was impressed at how well she could read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她识那么多字﹐这给他留下了深刻印象。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens to a very great degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: How the crowd loved it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们太喜欢它了！

Subsense.DEF: used to make a suggestion about what to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No, I’m busy on Monday. How about Tuesday at seven?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不行﹐我星期一没空。星期二7点行吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How about putting the sofa closer to the window?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把沙发挪近窗户一些好吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: How about we have that game when we get back?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们回来后再玩那个游戏好吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How about if we tell the police where Newley is hiding?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们告诉警方纽利的藏身之处好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How’s about going to the beach this afternoon?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午去海滩好吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask about another person or thing
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于提及另一人或事〕…又怎么样呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mary and Ken are still away.’ ‘And how about Billy?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “玛丽和肯还没回来。”“那比利呢？”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I need a long cold drink. How about you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要一大杯冷饮。你呢？

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to explain something they have just said
Sense.TRAN: 你是指什么？〔要求进一步解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s your family situation?’ ‘How do you mean?’ ‘Are you married?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的家庭状况如何？”“你是指什么？” “你结婚了吗？”

Sense.DEF: used to ask why something has happened or why a particular situation exists, especially when you are surprised by it
Sense.TRAN: 怎么会呢？〔尤用于表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How come Dave’s home? Isn’t he feeling well?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫怎么会在家呢？他不舒服吗？

Sense.DEF: used as a polite greeting when you meet someone for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 您好！〔初次见面时的礼貌问候语〕

Sense.DEF: used when you are very surprised by something or disapprove strongly of something
Sense.TRAN: 某人怎么能做某事呢？〔表示震惊或强烈反感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: William! How can you say such a thing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉！ 你怎么能说这种话呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could anyone be so cruel?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么会有人这么冷酷呢？

Sense.DEF: in whatever way you like or want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then you can arrange it how you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么随便你怎么安排吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: how about that!/how do you like that!
Sense.DEF: used when you think something is surprising, rude, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 你信吗？/你说怎么样呀？〔用于认为某事令人吃惊﹑粗鲁﹑给人印象深刻等时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scored two goals! How about that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他进了两个球！你说神奇不神奇？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something is very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 某事物怎么样[如何]？〔用于认为某事给人印象很深刻时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve already arranged everything. How’s that for efficiency?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经全部安排好了﹐效率高吧？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that an action or event has a particular quality to a great degree
Subsense.TRAN: 那多…呀！〔用于表示某一行为或事件极具某种特性〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He sent himself a card for Valentine’s Day. How sad is that?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情人节他给自己寄了一张贺卡﹐你说有多凄凉呀！

Subsense.DEF: used to say that an action or event does not have a particular quality
Subsense.TRAN: 那怎么…？〔用于表示某一行为或事件没有某种特性〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They say they’re not going to leave, but how likely is that?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说不打算走了﹐不过那怎么可能呢？

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to explain an opinion they have given
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Rick’s parents are a little strange, I think.’ ‘How so?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我觉得里克的父母有些怪。”“怎么个怪法？”

Sense.DEF: used to mention something that may happen, and ask what should be done if it does happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: How about if we quit now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们现在放弃会怎么样？

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘yes’ strongly in reply to a question
Sense.TRAN: 那还用说！当然啦！〔用于对问题极肯定的回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Was Matt drunk?’ ‘And how!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “马特醉了吗？” “那还用说！”

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: How much is used before comparative adjectives to ask or talk about a difference.
F2NBox.TRAN: how much用于形容词的比较级形式前﹐以询问或谈论差异
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They realize how much better off they are than previous generations.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认识到自己的生活要比先辈们好得多。
F2NBox.EXPL: However, before an ordinary adjective, use how, not ‘how much’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 然而﹐形容词原形之前要用how﹐而不用how much
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We all know how important ( NOT 不说 how much important ) a balanced diet is.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都知道膳食均衡非常重要。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use how with ‘look like/feel like/be like’ to ask for or talk about a description of someone or something. Use what .
F2NBox.TRAN: 询问或描述人或物的情况时﹐不要把how和look like/feel like/be like连用﹐而要用what
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What does she look like?
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use how with ‘think’ to ask or talk about someone’s opinion. Use what .
F2NBox.TRAN: 询问或描述观点时﹐不要把how和think连用﹐而要用what
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What do you think of your present employer?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得你现在的老板怎么样？

Sense.DEF:
a covered seat used for riding an
elephant
Sense.TRAN: 象轿〔一种架在象背上供人乘坐的有顶篷的座椅〕

Sense.DEF: hello
used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法﹐不过有危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

Sense.DEF: used to say that it does not matter how big, good, serious etc something is because it will not change a situation in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should report any incident, however minor it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何事件你都应该汇报﹐不管它多小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to finish, however long it takes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须完成﹐不管需要多长时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I really want the car, however much it costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很想要这辆汽车﹐不管它要多少钱。

Sense.DEF: used to show surprise when you ask how something happens or how someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: However did he get that job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到底是怎样得到那份工作的？

Sense.DEF: in whatever way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do it however you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以按自己的意思去做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we win the match, we’ll be delighted, however it happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们能赢下这场比赛﹐不管怎么赢的我们都会高兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: However you look at it, it was a wicked thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你怎么看待这件事情﹐它都是一件缺德的事。

Sense.DEF:
a heavy gun that fires
shells
high into the air

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dogs howled all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些狗整夜嘷叫。

Sense.DEF: to make a long loud cry because you are unhappy, angry, or in pain, or because you are amused or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔因悲伤﹑愤怒﹑痛苦﹑激动等〕嚎哭﹐咆哮﹔〔因开心或兴奋〕大声叫喊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Upstairs, one of the twins began to howl cry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼上﹐双胞胎中的一个开始大哭起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somewhere, someone was howling in pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知在哪里﹐有个人痛苦地叫喊着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He makes audiences howl with laughter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他令观众哈哈大笑。

Sense.DEF: to shout or demand something angrily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Republicans have been howling for military intervention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党人一直愤怒地要求进行军事干预。

Sense.DEF: if the wind howls, it makes a loud high sound as it blows
Sense.EXAMPLE: wind howling in the trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在林间呼啸的风

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone or something from being heard by shouting loudly and angrily
Sense.TRAN: 大声怒吼以盖过…的声音

Sense.DEF:
a long loud sound made by a dog,
wolf
, or other animal
a loud cry or shout showing pain, anger, unhappiness etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔痛苦﹑愤怒﹑悲伤等的〕嚎叫﹐咆哮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He let out a howl of anguish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发出一声痛苦的嚎叫。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were howls of protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传出了阵阵抗议的吼声。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This suggestion was greeted with howls of laughter .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个建议引起了阵阵大笑。

Sense.DEF: a loud high sound made by the wind blowing
a stupid mistake that makes people laugh
something that is a howling success is extremely successful
a set of instructions telling you how to do something

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=horsepower马力
the abbreviation of 缩写=hire purchase【英】分期付款购买法
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bought the carpets on HP .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们分期付款买下了那几块地毯。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= headquarters 总部﹐总公司﹐总办事处
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=hour or 或 hours 小时
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=His/Her Royal Highness 殿下〔对王室成员尤其是王子或公主的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
treatment for women during and after the
menopause
, in which they are given
hormones
to replace those which are lacking
Sense.TRAN: 激素替代疗法﹐荷尔蒙替代疗法

Sense.DEF: a British government organization that gives advice to companies about health and safety, and makes rules to prevent workers from being injured or becoming ill at work

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=height 高度

Sense.DEF: a computer language used for producing pages of writing and pictures that can be put on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 超文本置标语言〔用于编写网页的计算机语言〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: HTML documents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超文本置标语言文件

Sense.DEF: a set of standards that control how computer documents that are written in html connect to each other
the chemical sign for water
the central and most important part of an area, system, activity etc, which all the other parts are connected to
Sense.TRAN: 〔地域﹑系统﹑活动等的〕中心﹐枢纽

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birmingham is at the hub of Britain’s motorway network.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯明翰地处英国高速公路网的枢纽位置。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the commercial hub of the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的商业中心

Sense.DEF:
the central part of a wheel to which the
axle
is joined
a mixture of loud noises, especially the noise of a lot of people talking at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hubbub from the market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场的嘈杂声

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is a lot of activity, excitement, or argument
husband
a round metal cover for the centre of a wheel on a vehicle
too much pride
a small dark blue North American fruit that grows on a bush
someone who tries to sell things in a way that is too forceful and not honest - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔采用欺骗手段的〕强行推销者〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因寒冷或恐惧而〕（使）挤作一团﹐（使）聚成一堆
Sense.EXAMPLE: We lay huddled together for warmth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们紧紧挤在一起取暖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People huddled around the radio, waiting for news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们聚集在收音机旁﹐等候消息。

Sense.DEF: to lie or sit with your arms and legs close to your body because you are cold or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷或恐惧而〕蜷缩着身体
Sense.EXAMPLE: She huddled under the blankets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盖着毯子缩成一团。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snow blew against his huddled body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪花飘落在他蜷缩的身体上。

Sense.DEF: to sit or stand with a small group of people in order to discuss something privately
Sense.TRAN: 〔一小群人〕聚集〔私下讨论某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The executive board huddled to discuss the issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层聚在一起讨论那个问题。

Sense.DEF: if American football players huddle, they gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球队员〕靠拢〔听取指示〕

Sense.DEF: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system
Sense.TRAN: 紧紧聚在一起的一群人﹔杂乱的一堆东西

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huddle of straw huts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片杂乱的茅草屋
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Huddles of men stood around talking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人们三五成群地站在那里说话。

Sense.DEF: a group of players in American football who gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球中〕聚拢听取战术指导的一群队员

Sense.DEF: to form a small group away from other people in order to discuss something
a colour or type of colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a golden hue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种金黄色调

Sense.DEF: a type of opinion, belief etc

GramExa.GLOSS: of many kinds
GramExa.EXAMPLE: political opinions of every hue
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 形形色色的政治见解

Sense.DEF: angry protests about something, usually from a group of people

Subsense.DEF: to breathe out in a noisy way, especially when you do something that involves a lot of physical effort
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was huffing and puffing by the time he got to the top.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到顶层的时候已经气喘吁吁了。

Subsense.DEF: to show clearly that you strongly disagree with or are annoyed about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After a lot of huffing and puffing, he eventually gave in to our request.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过多番强烈反对后﹐他最终还是妥协﹐同意了我们的请求。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a way that shows you are annoyed, often because someone has offended you
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指因受到冒犯而〕生气地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I haven’t got time for that now,’ huffed Sam irritably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我目前没有时间做那件事情。”萨姆气冲冲地说道。

Sense.DEF: feeling angry or bad-tempered, especially because someone has offended you
Sense.TRAN: 生气﹐气恼〔尤指因受到冒犯〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: go off/walk off/leave etc in a huff
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stormed out in a huff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她气呼呼地冲了出去。

Sense.DEF:
in a bad
mood the way that you feel
, especially because someone has offended you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因受到冒犯而〕气冲冲的﹐发怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some customers get huffy when you ask them for their ID.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些顾客如果被要求出示身份证明﹐就会发火。

Sense.DEF: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood there crying and hugging each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站在那里哭着互相拥抱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went to her daughter and hugged her tightly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到女儿身边﹐紧紧地拥抱她。

Sense.DEF: to put your arms around yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah sat on the floor, hugging her knees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉抱着双膝坐在地板上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood hugging herself against the cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在寒冷中﹐她抱着胳膊瑟缩站立。

Sense.DEF: to move along the side, edge, top etc of something, staying very close to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The small boats hugged the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船贴近海岸航行。

Sense.DEF: if clothes hug your body, they fit closely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a figure-hugging dress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身连衣裙

Sense.DEF: to hold something in your arms close to your chest
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was hugging a big pile of books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱着一大堆书。

Sense.DEF: to feel very pleased with yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate hugged herself with pleasure after receiving the award.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖之后凯特非常高兴。

Exponent.DEF: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mother hugged him and tucked him into bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈搂了搂他﹐并给他盖好被子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Come here and give me a big hug.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 过来好好抱我一下。

Exponent.DEF: to put your arms around someone and hold him or her in a caring way. Embrace is more formal than hug .
Exponent.TRAN: 拥抱〔表示关爱﹐比hug更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jason warmly embraced his son.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾森热烈地拥抱儿子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two leaders embraced each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位领导人互相拥抱。

Exponent.DEF: to put your arms around someone or something as a sign of love, especially a child or a small animal
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为表示爱而〕拥抱﹐搂抱〔尤指小孩或小动物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sat on a chair, cuddling her daughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抱着女儿坐在一把椅子上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He cuddled the puppy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱着小狗。

Exponent.DEF: to hold someone closely to your body, especially to comfort them or show that you love them
Exponent.TRAN: 拥抱某人〔尤为安慰或示爱〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The woman put her arms around the sobbing boy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人搂住抽噎的小男孩。

Exponent.DEF: to hold someone very gently in your arms, like you would hold a baby
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She cradled the baby in her arms.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把宝宝轻轻抱在怀里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She cradled his head in her hands and kissed him on the forehead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双手轻轻抱住他的头﹐亲吻他的前额。

Sense.DEF: the action of putting your arms around someone and holding them tightly to show love or friendship
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul gave me a big hug .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗热情地拥抱了我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nesta greeted the visitors with hugs and kisses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内丝塔和客人拥抱﹑亲吻﹐迎接他们的到来

Sense.DEF: extremely large in size, amount, or degree
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹐庞大的﹔极大量的﹔程度深的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条大狗
Sense.EXAMPLE: huge crowds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大群大群的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your room’s huge compared to mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的房间跟我的比很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These shoes make my feet look huge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋让我的脚看上去大极了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: huge sums of money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大笔大笔的钱

Sense.EXAMPLE: the huge scale of the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该问题的严重性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge increase in cost
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本的大幅提高

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge range of issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The play was a huge success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧大获成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new system has made a huge difference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用了新系统以后大不一样了。

Sense.DEF: very popular or famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: David Hasselhoff is huge in Germany.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大卫·哈塞尔霍夫在德国很受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you have not heard or understood a question
Sense.TRAN: 嗯〔表示没听到或没听懂问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Carly, are you listening to me?’ ‘Huh?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “卡莉﹐你在听我说话吗？”“嗯？”

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a question, often to ask for agreement
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐啊〔用于问句末尾﹐常用来请求对方同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not a bad little place, huh?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小地方还不错吧﹐嗯？

Sense.DEF: used to show disagreement or surprise, or to show that you do not find something impressive
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐哼〔表示异议﹑惊讶或对某事印象平平〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She looks nice.’ ‘Huh! Too much make-up, if you ask me.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她看起来挺漂亮。”“哼！我倒觉得她妆化得太浓了。”

Sense.DEF:
a Polynesian dance done by women using gentle movements of the
hips
Sense.TRAN: 〔波利尼西亚女子跳的〕呼啦舞﹐草裙舞

Sense.DEF:
a large plastic ring that you swing around your waist by moving your
hips
a large heavy person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 身材庞大的人﹔庞然大物﹔笨重的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hulk of a man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壮汉

Sense.DEF: the main part of an old ship, vehicle etc that has decayed or been destroyed
very big and often awkward
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two hulking figures guarded the entrance of the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个壮汉守卫在俱乐部门口。

Sense.DEF: the main part of a ship that goes in the water

GramExa.GLOSS: having a wood, steel etc hull

Sense.DEF: the outer covering of seeds, rice, grain etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔种子﹑稻谷﹑谷物等的〕外皮﹐外壳

Sense.DEF: to take off the outer part of vegetables, rice, grain etc
excited talk, newspaper stories etc, especially when something surprising or shocking is happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对使人惊讶或震惊的事件的〕激烈评论﹐大量报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a huge hullabaloo when the book was first published.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书刚出版的时候引起了轰动。

Sense.DEF: a lot of noise, especially made by people shouting
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked up to see what all the hullabaloo was about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抬起头想看看是什么事这么吵闹。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
hello
to sing a tune by making a continuous sound with your lips closed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tony was humming to himself as he drove along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼边开车边哼着曲子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to hum a tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始哼唱一支曲子。

Sense.DEF: to make a low continuous sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Machines hummed on the factory floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器在车间里嗡嗡作响。

Sense.DEF: if a place hums, it is full of activity – use this to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: By nine o’clock, the restaurant was humming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到9点钟时﹐餐馆里开始忙碌起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The streets were humming with life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大街上熙熙攘攘。

Sense.DEF: to take a long time deciding what to say or do
a low continuous sound
Sense.TRAN: 嗡嗡声﹔低沉而持续的嘈杂声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distant hum of traffic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处嘈杂的车流声

Sense.DEF: the sound of people talking because they are excited etc
belonging to or relating to people, especially as opposed to machines or animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与机器或动物相对的〕人的﹐人类的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are many different cell types in the human body .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体中有许多种不同的细胞类型。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the power of the human mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人脑的威力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The desire for joy lies deep within the human spirit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对快乐的渴求藏在人类心灵深处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Infra-red light is invisible to the human eye .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红外线是人眼看不见的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: theories of human behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于人类行为的理论
Sense.EXAMPLE: different areas of human experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类各方面的经验
Sense.EXAMPLE: respect for the absolute value of human life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人类生命绝对价值的尊重
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident was the result of human error .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故是由于人为过失造成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种肉被宣布不适合人类食用。

PIC.HEADING: HUMAN BODY 人体
PIC.PICCONTENT: brain 脑；throat 喉；vein 静脉；artery 动脉；heart 心；lung 肺；liver 肝；kidney 肾；large intestine 大肠；stomach 胃；fatty tissue 脂肪组织；muscles 肌肉；small intestine 小肠

Sense.DEF: human weaknesses, emotions etc are those that are typical of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was also a person with very obvious human failings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也是一个具有明显人性弱点的人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should not be blamed for what they have done
Sense.TRAN: 某人只是个普通人而已 〔表示某人不应因其所为受责备〕

Sense.DEF: having the same feelings and emotions as ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 有人性的﹐有平凡人的思想感情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s really not so bad. When you get to know him he seems quite human.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真的没那么坏。你了解他之后就会知道他也是普普通通的人。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially someone in authority, who has the human touch deals with people in a kind friendly way and is able to understand their feelings and problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president has been accused of lacking the human touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统被指责不近人情。

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes a story interesting because it is about people’s feelings, lives, relationships etc
the experiences, emotions, needs etc that all people share, especially considered as a situation from which it is impossible to escape
a line of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters formed a human chain to carry the brothers to safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员们组成人链把几兄弟救到了安全的地方。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put a human face on sth
Sense.DEF: to make an important event or principle understandable to ordinary people by directing their attention to the way it affects a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过特定的个人〕形象生动地表现某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne Frank was the girl whose diary put a human face on the Holocaust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮·弗兰克就是那位在日记中通过个人经历来描写大屠杀的女孩。

Sense.LEXUNIT: capitalism/communism/socialism etc with a human face
Sense.DEF: a capitalist etc economic and political system that does not ignore people’s needs
Sense.TRAN: 人性化的资本主义/共产主义/社会主义等

Sense.DEF: a person
treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提倡人道地对待罪犯的运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a better, more humane world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更美好﹑更人道的社会

Sense.DEF: the belief that human problems can be solved through science rather than religion
the study during the Renaissance of the ideas of the ancient Greeks and Romans
Sense.TRAN: 〔文艺复兴时期的〕人文主义（运动）

Sense.DEF: concerned with improving bad living conditions and preventing unfair treatment of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Humanitarian aid is being sent to the refugees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正向难民提供人道主义援助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was released from prison on humanitarian grounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于人道主义原因﹐他获释出狱。

Sense.DEF: people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: crimes against humanity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反人类罪

Sense.DEF: kindness, respect, and sympathy towards others
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of deep humanity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个极富同情心的人

Sense.DEF: the state of being human rather than an animal or machine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must never forget our common humanity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

Sense.DEF: subjects of study such as literature, history, or art, rather than science or mathematics
to make a place or system more pleasant or more suitable for people
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to humanize prison conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让监狱环境更人性化的尝试

Sense.DEF: people in general

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is possible
Subsense.TRAN: 在人力所及范围内﹐人可以做到的〔用于强调〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to put as much distance as was humanly possible between herself and Adrian.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想尽最大可能和阿德里安保持距离。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone did all they could
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The doctors did everything humanly possible to save the child’s life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们尽了最大努力去挽救那孩子的生命。

Sense.DEF: the qualities or ways of behaving that are natural and common to most people
used to say that a particular feeling or way of behaving is normal and natural
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种感情或行为〕是正常的﹐是人之常情

Sense.DEF: having a human shape and human qualities
Sense.TRAN: 具人的形状和特性的﹐类人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The robot was humanoid in appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个机器人具有人类的外形。

Sense.DEF: all people, considered together as a group
in a company, the department that deals with employing, training, and helping people
one of the basic rights that many societies think every person should have to be treated in a fair equal way without cruelty, for example by their government, or the right to vote
Sense.EXAMPLE: human rights violations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人权的侵犯

Sense.DEF: someone who is taken and kept as a prisoner by a criminal in order to protect the criminal from being killed, injured, or caught
not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modest and humble man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个谦卑的男人

Sense.DEF: having a low social class or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started his career as a humble peanut farmer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从一个卑微的花生农起家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Iacocca rose from humble beginnings to become boss of Ford.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚科卡出身卑微﹐后来成了福特公司的总裁。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to give your opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 愚以为﹐依拙见〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say you are sorry
simple and ordinary, but useful or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: The humble potato may be the key to feeding the world’s population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小小的马铃薯却可能担起养活全世界人口的重任。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you were wrong about something
a formal way of ending a letter
Sense.TRAN: 您卑微的仆人〔信末的自谦词〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s house or apartment – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某人的陋室﹐某人的寒舍 〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Welcome to our humble abode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎光临寒舍。

Sense.DEF: if you are humbled, you realize that you are not as important, good, kind etc as you thought you were
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t help but be humbled when you enter this cathedral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入这座大教堂﹐你会禁不住感觉到自己很渺小。

Sense.DEF: to easily defeat someone who is much stronger than you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mighty U.S. army was humbled by a small Southeast Asian country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强大的美军被一个小小的东南亚国家轻易击败。

Sense.DEF: to show that you are not too proud to ask for something, admit you are wrong etc
Sense.TRAN: 作出谦恭的姿态﹐不耻下问﹔勇于认错
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew he had humbled himself to ask for my help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明白他是放下架子来向我求助的。

Sense.DEF: insincere or dishonest words or behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 空话﹐谎话﹔诡计﹐花招﹔假道学
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dismissed the prime minister’s comments as ‘pure humbug’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对首相的评论不屑一顾﹐认为是“纯粹的假道学”。

Sense.DEF:
a hard sweet made from boiled sugar, usually with a
peppermint
taste
someone who behaves in a dishonest or insincere way, for example by pretending to be someone they are not
a very exciting or impressive game, performance, or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real humdinger of a match
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场真正扣人心弦的比赛

Sense.DEF: boring and ordinary, and having no variety or interest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prisoners’ humdrum routine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯单调乏味的生活

Sense.DEF: the bone between your shoulder and elbow
if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

Sense.DEF: a machine that makes the air in a room less dry
to add very small drops of water to the air in a room etc because the air is too dry
the amount of water contained in the air

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间的温度保持在72度﹐相对湿度50%。

Sense.DEF: when the air is very warm and wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a day of hot sunshine and humidity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热潮湿的一天

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’ve never felt so humiliated in all my life.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子从未感到过如此丢人。

Sense.DEF: making you feel ashamed, embarrassed, and angry because you have been made to look weak or stupid

Sense.EXAMPLE: a humiliating defeat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丢脸的失败

Sense.DEF: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不开口伸手向她父母要钱的难堪

Sense.DEF: a situation that makes you feel humiliated

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府在政治上蒙受了一连串的羞辱。

Sense.DEF: the quality of not being too proud about yourself – use this to show approval
a large American car made for travelling over rough ground
a very small brightly-coloured tropical bird whose wings move very quickly
a very small hill

another spelling of
humus 1
very big
Sense.EXAMPLE: rich people living in humongous houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身居豪宅的富人

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a writer, who tells funny stories
Sense.TRAN: （谈吐）诙谐的人﹔〔尤指〕幽默作家

Sense.DEF: funny and enjoyable

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诙谐的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film has some mildly humorous moments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影中有些略显幽默的片段。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something is funny rather than humorous .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说funny﹐而不说humorous
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He told lots of funny stories.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了很多有趣的故事。

Sense.DEF: the ability or tendency to think that things are funny, or funny things you say that show you have this ability
Sense.EXAMPLE: his humour and charm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的幽默感和魅力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg’s feeble attempt at humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格干巴巴的幽默
Sense.EXAMPLE: English humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国式幽默

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作必须具备幽默感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The host puts the contestants at ease with his own brand of humour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主持人以他别具一格的幽默让参赛者放松心情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed flashes of humor that delighted the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不时冒出些幽默话逗得观众忍俊不禁。

Sense.DEF: the quality in something that makes it funny and makes people laugh

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看不出这一幕的幽默之处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in a good/an ill/a bad humour
Sense.DEF: in a good or bad mood
in a bad mood
to do what someone wants or to pretend to agree with them so that they do not become upset

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “当然了。”他迎合着她的意思说道。

Sense.DEF: too serious and not able to laugh at things that other people think are funny

Sense.DEF: a large round shape that rises above the surface of something

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb the hump/get the hump

a

a

if you have a hunch that something is true or will happen, you feel that it is true or will happen

Sense.DEF: to bend down and forwards so that your back forms a curve

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不伏在方向盘上就什么都看不见。

Sense.DEF: to raise your shoulders into a rounded shape because you are cold, anxious etc

Sense.DEF: the number 100

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一周挣900美元。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1,500英里的旅程

Subsense.DEF: completely

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money that is worth 100 dollars or 100 pounds

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
hang
lack of food, especially for a long period of time, that can cause illness or death

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people are dying from hunger every day.

Sense.DEF: to want something very much

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone refuses to eat for a long time in order to protest about something

Sense.DEF:
a

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you want to eat something very much

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如饥似渴地亲吻她的嘴。

Sense.DEF: wanting to eat something

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又冷﹐又累﹐又饿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you get hungry , there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是饿了﹐冰箱里有些冷鸡肉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you still feel hungry?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还觉得饿吗？

Sense.DEF: ill or weak as a result of not having enough to eat for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t justify wasting food when half the world is hungry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上有一半人在挨饿﹐我们没有理由浪费食物。

Sense.DEF: to not have enough to eat

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天都有数以千计的家庭吃不饱肚子。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她渴望成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stan was hungry to learn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦渴望学习。

Sense.DEF: people who do not have enough food to eat
wanting power, news etc very much

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴求权力的政客

Section.SECHEADING: wanting to eat 想吃东西

Exponent.DEF: wanting to eat something

Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 走了很长的路﹐我们饥肠辘辘。

Sense.DEF: to search for and try to catch a criminal or someone who is your enemy

to
vomit
