Sense.DEF: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water
a lamp that has a glass cover to protect the flame inside from the wind
done more quickly than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hurried meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匆匆吃完的一餐饭

Sense.DEF: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是赶紧的话﹐我们能及时到那里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate having to hurry a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得赶紧﹐否则就会错过开头部分了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不必匆忙﹐我们有的是时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were hurrying to catch their train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们匆匆忙忙去赶火车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hurried down the corridor as fast as she could.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以最快速度沿着走廊急匆匆地走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John hurried after his girlfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰急匆匆地追赶他的女朋友。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t hurry me. I’m doing this as fast as I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别催我﹐我正在尽快干呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t want to be hurried into making a decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想被人催着仓促作决定。

Sense.DEF: to take someone or something quickly to a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emergency supplies have been hurried to the areas worst hit by the famine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应急物资已经被紧急运往饥荒最严重的地区。

Exponent.DEF: to go somewhere or do something more quickly than usual, for example because you are late or you must finish something soon
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you don’t hurry, you’ll miss the bus.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不赶紧的话﹐你就赶不上公共汽车了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We have plenty of time. There’s no need to hurry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有的是时间﹐不用着急。

Exponent.DEF: to go somewhere very quickly, or to do something too quickly and without thinking carefully enough
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone rushed out into the street to see what was happening.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都冲到街上去看发生了什么事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Try to answer the questions calmly, without rushing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答问题要尽量冷静,别急。

Exponent.DEF: to go somewhere very quickly, especially because there is something important or urgent you must do
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因有重要或紧急的事而〕猛冲﹐急奔
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to dash to the shops to get some more milk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得赶紧到商店去再买些牛奶来。

Exponent.DEF: doing something quickly because you do not have much time, usually with the result that you make mistakes
Exponent.TRAN: 匆匆忙忙﹐赶时间〔常指导致犯错〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had left in a hurry, and forgotten her passport.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走得匆忙﹐忘了带护照。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to choose a present for her in a rush.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得匆匆忙忙给她选了份礼物。

Exponent.DEF: to start to do something or go somewhere more quickly than before
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Get a move on – it’s already 8 o’clock!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点——已经8点钟了！

Exponent.DEF: to start working quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s time you got cracking with your homework.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该抓紧时间做功课了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to do something more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up! We’re late!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐我们要迟到了！

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something more quickly or to make something happen more quickly
Sense.TRAN: 催促某人/某事﹐使某人/某事加快
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can hurry things up a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能否再加快一点。

Sense.DEF: more quickly than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I can’t stop, I’m in a hurry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不能停下﹐我赶时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll make mistakes if you do things in too much of a hurry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做事太仓促会出错。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in a hurry to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why are you in such a hurry to leave?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗这么急着要走？

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 you are ‘in hurry’. Say that 而要说 you are in a hurry.

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they do not have to do something quickly or soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pay me back whenever you can. There’s no great hurry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便什么时候还我钱都行﹐不用太着急。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will not be doing sth (again) in a hurry
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not want to do something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: We won’t be going back there again in a hurry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们再也不愿回到那里去了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in your hurry to do sth
Sense.DEF: while you are trying to do something too quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his hurry to leave the room, he tripped over a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他匆匆忙忙离开房间的时候﹐被椅子绊倒了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in no hurry/not be in any hurry (to do sth)

Subsense.DEF: to be able to wait because you have a lot of time in which to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 不急于（做某事）﹐不着急（做某事）
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Take your time – I’m not in any hurry.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢来﹐我不着急。

Subsense.DEF: to be unwilling to do something or not want to do it soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was clearly in no hurry to reply to our letter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然不想给我们回信。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is doing something too quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got plenty of time - what’s all the hurry?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有的是时间﹐这么急干吗？

Sense.DEF: to injure yourself or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故中有人受伤吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快把那东西放下﹐你会伤着别人的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He hurt his knee playing football.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踢足球时伤了膝盖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful you don’t fall and hurt yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心别摔伤了。

Sense.DEF: to feel pain in part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: My back hurts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我背痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where does it hurt?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪儿痛？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It hurts when I try to move my leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腿一动就痛。

GramExa.GLOSS: hurt very much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My shoulder hurts like hell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的肩膀痛死了。

Sense.DEF: to cause pain in a part of your body
Sense.TRAN: 使〔身体某个部位〕感到疼痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun’s hurting my eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光刺得我眼睛疼。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very upset, unhappy, sad etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What hurts is that he never even said goodbye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人伤心的是﹐他甚至没有和我道别。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It hurt me to think that you hated me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到你恨我﹐我就感到伤心。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on someone or something, especially by making them less successful or powerful
Sense.TRAN: 造成〔损害〕﹐产生〔不良影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foreign competition has hurt the company’s position in the market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自国外的竞争已经对这家公司的市场地位造成损害。

Subsense.DEF: to feel very upset or unhappy about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Martha’s going through a divorce and really hurting right now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎目前在闹离婚﹐内心十分痛苦。

Subsense.DEF: if a group, organization etc is hurting, they do not have something important that they need

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team is hurting for quarterbacks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队急需四分卫。

Sense.DEF: said when you think someone should do something or that something is a good idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house looks pretty good, but a fresh paint job wouldn’t hurt either.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子看上去还不错﹐但重新粉刷一次也无妨。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it won’t/doesn’t hurt (sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It won’t hurt Julia to get up early for a change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅偶尔早起一次也无妨。

Section.SECHEADING: to injure yourself or someone else 弄伤自己或他人

Exponent.DEF: to damage part of your body, or someone else’s body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She slipped on the ice and hurt herself badly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在冰上滑了一跤﹐伤得很厉害。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Be careful you don’t hurt anyone with that knife.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心不要让你的刀伤着别人。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt yourself quite severely, or to be hurt in an accident or fighting
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在事故或打斗中〕使受伤﹐弄伤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of our players has injured his leg, and will be out of the game for weeks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的一名队员腿部受伤﹐未来几周都不能参加比赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Four people have been seriously injured on the Arizona highway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有四人在亚利桑那州的公路上受了重伤。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately hurt someone using a weapon such as a knife or gun
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The gunmen shot and killed twelve people and wounded three others.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 持枪歹徒开枪打死了十二人﹐打伤了三人。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt someone very severely, especially so that they lose an arm, leg etc, often as the result of an explosion
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指因爆炸〕使受重伤﹐使残疾
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In countries where there are landmines, people are killed and maimed daily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一些埋过地雷的国家里﹐每天都有人被炸死炸伤。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt a part of your body by breaking a bone in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The X-ray showed that I had broken my wrist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: X光片显示我手腕骨折。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt a part of your body when you fall on it or hit it, causing a dark mark to appear on your skin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cathy fell off her bike and bruised her legs badly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜从自行车上摔下来﹐两腿严重瘀青。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt your knee, wrist, shoulder etc by suddenly twisting it while you are moving
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I jumped down from the wall and landed awkwardly, spraining my ankle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从墙上跳下来﹐着地时姿势不正﹐把脚踝扭伤了。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt one of your muscles by stretching it or using it too much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When you are lifting heavy loads, be careful not to strain a back muscle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提重物时﹐小心不要拉伤背部肌肉。

Exponent.DEF: to damage a joint in your body in a way that moves the two parts of the joint out of their normal position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our best batsman dislocated his shoulder during training.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好的击球手在训练时肩膀脱臼了。

Section.SECHEADING: when part of your body feels painful 身体部位感到疼痛

Exponent.DEF: if part of your body hurts, it feels painful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My chest hurts when I cough.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我咳嗽时胸口痛。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt with a continuous pain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d been walking all day and my legs were really aching.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走了一整天的路﹐腿痛得要命。

Exponent.DEF: to feel a bad pain that comes and goes again in a regular and continuous way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lou had a terrible headache and his whole head seemed to be throbbing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢头痛得厉害﹐整个头似乎都一抽一抽的。

Exponent.DEF: to feel a sharp pain, or to make someone feel this, especially in your eyes, throat, or skin
Exponent.TRAN: （使）〔眼睛﹑咽喉﹑皮肤等〕感到刺痛[灼痛]
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My throat stings every time I swallow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次吞咽﹐喉咙都感到刺痛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This injection may sting a little.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种针剂注射时可能会有点刺痛。

Exponent.DEF: to hurt with a sudden sharp pain – used especially about your eyes, or your skin where something has hit you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指眼睛﹑皮肤〕感到刺痛[剧痛]
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were smarting from the thick smoke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛被浓烟熏得生疼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jackson’s face was still smarting from the punch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊脸上挨了一拳﹐现在仍然痛得厉害。

Exponent.DEF: if something you are wearing pinches you, it is too tight and presses painfully on your skin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shirt was a bit too small and it was pinching my neck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 衬衫有点小﹐我的脖子勒得难受。

Exponent.DEF: used when something feels very painful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My legs are killing me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腿痛死了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These shoes are killing me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋我穿着痛得要命。

Exponent.DEF: if you have a bad back/leg/arm etc, it feels painful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s off work with a bad back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他背痛﹐没上班。

Sense.DEF: suffering pain or injury

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, no one was seriously hurt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好没有人受重伤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes players get hurt in training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候队员在训练中会受伤。

Sense.DEF: very upset or unhappy because someone has said or done something unkind, dishonest, or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel felt hurt and betrayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔觉得自己受到了伤害和欺骗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s no good for you, Jenny. You’ll only get hurt again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮﹐他不适合你﹐你只会再次受到伤害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his hurt pride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受了伤的自尊心
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore a hurt expression on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上一副受伤的表情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice was deeply hurt that she hadn’t been invited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有受到邀请﹐艾丽斯很伤心。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great unhappiness because someone, especially someone you trust, has treated you badly or unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw the hurt in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到了他眼中的伤痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the hurts and wrongs of the past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去所受的所有伤害和委屈

Sense.DEF: making you feel very upset or offended
if something, especially something big or heavy, hurtles somewhere, it moves or falls very fast
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指巨大物体〕飞速移动﹐快速落下﹐猛冲
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of a sudden, a car came hurtling round the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐一辆汽车从拐角处冲了出来。

Sense.DEF: the man that a woman is married to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you met my husband Roy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过我的丈夫罗伊吗？

Sense.DEF: a man that a woman used to be married to
a man and woman who are married to each other
to be very careful in the way you use your money, supplies etc and not waste any
farming
Sense.EXAMPLE: animal husbandry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 畜牧业

Sense.DEF: careful management of money and supplies
Sense.TRAN: 〔对资金﹑物资的〕节约﹐精打细算

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to be quiet, or to comfort a child who is crying or upset
Sense.TRAN: 嘘〔用于叫人别出声或哄小孩子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hush, now. Try to get to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘘﹐别哭了。 好好睡吧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop shouting, talking, crying etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ella asked them to hush their voices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉叫他们别作声。

Sense.DEF: to stop shouting, talking etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience hushed as he stepped onto the stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走上舞台﹐观众安静了下来。

Sense.DEF: to prevent people from knowing about something dishonest or immoral
Sense.TRAN: 隐瞒﹐遮掩〔不诚实或不道德之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole affair was hushed up by the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府隐瞒了整个事件。

Sense.DEF: a period of silence, especially when people are expecting something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 寂静﹐安静〔尤在人们期待某事发生时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden hush fell over the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群突然变得鸦雀无声。

Sense.DEF: used to ask people, especially noisy children, to be quiet
Sense.TRAN: 安静一点〔尤用于要求吵闹的小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have a bit of hush, please, gentlemen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先生们﹐请大家安静 一点。

Sense.DEF: quiet because people are listening, waiting to hear something, or talking quietly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hushed courtroom awaited the verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭上一片寂静﹐人们在等待裁决。

GramExa.GLOSS: quiet speech
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They spoke in hushed tones at the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在桌边窃窃私语。

Sense.DEF: very secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything was very hush-hush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都神神秘秘的。

Sense.DEF: money that is paid to someone not to tell other people about something embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了不让丑事张扬出去而付的〕封嘴钱﹐封口费

Sense.DEF: the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些谷物﹑种子﹑坚果等的〕干燥外皮﹐壳﹐荚

Sense.DEF: the useless outer part of something that remains after the important or useful part is gone or has been used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His drug addiction had turned him into a husk of his former self.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒瘾已经让他变得只剩下一副空皮囊。

Sense.DEF: to remove the husks from grains, seeds etc
Sense.TRAN: 去除…的干燥外皮﹔剥去…的干壳[荚]

Sense.DEF: a husky voice is deep, quiet, and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Come quickly,’ she said in a husky whisper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “快来。”她用沙哑的嗓音低声说道。

Sense.DEF: a man or boy who is husky is big and strong

a dog with thick hair used in Canada and Alaska to pull
sledges
over the snow

a British
cavalry
soldier
a woman who is sexually immoral
the process of trying to persuade people to vote for you by making speeches etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senator is usually at his best on the hustings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位参议员在为竞选拉票的时候状态通常是最好的。

Sense.DEF: to make someone move quickly, especially by pushing them roughly

GramExa.PROPFORM: hustle sb into/out of/through etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was hustled out of the building by a couple of security men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被几个保安人员推出了大楼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was hustled away by police officers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被警察推搡着带走了。

Sense.DEF: to do something with a lot of energy and determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cindy’s not a great player, but she really hustles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪不能算是一位很优秀的球员﹐但是她非常努力。

Sense.DEF: to hurry in doing something or going somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 匆忙做某事﹔仓促去某处
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to hustle if we’re going to make this flight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想搭乘这趟班机﹐我们得抓紧时间。

Sense.DEF: to sell or obtain things in an illegal or dishonest way
Sense.TRAN: 〔用非法或不正当的手段〕兜售﹔诈取
Sense.EXAMPLE: thieves hustling stolen goods on the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在街上兜售赃物的小偷

Sense.DEF:
to work as a
prostitute
, or to be in charge of prostitutes
busy and noisy activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hustle and bustle of the marketplace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场里的熙熙攘攘

Sense.DEF: ways of getting money that involve cheating or deceiving people
when someone does something quickly, with a lot of effort and eagerness
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team has a lot of talent but no hustle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支队伍很有天赋﹐但是不努力。

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to trick people into giving them money

a
prostitute
a small simple building with only one or two rooms
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wooden hut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小木屋

Sense.DEF:
a small wooden
cage
that small animals are kept in, especially rabbits
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指关兔子等小动物用的〕笼子

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture used for storing and showing dishes
a garden plant with blue, pink, or white bell-shaped flowers and a sweet smell

a British spelling of
hyena
an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Sense.TRAN: 杂种动物﹔杂交植物﹔杂交而成的生物体

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hybrid of wheat and rye
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麦和黑麦的杂交体

Sense.DEF: something that consists of or comes from a mixture of two or more other things
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种或两种以上不同物质组成的〕混合体
Sense.EXAMPLE: hybrid architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有混合风格的建筑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a unique hybrid of blues, country, pop, and gospel music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 糅合布鲁斯﹑乡村﹑流行和福音音乐的一种独特音乐

Sense.DEF:
a car that has both a petrol or
diesel
engine and an electric motor
Sense.TRAN: 混合动力汽车〔指内燃﹑电力两用汽车〕

Sense.DEF: to form a new type of plant or animal from two existing types, so that the new type has some qualities from each of the other types
a snake in ancient Greek stories with many heads that grow again when they are cut off
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话中头被斩去后会复生的〕多头蛇

Sense.DEF: a problem that is very difficult to get rid of because it keeps returning

a
fire hydrant
to supply someone or something with water to keep them healthy and in good condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: After you run, drink plenty of water to stay well hydrated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑步后要多喝水﹐以保持体内水分充足。

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that contains water
moved or operated by the pressure of water or other liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hydraulic pump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水压泵﹐液压泵
Sense.EXAMPLE: hydraulic brakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 液压制动器

Sense.DEF: parts of a machine or system that use the pressure of water or other liquids to move or lift things
the study of how to use the pressure of water or other liquids to produce power
relating to water, or using water
Sense.EXAMPLE: hydroelectricity produced by water power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水力发电﹔水电
Sense.EXAMPLE: hydrotherapy treatment of disease using water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水疗法

Sense.DEF:
relating to
hydrogen
, or containing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: hydrocarbons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烃﹐碳氢化合物

Sense.DEF:
a chemical compound that consists of
hydrogen
and
carbon
, such as coal or gas
a strong acid used especially in industry
using water power to produce electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge hydroelectric power station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大型水力发电站

Sense.DEF: a large boat with wing-shaped parts on the bottom that lift it above the surface of the water when it travels fast

a colourless gas that is the lightest of all gases, forms water when it combines with oxygen, and is used to produce
ammonia
and other chemicals. It is a chemical element
Sense.EXAMPLE: symbol H
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氢〔一种化学元素﹐符号为H〕

Sense.DEF:
a very powerful
nuclear
bomb

a chemical liquid used for killing
bacteria
and for making hair and other substances lighter in colour
fear of water

a
hydrofoil
a plane that can take off from and land on water
if a car hydroplanes, it slides on a wet road in a way that is out of control
if a boat hydroplanes, it travels very quickly, just touching the surface of the water

a chemical
compound
that contains an oxygen atom combined with a
hydrogen
atom
a wild animal like a dog that makes a sound like a laugh
the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of personal hygiene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人卫生的重要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: a food hygiene training course
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品卫生培训课程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Consumers’ Association blames poor hygiene standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者协会指责卫生标准低下。

Sense.DEF:
clean and likely to prevent
bacteria
, infections, or disease from spreading
Sense.EXAMPLE: An inspector ensures that food is prepared in hygienic conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查员的工作是确保食品在卫生的条件下制作。

Sense.DEF:
someone who helps a
dentist
by cleaning patients’ teeth and giving advice about keeping teeth healthy

a piece of skin that partly covers the entrance to the
vagina
of some girls or women who have not had sex
a song of praise to God
Sense.EXAMPLE: He liked to sing hymns as he worked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他工作时喜欢唱赞美诗。

Sense.DEF: a book, film, song etc that strongly praises a person or idea
Sense.TRAN: 歌颂某事物的书[电影，歌曲等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their first single was a hymn to selfishness called ‘Looking After Number One’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的第一首单曲是颂扬利己的一首歌﹐名为《珍惜自我》。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be singing from the same hymn book/sheet
Sense.DEF: used to say that two or more people understand each other and are thinking about something in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个或更多的人〕彼此理解且想法相同

Sense.DEF: a book of hymns
attempts to make people think something is good or important by talking about it a lot on television, the radio etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔传媒的〕大肆宣传﹐炒作〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some experts are concerned that the new drug won’t live up to all the hype.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些专家担心这种新药并不像宣传中那么好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the media hype , I found the film very disappointing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管媒体大肆炒作﹐我还是觉得这部影片很让人失望。

Sense.DEF: to try to make people think something is good or important by talking about it a lot on television, the radio etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The director is just using the controversy to hype his movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导演只是在利用这个争议来炒作他的影片。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel excited
very excited or nervous, and unable to keep still
Sense.TRAN: 过于兴奋的﹐激动的﹔坐立不安的

Sense.DEF: extremely excited or nervous about something
Sense.TRAN: 非常兴奋的﹔非常紧张的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, don’t give Luke any candy - it’ll make him hyper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐别给卢克糖果﹐不然他会起劲折腾的。

Sense.DEF: more than usual, especially too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: hypersensitive too sensitive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过度敏感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: hyperinflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极度通货膨胀
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hyper-extended knee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伸展过度的膝关节

Sense.DEF: beyond the usual size or limits
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hyperlink from one website to another
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超链接

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is hyperactive is too active, and is not able to keep still or be quiet for very long
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童〕过分活跃的﹐多动的

Sense.DEF: a way of describing something by saying it is much bigger, smaller, worse etc than it actually is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not hyperbole to call it the worst storm in twenty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 称它是20年来最大的风暴并不为过。

Sense.DEF: too eager to criticize other people and things, especially about small details
Sense.TRAN: 吹毛求疵的﹐过分挑剔的﹐苛求的

Sense.DEF:
a very fast rise in prices that seriously damages a country’s
economy
Sense.TRAN: 极度通货膨胀﹐超通货膨胀﹐恶性通货膨胀

Sense.DEF:
a word or picture in a
website
or computer document that will take you to another page or document if you
click
on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should encourage hyperlinks to each other’s webpages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该鼓励网页之间的超链接。

Sense.DEF:
a very large
supermarket
if someone is hypersensitive to a drug, substance etc, their body reacts very badly to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I discovered I was hypersensitive to caffeine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现我对咖啡因过敏。

Sense.DEF: very easily offended or upset
Sense.TRAN: 心胸狭隘的﹐容易生气[烦恼]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s hypersensitive to any form of criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经不起任何批评。

Sense.DEF:
a medical condition in which your
blood pressure
is too high

a way of writing computer documents that makes it possible to move from one document to another by
clicking
on words or pictures, especially on the Internet

to breathe too quickly or too deeply, so that you get too much
oxygen
and feel
dizzy

a short written or printed line (-) that joins words or
syllables

to join words or
syllables
with a
hyphen
a state similar to sleep, in which someone’s thoughts and actions can be influenced by someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: While under hypnosis, the victim was able to describe her attacker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在催眠状态下﹐受害者能够描述袭击者的模样。

Sense.DEF: the act of producing this state
the use of hypnosis to treat emotional or physical problems
making you feel tired or unable to pay attention to anything else, especially because of a regularly repeated sound or movement
Sense.TRAN: 催人入眠的﹐使人昏昏欲睡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice had a smooth hypnotic effect .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音有一种温柔的催眠效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hypnotic beat of the drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人昏昏欲睡的击鼓节奏

Sense.DEF:
relating to
hypnosis
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hypnotic trance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 催眠后的恍惚状态

Sense.DEF: a drug that helps you to sleep

a British spelling of
hypnotize
the practice of hypnotizing people
someone who hypnotizes people
Sense.TRAN: 施行催眠术的人﹐催眠师

Sense.DEF: to produce a sleep-like state in someone so that you can influence their thoughts and actions
to be so interesting or exciting that people cannot think of anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were completely hypnotized by her performance of the Haydn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全陶醉在她演奏的海顿作品之中。

Sense.DEF:
a
hypodermic
less than usual, especially too little
Sense.EXAMPLE: hypothermia condition in which your body temperature is too low
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体温过低

Sense.DEF: hypoallergenic substances or materials do not cause a bad reaction when you touch them or eat them
Sense.TRAN: 〔物质﹑材料〕低变应原的﹐不会导致过敏反应的﹐低致敏性的

Sense.DEF: when someone continuously worries that there is something wrong with their health, even when they are not ill
someone who always worries about their health and thinks they may be ill, even when they are really not ill
when someone pretends to have certain beliefs or opinions that they do not really have – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be sheer hypocrisy to pray for success, since I’ve never believed in God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不相信上帝﹐因此为获成功而祈祷是纯粹的虚伪之举。

Sense.DEF: someone who pretends to have certain beliefs or opinions that they do not really have – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 伪君子﹐伪善的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is different from what you claim to believe – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 伪善的﹐虚伪的﹐假惺惺的〔含贬义〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: it’s hypocritical (of sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hypocritical of these universities to call their football players student-athletes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些大学称自己的橄榄球队员是学生运动员﹐真虚伪。

Sense.DEF: an instrument with a very thin hollow needle used for putting drugs directly into the body through the skin

used to give an
injection
beneath the skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hypodermic needle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮下注射器针头
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hypodermic injection given under the skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮下注射

Sense.DEF:
the longest side of a
triangle
that has a
right angle
a serious medical condition caused by extreme cold
an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We hope that further research will confirm our hypothesis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望进一步的研究能证实我们的假设。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The authors reject the hypothesis about unemployment contributing to crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些作者否定了关于失业导致犯罪的假设。

Sense.DEF: ideas or guesses rather than facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this is mere hypothesis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切纯属猜想。

Sense.DEF: to suggest a possible explanation that has not yet been proved to be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists hypothesize that the dinosaurs were killed by a giant meteor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家假设恐龙灭绝的原因是一颗巨大的流星撞击了地球。

Sense.DEF: based on a situation that is not real, but that might happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brennan brought up a hypothetical case to make his point.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦南提出一个假设的例子来说明他的观点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The question is purely hypothetical .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题完全基于假设。

Sense.DEF:
a medical operation to remove a woman’s
uterus
extreme excitement that makes people cry, laugh, shout etc in a way that is out of control
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a fit of hysteria, Silvia blamed me for causing her father’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西尔维娅一阵歇斯底里﹐指责我害死了她父亲。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people feel fear, anger, or excitement, which makes them behave in an unreasonable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the general’s death, the population has been gripped by mass hysteria .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自将军死后﹐民众群情激愤。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition that upsets someone’s emotions and makes them suddenly feel very nervous, excited, anxious etc
unable to control your behaviour or emotions because you are very upset, afraid, excited etc
Sense.TRAN: 歇斯底里的﹐行为[情绪]失控的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet became hysterical and began screaming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特歇斯底里起来﹐开始尖叫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone in the studio burst into hysterical laughter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演播室里的每个人都爆发出一阵狂笑。

Sense.DEF: extremely funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was absolutely hysterical ! I’ve never laughed so much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太滑稽了！我还从来没笑得这么厉害。

Sense.DEF: when you are unable to control your behaviour or emotions because you are very upset, afraid, excited etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went into hysterics when she heard about her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说丈夫的事后﹐她陷入了歇斯底里状态。

GramExa.GLOSS: be extremely upset or angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum’d have hysterics if she knew what you’d done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈如果知道你干的好事﹐肯定会气得发疯。

Sense.DEF: if someone is in hysterics, they are laughing and not able to stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience was in hysterics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众狂笑不止。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=hertz 赫（兹）〔频率单位〕
